October 21, 2010 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA21


LENGTH: 653 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported recently by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

UNION ST. S., 100 block, Oct. 6. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

KING ST., 1500 block, Oct. 3. An assault was reported. 

KING ST., 3300 block, Oct. 4. An assault was reported.

LUNA PARK DR., 200 block, Oct. 6. An assault was reported.

UNION ST. S., 100 block, Oct. 6. An assault was reported.

WYTHE ST., 1200 block, Oct. 8. An assault was reported.

YOAKUM PKWY., 300 block, Oct. 9. An assault was reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ALFRED ST. S., 1100 block, Oct. 11. A theft was reported.

BRADDOCK RD. E., 400 block, Oct. 6. A theft was reported.

FAIRFAX ST. S., 600 block, Oct. 11. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

GIBBON ST., 900 block, Oct. 11. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3400 block, Oct. 12. A theft was reported.

KING ST., 3600 block, Oct. 11. A theft was reported.

KING ST., 3600 block, Oct. 12. A theft was reported.

MADISON ST., 400 block, Oct. 7. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

ORONOCO ST., 1000 block, Oct. 6. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

ST. ASAPH ST. N., 900 block, Oct. 12. A theft was reported.

YOAKUM PKWY., 200 block, Oct. 12. A theft was reported.

YOAKUM PKWY., 300 block, Oct. 7 A theft from a vehicle was reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CARPENTER LANE, 700 block, Oct. 6. A vehicle was reported stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3800 block, Oct. 11. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Arlington County 

These were among incidents reported recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

GLEBE RD. S., 2900 block, 3:30 a.m. Oct. 12. A person hit a male in the face with a metal candlestick.

WILSON BLVD., 6100 block, 11:45 p.m. Oct. 9. A male tenant was allegedly assaulted by a landlady and a man. An Arlington man and woman, both 27, were charged with assault.

16TH ST. S., 3500 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 8. A man allegedly assaulted a female acquaintance. An Arlington man, 49, was charged with assault.

17TH ST. S., 3500 block, 5 a.m. Oct. 10. A male hit a man with an object as he opened his apartment door.

CARJACKINGS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 4800 block, 12:20 a.m. Oct. 11. Two men assaulted a male sitting in his truck and demanded his vehicle. Police located two Hyattsville men, ages 18 and 20; they were charged with attempted carjacking.

ROBBERIES

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 6. A male asked a man for a cigarette, then grabbed the man's cellphone.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

RHODES ST. N., 1800 block, 3 a.m. Oct. 9. A man was seen peering into an apartment window. An Arlington man, 36, was charged with peeping.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BLUEMONT NEIGHBORHOOD, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 5 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 6. Property was stolen from four vehicles.

CLARENDON BLVD., 2800 block, 9:15 p.m. Oct. 7. A male took a laptop computer from the floor beside a table at a bookstore cafe.

RANDOLPH ST. N., 800 block, 9:45 p.m. Oct. 10. Two men opened an apartment door, then fled after not entering.

FIRST RD. S., 4400 block, 8:45 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Oct. 8. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

FOUR MILE RUN DR., 4100 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 11 to 7 a.m. Oct. 12. Cash was stolen from a business entered by force.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

TAYLOR ST. S., 1400 block. A black 2010 Taizhou scooter was stolen.

WOODLEY ST. N., 1900 block. A black 2005 Honda motorcycle was stolen.

FOUR MILE RUN DR., 4300 block. A black 2007 Chuanl scooter was stolen.

SCOTT ST. N., 1200 block. A red 2006 Baja scooter was stolen.

15TH ST. N., 4100 block. A blue 1996 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

23RD ST. S., 800 block. A white 2000 Ford F-250 was stolen.

28TH ST. S., 4600 block. A white 2006 Suzuki motorcycle was stolen.

VANDALISM

S. MANCHESTER AND S. MONTANA STREETS, 1 to 11 a.m. Oct. 10. Side-view mirrors on eight vehicles were broken.

-- Compiled by Ria Manglapus

The Washington Post


April 7, 2002 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 400 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.charlescountysheriffsoffice.org. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COBB ISLAND RD., 16000 block, 6:30 p.m. March 27 to 9:30 a.m. March 28. A rear garage door at Shymansky's Marina was forced open. Nothing was stolen.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

WALDORF, March 27. A man, 37, sexually abused a female youth, 11, from April 1998 to January 2002. He was charged with third- and fourth-degree sexual offense.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 2300 block, March 31 to April 1. Money was stolen from a safe at Burger King.

OLD WASHINGTON RD., 2000 block, 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 28. A laptop computer, a Samsonite computer case, a Lexmark printer, two computer speakers, computer software and a pocket knife were stolen from a room at the Master Suites Hotel.

ST. PATRICK'S DR., unit block, 4 p.m. March 29 to 6 a.m. April 1. Three medical offices were entered. Several locked cabinets were damaged. Nothing appeared to be stolen.

VEHICLE THEFTS

COPELY AVE., 800 block, 5:40 a.m. March 28. A 2001 Honda Accord was stolen from a residence. The unlocked car had been left running in the driveway.

WHITE OAK DR., 4:35 a.m. March 29. Two youths, ages 14 and 15, stole a 2001 Ford Mustang. They were apprehended after driving the vehicle into a ditch. They were charged with theft of a motor vehicle, theft under $ 500, unauthorized use of a motor vehicle and driving without a license.

ROBBERIES

FORD TERR., 10000 block, 10:15 p.m. March 28. Two men, one with a handgun, robbed another man, 21, as he walked to a residence. They stole money from his wallet and fled the area on foot. The first suspect is described as 5 feet 10 or 11 inches tall, having a medium build, wearing dark clothing and possessing a handgun. The second man is 6 feet 1 inch tall, wearing dark clothing and a dark, hooded jacket.

-- Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: April 7, 2002


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DOCUMENT-TYPE: LIST


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 2269 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 ASSAULTS

Randolph Rd., 5500 block, 12:24 a.m. July 31. A 23-year-old Hyattsville man was charged with aggravated assault. 

ROBBERIES

Indigoand Ferrara drives, 2:02 a.m. July 30. Two men threatened a motorist and fled in the victim's vehicle.

Monroe St. and E. Montgomery Ave., 2:30 p.m. July 26. A male threatened and robbed a person.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baederwood Lane, 16600 block, Bee Bee Ct., unit block, Bee Bee Dr., 7400 block, Bethayres Ct., unit block, Briardale Rd., 16600, 16800, and 16900 blocks, Camberford St., 16800 block, and Grande Vista Dr., 16500 block, July 29 to 30. A camera was among property stolen from 12 unlocked vehicles.

Brent Rd., 11000 block, Coach St., 8000 block, and Holbrook Dr., July 23 to 31. DVDs and cash were among property stolen from three vehicles.

Coddle Harbor Lane, 7800 block, 3:30 to 3:59 p.m. July 24. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Crawford Dr., 1300 block, Grandin Ave., 1700 block, Lewis Ave., 1100 block, and Veirs Mill Rd., 1000 block, July 23 to 31. Property was stolen from four vehicles, three of which had been left unlocked.

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1973 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Somerville Dr., 15900 block, 9:30 p.m. June 3. A man groped a person at a Metro station. A 36-year-old Gaithersburg man was arrested.  

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Rockville Pike, 200 block, 10:10 a.m. June 1. Following an incident at a government office, a 23-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested for indecent exposure.

ROBBERIES

Bennion Rd., 4400 block, 10:30 p.m. May 31. A man threatened a person and demanded property. A 19-year-old Rockville man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fall River Lane, 9200 block, May 30 to June 1. Property was stolen from a garage at a residence.

Ferrara Dr., 300 block, 9:20 p.m. June 3. A break-in occurred at a residence. A 15-year-old Silver Spring female was arrested.

Flints Grove Dr., unit block, 5:20 p.m. May 31. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Mount Vernon Pl., 300 block, 11:30 a.m. to 1:15 p.m. May 30. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

River Rd., 9400 block, 4:14 p.m. June 1. A break-in occurred at a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Rockville Pike, 1800 block, 1:15 p.m. June 5. A vehicle was stolen from a parking garage. Global Positioning System units were among property stolen from two vehicles in the garage.

Yale Pl., 1700 block, 1:30 to 6:04 a.m. June 4. A vehicle was stolen.

Postgate Terr., 4100 block, June 1 to 2. Property was stolen from a business.

St. Florence Terr., 3700 block, May 30 to 31. Wallets, a backpack and a camera were among property stolen from four unlocked vehicles.

Tamarack Rd., 12900 block, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. June 1. A break-in occurred at a residence.

DISTRICT 5GERMANTOWN STATION240-773-6200 ROBBERIES

Brundidge Terr. and Frederick Rd., 9 p.m. May 31. A male armed with a weapon robbed a person of property, then fled with two accomplices.

Mustard Seed Ct. and Cinnamon Dr., 7:08 p.m. June 4. Two people, one of them armed with a weapon, robbed a person of property. A 23-year-old Boyds woman and a 24-year-old Germantown man were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crystal Rock Dr., 19700 block, 7 a.m. May 30 to 1:09 a.m. May 31. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Brassie Pl., 19400 block, 3 p.m. June 1 to 1:30 p.m. June 3. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Sugar Notch Cir., June 1 to 2. Property was stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

Walkers Choice Rd., 18700 block, May 29 to 30. Stereos were stolen from two vehicles entered by force.

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

Grandin Ave., 1000 block, 1:54 a.m. June 8. A 24-year-old man was arrested on charges that included second-degree assault, theft and failure to obey a lawful order.

Baltimore Rd., 2100 block, 4 to 4:55 p.m. June 5. A cellphone was stolen from a backpack in a locker room at a school.

Charles St., 300 block, 10:20 p.m. June 8. A laptop computer and a Metro pass were stolen from a residence entered through a sliding-glass door. A male was seen fleeing the premises with the property.

Congressional Lane, 300 block, 9 p.m. June 2 to 8 a.m. June 3. A remote-access device and a set of keys were stolen from a vehicle.

King Farm Blvd., 800 block, 10:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. June 4. Cash was stolen from two purses in office cubicles.

Rockville Pike, 1200 block, noon May 27 to noon June 3. Thirteen flagpoles were stolen from a golf course.

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

Carroll Ave., 7000 block, 2:34 p.m. June 10. Property was stolen from a retail business.

SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA15

Alexandria

These were among incidents recently reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

KING ST., 1000 block, 11:35 p.m. May 25. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

HENRY ST. N., 900 block, 5 p.m. May 23. An assault was reported.

KING ST., 1400 block, 8:59 a.m. May 27. An assault was reported. An arrest was made.

KING ST., 300 block, 12:58 p.m. May 22. A person threatened to strike another person. 

MADISON ST., 1000 block, 9:11 p.m. May 21. An assault was reported.

MILL RD., 2100 block, 3:41 a.m. May 25. An assault was reported. An arrest was made.

MILL RD., 2100 block, May 25. A male driver tried to strike a police officer with his vehicle. An arrest was made.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4331 or visit www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

QUINCY ST. S., 1400 block, 2 a.m. May 25. A man entered a female acquaintance's apartment. When he said he was going to rape her, the woman escaped. An Arlington County man, 24, was charged with burglary with the intent to rape.

ASSAULTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5000 block, 5:40 p.m. May 24. A man grabbed a woman's pelvic area as she walked into a store. Police found an Arlington County man nearby and charged him with assault.

ROBBERIES

FIFTH ST. N., 3800 block, 1:30 p.m. May 26. A man pushed a female pedestrian to the ground and took her purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GEORGE MASON DR. N., 3400 block, 6 p.m. May 19 to 8:30 a.m. May 20. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

HIGHLAND ST. S., 700 block, 9:45 a.m. May 21. A woman left her key in a door of her vehicle in a parking lot. A man was later seen driving the vehicle away. Police found the vehicle. A man, 55, of no fixed address was charged with grand larceny.

N. STAFFORD AND N. RANDOLPH STREETS, 7 p.m. May 19 to 11:30 a.m. May 20. Global Positioning System devices were stolen from two vehicles.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 776 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Crain Hwy., 100 block, noon, April 8. A woman leaving a college was grabbed on the buttocks by a male, who then fled on foot. A Severn man, 18, was charged with second-degree assault and fourth-degree sex offense.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Holly Creek Dr., 8:12 p.m. March 23. A woman leaving her vehicle was robbed of her purse, keys and cellphone at gunpoint. An Upper Marlboro man, 32, was charged with armed robbery, robbery and second-degree assault. 

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

ROBBERIES

Melrob Ct., 11:55 p.m. April 6. A man sitting in a vehicle in a parking lot was assaulted by two men with guns and robbed of his cellphone and watch.

Solomons Island Rd., 2500 block, 5 p.m. April 9. A male, who implied he had a gun, tried to rob a hair salon. A Curtis Bay man, 29, was charged with attempted robbery and theft.

ASSAULTS

Bestgate Rd., 11:45 a.m. April 10. During a narcotics investigation, a male driver in a vehicle fled. When an officer on foot attempted to stop the driver, the officer was hit on the arm by the vehicle. The suspect then traveled to Chinquapin Road, where he fled from the vehicle. After a brief foot chase, the suspect was detained. An Annapolis man, 24, was charged with attempted murder, first- and second-degree assault, assaulting a police officer, possession of heroin with intent to distribute and numerous traffic violations.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Greenbriar Lane, 9:40 a.m. to 5 p.m. April 10. A sliding glass door was forced open at a home, and two video game units and cash were stolen.

Murray Ave., 10 p.m. April 5 to 7:45 p.m. April 6. Cash and a high school ring were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

West St., 100 block, 7:45 p.m. April 4 to 12:30 a.m. April 5. A makeup bag, jewelry and sunglasses were stolen from a vehicle.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Cradlerock Way, 3:30 a.m. April 8. During a struggle, someone stole a wallet and prescription medication from a person.

Lambskin Lane, 5:59 p.m. April 6. While playing basketball, a person was assaulted and another was robbed of a cellphone. Four youths were charged with robbery, assault and theft.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alexander Bell Dr., 6700 block, April 4 to April 7. Cash was stolen from a lock box at a warehouse. A door was pried open.

Eclipse Way, 10300 block, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. April 7. An attempt was made to pry open a garage door.

Harpers Farm Rd., 2:39 p.m. April 8. Someone entered a home through an unlocked window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10200 block, April 4 to April 5. Copper pipe, scrap metal and a power tool were stolen from a construction site.

Millrace Ct., 4:30 p.m. April 8. A rear door was kicked open at a home. Nothing was reported stolen.

Robert Oliver Pl., 1:42 a.m. April 7. A rock was used to break a rear window at a saloon, and bottles of liquor and an empty cash register were stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Old Washington Rd., 9:20 p.m. April 5. A disabled vehicle in the roadway was struck from the rear by another a vehicle. Occupants got out of the disabled vehicle and assaulted a female occupant of the other vehicle. Another group of people stopped to assist and they also assaulted and threw their phones into a wooded area. Two D.C. men, ages 18 and 23, were charged with five counts of assault, theft and robbery. The 18-year-old was charged with an additional count of theft.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Ring Dove Lane, April 5. An attempt was made to steal a black BMW.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Mitzy Lane, 1 a.m. April 6. A Chevrolet Impala was stolen.

JESSUP AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Montevideo Rd., 7500 block, 12:01 a.m. April 2 to 11:40 a.m. April 6. Someone cut a padlock on the front gate of a crane services business. Nothing was reported stolen.

Montevideo Rd., 3 p.m. April 5 to 11:40 a.m. April 6. A hole was cut in the rear fence at a tree service business, and tires were stolen.

Patuxent Rd., 2:51 a.m. April 6. Front-door glass was broken at a produce store, and a TV was stolen.

Redondo Way, 8700 block, 2:23 p.m. April 7. The frame of a basement door was damaged at a home, and a door was opened. Nothing was reported missing.

LAUREL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ice Crystal Dr., 8300 block, 3:20 a.m. April 5. An attempt was made to steal an ATM at a grocery store.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report 


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1056 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

River Ridge Golf Course area, Sept. 28. A man sexually assaulted the child of an acquaintance. A 20-year-old South Carolina man was arrested Jan. 19.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Vanetta Ct., 3400 block, 6:30 a.m. Dec. 11 to 10:30 p.m. Jan. 17. A TV, a DVD player, computer equipment, jewelry and other property were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Winnipeg Ct., 7200 block, 4:37 p.m. Jan. 23. A residence was entered through an unlocked window. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Bull Run Park area, Jan. 13. A man sexually assaulted the child of an acquaintance. A 49-year-old Manassas man was arrested Jan. 19. 

Bull Run Park area, October to Jan. 17. A teenager was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance. On Jan. 18, a 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested on three counts of aggravated sexual battery.

ROBBERIES

Hollis Dr. and Willoughby Lane, 5:47 a.m. Jan. 19. Two males robbed a pedestrian of his wallet at gunpoint, then fled in a vehicle driven by an accomplice.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Community Dr., 8000 block, 11:30 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Jan. 23. Two laptops and a video game system were stolen from a residence.

West Point Ct., 7800 block, 2:30 p.m. Jan. 13 to 9 a.m. Jan. 17. A residence that is under construction was entered through an unlocked door. Nothing was reported missing.

Yates Ford Rd., 7000 block, Nov. 25 to Jan. 17. Jewelry and tools were stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hamill Mill Park area, December. A juvenile was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance. A 55-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested on Jan. 18.

ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd. and Mapledale Ave., 3:12 a.m. Jan. 11. A man who had been arguing with two people followed them as they drove to a restaurant, where he got out of his vehicle and broke their vehicle's windows with a tire iron. The victims tried to drive away. He sideswiped their vehicle, forcing it to spin out. The assailant then abandoned his vehicle in a ditch. A short time later, a 31-year-old man was arrested.

Gordon Blvd., 100 block, 8:35 a.m. Jan. 19. A woman forced her way into an acquaintance's residence, then threatened her at knifepoint. As the victim fled the premises, the assailant followed, then knifed a vehicle tire. A 22-year-old woman was arrested. No injuries were reported.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 10:20 p.m. Jan. 20. A stop sign was damaged by shot from a pellet gun. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Sunny Ridge Ct., 15000 block, 8:41 p.m. Jan. 19. A handgun was discharged inside a residence. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14000 block, 10:05 a.m. Jan. 21. Two men tried to rob a bank at gunpoint. When an employee refused to let them inside the building, they fled empty-handed.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14900 block, 6:01 p.m. Jan. 23. Three men tried to rob a pharmacy of narcotics at gunpoint. When an employee ducked behind the counter, they fled empty-handed.

Maurice Dr., 1500 block, 1:42 p.m. Jan. 18. Two males armed with a stun gun and a baseball bat robbed a man of a Global Positioning System device, prescription medication and cash.

Old Bridge Rd., 3200 block, 10:49 p.m. Jan. 22. A man attempted to rob a woman who was loading items into a vehicle. After a brief struggle, he fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

Pohick Creek Ct., 1900 block, Jan. 18. A man was arrested for his role in a plan to commit a home invasion in Dale City. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was charged with attempted armed robbery.

Tilletson Pl., 1700 block, 10:19 p.m. Jan. 18. A gunman demanded cash from a man near a trash-collection area, then fled empty-handed. The victim said that he was carrying a golf club and that it might have discouraged the assailant.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brickwood Dr., 15100 block, 5:58 a.m. Jan. 18. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked door. The intruder, confronted while looking through a purse, fled empty-handed.

Faith Ct., 14500 block, 1:14 a.m. Jan. 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a rear window.

Faith Ct., 14500 block, 1:15 a.m. Jan. 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a screen and forcing a rear window.

Hamilton Dr., 4400 block, 7:30 to 9:30 a.m. Jan. 18. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Horseshoe Lane, 15600 block, 12:30 to 5 p.m. Jan. 21. A residence was entered by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Sequoia Ct., 2000 block, midnight to 3 a.m. Jan. 17. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Park Ct. S., 4700 block, noon Jan. 18. A man followed an acquaintance from a store to his residence, then threatened him and robbed him of his vehicle.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Taney Rd., 9400 block, 1:50 p.m. Jan. 22. A man grabbed a purse from a pedestrian, who chased him and saw him go inside a residence. A 28-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burlington Ct., 8500 block, 11:30 p.m. Jan. 19 to 8 a.m. Jan. 20. A GPS device and a camera were stolen from a vehicle.

Liberia Ave., 9000 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 19 to 5:30 a.m. Jan. 20. Two air-conditioning units and construction equipment were stolen from a construction site.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 4:40 p.m. Jan. 18. A male stole a cellphone from a gas station.

Digital Dr., 9100 block, 7 p.m. Jan. 18 to 7 a.m. Jan. 19. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

Kent Dr., 200 block, 12:01 to 5:50 a.m. Jan. 18. Five nail guns and an air compressor were among property stolen from two vehicles.

Kent Dr., 200 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 17 to 7:30 a.m. Jan. 18. Three power drills were stolen from a vehicle.

Moseby Ct., 300 block, 5:30 p.m. Jan. 22 to 5:30 a.m. Jan. 23. A GPS device, CDs and a checkbook were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Kirby St., 2:46 a.m. Jan. 15. A man jumped on the hood and roof of a vehicle. A 33-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 982 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristow Rd., 10700 block, 4 p.m. May 15 to 9 a.m. May 17. A business was entered by forcing a rear door.

DALE CITY AREA

ASSAULTS

Darbydale Ave., 14800 block, 5:10 p.m. May 20. Four males attacked two male pedestrians.

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Kilpatrick Pl., 2400 block, 5:19 p.m. May 19. Two males robbed a male pedestrian of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Royale Terr., 17500 block, 11:30 p.m. May 18 to 5:30 a.m. May 19. A residence was entered by breaking a basement window. An attempt was made to remove a TV from a wall.  

Toms River Loop, 16900 block, 5:40 a.m. to 7 p.m. May 20. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

GAINESVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Cellar Door Dr., 7800 block, 12:15 a.m. May 22. During a dispute, two men attacked a man. Two Chantilly men, ages 18 and 22, were arrested. The victim was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Equinox Landing Ct., 7500 block, 2 p.m. May 20 to 11:30 a.m. May 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence by removing a screen from a rear window.

Rail Line Ct., 7200 block, 7 a.m. May 11 to 12:33 p.m. May 18. Cash was stolen from a commercial trailer.

LAKE RIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Golf Side Cir., 3600 block, 8 a.m. May 12 to 7:45 a.m. May 17. DVDs were stolen from a residence.

Old Bridge Rd., 3000 block, 1:25 to 2:30 a.m. May 21. During a break-in at a school, fire extinguishers were set off, liquid was dumped on a floor and coins were glued to door locks.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Yorkshire area, 5:44 a.m. May 17. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance at a residence. A 34-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Lomond and Garner drives, 8:59 a.m. May 14. The driver of a dump truck involved in a collision aggressively approached an investigating officer, then drove the vehicle at the officer, who had to move aside to avoid being hit. A 56-year-0ld Woodbridge man was charged with attempted malicious wounding of a law enforcement officer and obstruction of justice.

Sudley Rd., 8000 block, May 4. Three men attacked a male teenager walking in the area. The victim was treated for a head injury.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Emerald Dr., 7400 block, 12:30 p.m. May 17 to 11:59 p.m. May 18. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Westchester Dr., 9000 block, 9:09 p.m. May 23. As many as five men forced their way into a residence and attacked an occupant, then robbed him of cash at gunpoint.

NOKESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Nokesville Road and Route 646 area, 10:27 p.m. May 18. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile. A 44-year-old Nokesville man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kilmer Lane, 18200 block, 6 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. May 20. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Cheshire Station Plaza area, 8:46 p.m. May 21. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile acquaintance. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Gableridge Turn, 1800 block, 6:39 p.m. May 21. A handgun was discharged inside an apartment, with the bullet going through the floor and into the apartment below. No injuries were reported. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Marina Way, 13100 block, 2:20 a.m. May 22. During an argument, a man made threats with a shotgun. Two security guards detained the man until police arrived. A 22-year-old Newport News man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Constellation Pl. and Oriskany Way, 1:02 a.m. May 22. Three males robbed a male juvenile of cash, a cellphone and a watch.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Haverford Loop, 2700 block, 8 p.m. May 17. A man inside a residence exposed himself to a juvenile walking a dog. A 60-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

Worchester Dr., 4400 block, 12:01 a.m. May 20. A man looking through a window at a residence fled when confronted.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aldrin St., 13200 block, 4:34 p.m. May 17. Two TVs and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a side door. Two men were seen fleeing with the property.

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 1 a.m. May 18. Property was stolen from five vehicles. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man and a 20-year-old Springfield man were arrested. The property was recovered.

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. May 18. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through a second-floor window accessed with a ladder.

Holly View Ct., 11900 block, 4 to 9 a.m. May 21. A TV and a computer monitor were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Jennings St., 2100 block, midnight to 5 a.m. May 19. A global positioning system device was stolen from a residence entered through a garage accessed by using an electronic door opener in an unlocked vehicle.

Knightsbridge Dr., 12500 block, 1 a.m. May 17 to noon May 18. A credit card was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Naylor Ct., 5600 block, 8:45 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 21. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Shingle Oak Dr., 16700 block, 7:30 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. May 17. Electronics and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Baker Street Park area, May 23. A 26-year-old Manassas Park man was charged with carnal knowledge of a child and contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

VANDALISM

Industry Dr., 9100 block, 9 p.m. May 14 to 2:35 a.m. May 15. Paint was thrown on the front door and a window at a business.

Market St., 100 block, 11 p.m. May 14 to 11 a.m. May 15. A vehicle's paint surface was scratched.

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 414 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

ROUTE 235 AND AIRPORT RD., 9:30 p.m. Aug. 6. A woman, 29, assaulted another woman in a road rage incident. She was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, 11:11 a.m. Aug. 10. A man, 30, and a woman, 29, stole power tools and assaulted an employee at a home improvement store. They were charged with robbery and theft. The man was additionally charged with assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 12:33 p.m. Aug. 9. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

MEREDITH CT., 5:16 p.m. Aug. 6. A cell phone was stolen from a vehicle.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LEONARDTOWN, Aug. 11 to 13. The paint of 16 vehicles at Leonardtown Ford was scratched.

ASSAULTS

BRYAN RD., 11:13 p.m. Aug. 3. A man, 43, pointed a handgun at two people during an argument. He was charged with two counts of first-degree assault.

ESSEX DR., 5:19 p.m. Aug. 12. A man, 38, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault and malicious destruction of property.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

LEXINGTON PARK, Aug. 6 to 7. A woman, 28, gave alcohol to three male youths, ages 14, 15 and 17, and engaged in sexual activities with them. She was charged with three counts of child abuse and two counts of third-and fourth-degree sex offense.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, 2:15 a.m. Aug. 8. A golf bag and clubs were stolen from a vehicle.

MICHELLE DR., 4:26 p.m. July 30. A canoe was stolen from a pier at a residence.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 9:25 p.m. Aug. 6. A motorist, 40, after being arrested on suspicion of drunken driving, pushed a trooper and tried to flee. He was charged with driving while intoxicated, second-degree assault and resisting arrest.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

PINEY POINT, 2 a.m. May 28. A man, 37, provided alcohol and marijuana to a group of juveniles and sexually assaulted a male youth, 14. He was charged with third-degree sex offense, second-degree assault and possession of marijuana.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CORNFIELD RD., 2:57 p.m. Aug. 8. A lock and a meter were damaged at a pump station owned by the Maryland Department of Environment.

-- Bonnie Smith

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 794 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dorsey Rd. area, July 13. A boy reported that he had been sexually abused while attending a youth education and service group during a two-year period. A group leader, 15, was charged with second-degree child abuse and third- and fourth-degree sex offense.

ASSAULTS

Browning Ct., 400 block, 7;14 p.m. July 11. A man, 27, was stabbed in the chest. A Pasadena man was charged with attempted second-degree homicide, first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment. The injured man was taken to University of Maryland Shock Trauma. 

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 1200 block, 11:10 p.m. July 15. A man at a convenience store was robbed at gunpoint.

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block, 5 a.m. July 12. After a hotel guest attempted to pay for a room with a counterfeit bill, the man jumped over a counter and assaulted a clerk, then took his cellphone and cash. A Severn man was charged with robbery, theft and second-degree assault.

ANIMAL CARE INCIDENTS

Ritchie Hwy., 7500 block, 1:14 p.m. July 15. Investigating a report of an animal in a vehicle at the district court parking lot, officers broke a window and rescued a 7-year-old Scottish terrier mix. The animal was evaluated by Animal Control and returned to the owner. The owner, an Owings man, 54, was cited in connection with leaving an animal unattended in a vehicle.

MILLERSVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Veterans Hwy., 8800 block, 12:55 p.m. July 14. A 21-year-old autistic man was allegedly sexually abused by a staff member of an organization between May 15 and June 15. A Glen Burnie man, 50, was charged with third- and fourth-degree sex offense, second-degree assault and vulnerable adult abuse.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

WEAPONS

Copeland St., 1900 block, 3:51 p.m. July 10. A 17-year-old male pedestrian was shot in the hand.

ROBBERIES

Forest Dr., 1:30 to 3:30 p.m. July 9. A pedestrian was robbed of cash by three men.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Carraway Lane, 7:15 p.m. July 9 to 3 a.m. July 10. Three watches were stolen from a home.

McGuckian St., 1200 block, 6 p.m. July 5 to 6:45 p.m. July 10. A TV was stolen from a building.

Milkshake Lane, 4 p.m. July 3 to 9 a.m. July 10. A power washer was stolen from a locked shed.

Silopanna Rd., 11 p.m. July 16 to 8 a.m. July 17. A custom-made bicycle was stolen from a deck at a home.

Tyler Ave., 1300 block, 3 to 8 p.m. July 17. Instant soup and a 12-pack of sodas were stolen from a home. The home was vandalized.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Stevens Forest Rd., 5800 block, midnight July 14. A purse, cash, a cellphone and documents were taken from people standing in a parking lot.

Waning Moon Way, 6600 block, 9:15 p.m. July 14. A person was robbed by a male wearing black clothing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alexander Bell Dr., 6700 block, 6 p.m. July 10 to 7 a.m. July 11. A safe and money orders were stolen from a business.

Columbia Rd., 11 p.m. July 11 to 6:15 a.m. July 12. Cash was stolen from a pool.

Pyramid Way, 6800 block, 1:50 p.m. July 10. A bicycle was stolen.

Tilted Stone, 5400 block, 12:40 p.m., July 11. A male youth was seen leaving a home with a stereo.

ELKRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Business Pkwy., 6700 block, 7:15 p.m. July 13. A man sitting in his vehicle was robbed at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Elkridge Crossing Way, 7200 block, July 12. Appliances were stolen from a business.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Rd., 9200 block, 9:20 a.m. to 4:10 p.m. July 14. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Montgomery Rd., 6800 block, 5:10 p.m. July 10. Someone entered a home through a kitchen window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Tyler Dr., 3400 block, 3:54 p.m. July 14. Someone entered a home through an unlocked door, then fled after being confronted by the homeowner.

JESSUP AREA

ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd., 8000 block, 8:45 p.m. July 15. An employee at a business was robbed at gunpoint.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd., 7500 block, 11:43 p.m. July 12. Two males robbed two people at gunpoint. A Jessup man, 19, was charged with robbery, armed robbery and theft.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Traders Crossing, 9200 block, 4:55 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. July 15. Electronics, a wallet and credit cards were stolen from a home.

SAVAGE AREA

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 905 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Francis West Lane, 16800 block, 1:03 a.m. April 22. A man assaulted relatives. A 36-year-old man was arrested.

GAINESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Witton Cir., 6800 block, April 25. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. An 18-year-old Bristow man was arrested. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Piney Grove Way, 6000 block, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. April 25. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Laurie Ct. area, Jan. 24. Police investigated a report that a man had sexually assaulted two male juveniles in 1978, when he was their sports coach, at residences. A 58-year-old Manassas man of the Laurie Court area was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Carolina Dr., 10900 block, 12:30 to 2:30 a.m. April 27. Cash was stolen from a business entered through an unlocked bay door. A 21-year-old male and a 16-year-old Gainesville male were arrested.

Country Roads Lane, 9500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. April 25. A bike was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

VANDALISM

Moore Dr., 9800 block, 6:18 p.m. April 25. A man poured paint on a county police cruiser. An 18-year-old Manassas man and a 19-year-old Herndon man were arrested.

NOKESVILLE AREA

WEAPONS

Aden Rd., 14100 block, 10:42 a.m. April 26. A man attempted to give a male pedestrian what appeared to be an explosive device. When the pedestrian refused, the man put the device in a ditch and walked away. The Virginia State Police Explosive Ordinance Disposal Unit determined that the device was inert. A 34-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with manufacturing a hoax explosive device.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Delaney Rd., 13200 block, 3:30 p.m. April 24. During an argument, a female juvenile threw a knife toward a female relative. The knife hit a wall. No injuries were reported. A 16-year-old Woodbridge girl was arrested.

WEAPONS

Carlsbad Rd., 14900 block, 7:27 a.m. April 24. A man got out of a white van and used a gun to threaten a male pedestrian, who ran to a nearby vehicle and hid. The gunman drove away.

ROBBERIES

Chinn Park Dr. and Prince William Pkwy., 7:08 p.m. April 25. A group of men assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet containing cash and a cellphone. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Daniel Stuart Sq., 2000 block, 6:14 p.m. April 30. A group of males robbed three male juveniles of a watch, an MP3 player and a pair of headphones. An 18-year-old man and two male juveniles, 14 and 15, all from Woodbridge, were arrested.

Mapledale Plaza, 5800 block, 7:16 p.m. April 27. Three males assaulted a male juvenile pedestrian and robbed him of a cellphone.

Prince William Pkwy. and York Dr., 2:45 a.m. April 30. A male passenger in a taxi assaulted the male driver and ordered him out of the vehicle. The passenger drove away in the taxi, which was located in Fairfax County. A 29-year-old Chantilly man was arrested.

Telegraph Rd. and Morse Lane, 9:22 a.m. April 24. A male passenger got out of a vehicle parked on the shoulder of a road and approached a male motorist stopped at an intersection. The male asked for directions, then showed a handgun and demanded money from the motorist. He then took cash and fled in a vehicle driven by another person.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dulcinea Pl., 12600 block, 6:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. April 24. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Esquarre Ct., 3300 block, 8:30 a.m. April 25 to 10 a.m. April 26. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear glass door.

Fox Lair Dr., 2900 block, 2:40 to 3 a.m. April 28. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a rear window.

Georgia Rd., 15100 block, 5 to 7 p.m. April 27. Two laptops, two video game systems and video games were stolen from a residence.

Glendale Rd., 4500 block, 7:45 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. April 23. Electronics and five pairs of shoes were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

Kirkdale Dr., 4600 block, 7:35 a.m. to 6:50 p.m. April 23. Two TVs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Cannoneer Ct., 9500 block, 7:30 p.m. April 22. A man assaulted a female acquaintance when she attempted to leave a residence. He hit and choked her until she lost consciousness. When she awoke, he hit her again. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Byrd Dr.,9200 block, 8:45 p.m. April 25. Three males demanded money from a male pedestrian. When he refused, the three assaulted him. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

WEAPONS

Manassas Dr. and Sandstone Way, 4:41 p.m. April 30. Someone fired an air rifle outdoors. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enterprise Ct., 9100 block, 7:30 p.m. April 20 to 3:15 p.m. April 21. A trailer was entered by breaking a door lock. Nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas Dr., 100 block, 9 p.m. April 24 to 4:21 a.m. April 25. Cash, an air compressor, a socket set, two bowling balls, a bag, shoes and gloves were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Adams St.,unit block, 3:15 p.m. April 29. Someone spray-painted gang graffiti on the rear of a snack bar.

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 626 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.  

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, 6:47 p.m. March 26. A woman, 26, assaulted two men at a residence. She was charged with two counts of second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CALIFORNIA, March 22. Two men, both 26, were apprehended climbing out of a window of the Super 8 Motel using bed sheets. They were wanted on outstanding warrants. They were charged with possession of cocaine, possession of drug paraphernalia and property destruction.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HAPPYLAND RD., Feb. 25 to March 7. A 9mm handgun was stolen from a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CHARLOTTE HALL, March 20. Cinder blocks were used to damage the hood of a vehicle at a residence.

CHARLOTTE HALL, 7 to 10 p.m. March 22. A portion of a Burger King's drive-through sign was stolen, and an interior light of the sign was broken.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

CLEMENTS, 8:15 p.m. March 22. A man, 27, raped a woman, 23, at a residence on March 1. He was charged with second-degree rape and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREAT MILLS, 10:15 to 11 a.m. March 25. A door at a residence was forced open. Nothing was reported stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 4:10 p.m. March 26. A man, 25, failed to perform a home improvement contract at a residence. He was charged with theft of more than $ 500.

VEHICLE THEFTS

HOLLYWOOD, 1:49 a.m. March 26. A man, 21, was driving a stolen vehicle on a suspended license. He was charged with theft of more than $ 500, theft less than $ 500, fleeing and eluding, and driving with a suspended license.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 5:36 p.m. March 22. A female youth, 11, stole a purse from a classroom at Leonardtown Middle School. She was charged with theft less than $ 500.

VEHICLE THEFTS

LEONARDTOWN, 4:05 p.m., March 21. A 1989 Chevrolet Silverado truck, unlocked and keys in the ignition, was stolen when the owner went into a store. The truck was found later on Fairgrounds Road.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, March 20. A man, 33, physically assaulted a male youth, 10. He was charged with second-degree assault and child abuse.

LEXINGTON PARK, 7:32 p.m. March 24. A man, 25, and a male youth, 17, were fighting. The youth assaulted the resident with a broom handle. The charges included a weapon's violation for the man and a second-degree assault charge for the youth.

ROUTE 246 AND FOREST RUN DR., 3 p.m. March 21. A man, 19, and three other men assaulted a fifth man, 18, and stole his skateboard and money. The three men then fled, and the 19-year-old was apprehended andcharged with robbery and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DEVIN CIR., 7 p.m. March 25 to 9 a.m. March 26. A cell phone and money were stolen from a vehicle.

LEXINGTON PARK, 4 p.m. March 25 to 5 p.m. March 26. Personal papers were stolen from the glove compartment of a vehicle.

LEXINGTON PARK, 5 p.m. March 25 to 3 p.m. March 26. Money was stolen from a vehicle.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 11:25 a.m. March 25. A man, 21, assaulted another man at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, 6 p.m. March 20 to 6:50 a.m. March 21. One vehicle was damaged and several others were stolen from a fenced area at Just Trucks Auto Sales.

WILLIAM DR., March 21. Personal property was stolen from a residence.

RIDGE, 1:53 a.m. March 26. A man, 45, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

-- Bonnie Smith

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 430 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

CALIFORNIA, 6:08 a.m. May 4. A man, 42, undressed and sexually molested a female youth, 17. He was charged with second-, third- and fourth-degree sex offenses and perverted sexual practice.

PRESCRIPTION DRUG FRAUD

CALIFORNIA, May 1. A woman, 29, said she was an employee of a doctor's office and ordered a prescription drug. She was charged with fraud.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

CALLAWAY, March 1-26. Two men, ages 25 and 43, provided controlled dangerous substances and alcoholic beverages to a female youth, 15, and sexually assaulted her. They were charged with third-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

GREAT MILLS, 5:05 p.m. April 30. A male youth, 13, assaulted a female victim at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ARSON

STRICKLAND AND CHANCELLORS RUN ROADS, 9:26 a.m. May 7. An abandoned house was set on fire.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, noon to 5 p.m. May 3. License plates were stolen from a vehicle parked at a gas station.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, May 2. A woman, 42, and a man, 40, assaulted each other at a residence. They were charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 1 to 1:25 a.m. April 29. A man, 29, shot another man, 40. He was charged with first-degree assault and attempted second-degree murder. The victim later died at Prince George's Hospital Center.

LEXINGTON PARK, 3:40 p.m. May 7. A man, 23, assaulted another man at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, Jan. 15 to 25. A male youth, 17, advertised online the sale of a drum set. After he received money, police learned there was no drum set. He was charged with theft under $ 500 and theft over $ 500.

LEXINGTON PARK, 6:10 p.m. May 3. Two male youths, ages 10 and 13, entered a residence without permission and refused to leave. They were charged with first-degree burglary.

ARSON

GREAT MILLS RD., 8:46 a.m. May 7. An abandoned house was set on fire.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

THREE NOTCH RD., May 7. A man was charged with theft over $ 500 and theft under $ 500 in connection with items found buried in his yard.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

MECHANICSVILLE, April 24-26. A window at a residence was damaged with a BB gun.

-- Bonnie Smith

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T10


LENGTH: 548 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

BUSHWOOD, 10:55 p.m. March 29. A man, 32, assaulted a female victim in the parking lot of a restaurant. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, April 4. Two men, ages 38 and 39, assaulted each other at a residence on March 12. They were charged with second-degree assault.

CALIFORNIA, 8:31 a.m. April 4. A female youth, 15, was charged with second-degree assault upon another female youth, 17, at the Walden Sierra House.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

SYCAMORE HOLLOW DR., March 28 to April 5. A window to a residence was broken with a ceramic pot. The house was not entered.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, April 5. A woman, 18, stole items from Kmart by using a receipt from a previous purchase of similar items. She was charged with theft under $ 500.

ASSAULTS

COMPTON, 3:38 a.m. April 6. A man, 27, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MADDOX RD., March 13 to 29. A homemade log splitter and a roto-spader were stolen from an unlocked barn.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

LEONARDTOWN, 10:28 a.m. April 7. A woman, 19, reported that she was raped by two men. She went to a residence with one of the men, where they consumed alcohol. When the other man arrived, the two raped her.

ASSAULTS

CORAL PL., 4:30 p.m. April 5. A man, 48, assaulted two troopers while he was beingarrested. He was charged with disorderly conduct, resisting arrest, two counts of failing to obey a lawful order and three counts of second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LEXINGTON PARK, 9:15 p.m. April 8. Two boys, ages 12 and 14, threw rocks at each other's front door. They were charged with malicious destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, April 5. Four juveniles, ages 15, 15, 14 and 12, stole tools and equipment from a shed. They were charged with second-degree burglary, theft under $ 500 and property destruction.

LEXINGTON PARK, 3:25 a.m. April 8. Alcohol and cigarettes were stolen from a liquor store, entered by breaking a front window.

VEHICLE THEFTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 7 to 11 p.m. April 4. A 1982 Ford F-150 truck was stolen from a motel parking lot.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 10 p.m. March 28. A female youth, 15, spat on a customer at Bert's restaurant who had requested a channel change on the television. She was charged with second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

ANNE CT., March 28. Two mailboxes were damaged.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, 7 to 8:45 p.m. April 1. A man, 37, burglarized a residence. He was charged with first-degree burglary and theft under $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

POINT LOOKOUT RD., noon April 3 to 5:33 p.m. April 6. A male youth, 12, stole a bicycle frame from a residence. He was charged with theft under $ 500.

VEHICLE THEFTS

LIGHTHOUSE RD., 10:16 a.m. April 2. A 1995 Chevrolet S-10 truck was reported stolen from a residence between Feb. 1 and March 1.

-- Bonnie Smith

CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T09


LENGTH: 547 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site may be accessed at the following address: www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

NORTH INDIAN ESTATES, 10:30 p.m. July 15 to 4:30 a.m. July 16. Several vehicles on several streets in the neighborhood were damaged.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

INDIAN HEAD, July 10. A man, 38, was arrested in connection with a March 1987 incident in which he confronted a woman with a knife, sexually assaulted her, stole money and fled. He was charged with first-degree rape and burglary.

ASSAULTS

WILLOW LANE, 300 block, 6:43 p.m. July 13. A man, 28, was stabbed during an altercation involving a group of men at Milton M. Somers Middle School. He was hospitalized at Civista Medical Center.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 4500 block, 4 p.m. July 11. A male youth, 16, dropped a dirt bike off at Atlantic Cycle to be fixed. It was discovered that the motorcycle had been reported stolen. The youth was charged with theft over $ 500.

HOMICIDES

CEDAR LANE, 7:36 a.m., July 15. A man, 21, was found on the side of the road, dead from a gunshot wound.

ASSAULTS

COPELY AVE., 800 block, 10:04 a.m. July 15. A man, 36, assaulted a woman, also 36, during a domestic dispute. He was charged with second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HAMILTON RD., 2500 block, 3:30 p.m. July 12 to 6:30 a.m. July 15. Windows were smashed on several tractors at a construction site.

WENDY LANE, 12200 block, 11 p.m. July 14 to 7 a.m. July 15. Someone damaged a 1998 Ford Mustang Cobra trying unsuccessfully to gain entry to the car.

WESTERN PKWY., 3100 block, 9:30 p.m. July 10. Rocks were thrown at a 1994 Chevrolet Corsica causing damage to the vehicle. The suspects fled.

ROBBERIES

HADLEY DR., 20 block, 10:23 p.m. July 10. An unknown suspect attempted to rob a pizza delivery person.

NEW FOREST CT., 9:43 p.m. July 17. A woman and her two small children were approached by a man with a gun. He demanded her purse. She complied, and the man fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LELAND RD., 11400 block, between 9 p.m. July 16 to 11 a.m. July 17. An Alpine car stereo was stolen from a 1996 Honda Accord.

MALL CIR., 11200 block, 9:10 p.m. July 15. Two women, 43 and 47, were observed shoplifting by a security officer at Hecht's. When the officer attempted to stop them, the 47-year-oldbrandished a knife and tried to stab the officer. She was charged with armed robbery, first- and second-degree assault and theft over $ 500. The other woman was charged with theft under $ 500.

VANDALISM

ROLLING MEADOWS ST., 2300 block, 12:15-9:30 a.m. July 16. Eggs were thrown at a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PICKERAL ST., 4500 block, 7:30 p.m. July 5 to 7:30 a.m. July 7. Property was stolen from a Ford truck.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 614 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.charlescountysheriffsoffice.org. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ROBBERIES

INDIAN HEAD HWY., 6900 block, 12:15 a.m. Feb. 2. A man, 18, and two women, 18 and 19, entered a gas station with shotguns and long rifles and demanded money. They locked the employees in the office, then stole an employee's vehicle and fled to Prince George's County. They were charged with armed robbery.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

INDEPENDENCE CIRCLE, 12:09 a.m. Feb. 3. A man, 31, smashed a plastic chair on the ground. He was charged with destruction of property less than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 10030 block, 11:35 p.m. Jan. 30. A glass door was broken at a business. Property from inside the business was stacked outside the door.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

WASHINGTON AVENUE AND HARFORD STREET, 9:30 a.m. Feb. 2. A man, 37, raped a female youth, 14, on Jan. 12. He was charged with first-degree rape and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WASHINGTON AVE., 5000 block, 7:30 p.m. Jan. 30 to 7:30 a.m. Jan. 31. A propane tank and other items were stolen from a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LA PLATA, Jan. 28. Two male youths, 17, damaged the fields at Laurel Springs Regional Park. They were charged with destruction of property.

ASSAULTS

PEACH CT., 1000 block, 7:50 a.m. Feb. 2. A man, 39, assaulted a woman with a knife during an argument. He was charged with first- and second-degree assault and possession of a deadly weapon.

ROBBERIES

ARMES DR., 1003 block, 1:31 a.m. Feb. 6. Two men robbed a 7-Eleven store of an undisclosed amount of money.

SMALLWOOD DRIVE W., 2000 block, 12:40 a.m. Feb. 5. Two men robbed a Dash-In store at gunpoint. The first man was described as six feet tall, about 20 to 25 years old, having a large build, wearing a black hood, a white mask and light-colored pants. The second suspect was described as five feet nine inches tall, about 20 to 25 years old, having a medium build, wearing a black mask and black hood.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

FORDINGTON PLACE AND DRAKE COURT, 4:30 to 5 p.m. Feb. 6. A woman, 20, who was walking on a bike path was struck on the back of the head and lost consciousness. When she awoke, her clothing had been removed. The suspect is described as a man in his early twenties, about six feet three inches tall, weighing about 200 pounds and wearing a cornrow hairstyle and goatee.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GOUGH DR., 3400 block, 12:44 a.m. Feb. 6. A vehicle was stolen from the 11000 block of Holly Auto Center Lane and used to steal automotive merchandise from a place of business.

SUGAR MILL CT., 13000 block, 6 p.m. Jan. 31 to 7:30 a.m. Feb. 1. Property was stolen from a Ryan Homes trailer.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

FESTIVAL WAY, 3000 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 1 to 7 a.m. Feb. 2. A telephone junction box was damaged.

ASSAULTS

WILLETS CROSSING RD., 10700 block, 8:12 a.m. Feb. 3. A man, 30, held a knife to the throat of another man, 43, and pushed a woman, 27. He was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

VEHICLE THEFTS

THEODORE GREEN BLVD., 10300 block, 6:30 p.m. Jan. 31 to 6 a.m. Feb. 1. A loader was stolen from a construction business.

-- Bonnie Smith

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 350 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CALIFORNIA, 1:42 a.m. Dec. 14. A female youth, 16, scratched a vehicle with a utility knife. She was charged with malicious destruction of property less than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHAPTICO, 6:30 a.m. Dec. 26. A shotgun was stolen from a vehicle parked at a market.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHARLOTTE HALL, Dec. 22. A man, 37, stole two welders, a hydraulic hammer and hydraulic fluid from an iron works company. He is charged with second-degree burglary and theft of more than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

DORSEY ST., 10:44 p.m. Dec. 23. A man, 22, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault and disturbing the peace.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 6:30 p.m. Dec. 20 to 1 p.m. Dec. 21. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, Jan. 2. Two men, both 21, were charged with attempted murder, assault and reckless endangerment in connection with a Nov. 9 shooting.

LEXINGTON PARK, 9:40 p.m. Dec. 25. A man, 18, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEXINGTON PARK, 8 p.m. Dec. 20. Three men, ages 24, 26 and 27, had sexual intercourse and performed sex acts with a female youth, 13. They picked her up in front of a local bar, gave her alcohol and cigarettes and took her to a local motel. Two of the men, ages 24 and 26, are still at large. The 27-year-old was charged with second-degree rape, two counts of sex offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

KAVANAUGH RD., 2:01 a.m. Dec. 31. A man, 45, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, Dec. 1 to 21. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

-- Bonnie Smith

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T13


LENGTH: 420 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, 9:35 p.m. March 2. A man, 40, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

FRAUD

CALIFORNIA, 10:20 a.m. March 4. A man, 22, altered a prescription he obtained from his doctor to receive a larger quantity and to add codeine. He was charged with prescription fraud.

ASSAULTS

CALLAWAY, 1:29 p.m. March 1. A man, 43, forced his way into a residence and threatened a woman with a knife. He was charged with fourth-degree burglary and second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

HOLLYWOOD, 7:50 p.m. March 6. A man, 18, raped a female youth, 13. He was charged with second-degree rape.

ASSAULTS

LEONARDTOWN, March 5. A man, 37, forced his way into a residence, damaged property and assaulted two women. He was charged with first-degree burglary, malicious destruction of property less than $ 500 and two counts of second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 9:27 p.m. Feb. 28. A woman, 28, forced her way into a residence and assaulted a woman. She was charged with first-degree burglary and second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 1:45 a.m. March 2. A man, 27, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 7:25 p.m. March 2. A woman, 45, assaulted a man at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

ROUTE 246 AND SHANGRI-LA DR., 12:30 a.m. March 2. A man, 43, with a sword chased a man, 39. He was charged with assault with a deadly weapon.

LEXINGTON PARK, 12:35 a.m. March 3. A man, 18, refused to leave a residence. When a trooper advised him to leave, the man charged at the officer. He was charged with second-degree assault, resisting arrest and trespassing.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LEXINGTON PARK, 6:30 a.m. March 1. A woman, 25, broke a window of a vehicle on Feb. 22 at a residence in Lexington Park. She was charged with malicious destruction of property less than $ 500.

RADFORD LANE, noon to 3 p.m. Feb. 27. A window was broken on a vehicle parked at a day-care center.

PINEY POINT, 7:50 p.m. March 2. A woman, 31, assaulted a man at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

-- Bonnie Smith

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T13

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, 10:40 p.m. Jan. 22. A man, 41, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, 5:15 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Jan. 25. Someone broke into a vehicle and an attempted to steal the radio.

TOWN CREEK PARK, 2:45 p.m. Jan. 26. Five Wilson tennis rackets were stolen from the park.

ARSON

PINEY POINT RD., 4:53 p.m. Jan. 25. An ignitable liquid was used to set a house on fire.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

GREAT MILLS, 8 p.m. Jan. 24 to 9:30 a.m. Jan. 25. A brick was thrown through the windshield of a vehicle at a residence.

ASSAULTS

HOLLYWOOD, 10:06 a.m. Jan. 23. A man, 44, assaulted a trooper. He was charged with second-degree assault, disorderly conduct, failure to obey a lawful order and resisting arrest.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEONARDTOWN, 9:45 a.m. Jan. 30. A man, 26, who allegedly raped a female youth, 13, on Dec. 5, was charged with second-degree rape, two counts of sex offense and second-degree assault. Another man, 24, is still being sought in connection with the incident.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, Jan. 25. A woman, 53, stole money from a patient's wallet at a medical center. She was charged with theft more than $ 500.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LEONARDTOWN, 6 p.m. Jan. 22 to 7:30 a.m. Jan. 23. A soda machine was damaged.

MECHANICSVILLE, 6:06 p.m. Jan. 21. A man, 42, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE, 8:37 p.m. Jan. 25. A man, 54, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ST. MARY'S CITY, 10:26 a.m. Jan. 24. A man, 25, stole checks from an auto repair business in Lexington Park and cashed them. He was charged with theft more than $ 500, forgery and uttering.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 646 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristow Center Dr., 10400 block, 5:30 p.m. May 1 to 8:30 a.m. May 2. Cash was stolen from a business.

DALE CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Elmwood Dr. and Darbydale Ave., 11 p.m. May 3. Five or six men assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of cash. The pedestrian was treated for injuries. 

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Sharon Rd., 18300 block, 6:49 p.m. May 6. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and prevented her from leaving a bedroom. A 20-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 6:50 to 11:30 p.m. May 7. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Mine Rd., 17400 block, 8 p.m. May 6 to 5 p.m. May 7. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

King George Dr., 7:45 p.m. May 3. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance at a residence, then sexually assaulted her at knifepoint. He also threatened to blow up the residence. A 53-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Loudoun Ave., 2:48 p.m. May 8. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 30-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sierra Ct., 6200 block, 4 p.m. April 26 to 9 a.m. May 4. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Visionary Ct.,7600 block, 8:33 a.m. May 3. Someone attempted to enter a residence by forcing open a basement door.

Yates Ford R., 6100 block, 3 p.m. May 1 to 12:30 p.m. May 2. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a side door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd., 4900 block, 2:58 p.m. May 6. A man at a school inappropriately touched a female juvenile. A 33-year-old Alexandria man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Bombay Way, 12700 block, 12:29 a.m. May 8. A man fired a weapon inside a residence. Bullet holes were found in a nearby residence. A 53-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Chinkapin Oak Lane, 3000 block, 8 p.m. April 15. Someone fired BBs at a residence, hitting a rear window.

ROBBERIES

Haversack Lane, 13500 block, 10:05 a.m. May 11. Two males with shotguns forcibly entered a residence and robbed two men of a firearm, cash, a wallet and a cellphone. The robbers fled in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cleeve Ct., 2800 block, 11:32 a.m. May 6. A man attempted to enter a residence, then fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

Eisenhower Cir., 1300 block, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. May 5. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a front door.

Eisenhower Cir., 1300 block, 6:20 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. May 5. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14100 block, 6:30 p.m. May 5 to 9:10 a.m. May 6. Cash was stolen from an office of a business. The area was entered by forcing open an interior door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Dale Blvd., 2900 block, 8:31 p.m. May 9. A man in a parking lot asked a male motorist for money. When the motorist refused, the man pulled out a gun and robbed the motorist of the vehicle, which was later recovered.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 10:35 a.m. May 4. Two women stole merchandise from a store.

Colfax Ct., 200 block, 12:30 to 2:15 p.m. April 30. An iPod touch was stolen from a residence.

Manassas Dr.,9100 block, 4 a.m. to 1:01 p.m. May 3. A headlight assembly was stolen from a business.

Owens Dr., 9100 block, 2 p.m. May 4 to 4 a.m. May 5. A truck battery, jumper cables and other property were stolen from vehicles in a parking lot.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T15


LENGTH: 814 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.  

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

STONE CORNER LANE, midnight June 20. A man, 29, damaged a vehicle by pulling the door open beyond its limits. He was charged with property destruction less than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WORTH AVE., June 13. Items were removed from a locked waste container at a business.

CALIFORNIA, 9 a.m. May 20 to 7:28 p.m. June 6. Money and jewelry were stolen from a residence being remodeled.

CALIFORNIA, 8:30 a.m. June 7 to 1:30 a.m. June 8. An antique tricycle lawn ornament was stolen from the front yard of a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CALIFORNIA, 7:45 p.m. June 10 to 5:20 a.m. June 11. A vehicle's window was broken with a rock while it was parked at the Lowe's store.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

MILL CREEK DR., 11:30 p.m. June 19. A man, 35, damaged a door at a residence. He was charged with property destruction and disorderly conduct.

CHAPTICO, 5 p.m. June 15 to 4 p.m. June 16. Windows were broken on a vehicle.

ASSAULTS

DAMERON, 8:45 a.m. June 18. A woman, 31, assaulted a man at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

CHANCELLORS RUN RD., 11 p.m. June 20. Three unidentified men assaulted a resident when he answered his door.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MILITARY LANE, 9 p.m. June 15 to 5:30 a.m. June 16. A microwave, still in the box, was stolen from a vehicle.

ASSAULTS

LEONARDTOWN, 10:45 p.m. June 14. A female youth, 17, assaulted another youth. She was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEONARDTOWN, November 2000 to March 2002. A man, 36, physically and sexually abused two female youths, ages 12 and 14. He was charged with two counts of sexual child abuse, two counts of physical child abuse and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 10:15 a.m. June 13 to 6:45 a.m. June 14. Money was stolen from the Cafe Des Artistes restaurant. A window was broken to gain entry.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 10:25 p.m. June 13. A man, 42, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 1:21 p.m. June 9. A female youth, 14, assaulted a female victim at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

ARSON

MIDWAY DR., 6 a.m. June 13. Two youths threw fireworks into a U.S. Postal Service drop box and an abandoned car. They were charged with malicious burning.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FDR BLVD., 1:45 to 4:10 p.m. June 15. Windows were broken on a vehicle. An MP3 player was stolen.

GREAT MILLS RD., 8-10:30 p.m. June 12. A golf cart on display at the St. Mary's Golf Center was stolen. The cart was recovered behind a trailer at Little Girls Way.

LEXINGTON PARK, 7 p.m. June 13 to 5:20 p.m. June 14. Stereo equipment was stolen from a vehicle.

LEXINGTON PARK, 9 p.m. June 10 to 6 a.m. June 11. A bank card was stolen from an unlocked vehicle parked at a residence. The bank card was used at different businesses in Lexington Park.

LEXINGTON PARK, May 30. A man, 39, took property from a residence. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

LEXINGTON PARK, 5 p.m. June 5 to 5 p.m. June 6. A bicycle was stolen from the back yard of a residence.

LEXINGTON PARK, 8 p.m. June 6 to 3:15 a.m. June 7. Computer equipment, jewelry and other items were stolen from an unlocked residence.

LEXINGTON PARK, 1:08 p.m. June 17. A woman, 31, stole property from the Super 8 Motel. She was charged with theft less than $ 500.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

THREE NOTCH RD., 6:30 p.m. June 18 to 6 a.m. June 19. A sign to a housing development was damaged.

LEXINGTON PARK, 5 p.m. June 4 to 6 p.m. June 10. A townhouse was painted with graffiti.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 1:30 p.m. June 11. A female youth, 15, assaulted another youth at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

THREE NOTCH RD., 9:30 to 9:58 a.m. June 13. A man, 30, assaulted another man, 54, with a jack handle. He was charged with first-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

QUEEN ARBOR CT., 4 to 6 p.m. June 16. Two male youths stole items from a residence. They were charged with burglary.

THREE NOTCH RD., 6:51 p.m. June 16. Someone purchased 19 gallons of gas at a service station and left without paying.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

TRADEMANS LANE, June 15 to 16. A 1999 Chevrolet Blazer was damaged.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

MORGANZA, 9:30 a.m. June 13. A man, 47, was charged with third-degree sex offense and second-degree assault on a female youth, 13.

VEHICLE THEFTS

TALL TIMBERS, 9:30 p.m. June 1 to 8:30 a.m. June 2. A 2002 Ford Expedition was stolen from a parking lot at the Tall Timbers Marina.

-- Bonnie Smith
