St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 446 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, 9:02 p.m. May 31. A male youth, 15, assaulted another boy at the Walden Sierra House. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, 8:25 p.m. May 30. Two women, 32 and 29, stole items from Kmart. They were charged with theft scheme, theft over $ 500 and theft less than $ 500. Police also learned that the women were involved in several other area thefts.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHARLOTTE HALL, 11:30 p.m. June 1 to 2:30 p.m. June 2. A vehicle's temporary license plates were stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 10:30 p.m. June 3. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

ASSAULTS

CABOT PLACE, 10:07 p.m. June 3. A man, 21, assaulted a female and a sheriff's deputy and destroyed property. He was charged with assault and property destruction.

LEXINGTON PARK, March 28 to April 9. A man, 53, showed graphic sexual photos to a girl, 9, and sexually assaulted her. He was charged with possession of child pornography and second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 7:56 p.m. May 24. A man, 28, struck a co-worker several times and bit off a piece of his ear. He was charged with first-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

THAMES AVE., 8 p.m. May 31 to 2:30 p.m. June 1. The front door of the Pregnancy Center was forced open and a steel file cabinet was damaged.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LEXINGTON PARK, 11:25 a.m. May 31. A man, 29, kicked out several panes of glass on a door at a residence. He was charged with malicious destruction of property.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 3:24 p.m. June 1. A man, 25, and a woman, 22, assaulted each other. They were charged with second-degree assault.

REDGATE DR., 2:29 a.m. June 3. A man, 33, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

GOLDEN BEACH, May 28 to June 1. A police investigation determined that a man, 18, had engaged in sexual acts with a 4-year-old girl. He was charged with second-degree rape, attempted second-degree rape and third-degree sex offense.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, 8:45 a.m. May 26. Four tires were stolen from a Chrysler Sebring for sale at B & B Auto Sales.

ASSAULTS

ST. INIGOES, June 5. A woman, 21, was charged with first-degree assault for attempting to hit another woman with her vehicle last October.

-- Bonnie Smith

Crime Report

Alexandria

These were among incidents reported recently by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police.

ASSAULTS

Arlington County 

These were among incidents reported recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4331 or visit www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

CULPEPPER ST. N., 1900 block, 3:50 a.m. Jan. 5. Police, responding to a report of a domestic dispute, found a woman bound in a locked bedroom. An Arlington man, 28, was charged with attempted murder.

FREDERICK ST. S., 8400 block, 3 a.m. Jan. 1. An intoxicated man stabbed a male acquaintance during a fight.

GLEBE RD. S., 1500 block, 3 to 5 a.m. Jan. 1. A male hit a man in the back of the head with an object.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2700 block, 3 a.m. Jan. 1. A male stabbed a man during a fight and fled. The man was taken to a hospital.

WILSON BLVD., 4200 block, 2 a.m. Jan. 2. A man threw a glass bottle at a group of people, striking a woman in the face. The woman was taken to a hospital. An Annandale man, 22, was charged with malicious wounding.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

LEXINGTON ST. N., 800 block, 3 p.m. Jan. 5. A man exposed himself to a woman on a bike trail and fled on a bike.

ROBBERIES

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2900 block, 7:45 p.m. Dec. 31. A man entered a grocery store, held a child while he robbed the store of cash and released the child before fleeing on foot. No injuries were reported.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 10:30 a.m. Jan. 5. A man robbed a store of cash at knifepoint and tied up an employee in a back room.

WALTER REED DR. S., 2600 block, 3 a.m. Jan. 3. A man was assaulted and robbed of a wallet by acquaintances.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ADAMS ST. S., 2500 block, 1 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Jan. 6. A garage was entered.

ARLINGTON BLVD., 1600 block, 8:30 p.m. Dec. 31 to 4 a.m. Jan. 1. A hotel room was entered by force, and property was damaged.

CHESTERFIELD RD. S., 4900 block, 10 p.m. Dec. 30 to 10 a.m. Jan. 2. Offices at a school were entered.

CLEVELAND ST. N., 700 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 31 to 9:30 p.m. Jan. 1. A residence was entered.

COLUMBIA PIKE N., 5500 block, 6 a.m. Jan. 6. Construction material was stolen from a construction site.

QUINCY ST. S., 2200 block, 5:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Jan. 5. A laptop was stolen from a residence.

QUINN ST. N., 1800 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 30 to 10 p.m. Jan. 1. Property was stolen from an apartment. Seven vacant apartments were also entered.

TROY ST. N., 1700 block, 9 p.m. Dec. 31 to 1 a.m. Jan. 1. Electronics were stolen from an apartment.

WILSON BLVD., 2800 block, 3:30 a.m. Jan. 1 to 3:30 p.m. Jan. 2. Cash was stolen from a business.

11TH ST. N., 4000 block, 4 a.m. Jan. 1. A man tried to enter a residence by breaking a window. He fled when a resident called police but was found nearby. A Dumfries man, 21, was charged with destruction of property and unlawful entry.

20TH RD. N., 2400 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 31 to 12:30 a.m. Jan. 1. Property was stolen from an apartment entered through a window.

September 4, 2014 Thursday 11:10 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 627 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA ASSAULTS

Sequoia Park Way, 7900 block, 11:23 a.m. Aug. 23. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 42-year-old Bristow man was arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Dr David Cline Lane, 17900 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 21 to 4:30 a.m. Aug. 22. Two laptop computers, three video game systems and other items were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

GAINESVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lee Hwy. and Gainesville Square Shopping Center, 9:45 to 10 p.m. Aug. 27. A man pushed a female pedestrian down an embankment and sexually assaulted her.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wellington Rd., 5500 block, 5:20 p.m. Aug. 21 to 7:20 a.m. Aug. 22. Copper, truck tires and other property were stolen from a scrap yard entered by cutting a gate lock.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Keystone Rd. area, 2009 to 2014. A man reportedly sexually assaulted a female acquaintance several times. A 41-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd., 2800 block, 6:49 p.m. Aug. 25. A woman arranged to meet a man in a parking lot. When the man arrived, the woman was with a male acquaintance, who shot the man in the face. The pair fled. The injured man was taken to a hospital. The alleged assailant abandoned a vehicle in a school parking lot, then flagged down a motorist and forced him to drive to another location, where he fled on foot. A 31-year-old Stafford woman and a 28-year-old Woodbridge man were arrested.

Gordon Blvd., 12500 block, 10:09 p.m. Aug. 21. During an argument, a man threw a bottle at a female acquaintance, hitting her head. He then choked her until she lost consciousness. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Queensbury Ct., 12500 block, 6:03 p.m. Aug. 21. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance in the face, knocking him down. The injured man's head struck the pavement, rendering him unconscious. He was treated for injuries.

WEAPONS

Birchdale Ave. and Dale Blvd., 9:30 p.m. Aug. 25. During a fight on a basketball court involving two groups, gunshots were fired. A bullet hit an occupied parked vehicle. No injuries were reported.

Lakota Dr., 7000 block, 6:13 p.m. Aug. 23. Several gunshots were heard. A side of a residence and a vehicle were hit. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Cloverdale Rd., 14800 block, 2:04 a.m. Aug. 24. Two males stole beer from a convenience store. They assaulted the employee who had attempted to stop them and implied they had a knife.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cardin Pl., 15000 block, 4 to 5 p.m. Aug. 21. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Thornwood Lane, 9200 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 25 to 8 a.m. Aug. 26. A purse containing cash, medicine and jewelry was stolen from a residence, which was entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Elm Ct.,Aug. 19 to 9:35 a.m. Aug. 20. A gray mountain bike and lock were stolen from the front area of a residence.

VANDALISM

Martin Dr., 8 to 9 p.m. Aug. 26. Tires of a vehicle were slashed.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

December 8, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1858 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Green Holly Dr., 1200 block, Nov. 15. Credit cards were stolen from a vehicle at a high school. The cards were later used to make purchases at the Annapolis Mall.  

DAVIDSONVILLE AREA ROBBERIES

Blackberry Lane and Governor Bridge Rd., 6:19 p.m. Nov. 27. A male got out of a small white car that had stopped near a vehicle in which the driver was programming a Global Position System device. He robbed her of cash, then got back in the car, which was driven by a female.

EDGEWATER AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Selby-on-the-Bay area, 1:15 p.m. Nov. 21. An Edgewater man, 62, was arrested in connection with reports of a man in a pickup truck approaching students. The incidents took place Nov. 17 and 18, near the intersection of May Lane and Monarch Drive and near Colony Crossing and Antiqua Place. A registered sex offender, the man was charged with violating conditions of parole.

GAMBRILLS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Annapolis Rd., 1000 block, Nov. 28. A male student sexually assaulted a female student in a school bathroom. An investigation was continuing.

GLEN BURNIE AREA HOMICIDES

Ritchie Hwy., 7100 block, 10:34 p.m. Nov. 13. Andrew Michael Johnson, 25, of Glen Burnie, was found in the parking lot of a restaurant suffering from a gunshot wound. He was taken to a hospital, where he died from his injuries. A suspect, being held on an unrelated charge in the Baltimore County Detention Center, was charged with first-degree murder on Nov. 18.

ASSAULTS

Mary Lane and Oakwood Rd., 6:04 p.m. Nov. 29. During an argument, a man stabbed an acquaintance in the abdomen. An Owings Mill man, 38, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and other offenses. The victim was taken to a hospital, where he was treated for non-life threatening injuries.

ROBBERIES

Pamela Rd., 400 block, 7:20 p.m. Nov. 25. Two males wearing ski masks robbed a pedestrian behind an apartment building of cash at gunpoint. The victim sustained minor injuries but did not require medical attention.

Ritchie St., 5800 block, 8:49 p.m. Nov. 25. A woman was robbed by two men who implied they were armed. A Baltimore man, 34, and a Glen Burnie man, 34, were arrested.

HANOVER AREA ROBBERIES

Arundel Mills Cir., 7000 block, 6:10 p.m. Nov. 26. A male tried to rob a man in a parking lot at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed when the victim resisted.

LINTHICUM AREA ROBBERIES

School Lane and Orchard Rd., 8:27 p.m. Nov. 24. Two male teenagers robbed three people in a vehicle that had stopped at an intersection. The assailants fled on foot with cash.

PASADENA AREA ROBBERIES

Mountain Rd., 4400 block, 8:58 a.m. Nov. 21. Two men robbed a restaurant of cash at knifepoint.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

ROBBERIES

Atwater Dr., 300 block, 6:15 p.m. Nov. 28. Ten male teenagers robbed a pedestrian of a cellphone and his wallet at gunpoint. A 14-year-old male was arrested that same day on charges of robbery, assault and reckless endangerment. A 16-year-old male was arrested Nov. 30.

Croll Dr., 200 block, 6:30 a.m. Nov. 13. A man robbed an acquaintance of her cellphone, then fled in her vehicle, which was recovered the same day. On Nov. 29, an Annapolis man, 21, was charged with robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Boucher Ave., 1000 block, Nov. 28. A man was found inside a vehicle he had broken into. An Annapolis man, 40, was charged with rogue and vagabond and in connection with a theft from a vehicle in the unit block of Munroe Court the night of Nov. 11.

Bunche St., unit block, 8 p.m. Nov. 29 to 11 a.m. Nov. 30. A vehicle was entered by breaking a window.

Clay St., 200 block, Nov. 27. A bicycle was stolen. It was recovered the same day. A juvenile was charged with theft.

Hicks Ave., 1-99 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 24 to 8 a.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a screen door.

Old Solomons Island Rd., 200 block, 3:15 p.m. Nov. 28. A woman took a purse from a shopping cart, then dropped it to the ground when the victim gave chase.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Quiet Waters Pl., 100 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 18 to 4 p.m. Nov. 27. A gray Yamaha Zuma motor scooter was stolen from a parking space.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ten Oaks Rd., 6300 block, 3:56 a.m. Dec. 1. A safe was among property stolen from a tanning salon.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Centre Park Dr., 8700 block, 12:53 a.m. Nov. 26. A man robbed a convenience store of cash and cigarettes at gunpoint.

Clarksville Pike, 10900 block, 2:15 p.m. Nov. 25. Two male teenagers threatened a male and fled with a tablet PC. A male, 17, was arrested.

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 10:08 a.m. Nov. 24. Three males robbed someone at a gas station of cash at gunpoint.

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 26. Two males threatened a pedestrian on a footpath, then fled with a wallet.

Hickory Ridge Rd. and Campus Dr., 8:20 p.m. Nov. 28. A male waved down a vehicle, then forced the occupants out at gunpoint and robbed one of a wallet and cellphone. He then drove away in the car with a female accomplice.

Majors Lane, 6000 block, 7:53 p.m. Nov. 23. A teenager asked an acquaintance to meet her in a parking lot, where he was threatened by four people who robbed him of a cellphone, shoes and other property, then fled in her vehicle. A female and a male, both 17, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berrypick Lane, 11000 block, 9:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Nov. 20. A video game console was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a front door. An acquaintance is suspected.

Camelback Lane, 6000 block, 11:30 p.m. Nov. 25 to 9 a.m. Nov. 26. Two laptops, cash and a wallet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Columbia Rd., 5600 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 23 to 7:45 p.m. Nov. 27. Two TVs and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Green Meadow Dr., 12200 block, 2:45 a.m. Nov. 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Green Meadow Dr., 12200 block, 9 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. Nov. 26. Tools, medication and a shotgun were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass near a door.

High Hay Dr., 11400 block, 11 a.m. to 11:15 p.m. Nov. 25. A residence was entered by breaking glass in a back door.

New Country Lane, 11800 block, 4:23 p.m. Nov. 28. A residence was entered by removing boards from the front entrance. Former occupants who had been evicted were seen leaving the premises.

Quarterstaff Rd., 10600 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 23 to 3:36 p.m. Nov. 26. A residence was entered by breaking glass next to the front door.

Standon Pl., 9500 block, 7:56 a.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a door. An intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Swansfield Rd., 10900 block, 12:15 to 10:20 p.m. Nov. 26. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Wesleigh Dr., 10100 block, 11:42 a.m. Nov. 29. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a door.

Winter Moss Ct., 5300 block,, 10:30 p.m. Nov. 27 to 7:30 a.m. Nov. 28. A purse, a video game system and a backpack were stolen from a residence entered by using a garage door opener that was in an unlocked vehicle in the driveway.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Hickory Ridge Rd., 10200 block, 4:07 a.m. Nov. 26. A vehicle that had been reported stolen from this location was recovered in Baltimore.

Minstrel Way, 7100 block, 9:33 a.m. Nov. 28. An attempt was made to steal a vehicle by damaging the ignition.

ELKRIDGE AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Marshalee Dr., 6000 block, 11:49 a.m. Nov. 24. A male was seen exposing himself.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Waterloo Rd., 6700 block, 9 a.m. to 1:52 p.m. Nov. 28. A camcorder and car keys were stolen from an apartment entered by prying open the front door.

Old Waterloo Rd., 6700 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1:52 p.m. Nov. 28. An apartment was entered by prying open the front door.

Susans Pass, 7100 block, 4:15 p.m. Nov. 25 to 3 p.m. Nov. 28. Cabinets and flat trim were stolen from an unlocked house under construction.

Washington Blvd., 7500 block, 11:18 p.m. Nov. 29. A business was entered by forcing the front door.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA ROBBERIES

Baltimore National Pike, 9300 block, 3:12 a.m. Nov. 24. A male robbed a convenience store at gunpoint, then fled on foot.

Old Columbia Pike, 4100 block, 12:36 p.m. Nov. 23. A male implied that he had a weapon and demanded cash from gas station employees. When they refused, he fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore National Pike, 10000 block, 3:55 a.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a liquor store by tampering with a door.

Rogers Ave., 3000 block, 11:27 p.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to break into an apartment. A male was seen fleeing empty-handed.

FULTON AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maple Lawn Blvd., 7800 block, Nov. 14 to Nov. 28. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a side window.

JESSUP AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Savage-Guilford Rd., 8600 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 23. A vehicle was stolen.

LAUREL AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Hitching Post Lane, 9100 block, 4:54 p.m. Nov. 23. A boy exposed himself outside a residence window, then fled with a group of boys.

ROBBERIES

All Saints Rd., 9100 block, 9:01 a.m. Nov. 25. A man robbed a flower shop of cash at knifepoint.

WOODBINE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lisbon Center Dr., 700 block, 12:19 a.m. Nov. 30. A safe was stolen from a business entered by forcing a back door. The safe was recovered behind the building.

February 21, 2008 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ26


LENGTH: 2702 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received complete reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

KING FARM BLVD., 500 to 900 block, 7:15 p.m. Feb. 1. A male approached a woman in a garage, physically assaulted her, touched her inappropriately and fled.

ROBBERIES

REDLAND RD., 17500 block, 4:05 p.m. Feb. 3. A man in a bank parking lot robbed a woman of property at gunpoint after she had made a deposit. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASTER BLVD., 600 block, Feb. 2. A residential burglary was reported.

CARROLL AVE., 12300 block, Feb. 6. A commercial burglary occurred at an auto wholesale business. Several vehicles in the lot were damaged.

CHASE CROSSING CIRCLE, Jan. 30 to Jan. 31. Property was stolen from three vehicles entered by force.

CONGRESSIONAL CT., 4 p.m. Feb. 3 to 7 a.m. Feb. 4. Property was stolen from a home under construction.

EDMONSTON DR., 600 block, 2:45 to 3:15 a.m. Jan. 29. Two male youths and a female youth attempted to enter a historic mansion.

FREDERICK RD., 15300 block, Feb. 1 to Feb. 2. A car dealership was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

FREDERICK RD., 15400 block, 1:45 a.m. Feb. 2. A car dealership was entered. Property from the intruder was recovered at the scene.

GREENBRIAR DR., 12200 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 30 to 3:30 p.m. Jan. 31. Property was stolen from a home under construction and entered by force.

INDIANOLA DR., 15900 block, 9:30 p.m. Feb. 2 to 10:30 a.m. Feb. 3. A car dealership was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

PARRISH DR., 2:45 a.m. Jan. 29. Car stereos, stereo equipment and loose items were stolen from several vehicles entered by force.

POTOMAC PARK AREA, Feb. 3 to Feb. 4. Global Positioning System devices were stolen from four vehicles entered by force.

RESERVE CHAMPION DR., 800 block, Feb. 2. A residential burglary was reported.

SABRINA TERR., 17500 block, Feb. 6. A residential burglary was reported.

SHADY GROVE RD., 16100 block, 4:33 a.m. Jan. 31. A sign shop was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

WINTERGREEN TERR., 1000 block, Feb. 5. A residential burglary was reported.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BETHESDA AVE., 4800 block, 1 to 9 a.m. Feb. 3. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

BREWER HOUSE RD., 10800 block, Feb. 1 to Feb. 2. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

CRESTBERRY PL., 10100 block, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Jan. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

DEMOCRACY BLVD., 6700 block, Feb. 3 to Feb. 4. Property was stolen from two vehicles entered by force in a hotel parking lot.

DERBYSHIRE LANE, 9900 block, 1 a.m. Feb. 1. Two people were seen attempting to enter a residence, but they were interrupted by a security alarm and fled.

DUPONT AVE., 3800 block. An auto repair and car maintenance business was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

EAST WEST HWY., 1900 block, 9:10 p.m. Jan. 30. A man accosted a female, grabbed her purse and fled.

EXECUTIVE BOULEVARD, Jan. 30 to Jan. 31. Property was stolen from two suites at a clinical trials center. One of the suites was entered by force.

MARINELLI RD., 5400 block, 3 to 5 p.m. Feb. 5. Property was stolen from a residence.

OLD GEORGETOWN RD., 10400 block, 1:45 a.m. Feb. 5. A salon was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

WISCONSIN AVE., 8200 block, 1:30 a.m. Jan. 20. A management company was entered. An arrest was made at the scene.

WOODGLEN DR., 11200 block, 12:45 a.m. Feb. 2. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

WOODGLEN DR., 11200 block, Feb. 2 to Feb. 6. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GETTY PARK AREA, 3 p.m. Jan. 31. A 15-year old female reported being sexually assaulted. She was in the company of several acquaintances when the sexual assault occurred.

EAST WEST HIGHWAY AND 16TH STREET, 11:57 p.m. Feb. 3. A male accosted a pedestrian and touched her inappropriately. A male was arrested in connection with the incident.

ASSAULTS

LOCKWOOD DR., 11600 block, 3:15 a.m. Feb. 3. A stabbing occurred during an argument at a residence. A roommate of the stabbed resident was arrested and charged with aggravated assault.

QUEBEC TERR., 1100 block, Feb. 4. A man argued with a male and assaulted him, resulting in a blunt force trauma injury. An adult male relative of the assaulted male was arrested and charged with aggravated assault.

ROBBERIES

CASTLE BLVD., 14100 block, 6:50 p.m. Jan. 30. Two males accosted a pedestrian walking from his apartment to a Metro parking lot, robbed him and fled.

EASLEY ST., 800 block, 11:40 p.m. Feb 5. Three men in a stairwell of a building robbed someone of property and fled.

FENTON STREET AND SILVER SPRING AVENUE, 5:35 p.m. Feb. 4. A man implied he had a gun and attempted to rob someone but fled empty-handed.

GREENWOOD AVENUE AND DOMER AVENUE, 5 p.m. Jan. 31. Two males armed with knives accosted a pedestrian and fled in a gray Dodge mini van. Nothing was reported taken.

PARKFORD MANOR TERR., 3300 block, 6:50 p.m. Jan. 30. Ten males accosted a food delivery person, took food and fled.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 8500 block, 1 a.m. Feb. 2. Several people armed with at least one weapon robbed a pedestrian and fled in a red Ford Explorer with Maryland tags.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BEETHOVEN WAY, 3100 block, 9 a.m. to noon Feb. 1. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

SUNRISE CT., 1700 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 5 to 8:30 a.m. Feb. 6. Three pairs of shoes, two bottles of cologne and a prescription were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ELM AVE., 400 block, 7:43 p.m. Feb. 11. A male wearing a red plaid shirt attempted to force open a side window of a residence, but was interrupted and fled through a side yard when a resident returned home.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6400 block, 10:50 a.m. Feb. 14. Two male motorists in a light-color Honda at a gas station stopped near a woman pumping gas. A surveillance camera showed one of the motorists getting out of the car, opening the woman's unlocked passenger door and taking her purse. The robbers then sped off in the Honda.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7200 block, Feb. 9 to 11:37 a.m. Feb. 10. Property was stolen from a business entered by pushing out a window of a front door.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7600 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 8 to 8:34 a.m. Feb. 9. Property was stolen from business entered by throwing a rock through a front window.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 589 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ROBBERIES

Columbia Springs Way and Falling Water Dr., 3:55 p.m. March 22. A male entered a vehicle occupied by two men. One of the men assaulted the male and took cash from his pocket. The male exited the vehicle and the two men fled.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Old Stage Rd., 16900 block, March 26. A 33-year-old Falls Church man was arrested in connection with the rape of a female juvenile acquaintance. 

ASSAULTS

Stewart Lane, 3600 block, 1:06 a.m. March 23. A group of men confronted a male juvenile at a residence. One of the men shot the juvenile in the leg. The juvenile was treated for injuries. An 18-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Edgewood Dr., 16500 block, 7:30 p.m. March 2 to 8:30 a.m. March 23. A shop was entered by forcing a front door and a vending machine was damaged. Nothing was reported missing.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lomond Dr., March 21. A man reportedly sexually assaulted two female juveniles during the past few years. A 40-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Edgepark Cir., 11000 block, 5:35 p.m. March 20. A man knocked on a front door of a residence, then assaulted a male acquaintance who answered the door. As the two continued to fight outside, a relative of the man entered the residence and took several pairs of tennis shoes. An 18-year-old Nokesville man was arrested.

New Market Ct., 7100 block, Feb. 26. A female director of a day-care facility allegedly assaulted two children. A 39-year-old Haymarket woman was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Ranger Loop, 1400 block, 8:40 a.m. March 26. A man in an apartment complex hallway exposed himself to a woman.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dumfries Rd., 10600 block, 12:30 p.m. March 22 to 6:50 a.m. March 24. Several state vehicle inspection stickers were stolen from a business entered by breaking a window of a rear door.

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 1:20 a.m. March 24. Costume jewelry was stolen from a business entered by breaking a glass door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Potomac Mills Cir. and Nazarene Way, 9:29 p.m. March 20. A man approached a woman standing next to her vehicle and asked for directions. He then grabbed the woman and began to choke her. They both fell and the two struggled. He demanded her car keys and after an unsuccessful attempt to force her into the back seat of the vehicle, he fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Photo Dr., 13500 block, 11:46 p.m. March 22. A man entered a residence through a front door. A male resident and an acquaintance confronted the man and detained him until police arrived. A 30-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Winona Way, 12000 block, 6 p.m. March 18 to 8:20 a.m. March 19. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a side door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Mathis Ave., 9000 block, 5:45 p.m. March 19. A man grabbed a female acquaintance's purse and ran into a residence through a back yard. When the woman shouted, he returned the purse to her. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holden Dr., 10 p.m. March 18 to 11:08 a.m. March 19. A hammer drill was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Corbett Cir., 5 to 9 p.m. March 21. Rocks were thrown at the front door of a residence and the glass was broken.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

February 24, 2011 Thursday

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime reportAnne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Carrie Donovan


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1411 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit group, will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Tips can be submitted anonymously by calling the 24-hour hotline at 866-756-2587, or atwww.metrocrimestoppers.net. You can also send a text to 274637: Type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

BROOKLYN AREA

ROBBERIES

Ritchie Hwy., 5700 block, 11:20 a.m. Feb. 10. A man got out of a car in a parking lot, grabbed a purse from a woman pushing a shopping cart, then fled in the vehicle. The victim was injured slightly but did not require medical treatment. A Glen Burnie man, 23, was arrested at a residence on Lacross Lane in Glen Burnie. Police said the man is also suspected in two purse snatchings Dec. 29 in the 6700 block of Ritchie Highway. He was charged with robbery, assault and three counts of theft.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ASSAULTS
 

Crainmont Dr. and Nol Park Rd., 11:01 a.m. Feb. 16. A man resisted a police officer serving an arrest warrant, then fled on foot to an apartment in the 7900 block of Nol Park Court. Officers entered the apartment and arrested three men, all of Glen Burnie. A 23-year-old man was charged with assaulting a police officer, disorderly conduct, failure to obey a lawful order, possession of drugs and possession with intent to distribute. A 22-year-old man was charged with obstruction and hindering a police investigation and probation violations. A 19-year-old man was charged with obstruction and hindering a police investigation.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Secluded Post Cir., 12:30 a.m. Feb. 11. Two males wearing ski masks grabbed a woman entering her building and forced her into her apartment, where they sexually assaulted her. Anyone with information should call 410-222-3750.

LAUREL AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Laurel Fort Meade Rd., 3500 block, 2:12 a.m. Feb. 14. Three men seen breaking into vehicles at an auto dealership fled to a wooded area. Two 25-year-old District men and a 29-year-old Beltsville man were arrested a short time later. Charges included motor vehicle theft and malicious destruction of property.

LINTHICUM HEIGHTS AREA

ROBBERIES

Hammonds Ferry and Shipley roads, 12:23 p.m. Feb. 12. Two males attacked a man and robbed him of property. With the help of witnesses, two Halethorpe males, ages 15 and 19, were arrested after a brief foot chase. Charges included attempted murder, first degree assault and robbery. The victim was treated at a hospital for injuries that were said not be life-threatening.

LOTHIAN AREA

ROBBERIES

Southern Maryland Blvd., 5400 block, 6:28 p.m. Feb. 12. A man and a woman approached an acquaintance in a restaurant parking lot. After a short conversation, the man forced the acquaintance into his vehicle at knifepoint and demanded a ride. The victim broke free and fled with the keys. A short time later, a man, 47, and a woman, 39, were arrested.

PASADENA AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Gooseneck Rd., 2000 block, 7:15 a.m. Dec. 17. A 2005 Ford F550 that had been reported stolen was recovered at a storage lot in the 8200 block of Baltimore Annapolis Boulevard. A warrant has been issued for a 25-year-old Pasadena man.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

ROBBERIES

Yawl and Island Creek roads, 3 p.m. Feb. 11. Three passengers in a taxi robbed the driver of cash at knifepoint.

 THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barbud Lane, 1200 block, Feb. 11 to Feb. 14. A computer was stolen from an unlocked van.

Tyler Ave., 1300 block, 1 to 8 p.m. Feb. 12. A video game system was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

First St., 300 block, 7:30 to 8:30 p.m. Feb. 13. Computer equipment was stolen from an unlocked Chevrolet truck.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Center St., 200 block, 9 P.M. Feb. 13 to 6 a.m. Feb. 14. An Americana scooter was stolen from a driveway.

McGuckian St.,1800 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 11 to 8:30 a.m. Feb. 12. Three vehicles were stolen from the service area of an auto-repair shop. Keys to the vehicles were stolen during a break-in at the business.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other felonies, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867 (STOP).

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Downdale Pl., 6600 block, 5:29 p.m. Feb. 14. A pizza delivery driver was attacked and robbed of food. No serious injuries were reported.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 12:10 a.m. Feb. 13. Two males attacked five people in a parking lot and fled with a wallet and a cellphone.

Robert Oliver Pl., 5800 block, 11:31 p.m. Feb. 12. Three males attacked a pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet and jacket at knifepoint. Two Columbia males, ages 16 and 28, were arrested. Charges included armed robbery, first- and second-degree assault and theft. No serious injuries were reported.

Whiteacre Rd., 9600 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 11. Three male teenagers attacked a pizza delivery driver. The assailants fled with cash and a GPS device. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Flowerstock Row, 8800 block, 10:57 p.m. Feb. 15. A break-in occurred at a residence. Police said it was a domestic incident.

Ridermark Row, 11200 block, 11:30 a.m. to 3:44 p.m. Feb. 14. An attempt was made to break into a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Summer Day Lane, 5000 block, 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Feb. 10. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through a sliding-glass door.

Tidesebb Ct., 8800 block, Feb. 11 to Feb. 15. A video game system was stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear window.

Wincopin Cir., 10200 block, 9:18 a.m. Feb. 15. A cart was stolen from a restaurant. A man seen driving away with the property was arrested a short time later. A Pasadena man, 36, was charged with theft, resisting arrest and reckless endangerment.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Barnwood Pl., 5800 block, 11:06 a.m. Feb. 12. A blue 2000 Honda Civic SI was stolen.

Stanford Blvd., 8800 block, 11:30 a.m. Feb. 11. A person stole a vehicle from a business. An employee is suspected.

ELKRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd., 6500 block, 1:28 a.m. Dec. 17. A gunman robbed a convenience store. On Feb. 16, a Laurel man, 21, was charged with armed robbery, robbery, assault, reckless endangerment, using a handgun in the commission of a felony and theft.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Furnace Ave., 5600 block, 3:41 p.m. Feb. 16. An attempt was made to break into a contracting business. Nothing was reported missing.

Lori Lane, 6000 block, 8:15 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. Feb. 15. Three laptop computers, an MP3 player and a sports bag were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a sliding-glass door.

Red Barn Way, 7900 block, 11:24 a.m. Feb. 15. A residence was entered by prying open a screen and forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Washington Blvd., 6600 block, 4:56 p.m. Feb. 13. A man was seen entering a vacant mobile home through a hole in the floor. An Elkridge man, 21, was charged with first-, second- and fourth degree burglary.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Dorsey Run Rd., 7100 b lock, 11:23 a.m. Feb. 10. A vehicle was stolen from an auction lot.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Vinter Way, 4500 block, 4:31 a.m. Feb. 17. A break-in occurred at a trailer at a construction site. Nothing was reported missing.

JESSUP AREA

ROBBERIES

Oceano Ave. and Tarbay Dr., 3:30 p.m. Feb. 10. A male attacked a motorist getting out of his vehicle. After trying to get into the vehicle and searching the motorist for personal property, the assailant fled empty-handed. The victim drove himself to an urgent-care facility for medical treatment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Inwood Ct., 8400 block, Jan. 29 to Feb. 13. A TV was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

LAUREL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Livery Lane, 9200 block, 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. Feb. 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Whiskey Run, 9800 block, 10:24 p.m. Feb. 14. A 2007 Harley-Davidson motorcycle and a 12-foot Valu trailer were stolen.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 725 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

WEAPONS

Dumfries Rd., 17300 block, 11:49 p.m. June 9. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pine Bluff Dr., 3300 block, 2:07 a.m. June 10. Two men attempted to enter a restaurant by breaking a side window. They fled when an employee yelled at them.

GAINESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Braemar Village Plaza, 12800 block, 4:23 p.m. June 4. A motorist picked up a female juvenile acquaintance, drove her to the location and sexually assaulted her. A 26-year-old Gainesville man was arrested. 

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Whitehall Dr., 7500 block, 3 a.m. June 8. During an argument, a woman hit a female acquaintance in the head with a bottle. A 43-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Keara Ct., 7700 block, 11:05 to 11:50 a.m. June 3. Cash and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through a window.

NOKESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Par Dr. and Vint Hill Rd., June 8. A man raped an acquaintance at gunpoint after she picked him up and drove him to the area. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Graham Park Rd., 3800 block, 1:47 a.m. June 8. During an argument, a woman threw a bottle at a female acquaintance, cutting her head. A 48-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

Katie Pl. and Kyle Lane, 3700 block, 12:26 a.m. June 9. Responding to a report of a loud party, officers heard several gunshots.

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 2 p.m. June 6. Three males pointed a handgun at a man cleaning out his vehicle. The man confronted them, and they fled empty-handed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Bel Air and Jeffries Roads, 10:05 p.m. June 9. A man accompanied by a woman assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a bag containing food.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14000 block, 9:33 p.m. June 10. A gunman robbed a man and a woman of a purse and cellphone.

Old Bridge Rd., 3500 block, 11:21 p.m. June 9. Three gunmen robbed a gas station of cash and a customer of a wallet and cellphone.

Reardon Lane, 5600 block, 12:58 a.m. June 6. A man demanded narcotics from a male acquaintance at gunpoint. The acquaintance assaulted the man, who fired the gun at him. The man took the acquaintance's car keys and sunglasses and fled on foot. The acquaintance called a female acquaintance before calling police and put marijuana in her vehicle. A 21-year-old man and a 20-year-old woman, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, 10:51 a.m. June 5. A man in a building exposed himself to a woman and propositioned her for sex. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Armstead St., 13100 block, 6 a.m. to noon. June 6. Several firearms and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 3:25 p.m. June 5. A group of men entered a residence by breaking a rear door and ransacked the interior while a resident hid.

Canada Goose Loop, 15900 block, 4:30 a.m. June 6. A gold chain was stolen from a residence.

Grady Lane, 3200 block, 8 a.m. to 4:20 p.m. June 6. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Manchester Way, 12300 block, noon to 5:45 p.m. June 6. A laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear door.

Shallow Ct., 14800 block, 5 to 7:30 p.m. June 10. Cash and a computer tablet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Sunny Brook Ct., 3900 block, 10:45 a.m. June 7 to 2:30 p.m. June 8. Two rugs were stolen from a residence.

Woodmark Dr., 2800 block, 7:15 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. June 7. Cash and a computer tablet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T15


LENGTH: 198 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police.  

For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

COLTON'S POINT, 12:40 a.m. Dec. 17. A man, 31, sexually assaulted a female youth, 15, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree rape.

ASSAULTS

GREEN VIEW KNOLLS, 10:30 a.m. Dec. 20. A woman, 25, was arrested in connection with a Dec. 18 stabbing. She was charged with second-degree assault, reckless endangerment, false imprisonment and kidnapping.

ASSAULTS

GODDARD CT., 3:45 p.m. Dec. 18. A female youth, 14, assaulted another female at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN, 11:15 a.m. Dec. 21. A man, 38, assaulted a female at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 10:14 p.m. Dec. 17. A man, 43, assaulted another man at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

-- Bonnie Smith

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 247 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police.  

For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

CHARLOTTE HALL, Dec. 11. A man, 77, had sexual contact with a male youth, 10. He was charged with four counts of third-degree sex offense.

ASSAULTS

LEONARDTOWN, 7:25 p.m. Dec. 7. A man, 37, and a woman, 36, assaulted each other. They were charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

FOREST PARK RD., 4:25 p.m. Dec. 12. A woman, 27, assaulted another woman at a residence on Oct. 31. She was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEXINGTON PARK, Sept. 1 through Oct. 31. A man, 60, sexually assaulted a female youth, 7. He was charged with fourth-degree sexual offense and second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

NEW MARKET TURNER RD., 12:41 a.m. Dec. 2. Four male teenagers destroyed mailboxes with baseball bats. They were charged with malicious destruction of property less than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

NEW MARKET TURNER RD., Nov. 26 through Dec. 10. A rear license plate was stolen off a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

VALLEY LEE, midnight Nov. 30 through 6:30 p.m. Dec. 4. License plates were stolen off a vehicle parked at a bar.

-- Bonnie Smith

Washingtonpost.com


December 22, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 2337 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA THEFT/BREAK-IN

Riverwalk Dr., 3000 block, night of Dec. 7 to 6:57 a.m. Dec. 8. A 2005 Mitsubishi Eclipse was stolen from an unlocked garage. The vehicle was recovered at Harbor Drive and Carrollton Road. Credit cards had been taken from the vehicle and used at several Annapolis locations, including a convenience store in the 900 block of Bay Ridge Road. Anyone with information is asked to contact Detective Mark Ottey at 410-222-1965. 

BROOKLYN PARK AREA ROBBERy

Belle Grove and W. Arden roads, 10:40 p.m. Dec. 14. Three males assaulted and robbed a male teenager who was walking with a female. A phone was taken.

GAMBRILLS AREA ROBBERy

Brandermill Blvd., 2400 block, 6:50 a.m. Dec. 11. A masked gunman robbed a restaurant of cash, then fled on foot.

GLEN BURNIE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Eugenia Ave., Dec. 3. A female said she observed a male acquaintance perform a sexual act on a boy inside a residence. An investigation determined that a man had sexually assaulted a boy on two other occasions in the past month. A Glen Burnie man, 52, was charged with sexual abuse of a minor, three counts of second-degree assault and other violations. Anyone with information is asked to contact Detective Vincent Carbonaro at 410-222-3484.

Hospital Dr., 300 block, 1:40 a.m. Dec. 14. A male sexually assaulted a woman as they were walking from a bar on Crain Highway. They had met at the bar earlier in the evening. Anyone with information is asked to contact Detective Justin Widup at 410-222-3468.

WEAPON

Hideaway Loop Rd., 400 block, 1:20 p.m. Dec. 9. During a police traffic stop of a motorist, two knives, crack cocaine and marijuana were found. A Glen Burnie man, 35, was charged with possession of a dangerous and deadly weapon and marijuana, and possession of crack cocaine with intent to distribute. A 2011 Hyundai Sonata was seized.

ROBBERy

Pamela Rd., 400 block, 6:36 p.m. Dec. 13. A male hit a pedestrian in the face with an object, knocking him down. The assailant and another male robbed the pedestrian of cash, a cellphone and other items, then fled on foot toward Old Stage Road.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Crain Hwy., 7900 block, 3:36 a.m. Dec. 8. Police responded to an alarm at a hardware store and saw a male driving away in a Chevy Cavalier. The driver initially refused to stop but eventually got out of the vehicle. Power tools and other merchandise were discovered in the car. A Glen Burnie man, 48, was arrested and charged with second-degree burglary, theft, destruction of property and resisting arrest.

LAUREL AREA DRUG-RELATED INCIDENT

Whiskey Bottom Rd. near Yellow Flower Rd.,Dec. 10. Investigating a report, police found a group of males walking behind a business. One ran and threw down a bag containing 12 smaller bags of marijuana. An Upper Marlboro man, 20, was arrested and charged with possession of marijuana and resisting arrest.

ODENTON AREA ROBBERIES

Breitwert and Oakton roads, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 10. Two juveniles were robbed of cash and a cellphone at knifepoint. During an investigation, the driver of a vehicle was stopped at Monterey Avenue and Murray Road. Three suspects were identified, and the cash and cell phone were recovered. Two Odenton men, 19 and 22, and a Gambrills man, 21, were arrested and charged with armed robbery and theft.

Conquest Dr., 2200 block, 12:58 a.m. Dec. 9. A group assaulted a pizza-delivery driver making a delivery. The driver dropped the food, then fled in his vehicle. Five people were charged with robbery and related offenses: a Glen Burnie man, 18, a Severn male, 17, two Odenton men, 20 and 18, and an Odenton woman, 19.

SEVERNA PARK AREA ROBBERy

Redwood Rd., unit block, 8:50 p.m. Aug. 14. A male asked a resident for a bottle of water at a house, then forced his way into the residence at knifepoint. He robbed residents of cash, credit cards and car keys. He drove away in a resident's 2002 Mercury Grand Marquis. The car was found during an investigation at the Park Plaza Shopping Center. On Nov. 29, DNA evidence was used to identify a suspect. A Severna Park man, 42, was charged with robbery, assault and theft. He was incarcerated in Hagerstown for an unrelated burglary conviction.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Madison St., Dec. 8. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. The female escaped and ran into an apartment, where she called police. An Annapolis man, 29, was arrested Dec. 12 and charged with a third- and fourth-degree sexual offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULT

Cherry Grove Ave. S., 500 block, 1:45 a.m. Dec. 13. A pedestrian suffering from five stab wounds was taken to a hospital. The pedestrian refused to provide information about the incident.

ROBBERy

Washington St. W., unit block, 7 p.m. Nov. 18. A man attempted to rob a man and injured him. An Annapolis man, 42, was arrested Dec. 8 and charged with robbery, first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bay Ridge Ave., 700 block, 5:30 p.m. Dec. 9. A man took a purse from a vehicle while the owner was unloading the vehicle.

Boucher Ave., 900 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 10 to 9 a.m. Dec. 11. A digital media player, a navigator and a pair of sunglasses were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Boucher Ave., 900 block, 5 p.m. Dec. 10 to 9:30 a.m. Dec. 11. A jacket, sunglasses, tennis shoes and a battery charger were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Chesapeake Ave., unit block, 5 p.m. Nov. 17 to 7 a.m. Nov. 25. A miter saw and other property were stolen from an unlocked garage.

Lincoln Dr., 1900 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 10 to 8:45 a.m. Dec. 11. A front door was smashed at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Madison St., 1100 block, noon to 3 p.m. Dec. 14. A handgun and a video game console were stolen from a residence, which might have been entered through a balcony window.

Main St., 100 block, 7:58 p.m. Dec. 10. A man pretended to browse in a store and left with several hats.

Main St., 100 block, Dec. 13. A woman shoplifted several items from a pharmacy. A woman was located in the unit block of West Street with stolen items. An Annapolis woman, 41, was charged with theft.

Taylor Ave., 600 block, 8:30 p.m. Dec. 6 to 5:30 a.m. Dec. 7. A business foyer was entered by damaging a front-door lock. A locked interior door prevented entry to the main area of the business.

West St., 1800 block, 10 p.m. Dec. 9 to 7:30 a.m. Dec. 12. CDs, cash and papers were stolen from a truck entered by breaking a rear window.

West St., 1800 block, 2 a.m. to noon Dec. 11. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by smashing a window.

Sixth St., 400 block, 9 p.m. Dec. 8. Crab meat was stolen from a restaurant kitchen. A suspect was identified when a restaurant in the 400 block of Fourth Street reported a man entering its kitchen. Police arrived, and a man fled on foot while throwing several cans of crab meat. An Annapolis man, 51, was arrested and charged with theft.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Forest Dr., 1000 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 9. A vehicle was stolen after it was left with its engine running. The vehicle was found at 1:30 a.m. Dec. 10 in the 200 block of Janwall Street.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line at 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Macbeth Farm Lane, 12800 block, 9:30 to 10 p.m. Dec. 9. A safe containing cash, jewelry, stamps and collectible coins was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Moorland Dr., 7100 block, 4:30 to 6:30 p.m. Dec. 9. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Sandy Creek Ct., 6900 block, 2 to 8:30 p.m. Dec. 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a back door.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERy

Phelps Luck Dr., 5600 block, 6:07 p.m. Dec. 8. Three male teenagers on bicycles attacked a male on a scooter and robbed him of the scooter, headphones and cash. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Columbia Crossing Cir., 6200 block, 5:32 a.m. Dec. 10. Clothing was stolen from a store entered by breaking a side window.

Columbia Crossing Cir., 6200 block, 12:44 to 5:22 a.m. Dec. 12. Cash was stolen from a safe at a restaurant entered by forcing a door.

Cradlerock Way, 6800 block, 3:20 a.m. Dec. 10. Cash and a computer were stolen from a market entered by forcing a back door.

Emersons Reach, 9100 block, 10:53 p.m. Dec. 12. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by tampering with a back door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10800 block, 11:30 a.m. Dec. 12. A computer, a CD player and a router were stolen from a child-care center. There was no sign of forced entry.

Mission Rd., 8100 block, 5:40 to 10 p.m. Dec. 10. Diesel fuel was stolen from gas pumps at a secured lot.

Old Tucker Row, 5400 block, 10:07 a.m. Dec. 12. A break-in occurred.

Winter Rose Path, 7100 block, 11 a.m. to noon Dec. 13. A laptop was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Launcelot Lane, 10300 block, 4:54 to 5:04 a.m. Dec. 12. A white 2010 Chevrolet pickup was stolen.

Rumsey Rd., 9200 block, 2:21 p.m. Dec. 10. A vehicle was stolen. It was found nearby with damage to the windshield and tires and with its air bags deployed.

ELKRIDGE AREA ROBBERIES

Green Field Rd., 6400 block, 12:53 a.m. Dec. 13. A gunman wearing a bandanna over his face robbed a person getting out of a vehicle of a wallet, a cellphone and a book bag.

Old Waterloo Rd., 6500 block, 10:12 p.m. Dec. 11. A gunman demanded cash at a convenience store, then fled empty-handed after a clerk showed that there was little in the cash register.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Forest Kelly Ct., 5900 block, 8:30 a.m. Dec. 7 to 11:05 a.m. Dec. 8. Cash and collectible coins were stolen from a residence entered by removing glass from a back door.

Montgomery Rd., 6300 block, 12:47 p.m. Dec. 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Aspern Dr., 6600 block, 5:03 p.m. Dec. 10. A blue 1994 Toyota Camry was stolen.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chestnut Farm Lane, 8300 block, 8 a.m. to 3:10 p.m. Dec. 8. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Longview Dr., 9800 block, 11:56 a.m. Dec. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Michael's Way, 9500 block, 11 a.m. to 4:50 p.m. Dec. 12. A gun, jewelry, a camera and cash were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Reynard Dr., 3500 block, Nov. 19 to Dec. 12. A residence was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

Winchester Lane E., 11500 block, 9:54 p.m. Dec. 12. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked back door. After being confronted by an acquaintance, the intruder fled empty-handed.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Long Gate Pkwy., 4400 block, 11:50 p.m. Dec. 10. A silver 2001 Chrysler Town and Country van was stolen.

GLENELG AREA ROBBERy

Triadelphia Rd., 13700 block, 7:08 p.m. Dec. 11. Three males forced their way into a residence at gunpoint, tied up an occupant, then fled with cash from a safe.

GLENWOOD AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Glenwood Springs Dr., 2800 block, 5:23 p.m. Dec. 8. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen.

HANOVER AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Skipton Dr., 6400 block, Nov. 30. A black 1990 GMC Sierra was stolen.

JESSUP AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Patuxent Range Rd., 8200 block, 11:32 a.m. Dec. 12. An attempt was made to steal a van parked on a college campus.

Preston Ct., 8200 block, 3:17 p.m. Dec. 13. A 1998 Ford E-350 van was stolen from a business.

LAUREL AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Ridings Way, 9300 block, 8:23 a.m. Dec. 13. A 2000 Acura Integra was stolen.

SYKESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Underwood Rd., 1100 block, 6:15 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Dec. 8. A jar of coins was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Underwood Rd., 1100 block, 6:20 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Dec. 13. A laptop was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Underwood Rd.,1200 block, 12:45 to 2:30 p.m. Dec. 13. A residence was entered through an unlocked basement door. Nothing was reported missing.

WOODSTOCK AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Enfield Dr., 10800 block, 8:40 p.m. Dec. 13. A black Lincoln Navigator was stolen.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 216 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police.  

For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BUDDS CREEK, June 10. A man, 19, stole a Honda dirt bike from a trailer. He was charged with theft of more than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

JAY DEE CT., 3 p.m. June 8. A man, 48, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with first-degree assault.

VEHICLE THEFTS

LEONARDTOWN, June 11-12. A pickup truck was stolen from a parking lot.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, June 14. A man, 27, pushed a trooper. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

TOWN CREEK, June 12. A man, 48, sexually assaulted a female youth, 15, at a foster home. He was charged with child abuse, sex offense and second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

MECHANICSVILLE, Jan. 1 to May 25. A male youth, 15, sexually assaulted a female youth, 10. He also threatened to kill her if she asked for help. He was charged with second-degree rape, third-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

-- Bonnie Smith

The Washington Post


May 22, 2008 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA14


LENGTH: 489 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

HENRY ST. S., 100 block, 11:55 a.m. May 8. An Alexandria woman, 29, was touched inappropriately.

Prince William County crime watch


BYLINE: - Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 801 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Upper Mill Loop, 9900 block, 8:24 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. Feb. 11. Electronic devices were among property stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage door.

DALE CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Foulger Sq., 13800 block, 8:38 p.m. Feb. 11. Two men robbed store customers and an employee of cash and a cellphone at gunpoint. 

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dumfries, Jan. 25. A man sent sexually explicit and threatening messages to a female. A 21-year-old District man was charged with solicitation and telephone threats.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tall Timber Dr., 8100 block, 12:01 to 8 a.m. Feb. 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence by prying a screen from a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clifton Manor Pl., 3800 block, 6:45 p.m. Jan. 28 to 1 p.m. Jan. 29. Two lamps were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Stony Creek Ct., 14500 block, 10:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Feb. 9. A residence was entered by breaking glass in a basement door. A 2002 Mercedes was stolen using keys found in the residence. The vehicle was recovered in Gainesville. A 17-year-old Gainesville male was arrested.

INDEPENDENT HILL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Counselor Rd., 7900 block, noon Feb. 7 to 3:45 a.m. Feb. 8. Medication was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Manaport Plaza Shopping Center area, 10200 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 12. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile acquaintance at a residence. A 31-year-old man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Ashland Ave., 8000 block, 11:45 a.m. Feb. 9. A woman asked a woman for cash, then grabbed her wallet. After a struggle, the wallet was recovered, but cash had been stolen. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 7200 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 7 to 7:30 a.m. Feb. 8. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in a side door.

Gwendolyn Dr., 6200 block, 5 to 8:30 p.m. Feb. 13. A safe containing a gun, medication and jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Peakwood Ct., 8100 block, 11:32 p.m. Feb. 12. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence. A man was seen fleeing with the property.

Princess Carole Ct., 7400 block, 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. Feb. 12. Cash and electronics were stolen from a residence.

Signal Hill Rd., 8100 block, 6 to 7 p.m. Jan. 24. Cash, a GPS, a credit card, a camera and two sleeping bags were among property stolen from two vehicles entered by breaking windows.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Main and Graham streets and Main St. and Mine Rd., 7:35 and 7:45 a.m. Feb. 14. A motorist stopped at school bus stops and offered rides to females, then drove away when they resisted. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Fuller Heights Rd., 19100 block, 10:35 p.m. Feb. 11. Three men attacked a pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Purvis Dr., 18000 block, 3:24 a.m. Feb. 12. A man tried to enter the residence of an acquaintance by breaking a window, then fled in a vehicle. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hamill Mill Park area, Feb. 9. A female who had been reported missing more than a year ago was found at a residence. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. Charges included contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

Opitz Blvd., 2000 block, Feb. 9. Three women said that they were groped during appointments with a physician. A 44-year-old McLean man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Fisher Ave. and Harrison St., 4:47 p.m. Feb. 13. Three men got out of a gray SUV and attacked a male pedestrian. The victim was treated for cuts on his face and arm and for injuries inflicted by a baseball bat.

Maryland Ave., 1400 block, 7:28 p.m. Feb. 12. During an argument, a man struck a male acquaintance with a blunt object, then fled in a vehicle. The victim was treated for minor injuries.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 3:28 p.m. Feb. 10. A man groped a female at a mall. A 66-year-old Lorton man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aldrin St., 13200 block, 5 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Feb. 10. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Park Ct. S., 4700 block, 2:30 to 7 p.m. Feb. 14. An attempt was made to enter a residence by prying open the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Moseby Ct., 300 block, 6 a.m. Jan. 26. An extension cord was damaged outside a residence. A 23-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

April 17, 2014 Thursday 12:18 AM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 846 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

GLEN BURNIE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Crain Hwy.,100 block, noon, April 8. A woman leaving a college was grabbed on the buttocks by a male, who then fled on foot. A Severn man, 18, was charged with second-degree assault and fourth-degree sex offense.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES  

Holly Creek Dr.,8:12 p.m. March 23. A woman leaving her vehicle was robbed of her purse, keys and cellphone at gunpoint. An Upper Marlboro man, 32, was charged with armed robbery, robbery and second-degree assault.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

ROBBERIES

Melrob Ct.,11:55 p.m. April 6. A man sitting in a vehicle in a parking lot was assaulted by two men with guns and robbed of his cellphone and watch.

Solomons Island Rd.,2500 block, 5 p.m. April 9. A male, who implied he had a gun, tried to rob a hair salon. A Curtis Bay man, 29, was charged with attempted robbery and theft.

ASSAULTS

Bestgate Rd.,11:45 a.m. April 10. During a narcotics investigation, a male driver in a vehicle fled. When an officer on foot attempted to stop the driver, the officer was hit on the arm by the vehicle. The suspect then traveled to Chinquapin Road, where he fled from the vehicle. After a brief foot chase, the suspect was detained. An Annapolis man, 24, was charged with attempted murder, first- and second-degree assault, assaulting a police officer, possession of heroin with intent to distribute and numerous traffic violations.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Greenbriar Lane,9:40 a.m. to 5 p.m. April 10. A sliding glass door was forced open at a home, and two video game units and cash were stolen.

Murray Ave.,10 p.m. April 5 to 7:45 p.m. April 6. Cash and a high school ring were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

West St.,100 block, 7:45 p.m. April 4 to 12:30 a.m. April 5. A makeup bag, jewelry and sunglasses were stolen from a vehicle.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

Cradlerock Way,3:30 a.m. April 8. During a struggle, someone stole a wallet and prescription medication from a person.

Lambskin Lane,5:59 p.m. April 6. While playing basketball, a person was assaulted and another was robbed of a cellphone. Four youths were charged with robbery, assault and theft.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alexander Bell Dr.,6700 block, April 4 to April 7. Cash was stolen from a lock box at a warehouse. A door was pried open.

Eclipse Way, 10300 block, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. April 7. An attempt was made to pry open a garage door.

Harpers Farm Rd.,2:39 p.m. April 8. Someone entered a home through an unlocked window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Little Patuxent Pkwy.,10200 block, April 4 to April 5. Copper pipe, scrap metal and a power tool were stolen from a construction site.

Millrace Ct.,4:30 p.m. April 8. A rear door was kicked open at a home. Nothing was reported stolen.

Robert Oliver Pl., 1:42 a.m. April 7. A rock was used to break a rear window at a saloon, and bottles of liquor and an empty cash register were stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA ROBBERIES

Old Washington Rd.,9:20 p.m. April 5. A disabled vehicle in the roadway was struck from the rear by another a vehicle. Occupants got out of the disabled vehicle and assaulted a female occupant of the other vehicle. Another group of people stopped to assist and they also assaulted and threw their phones into a wooded area. Two D.C. men, ages 18 and 23, were charged with five counts of assault, theft and robbery. The 18-year-old was charged with an additional count of theft.

Ring Dove Lane,April 5. An attempt was made to steal a black BMW.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Mitzy Lane,1 a.m. April 6. A Chevrolet Impala was stolen.

JESSUP AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Montevideo Rd.,7500 block, 12:01 a.m. April 2 to 11:40 a.m. April 6. Someone cut a padlock on the front gate of a crane services business. Nothing was reported stolen.

Montevideo Rd.,3 p.m. April 5 to 11:40 a.m. April 6. A hole was cut in the rear fence at a tree service business, and tires were stolen.

Patuxent Rd.,2:51 a.m. April 6. Front-door glass was broken at a produce store, and a TV was stolen.

Redondo Way,8700 block, 2:23 p.m. April 7. The frame of a basement door was damaged at a home, and a door was opened. Nothing was reported missing.

LAUREL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ice Crystal Dr.,8300 block, 3:20 a.m. April 5. An attempt was made to steal an ATM at a grocery store.

164 of 507 DOCUMENTS




Washingtonpost.com


May 22, 2011 Sunday 8:11 PM EST 


County's overall crime rate at 16-year low


BYLINE: Jennifer Buske


SECTION: ; Pg. T01


LENGTH: 371 words


Prince William County's overall crime rate fell to a 16-year low last year, despite a slight uptick in aggravated assault and larceny cases, according to the 2010 crime statistics report released Wednesday. 

Last year, Prince William's crime rate dropped from 19.5 crimes per 1,000 residents to 19.2, the report said. Violent crimes, including murder, rape and robbery, dropped almost 6 percent, while aggravated assault and larceny went up 3.7 percent and 2 percent, respectively.

"Crime continues to be down significantly, and that's a trend we're seeing across the country," Prince William Police Chief Charlie T. Deane said. "I think our strong neighborhood watch program and citizens police academy" have helped keep crime rates low.

The number of reported rapes dropped 7 percent last year, after almost doubling in 2009, the report said. In all 53 rape cases reported, the victims were related to or acquainted with the offender, according to the report.

Crimes against property, which make up the majority of offenses in the community, rose 0.6 percent because of the increase in larceny cases, Deane said. The number of burglary and car theft cases declined, Deane said, adding that he attributes the drop in car thefts to a rise in the use of vehicle security devices.

The report also breaks down the number of undocumented immigrants arrested in Prince William.

In 2008, county supervisors adopted a policy that requires police to ask the immigration status of people arrested on suspicion of violating state or local laws. Of the 1,785 people arrested last year in connection with major crimes, 138 - or about 8 percent - were illegal immigrants, the report shows, noting that 80 percent of those arrests were for property crimes.

When looking at other offenses, the report shows that about 20 percent of those arrested for public drunkenness were suspected illegal immigrants, as were about 16 percent of those arrested for drunken driving.

The report also addresses traffic offenses. The number of traffic accidents declined almost 7 percent last year, although the number of fatal accidents increased slightly, the report said. Last year, 22 people died from traffic accidents, including six pedestrians.

buskej@washpost.com


LOAD-DATE: May 23, 2011


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Web Publication



Copyright 2011 Washingtonpost.Newsweek Interactive
All Rights Reserved

May 31, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Anne Arundel and Howard crime report Anne Arundel and Howard crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1908 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with these and other felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment. ANNAPOLIS AREA POLICE IMPERSONATION

Forest Dr.,2300 block, 10:51 p.m. May 22. A male got out of a vehicle and displayed a badge to two people in a parking lot. Identifying himself as a detective, he asked for identification and directed one person to perform field sobriety tests. He then approached two men in the lot. They left in a vehicle and contacted police. An Odenton man, 31, was charged with impersonating a police officer and with disorderly conduct.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES  

Tall Pines Ct., 7800 block, 11:19 p.m. May 20. A male grabbed a pedestrian by the pants and tried to take his wallet. After a brief struggle, the assailant fled empty-handed.

MILLERSVILLE AREA ROBBERIES

Waterwheel Ct., 600 block, 10:55 a.m. May 19. Three teenagers grabbed a woman getting into a vehicle and tried to pull her away from it. After a struggle, the assailants fled toward Patriot Lane. A short time later, a Brooklyn Park male, 15, and two Glen Burnie males, both 14, were arrested.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or other suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Duke of Gloucester St., 100 block, 1:30 a.m. May 19. A male pulled a pedestrian into an alley and sexually assaulted her. The victim resisted, and the assailant fled on foot.

ASSAULTS

Bens Dr. and Bay Ridge Ave., 2:30 a.m. May 24. A group of six women attacked a female pedestrian. She sustained abrasions and a cut that she said was inflicted by a weapon.

Bethany Ct., 900 block, 5 p.m. May 21 to 8 a.m. May 22. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Ford Cir., unit block, 6 p.m. May 19 to 10:30 a.m. May 20. A digital media player, a GPS device and cash were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Market St., 100 block, 12:45 to 10:30 a.m. May 13. A clutch purse was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked ground-floor window.

Nimitz Dr., 1700 block, 9 p.m. May 22 to 9:30 a.m. May 23. A purse, keys, cash, a cellphone battery charger, two BB guns and a garment bag were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle. The property was recovered May 23 inside a vehicle that had been reported stolen from the unit block of Randys Lane.

Old Solomons Island Rd., 100 block, 6 p.m. May 18 to 9 a.m. May 21. Five aluminum downspouts were removed from a building.

Peters Way, unit block, 10 p.m. May 21 to 8 a.m. May 22. An orange Electra Townie bike was stolen from a porch at a residence. Police recovered the bicycle May 22 near Newtowne Drive and Juliana Circle. A juvenile riding the bike was charged with theft.

His pants were down, and during his arrest he said that he had intended to sexually assault an occupant. An Annapolis man, 40, was charged with first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary and disorderly conduct.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Randys Lane, unit block, 12:01 to 3 a.m. May 23. A 2009 Honda CR-V was stolen from a driveway using a key that had been left in the ignition. It was recovered at 2:30 p.m. in the 1900 block of Moreland Parkway. Property reported stolen from a residence in the 1700 block of Nimitz Drive was found inside the vehicle.

He was then robbed of cash and a cellphone. An Elkridge man, 22, and a Columbia man, 23, were charged with robbery. No serious injuries were reported.

Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.
