Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, Feb. 26. A woman caused a burn by pressing salt and ice against the arm of a female acquaintance. A 21-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Wayside Dr., 17200 block, 1:49 p.m. March 10. A naked man ran out of a wooded area, then went back into the woods when seen by three passersby. A short time later, the man, fully dressed, was seen leaving the area in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fraley Blvd., 17700 block, 6:33 p.m. March 5 to 5:30 a.m. March 6. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a bay door.

GAINESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Artemus Dr., 5700 block, 3:25 a.m. March 8. A man entered a residence by kicking in a back door, then threatened a female acquaintance. A 32-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Great Dover St., 7600 block, 9:15 p.m. March 8. During a party at a residence, a man attacked a man.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Manassas Park area, March 10, An 18-year-old man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of two juvenile acquaintances in February and March.

ASSAULTS

Fenwood Ct., 7400 block, 10:20 p.m. March 10. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Community Dr., 8200 block, 10:33 p.m. March 10. A man threatened a person standing outside a residence and robbed him of a cellphone.

Rosemary Dr. and Sudley Rd., 7:11 p.m. March 8. A male approached a pedestrian from behind and robbed her of a purse.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Colonial Dr., 1500 block, 1:24 p.m. March 7. During an argument at a residence, a woman fell and hit her head on a table. She then attacked an acquaintance, striking him with a shovel. A 44-year-old woman and a 52-year-old man, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

Dale Blvd., 4100 block, 1:16 p.m. March 7. A man with a knife attacked an employee in a store, then fled in a vehicle. A 20-year-old Dumfries man was arrested. The victim was treated for stab wounds.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 1:53 a.m. March 9. A man forced an acquaintance into a vehicle and threatened her at knifepoint. He then drove to her residence, where he pushed her from the vehicle. A 31-year-old Arlington County man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Smoketown Rd., 14200 block, 9:21 p.m. March 6. Three men got into a vehicle and demanded cash from the motorist at gunpoint. After a brief struggle, during which a handgun was discharged, damaging the dashboard, the men fled empty-handed in a vehicle driven by an accomplice. Three Woodbridge men, ages 18, 18 and 19, and a 21-year-old Arlington County man were arrested.

Shoppers Best Way, 14000 block, 12:54 p.m. March 4. A man with a knife threatened grocery-store employees who had seen him conceal merchandise. A 58-year-old Cheverly man was arrested.

Worth Ave., 13300 block, 10:35 p.m. March 7. A male a bat demanded cash from a person leaving a store with a night deposit. After a brief struggle, the assailant fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gloucester Ct., 2800 block, 8:20 a.m. to 3 p.m. March 5. Two laptop computers, two tablet computers, two cellphones, a camera and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Harbor Dr., 12800 block, 8:15 to 8:22 p.m. March 7. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a rear window.

Industry Ct., 14700 block, 4:30 a.m. March 8 to 5:25 a.m. March 9. Cash and T-shirts were stolen from a business entered by removing a deadbolt from a front door.

Taverner Loop, 13100 block, 12:10 to 1:20 p.m. March 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Uppsala Ct., 15900 block, 8 a.m. March 1 to 10 a.m. March 4. Credit cards, a TV, jewelry and prescription medication were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Village Dr., 14400 block, 1:35 a.m. March 10. A man entered a residence by forcing a back door, then fled empty-handed when confronted by an acquaintance. A 37-year-old man was arrested.

Woodvale Ct., 13500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 12:06 p.m. March 5. Two TVs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Ladue Ct., 1600 block, 5:25 p.m. March 6. After an altercation with an acquaintance at a residence, a man stole a food-delivery vehicle that had been left with its engine running. After crashing into a tractor-trailer, he abandoned the vehicle. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Manassas

No report was received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Colburn Dr., 6:39 a.m. March 11. A camera, an MP3 player and sunglasses were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA17


LENGTH: 794 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents recently reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

ASSAULTS

FLORENCE DR., 3800 block, 6:45 a.m. Dec. 23. During a fight, a 27-year-old Alexandria man was slashed with a sharp object. He was taken to a hospital.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2600 block, 7:27 p.m. Dec. 27. A motorist discovered a 57-year-old Fairfax County woman lying in a traffic lane. The woman was taken to a hospital. 

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 3800 block, 7:40 p.m. Dec. 24. An 18-year-old Alexandria man was assaulted with a baseball bat and other objects. The man was taken to a hospital.

ROBBERIES

COMMONWEALTH AVE., 3400 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 25. Two men, one displaying a pistol, approached a 48-year-old Maryland woman and demanded her purse and car keys. The robbers fled in the woman's car. No injuries were reported.

 Arlington

These were among incidents recently reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MONROE ST. N., 700 block, 8:10 p.m. Dec. 19. A man approached a 25-year-old woman sitting in her car and spoke in a sexually explicit manner. The woman drove away.

ROBBERIES

CARLIN SPRINGS RD. S., unit block, 5:11 a.m. Dec. 21. A man stuck his hand inside the pocket of a 31-year-old man who was purchasing food in a convenience store. He and two other men followed the customer outside the store, and an altercation ensued. A police officer investigating another incident observed the altercation and took two men into custody. A third man fled on foot. A 26-year-old Arlington man was charged with felony attempted grand theft. A 32-year-old Alexandria man was charged with disorderly conduct.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARLINGTON BLVD. N., 1000 block, 3:03 p.m. Dec. 23. A resident caught a 14-year-old boy coming out of his apartment. After searching the boy, the resident let him go. The resident later found his laptop, two cameras and other items in a closet. A boy was taken into custody.

CRYSTAL DR. S., 1300 block, 7:18 p.m. Dec. 24. Police officers caught two men breaking into vehicles. A Global Positioning System device was found nearby. Another GPS device was found in a bag that one of the men was carrying. An 18-year-old Washington man and a 17-year-old boy were charged with grand theft, petty theft and destruction of property.

FERN ST. S., 1200 block, 5:30 p.m. Dec. 23 to 5:30 a.m. Dec. 24. Several boxes were stolen from the loading dock of a company.

GEORGE MASON DR. S., 1300 block, 1:46 a.m. Dec. 20. A stereo was partially removed and the dashboard was damaged in a vehicle. An 18-year-old Washington man was charged with attempted grand theft and destruction of property. A 19-year-old Bladensburg man was charged with attempted grand theft, possession of burglary tools and destruction of property.

GLEBE RD. S., 2000 block, 5:25 p.m. Dec. 21. A glass door at a residence was smashed with a rock. Nothing was reported stolen.

HIGHLAND ST. S., 300 block, 1:51 a.m. Dec. 19. A man was tampering with a vehicle. A 43-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with possession of a firearm by a felon, carrying a concealed weapon and theft from auto.

JOYCE ST. S., 1600 block, 8 p.m. Dec. 18 to 7:30 a.m. Dec. 19. Cash was stolen from a business entered through the front door.

RANDOLPH ST. N., 800 block, 6:30 p.m. Dec. 21 to 9:30 a.m. Dec. 24. Three computers were stolen from a business entered by forcing doors.

FOURTH RD. N., 4400 block, 8 a.m. to 8:20 p.m. Dec. 19. A laptop computer, a camera and other property were stolen from a residence.

25TH ST. N., 4 p.m. Dec. 16 to 11 a.m. Dec. 19. A window at a vacant residence was forced open. Nothing was reported stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ARMY NAVY DR., 800 block, 6:41 p.m. Dec. 20. A white Jeep Cherokee was stolen from a mall parking lot. A stereo and a Global Positioning System device were stolen from another vehicle. A handgun was stolen from a third vehicle.

ARMY NAVY DR. S., 800 bock. A yellow-and-red 2003 Ford E350 van was stolen.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 3000 block. A stolen red 1998 Dodge Neon was recovered.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 3000 block. A stolen silver 2006 Ford van was recovered.

GLEBE ROAD N. AND 16TH STREET, 12:43 a.m. Dec. 24. A Toyota sport-utility vehicle hit a car stopped at a traffic light. The SUV driver fled on foot. A 34-year-old Alexandria man was charged with felony hit and run.

VANDALISM

IRVING ST. N., 600 block, 5:15 p.m. Dec. 25 to 7:30 a.m. Dec. 26. Someone clogged two sinks in a kitchen and left water running in a church. Several rooms were flooded. Some music equipment was damaged.

23RD ST. N., 2700 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 23 to 7:30 a.m. Dec. 24. Tires of three parked vehicles were slashed.

-- Compiled by KATHY ORTON

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 349 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CALIFORNIA, Jan. 12. A soda machine in front of the Lowe's hardware store was damaged.

VEHICLE THEFTS

SUGAR MAPLE CT., Jan. 13. A man, 51, stole a vehicle, then returned it a short time later. He was charged with theft of a motor vehicle.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

COMPTON, Dec. 20. A man, 25, supplied two female youths, ages 16 and 13, with alcohol and drugs. He had sexual intercourse with the 16-year-old after she passed out. He also used a body-piercing kit and placed metal objects through the 13-year-old's breasts, ear and navel. He also took nude photographs of her and numerous other female youths. He is charged with rape/child abuse and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

HELEN, Jan. 16. A man assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

LEONARDTOWN, 2:40 p.m. Jan. 9. A woman, 36, assaulted a man at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 9:30 p.m. Jan. 13 to 1:30 a.m. Jan. 14. A CD player was stolen from a vehicle parked at a high school.

LEONARDTOWN, 4:15 to 9:28 p.m. Jan. 15. A vehicle's license plates were stolen.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, Jan. 15 to 16. A man, 31, and a woman, 23, assaulted each other on Nov. 8. They were charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, Jan. 9 to 11. A woman, 29, and a man, 29, assaulted each other at a residence. They were charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

MECHANICSVILLE, 10:30 p.m. Jan. 15. A man, 36, sexually assaulted a woman, 31. He was charged with second-degree rape and second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

SNOW HILL MANOR RD. N., Jan. 10 to 11. A mailbox was damaged.

-- Bonnie Smith

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T19


LENGTH: 643 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.  

ASSAULTS

CHARLOTTE HALL, 5:10 p.m. Oct. 6. A man, 42, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

GREAT MILLS, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 6. A man, 21, raped and assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree rape and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

HOLLYWOOD, 3 p.m. Oct. 6. Three men, ages 18, 18 and 19, assaulted one another in the parking lot of the McKay's store.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, Oct. 8. A man, 36, stole a cell phone from a vehicle in which he was riding. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

ROUTE 235 AND VISTA ROAD, midnight Oct. 11 to 9:35 a.m. Oct. 12. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HOLLYWOOD, 11:35 p.m. Oct. 13. A man, 21, broke a windshield on a vehicle at a residence. He also made unwanted phone calls to the residence. He was charged with telephone misuse and malicious destruction of property less than $ 500.

JONES WHARF ROAD AND ROUTE 235, 11:35 p.m. Oct. 13. A windshield was broken on a vehicle parked on the street.

MEREDITH CT., 1 to 7:43 a.m. Oct. 16. The passenger side window of a vehicle was broken.

ASSAULTS

ARCHER ST., 8 p.m. Oct. 15. A man, 33, assaulted another man and a woman at a residence. He was charged with two counts of second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN, 1:22 p.m. Oct. 14. A boy, 14, assaulted another boy, 15, at Leonardtown High School. He was charged with second-degree assault.

POINT LOOKOUT RD., 4:14 a.m. Oct. 8. A man, 22, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 14. A man, 25, broke into a residence and stole property, which included firearms. He was charged with first-degree burglary and theft more than $ 500.

ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH RD., 4 p.m. Oct. 5 to 9 a.m. Oct. 7. Someone attempted to pry off a window screen at Pet Paradise Kennels to gain entry.

ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH RD., midnight Oct. 6 to 7:40 a.m. Oct. 7. Power tools were stolen from a workshop. Entry was gained by breaking a window.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 5:27 p.m. Oct. 4. A woman, 37, assaulted and demanded money from a woman at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault and attempted robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FRANKLIN RD., 5 p.m. Oct. 9 to 10:50 a.m. Oct. 10. License plates were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

LEXINGTON PARK, 6:30 p.m. Oct. 5 to 1 p.m. Oct. 6. A rear license plate was stolen from a vehicle parked at Levi's Auto Body.

LEXINGTON PARK, 9:10 a.m. Oct. 12. A man, 27, took his employer's vehicle without permission and stole tools from the vehicle. He was charged with unlawful taking of a motor vehicle and theft more than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

CALVERT CIR., 8:10 p.m. Oct. 6. A man, 43, assaulted troopers as he was being arrested for violating a court order. In addition to the court order violation, he was charged with second-degree assault and resisting arrest.

MECHANICSVILLE, 9:45 p.m. Oct. 16. A man, 27, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SANDGATES RD., 8:20 p.m. Oct. 6. A man, 18, assaulted a man at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WEST LAKELAND DR., 11 p.m. Oct. 12 to 9 a.m. Oct. 13. The front license plate was stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CAT CREEK RD., 9 p.m. Oct. 3 to 12:07 a.m. Oct. 7. Three security lights on a vacant building were broken.

-- Bonnie Smith

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

STERLING AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 667 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA WEAPONS

Wythe Ct., 2900 block, 3:30 a.m. Oct. 10. Several gunshots were heard.

MANASSAS AREA PROSTITUTION

New Market Ct., 7200 block, 10:53 p.m. Oct. 16. A 22-year-old Sacramento, Calif., woman was arrested and charged with prostitution and possession of marijuana. 

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, Oct. 15. A male assaulted two male juveniles in a parking lot and robbed them of a cellphone. A 16-year-old Woodbridge boy was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8100 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 17 to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 21. An attempt was made to enter a business by damaging a rear door.

TRIANGLE AREA ROBBERIES

Sharon Rd., 18300 block, 3:52 p.m. Oct. 16. Two males knocked a male juvenile pedestrian to the ground and searched his pockets. They fled empty-handed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Linfield Dr., 4 a.m. Oct. 22. A man hit a female acquaintance several times and demanded her wallet and cellphone. He dragged her into a residence, where he assaulted her, including sexually, until she lost consciousness. She was treated for injuries. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Haddock Rd., 13100 block, Oct. 15. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and attempted to choke her. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Indiana Ave., 1500 block, 9:42 p.m. Oct. 20. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance.

Oberlin Dr., 2100 block, 8:10 a.m. Oct. 16. A man assaulted a female acquaintance, threatened her with a handgun and prevented her from leaving a residence. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENTS

Findley Rd., 3900 block, 6 a.m. Oct. 17. After an investigation by Prince William County detectives and federal agents, three juveniles were removed from a residence. A 33-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested and charged with reckless endangerment.

ROBBERIES

Gideon Dr., 14400 block, 11:38 a.m. Oct. 16. A gunman robbed a convenience store of a cash drawer.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Garber Way, 2800 block, 1:59 a.m. Oct. 22. Cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a business entered by breaking a front glass door.

Hampshire Ct., 13200 block, 7:20 p.m. Oct. 19 to 11 a.m. Oct. 20. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, Oct. 11 to 13. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 12:33 a.m. Oct. 23. A man attempted to enter a residence through a window. He fled when a resident saw him.

Lord Culpeper Ct., 15200 block, 12:30 p.m. Oct. 15. Cash, a computer and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through a rear basement door.

Reef Knot Way, 16800 block, 5 a.m. Oct. 22. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear door.

Swallow Ct., 14800 block, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 17. Cash, a video game system and an MP3 player were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Walnut St., 1500 block, Sept. 13 to Oct. 2. Power tools were stolen from a garage entered through a side door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Mathis Ave., 9100 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 18. A juvenile stabbed another juvenile, who was treated for injuries.

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Cabbel Dr., 5 p.m. Oct. 22 to 7 a.m. Oct. 23. Windows of a vehicle were broken.

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 517 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

SEX OFFENSE

CALIFORNIA, 4:55 p.m. March 28. A man, 51, abused a girl, 10, at a residence. He was charged with third-degree sex offense and child abuse.

ASSAULT

CALIFORNIA, 10:08 a.m. March 31. A man, 41, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CALIFORNIA, 12:40 to 1:37 p.m. March 22. A 1999 Chevrolet truck parked at the Eye Care Plaza was scratched.

SEX OFFENSE

CALLAWAY, March 28. A man, 31, committed sex offenses against two female youths, ages 12 and 15. He was charged with two counts of third-degree sex offense.

VEHICLE THEFT

SUNNYSIDE DR., 12:31 a.m. March 23. A driver, 32, was involved in an auto accident. He fled the scene but was later apprehended. Police discovered that his vehicle had been stolen. He was charged with theft of a motor vehicle and driving while under the influence of alcohol.

ASSAULT

ROUTE 235, 4:09 a.m. March 31. Three men, ages 22, 23 and 25, who were riding in a stolen vehicle failed to stop and attempted to ram into two Maryland State Police vehicles. They were charged with auto theft and first-degree assault.

ASSAULT

GREAT MILLS RD., 2:30-3 p.m. March 30. A man, 46, who assaulted a woman, 44, was arrested. A second man, 22, then attempted to hide the suspect's loaded handgun from officers. The suspect was charged with second-degree assault and possession of a handgun. The 22-year-old man was charged with hindering and obstruction.

LEI DR., 11:10 p.m. Mar. 27. A woman, 33, was hit in the head with a bottle and threatened with a knife.

LEXINGTON PARK, 3:36 a.m. March 22. A woman, 34, assaulted a man, 38. She was charged with second-degree assault.

VALLEY CT., 11:37 p.m. March 27. A man, 31, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

THREE NOTCH RD., noon to 4 p.m. March 24. CDs and a case were stolen from a vehicle parked at Damons Restaurant. The car was entered by smashing a window.

SEX OFFENSES

MECHANICSVILLE, February 2003. A man, 39, sexually assaulted a boy, 5. He was charged with one count of third-degree sex offense and one count of sex abuse to a minor.

ASSAULT

MECHANICSVILLE, 10:32 p.m. March 27. A man, 41, assaulted another man at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE, April 1. A man, 44, and a woman, 37, assaulted each other at a residence. They were charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, 7 p.m., March 27. A woman, 30, broke into a residence. She was charged with burglary.

MECHANICSVILLE, 5:41 p.m. March 24. A man broke into a residence and stole jewelry and a television. He was charged with theft over $ 500 and theft scheme.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LYNWOOD DR., 8:14 p.m. Sept. 1. A man was allegedly having a sexual relationship with a female teenager. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

DARBYDALE AVE., 14800 block, 11:05 p.m. Sept. 4. Two men armed with a baseball bat assaulted two pedestrians, a man and a woman, and robbed them of property. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRICKWOOD LANE, 15200 block, 3:15 a.m. Sept. 4. Someone entered a residence and set a mattress on fire, activating a sprinkler system.

Dumfries area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

VILLAGE PKWY., 1-99 block, 12:40 p.m. Sept. 3. A man allegedly inappropriately touched a male juvenile acquaintance. A 60-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

AVENEL LANE, 17600 block, 12:56 a.m. Sept. 1. A man entered a residence through an unlocked garage door and was in the kitchen when a resident found him. The man fled empty-handed.

LEATHERBACK DR., 5100 block, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sept. 1. Electronics were stolen from a residence.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

WILLIAM JOHNSON LANE, 3300 block, 9:15 p.m. Sept. 6. A man knocked on a bedroom window of a residence and looked inside at a female resident.

Gainesville area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

UPPER MEADOW CT., 5900 block, noon Aug. 10 to noon Aug. 14. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Independent Hill area

WEAPONS

CONWAY DR., 14700 block, 7:13 a.m. Sept. 1. During an argument at a residence, two men exchanged gunfire. No injuries were reported. Two Independent Hill men, 39 and 41, were arrested and charged with reckless handling of a firearm, shooting a firearm within an occupied dwelling, possession with intent to distribute marijuana and manufacturing marijuana.

Manassas area

ROBBERIES

PRINCE WILLIAM PKWY. AND SUDLEY MANOR DR., 8:44 p.m. Sept. 1. A passenger in a vehicle flagged down a female motorist and told her that her car was on fire. When the female stopped her vehicle, a male got out of the other vehicle and took money from the motorist at gunpoint.

ANIMAL INCIDENTS

BRISTOW RD., 14800 block, Sept. 1. An animal shelter caretaker was walking a pit bull to its owner when the dog allegedly attacked the caretaker. The dog had been quarantined at the shelter after it had allegedly attacked three members of a family. The dog was euthanized. The caretaker was treated for injuries on her leg.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DUMFRIES RD., 13700 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 29 to 6 a.m. Aug. 30. Property was stolen from a grocery store entered by breaking a front door.

Triangle area

ROBBERIES

KATIE PL., 3700 block, 11:10 p.m. Sept. 2. A gunman robbed two teenagers, a male and a female, as they were leaving a vehicle.

Woodbridge area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13700 block, 4:08 a.m. Sept. 4. Three men were in a vehicle outside a restaurant. A woman who recognized two of the men got into the vehicle, which was driven to the rear of a shopping center. One of the men held the woman at gunpoint while the other two sexually assaulted her. She was then hit with a wooden board and robbed of her purse. A 19-year-old man was arrested.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13900 block, 6:30 p.m. Sept. 2. A man outside a convenience store allegedly inappropriately touched a female juvenile. A 35-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

DALE BLVD., 2900 block, 2:24 p.m. Sept. 1. During an argument, two men assaulted a male stranger and fled in a vehicle.

BAYSIDE AVE., 8:34 p.m. Sept. 3. A person punched a male acquaintance in the face.

ROBBERIES

OCCOQUAN RD., 13300 block, 8:58 p.m. Sept. 5. A passenger got out of a vehicle in a convenience store parking lot and punched a man. Three other people got out of the vehicle, robbed the man of property and chased him across the street.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREENACRE DR., 13400 block, 9:25 p.m. Aug. 30. A man and a woman allegedly took property from an acquaintance's residence. Two Woodbridge residents, a 23-year-old man and a 21-year-old woman, were arrested.

HOLLOW WIND WAY, 13900 block, 8:45 a.m. to 6:25 p.m. Sept. 3. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

SHARP DR., 1700 block, 9:15 p.m. Sept. 5. Two men got out of a vehicle and robbed a male pedestrian of a wallet. The pedestrian was hit with a baseball bat.

TORY LOOP, 7:40 a.m. to 9:10 p.m. Aug. 31. A computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

WARREN DR., 1900 block, 12:32 a.m. Sept. 6. Two males entered a residence through an unlocked front door and ordered the occupants to the floor at gunpoint. One of the intruders hit a resident, causing a gun to fire. No injuries were reported.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

CENTREVILLE RD., 8500 block, 11 to 11:37 p.m. Sept. 5. A cellphone was stolen from a gas station after the owner left it on a counter.

KENT DR., 100 block, Sept. 4 to 5. Construction equipment and tools were stolen from an unlocked shed at a residence.

MANASSAS DR., 200 block, 1 to 3 p.m. Aug. 29. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window with a rock.

MOSEBY DR., 1 to 3 p.m. Aug. 29. A stereo was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

SIGNAL VIEW DR., 9300 block, Aug. 30. A purse and a camera were stolen from a vehicle.

Washingtonpost.com


February 23, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1343 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

River Ridge Golf Course area, Feb. 13. A 38-year-old Dumfries man was arrested in connection with an April 2010 assault of a juvenile acquaintance.

ASSAULTS

Old Triangle Rd. and Sigel Ct., 10:44 p.m. Feb. 10. A woman was struck by shot from a gun fired from a moving vehicle. She was treated for a minor head injury. A 19-year-old Maryland man was arrested Feb. 11. He is a suspect in an incident that took place a short time earlier at Heth Court and Old Triangle Road, near Dumfries Plaza, during which a gun was fired by a man involved in a fight following a high school basketball game. No injuries were reported in that incident.  

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Song Sparrow Dr., 8800 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Feb. 9. An attempt was made to break into a business by forcing a rear door.

MANASSAS AREA HOMICIDES

Parkland St. and Old Centreville Rd., 9:18 p.m. Feb. 12. During an argument with an acquaintance, Edwin Noe Enamorado Matute, 22, of the 7600 block of Somerset Lane, Manassas, was stabbed several times. He was taken to a hospital, where he died. A 21-year-old man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Porter Ridge Lane, 8100 block, 3:08 p.m. Feb. 8. During an argument, a woman cut a man with a knife. He was treated for a shoulder injury. A 28-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Blendia Lane, 10600 block, 9:49 p.m. Feb. 10. Three men robbed a man of cash and a jacket at gunpoint. The victim said that the incident took place during a meeting to discuss the sale of shoes.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hoadly Rd., 7500 block, 5 p.m. Feb. 5 to 11 a.m. Feb. 6. Copper and brass wire were stolen from a shed at a residence. A 24-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Perdue Ct., 7500 block, 8:15 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Feb. 7. Two TVs, two video game systems and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Shallow Creek Loop, 9800 block, 4 p.m. Feb. 1 to 9 a.m. Feb. 7. A residence was vandalized. There was no sign of forced entry.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Forest Park Dr., 15700 block, Feb. 1. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile in a school parking lot, then attacked her again on Feb. 3 in Dumfries. The two, who met online, were scheduled to meet again on Feb. 7. A 36-year-old Palmyra, Va., man was arrested at the arranged location.

Minnieville area, Feb. 13. A 24-year-old Beltsville man was arrested in connection with the sexual assaults of two juvenile acquaintances at a residence. The incidents took place in August and Jan. 13.

Veterans Memorial Park area, A 56-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a juvenile acquaintance on several occasions from Oct. 1 to Jan. 3.

ASSAULTS

Indiana Ave., 1500 block, 2:04 a.m. Feb. 8. During an argument, a woman attacked a male acquaintance at knifepoint. A 20-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested. No injuries were reported.

Village Dr., 14400 block, 10:12 p.m. Feb. 11. During an argument, a man attacked a male with a shovel. A 48-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. The victim was treated for an arm injury.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Frishman Ct., 4900 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 8. During an argument, a man threatened a male acquaintance at gunpoint. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Grayson Rd., 14100 block, 10:55 p.m. Feb. 7. An unoccupied vehicle was struck by gunfire. An unoccupied vehicle was struck by a white coupe that sped away from the scene. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Eames Lane, 4400 block, 7:09 p.m. Feb. 7. A group of men threatened an acquaintance at knifepoint and robbed him of cash. Three Woodbridge men, age 24 and two age 18, and a 19-year-old Manassas man were arrested.

Grayton Lane, 2600 block, 9:10 p.m. Feb. 9. Three males demanded cash from a deliveryman at knifepoint, then fled empty-handed when the victim ran to a vehicle.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Kitty Hawk Way, 13600 block, 3:35 a.m. Feb. 9. A man naked from the waist down followed a pedestrian, then fled when she confronted him.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dawson Beach Rd., 13800 block, noon Feb. 11 to 10:45 a.m. Feb. 12. Tools and other equipment were stolen from a business.

Emberdale Dr., 14800 block, 8 to 9:23 p.m. Feb. 11. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a rear window.

Granby Rd., 4100 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 10 to 8 p.m. Feb. 11. Cash, a video game system and medicine were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a kitchen window.

Gustus Dr., 4200 block, 7:56 a.m. Feb. 8. A man knocked on a bathroom window at a residence, then fled when confronted.

Kentland Dr., 4400 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 7 to noon Feb. 1. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered through an unlocked window.

Minnieville Rd., 14100 block, 4:09 p.m. Feb. 8. A church was entered by forcing a rear door. Nothing was reported missing.

Quinn Lane, 5400 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 7 to 11 a.m. Feb. 8. Tools were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Warbler Ct., 15200 block, 4:55 p.m. Feb. 7. A rifle and a handgun were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window. Two males fled with the property when confronted.

Wyndale Ct., 3300 block, 6:28 p.m. Feb. 9. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door, then fled empty-handed when confronted.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Azalea Grove Dr., 10000 block, 1:25 a.m. Feb. 10. A man was stabbed during a fight. A 30-year-old Manassas man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

Fairview Ave., 9500 block, 12:45 a.m. Feb. 13. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

Woodlea Ct., 9300 block, 4:50 p.m. Feb. 9. A man attacked an acquaintance. A Manassas man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Byrd Dr., 9200 block, Feb. 2. A teenager threatened a male juvenile and demanded cash. A 13-year-old male was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 9000 block, 12:01 to 6:45 a.m. Feb. 12. Cash was stolen from a restaurant.

Ditmars Ct., 8700 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 14 to 5 a.m. Feb. 15. A navigator was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Dumfries Rd., 10400 block, 10:45 p.m. Feb. 1 to 9 a.m. Feb. 14. A catalytic converter was stolen from a rental truck. A nearby truck was damaged during an unsuccessful attempt to steal a similar device

Fairfax St., 8500 block, Feb. 13. A video game system was stolen from a residence.

Godwin Dr., 8900 block, 2:45 p.m. Feb. 8. A camera that had been left behind by a motorist was stolen from a car wash.

Sudley Rd., 8500 block, 10:43 a.m. Feb. 12. A motorist drove away from a gas station without paying for a fuel purchase.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Centreville Rd., 9100 block, Jan. 23. An attempt was made to buy a used vehicle using fraudulent checks. A 41-year-old Upper Marlboro woman was arrested. Police suspect her in the fraudulent purchase of two other vehicles in the area.

VANDALISM

Bragg Lane, 9700 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 14 to 4 a.m. Feb. 15. A vehicle's tires were cut.

Oliver Ct., 8800 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 10 to 6 a.m. Feb. 11. A vehicle's tires were cut.

Tudor Oaks, 8800 block, 2 to 4 p.m. Feb. 10. A vehicle's tires were cut.

Manassas Park

No report was received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

February 23, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1501 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA ROBBERIES

Bay Dale Drive and Route 50, 5:45 p.m. Feb. 12. A man forced an acquaintance to drive him from her residence in the District to an ATM, where he forced her to withdraw cash. He then made her drive to this location in Arnold, where he got out of the vehicle and walked away. At 3:30 p.m. Feb. 13, an arrest was made at a residence near M&T Bank Stadium in Baltimore. An Annapolis man, 30, was charged with robbery, theft, false imprisonment and second-degree assault. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Harker Place, 200 block, Feb. 11. A wallet was stolen from a locker at a gym. A credit card from the wallet was used to purchase merchandise at Annapolis locations. Three other incidents involving fraudulent use of credit cards from wallets stolen at the gym have occurred since early November.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA WEAPONS OFFENSES

Townsend Ave. and Alley 7, 1 p.m. Feb. 15. A handgun and illegal drugs found in a 2009 Ford Flex were seized by police, as was the vehicle. A Baltimore man, 61, was charged with several firearm violations and possession of drugs with intent to distribute.

GLEN BURNIE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block, 12:04 p.m. Feb. 11. A man groped a woman inside a business. A 60-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested a short time later. Charges included second-degree assault, fourth-degree sex offense and disorderly conduct.

ASSAULTS

Silent Shadow Ct., 7900 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 11. A man went to an acquaintance's residence and threatened her at knifepoint. Another man intervened and was cut on the hand. A Severna Park man, 28, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore and Annapolis Blvd., 7600 block, 12:12 a.m. Feb. 16. A man was confronted while tampering with an ATM at a gas station. A Pasadena man, 27, was charged with destruction of property and attempted theft.

MILLERSVILLE AREA ROBBERIES

Cloverleaf Dr., 8200 block, 10:45 a.m. Feb. 15. A man robbed a business, then was chased into a wooded area by employees. When police arrived, a man tried to speed away in a vehicle and was stopped. A Glen Burnie man, 42, and a 29-year-old man of no fixed address were arrested.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

ASSAULTS

Madison St., 1100 block, 2:30 a.m. Feb. 15. A male was found on a sidewalk, suffering from a stab wound. He was flown to a hospital, where he was treated for a serious injury. An investigation was continuing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burnside St., 600 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 11 to noon Feb. 12. A Global Positioning System device and loose change were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Center St., 200 block, 1:30 to 2 p.m. Feb. 12. Four pairs of sneakers, a video game system and two controllers were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Clay St., unit block, 2 p.m. Feb. 15. A vacant apartment was entered by forcing a door. An Annapolis man, 32, was arrested.

Gorman St., 100 block, 9:30 p.m. Feb. 13. A man tried to steal a vehicle in a parking garage, then fled on foot and was chased down by an acquaintance of the vehicle's owner. An Annapolis man, 26, was charged with assault, resisting arrest and with being rogue and vagabond.

Spa View Cir., unit block, 12:20 a.m. Feb. 13. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked door. A man fled empty-handed when confronted.

West St., 1100 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 14 to 9 a.m. Feb. 15. Wheels and tires were stolen from two vehicles.

West St., 1400 block, Feb. 12. Two unlocked bicycles were stolen from a bike rack. The bikes were recovered that same day in the 1700 block of Forest Drive.

West St., 2000 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 12 to 9:30 a.m. Feb. 13. Wheels and tires were stolen from two vehicles.

Westgate Cir., 100 block, 1 p.m. Feb. 8 to 9 a.m. Feb. 9. A laptop that had been left under a table was stolen from a business.

Fifth St. and Chesapeake Ave., 7:30 to 7:40 p.m. Feb. 11. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Smithville St., 1000 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 11 to 9:30 a.m. Feb. 12. A silver-and-black 1997 Honda Civic was stolen.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other felonies, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

ANNAPOLIS JUNCTION AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Guilford Rd., 10900 block, 5 p.m. Feb. 13 to 9 a.m. Feb. 14. A 2001 International truck was stolen. It was recovered in Anne Arundel County. Its tires were missing.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Harpers Farm Rd., 5400 block, Feb. 1. Two males threatened a motorist and robbed her of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Overheart Lane, 6500 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 11. A residence was entered by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Peace Chimes Ct., 7100 block, 8:39 p.m. Feb. 15. A break-in occurred.

Trotting Ridge Way, 10900 block, 7:30 to 10 a.m. Feb. 3. A vacant residence was entered by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cordage Walk, 10700 block, 9 a.m. Feb. 11. A blue-and-black 2000 Honda Civic was stolen.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 11300 block, 11:28 a.m. Feb. 12. A silver 2006 Nissan Sentra was stolen.

Peartree Way, 11200 block, 11:57 a.m. Feb. 12. A blue 2003 Honda Civic was stolen.

Sunny Spring, 6000 block, 5:45 a.m. Feb. 14. A gold 1997 Ford Expedition was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Macaw Ct., 6300 block, 6:30 a.m. Feb. 13. Someone was seen fleeing a business with property taken from inside. There was no sign of forced entry.

Old Waterloo Rd., 6900 block, 10 a.m. Feb. 11 to 12:25 p.m. Feb. 12. A bathroom at a park facility was entered by forcing a door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Business Pkwy., 6600 block, 2:36 p.m. Feb. 13. A yellow International cargo truck was stolen.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Frederick Rd., 15000 block, 5 p.m. Feb. 10 to 3:30 p.m. Feb. 15. A minibike was stolen from an unlocked garage.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Court House Dr., 3400 block, 10:05 p.m. Feb. 10. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen.

Washington Blvd., 8000 block, 12:44 a.m. Feb. 12. A blue 2001 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

JESSUP AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Assateague Dr., 7300 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 9 to 10:30 a.m. Feb. 10. Tools and equipment were stolen from a business entered through a front door. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Montevideo Rd., 7500 block, 11:12 a.m. Feb. 13. Two 20-foot containers were stolen.

LAUREL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Helmart Dr., 7900 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Feb. 13. A residence was entered by kicking in the front door. The premises were ransacked, but nothing was reported missing.

Scaggsville Rd., 11900 block, 7 to 8 p.m. Feb. 10. A gun, cash, jewelry and a digital media player were stolen from a residence.

Washington Blvd., 8300 block, 5:30 p.m. Feb. 9 to 7:50 a.m. Feb. 10. A safe and cash were stolen from a business entered through a back door.

MOUNT AIRY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ridge Rd., 900 block, 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Gun cases and accessories were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

SAVAGE AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Foxborough Dr., 8500 block, 8:42 a.m. Feb. 10. A black trailer was stolen.

WOODBINE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Susan Marie Way, 14700 block, 3:40 to 7 p.m. Feb. 15. A safe containing cash and jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 889 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

GLEN BURNIE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dorsey Rd. area,July 13. A boy reported that he had been sexually abused while attending a youth education and service group during a two-year period. A group leader, 15, was charged with second-degree child abuse and third- and fourth-degree sex offense.

ASSAULTS  

Browning Ct., 400 block, 7;14 p.m. July 11. A man, 27, was stabbed in the chest. A Pasadena man was charged with attempted second-degree homicide, first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment. The injured man was taken to University of Maryland Shock Trauma.

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy.,1200 block, 11:10 p.m. July 15. A man at a convenience store was robbed at gunpoint.

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block, 5 a.m. July 12. After a hotel guest attempted to pay for a room with a counterfeit bill, the man jumped over a counter and assaulted a clerk, then took his cellphone and cash. A Severn man was charged with robbery, theft and second-degree assault.

ANIMAL CARE INCIDENTS

Ritchie Hwy.,7500 block, 1:14 p.m. July 15. Investigating a report of an animal in a vehicle at the district court parking lot, officers broke a window and rescued a 7-year-old Scottish terrier mix. The animal was evaluated by Animal Control and returned to the owner. The owner, an Owings man, 54, was cited in connection with leaving an animal unattended in a vehicle.

MILLERSVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Veterans Hwy., 8800 block, 12:55 p.m. July 14. A 21-year-old autistic man was allegedly sexually abused by a staff member of an organization between May 15 and June 15. A Glen Burnie man, 50, was charged with third- and fourth-degree sex offense, second-degree assault and vulnerable adult abuse.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

WEAPONS

Copeland St.,1900 block, 3:51 p.m. July 10. A 17-year-old male pedestrian was shot in the hand.

ROBBERIES

Forest Dr., 1:30 to 3:30 p.m. July 9. A pedestrian was robbed of cash by three men.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Carraway Lane, 7:15 p.m. July 9 to 3 a.m. July 10. Three watches were stolen from a home.

McGuckian St., 1200 block, 6 p.m. July 5 to 6:45 p.m. July 10. A TV was stolen from a building.

Milkshake Lane, 4 p.m. July 3 to 9 a.m. July 10. A power washer was stolen from a locked shed.

Silopanna Rd., 11 p.m. July 16 to 8 a.m. July 17. A custom-made bicycle was stolen from a deck at a home.

Tyler Ave.,1300 block, 3 to 8 p.m. July 17. Instant soup and a 12-pack of sodas were stolen from a home. The home was vandalized.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Stevens Forest Rd.,5800 block, midnight July 14. A purse, cash, a cellphone and documents were taken from people standing in a parking lot.

Waning Moon Way,6600 block, 9:15 p.m. July 14. A person was robbed by a male wearing black clothing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alexander Bell Dr., 6700 block, 6 p.m. July 10 to 7 a.m. July 11. A safe and money orders were stolen from a business.

Columbia Rd.,11 p.m. July 11 to 6:15 a.m. July 12. Cash was stolen from a pool.

Pyramid Way,6800 block, 1:50 p.m. July 10. A bicycle was stolen.

Tilted Stone, 5400 block, 12:40 p.m., July 11. A male youth was seen leaving a home with a stereo.

ELKRIDGE AREA ROBBERIES

Business Pkwy., 6700 block, 7:15 p.m. July 13. A man sitting in his vehicle was robbed at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Elkridge Crossing Way,7200 block, July 12. Appliances were stolen from a business.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Rd.,9200 block, 9:20 a.m. to 4:10 p.m. July 14. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Montgomery Rd.,6800 block, 5:10 p.m. July 10. Someone entered a home through a kitchen window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Tyler Dr.,3400 block, 3:54 p.m. July 14. Someone entered a home through an unlocked door, then fled after being confronted by the homeowner.

JESSUP AREA ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd.,8000 block, 8:45 p.m. July 15. An employee at a business was robbed at gunpoint.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd.,7500 block, 11:43 p.m. July 12. Two males robbed two people at gunpoint. A Jessup man, 19, was charged with robbery, armed robbery and theft.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Traders Crossing,9200 block, 4:55 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. July 15. Electronics, a wallet and credit cards were stolen from a home.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Washington Blvd.,10000 block, 8:44 p.m. July 14. A 2007 Chevrolet Corvette was stolen.

SAVAGE AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Howard Hills Dr., 8800 block, 8:32 a.m. July 11. A 2005 Cadillac Deville was stolen.

July 13, 2008 Sunday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. 13


LENGTH: 539 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Chesapeake Beach Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHESAPEAKE BEACH, July 3. A bucket was stolen from a snack bar at Chesapeake Beach Water Park. 

CHESAPEAKE BEACH, 3:30 p.m. July 5. A bicycle was stolen outside a McDonald's while the owner was inside.

Lusby Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

SHORT CUT ROAD, July 4. Graffiti was found on a vehicle, fencing, mailboxes and a roadway.

St. Leonard Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BAYSIDE ROAD, July 4-7. About $100 worth of gasoline was siphoned out of a truck at a residence.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Hughesville Area

ROBBERIES

LEONARDTOWN RD., 8100 block, 9:49 p.m. June 29. Two males with guns stole cash from Sunoco.

Waldorf Area

ASSAULTS

HAMMERHEAD CT., 5800 block, 6:52 p.m. July 2. A man stabbed a male youth, 17, multiple times during a fight. A man, 22, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, reckless endangerment and carrying a dangerous weapon.

ROBBERIES

THOROUGHBRED CT., 6000 block, 5:51 a.m. July 7. An armed robber took cash from a woman walking to her car.

WOLVERINE PL., 6200 block, 7 a.m. July 7. A male armed with a gun demanded a woman's purse. The woman screamed, and the male fled empty-handed.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Great Mills Area

SEX OFFENSES

GREAT MILLS, July 5. A male youth raped a girl, 12, at a residence. A youth, 16, was charged with second-degree rape, second- and fourth-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

Lexington Park Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ERIC ROAD, 12:52 p.m. July 1. Two digital cameras, an iPod and cash were stolen from a residence. A man, 21, was charged with first-degree burglary.

VALLEY COURT, July 4. A door frame was damaged when a man tried to force a residence's front door. A man, 18, was charged with third-degree burglary and destruction of property.

Mechanicsville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JOAN DRIVE, 7:24 a.m. June 28. License plates were stolen off of a vehicle.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

May 10, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1005 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Francis West Lane, 16800 block, 1:03 a.m. April 22. A man assaulted relatives. A 36-year-old man was arrested.

GAINESVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Witton Cir., 6800 block, April 25. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. An 18-year-old Bristow man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Piney Grove Way, 6000 block, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. April 25. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Laurie Ct. area,Jan. 24. Police investigated a report that a man had sexually assaulted two male juveniles in 1978, when he was their sports coach, at residences. A 58-year-old Manassas man of the Laurie Court area was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Carolina Dr., 10900 block, 12:30 to 2:30 a.m. April 27. Cash was stolen from a business entered through an unlocked bay door. A 21-year-old male and a 16-year-old Gainesville male were arrested.

Country Roads Lane, 9500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. April 25. A bike was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

VANDALISM

Moore Dr.,9800 block, 6:18 p.m. April 25. A man poured paint on a county police cruiser. An 18-year-old Manassas man and a 19-year-old Herndon man were arrested.

NOKESVILLE AREA WEAPONS

Aden Rd.,14100 block, 10:42 a.m. April 26. A man attempted to give a male pedestrian what appeared to be an explosive device. When the pedestrian refused, the man put the device in a ditch and walked away. The Virginia State Police Explosive Ordinance Disposal Unit determined that the device was inert. A 34-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with manufacturing a hoax explosive device.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Delaney Rd., 13200 block, 3:30 p.m. April 24. During an argument, a female juvenile threw a knife toward a female relative. The knife hit a wall. No injuries were reported. A 16-year-old Woodbridge girl was arrested.

WEAPONS

Carlsbad Rd., 14900 block, 7:27 a.m. April 24. A man got out of a white van and used a gun to threaten a male pedestrian, who ran to a nearby vehicle and hid. The gunman drove away.

ROBBERIES

Chinn Park Dr. and Prince William Pkwy., 7:08 p.m. April 25. A group of men assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet containing cash and a cellphone. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Daniel Stuart Sq., 2000 block, 6:14 p.m. April 30. A group of males robbed three male juveniles of a watch, an MP3 player and a pair of headphones. An 18-year-old man and two male juveniles, 14 and 15, all from Woodbridge, were arrested.

Mapledale Plaza, 5800 block, 7:16 p.m. April 27. Three males assaulted a male juvenile pedestrian and robbed him of a cellphone.

Prince William Pkwy. and York Dr., 2:45 a.m. April 30. A male passenger in a taxi assaulted the male driver and ordered him out of the vehicle. The passenger drove away in the taxi, which was located in Fairfax County. A 29-year-old Chantilly man was arrested.

Telegraph Rd. and Morse Lane, 9:22 a.m. April 24. A male passenger got out of a vehicle parked on the shoulder of a road and approached a male motorist stopped at an intersection. The male asked for directions, then showed a handgun and demanded money from the motorist. He then took cash and fled in a vehicle driven by another person.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dulcinea Pl., 12600 block, 6:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. April 24. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Esquarre Ct., 3300 block, 8:30 a.m. April 25 to 10 a.m. April 26. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear glass door.

Fox Lair Dr., 2900 block, 2:40 to 3 a.m. April 28. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a rear window.

Georgia Rd., 15100 block, 5 to 7 p.m. April 27. Two laptops, two video game systems and video games were stolen from a residence.

Glendale Rd., 4500 block, 7:45 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. April 23. Electronics and five pairs of shoes were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

Kirkdale Dr., 4600 block, 7:35 a.m. to 6:50 p.m. April 23. Two TVs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Cannoneer Ct., 9500 block, 7:30 p.m. April 22. A man assaulted a female acquaintance when she attempted to leave a residence. He hit and choked her until she lost consciousness. When she awoke, he hit her again. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Byrd Dr., 9200 block, 8:45 p.m. April 25. Three males demanded money from a male pedestrian. When he refused, the three assaulted him. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

WEAPONS

Manassas Dr. and Sandstone Way, 4:41 p.m. April 30. Someone fired an air rifle outdoors. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enterprise Ct., 9100 block, 7:30 p.m. April 20 to 3:15 p.m. April 21. A trailer was entered by breaking a door lock. Nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas Dr., 100 block, 9 p.m. April 24 to 4:21 a.m. April 25. Cash, an air compressor, a socket set, two bowling balls, a bag, shoes and gloves were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Adams St., unit block, 3:15 p.m. April 29. Someone spray-painted gang graffiti on the rear of a snack bar.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 884 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Frisco Ct., 14600 block, May 12. A man sexually assaulted a female relative. A 20-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

LENGTH: 745 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA WEAPONS

Dumfries Rd., 17300 block, 11:49 p.m. June 9. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pine Bluff Dr., 3300 block, 2:07 a.m. June 10. Two men attempted to enter a restaurant by breaking a side window. They fled when an employee yelled at them. 

GAINESVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Braemar Village Plaza, 12800 block, 4:23 p.m. June 4. A motorist picked up a female juvenile acquaintance, drove her to the location and sexually assaulted her. A 26-year-old Gainesville man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Whitehall Dr., 7500 block, 3 a.m. June 8. During an argument, a woman hit a female acquaintance in the head with a bottle. A 43-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Keara Ct., 7700 block, 11:05 to 11:50 a.m. June 3. Cash and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through a window.

NOKESVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Par Dr. and Vint Hill Rd., June 8. A man raped an acquaintance at gunpoint after she picked him up and drove him to the area. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULTS

Graham Park Rd., 3800 block, 1:47 a.m. June 8. During an argument, a woman threw a bottle at a female acquaintance, cutting her head. A 48-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

Katie Pl. and Kyle Lane, 3700 block, 12:26 a.m. June 9. Responding to a report of a loud party, officers heard several gunshots.

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 2 p.m. June 6. Three males pointed a handgun at a man cleaning out his vehicle. The man confronted them, and they fled empty-handed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ROBBERIES

Bel Air and Jeffries Roads, 10:05 p.m. June 9. A man accompanied by a woman assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a bag containing food.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14000 block, 9:33 p.m. June 10. A gunman robbed a man and a woman of a purse and cellphone.

Old Bridge Rd., 3500 block, 11:21 p.m. June 9. Three gunmen robbed a gas station of cash and a customer of a wallet and cellphone.

Reardon Lane, 5600 block, 12:58 a.m. June 6. A man demanded narcotics from a male acquaintance at gunpoint. The acquaintance assaulted the man, who fired the gun at him. The man took the acquaintance's car keys and sunglasses and fled on foot. The acquaintance called a female acquaintance before calling police and put marijuana in her vehicle. A 21-year-old man and a 20-year-old woman, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, 10:51 a.m. June 5. A man in a building exposed himself to a woman and propositioned her for sex. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Armstead St., 13100 block, 6 a.m. to noon. June 6. Several firearms and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 3:25 p.m. June 5. A group of men entered a residence by breaking a rear door and ransacked the interior while a resident hid.

Canada Goose Loop, 15900 block, 4:30 a.m. June 6. A gold chain was stolen from a residence.

Grady Lane, 3200 block, 8 a.m. to 4:20 p.m. June 6. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Manchester Way, 12300 block, noon to 5:45 p.m. June 6. A laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear door.

Shallow Ct., 14800 block, 5 to 7:30 p.m. June 10. Cash and a computer tablet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Sunny Brook Ct., 3900 block, 10:45 a.m. June 7 to 2:30 p.m. June 8. Two rugs were stolen from a residence.

Woodmark Dr., 2800 block, 7:15 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. June 7. Cash and a computer tablet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Congressional Lane, 1600 block, 8:40 p.m. March 27. A man threatened a store employee and stole several pairs of jeans.

Crawford Dr., 1000 block, 3 p.m. March 24 to 6 p.m. March 25. Cash and a watch were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Fallsgrove Dr., 700 block, 11 a.m. March 31 to 5:55 p.m. April 1. A jacket, a vehicle key and an ID card were stolen from a shelf in a workout room at a recreation center.

Frederick Rd., 15100 block, 5:45 to 5:55 p.m. April 1. A ring was stolen from a restroom at a store.

Horners Lane N., 600 block, 7 to 7:30 a.m. March 29. A musical instrument was stolen from a church.

Hungerford Dr., 300 block, 2:09 p.m. March 26. Merchandise was stolen from a store. A woman was seen fleeing with the property.

Hungerford Dr., 600 block, 6:13 p.m. March 31. A 44-year-old man was charged with theft.

Hungerford Dr., 800 block, 8 p.m. March 29 to 8:10 a.m. March 30. Cash and two checks were stolen from a business entered by forcing a side door.

Maryland Ave., unit block, 3:30 to 4:30 p.m. March 27. A cellphone was stolen from a stroller at a library.

Research Blvd., 1600 block, 1:30 p.m. March 27. A cellphone and three wallets were among property stolen from several offices in an office suite.

Rockville Pike, 700 block, 12:32 p.m. March 28. A male took several cosmetics items from a store, then fled to a waiting blue Chevy Impala driven by a female accomplice.

Shady Grove Rd., 14900 block, 8:30 to 9:56 p.m. March 22. A 16-year-old male was charged with theft.

Veirs Mill Rd., 2200 block, 9:07 p.m. March 27. A 39-year-old woman was charged with theft from a retail store.

Woodley Dr., 800 block, 8:30 a.m. to noon March 28. A TV was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

First St., 100 block, 11 p.m. March 29 to 8:30 a.m. March 30. An iPod, a radio and a satellite radio antenna were stolen from a vehicle.

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported recently by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA ROBBERIES

Braemar Village Plaza, 12800 block, 11:56 p.m. June 1. A male robbed a male juvenile acquaintance of cash and fled.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Cardinal Dr., 15000 block, midnight to 5:55 a.m. May 31. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a rear door.

Purvis Dr., 18000 block, 8 to 9 p.m. June 1. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Stone Mountain Ct., 4300 block, 12:30 p.m. May 31. Two males attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Newton Pl., 8600 block, 3:15 p.m. June 1. A man hit a male juvenile relative in the face. A female relative was aware of the incident and failed to report it. Two 27-year-old Manassas residents, a man and a woman, were arrested and charged with cruelty and injury to a child.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Buttercup Pl., 10800 block, May 31 to June 3. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Centreville Rd., 7300 block, 6 p.m. May 30 to 8 a.m. May 31. Vehicle rims were stolen from a business entered through an unlocked side door.

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:45 a.m. to 3 p.m. May 30. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:20 a.m. to 3:21 p.m. A computer, two TVs and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Etheridge Lane, 6300 block, 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. June 1. Cash and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barnette Cir., 18900 block, 4 to 8:30 p.m. June 1. A safe and other items were stolen from a residence entered through an open basement window.

ASSAULTS

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dundee Ct., 14500 block, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 29. Jewelry and other items were stolen from a residence.

Earlham Ct., 14600 block, 9:05 to 9:45 a.m. May 31. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear door.

Neddleton Ave., 5500 block, 11:30 a.m. to 2:11 p.m. May 30. A handgun, two laptop computers and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear basement door.

Stockholm Way, 3000 block, 3:30 to 8:30 p.m. May 27. A laptop computer, a camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Tuckahoe Ct., 3400 block, noon June 2 to 3 p.m. June 3. Someone entered a vacant residence by breaking a window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Vestal St., 600 block, 1:13 p.m. June 5. Someone entered a residence, then fled empty-handed through a rear door as a resident approached.

Prince William County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 701 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Leatherwood Lane and Dashiell Pl., 1:16 a.m. Feb. 5. A passenger in a vehicle operating with its headlights turned off fired several shots into the air through a sunroof. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Delaney Rd. and Dale Blvd., 9:57 p.m. Feb. 4. Two males knocked a teenager to the ground and robbed him of a cellphone and other property. No injuries were reported. 

Delaney Rd. and Kirkdale Dr., 10:13 p.m. Feb. 4. Two males attacked a teenager and robbed him of a wallet and a coat. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Worchester Dr., 4400 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 6 to 4:30 a.m. Feb. 7. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through the unlocked front door.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Henderson Lane, 16100 block, 10:30 p.m. Jan. 29 to 3:44 a.m. Jan. 30. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

William Johnston Lane, 3300 block, 11:59 p.m. Feb. 6. Two men forced their way into a residence and threatened a male acquaintance. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man and a 21-year-old Stafford man were arrested.

GAINESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Heritage Hunt golf course area, 12:28 p.m. Feb. 7. A man attacked an acquaintance with a stun gun, then sexually assaulted her. A 73-year-old Gainesville man was arrested. The victim was treated for injuries.

ASSAULTS

Affirmed Pl., 5900 block, 12:52 a.m. Feb. 6. A attacked an acquaintance and threatened her with a knife. A 69-year-old Gainesville man was arrested. The woman was treated for injuries.

MANASSAS AREA

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd. and Crestwood Dr., 1:34 p.m. Feb. 5. A male was robbed of a wallet from his back pocket. Two men fled with the property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gary Rd., 7200 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 3 to 6:45 a.m. Feb. 4. Tools and equipment were stolen from a work van parked near a business. An attempt was made to break into the business by prying open a front door.

MONTCLAIR AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lake Montclair area, 8:26 a.m. Feb. 4. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 32-year-old Montclair man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Forestdale Plaza area, 7:15 p.m. Feb. 7. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile acquaintance. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 4:39 a.m. Jan. 30. During what police described as a gang altercation, a female juvenile was assaulted. A short time later, three males and female fought with a man involved in the earlier assault. Two 18-year-old Dale City men were arrested.

Woodvale Ct., 13500 block, Jan. 31. A child was injured by a child-care worker. A 39-year-old Woodbridge woman was charged with felony child abuse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Corbin Ct., 2700 block, 9 to 9:30 p.m. Feb. 1. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Gardensen Dr., 4100 block, 7:56 a.m. Feb. 1. A residence was entered by breaking a bedroom window. Two men were seen fleeing the premises empty-handed.

Gardenview Loop, 1000 block, 12:01 a.m. Feb. 6 to 6:30 a.m. Feb. 7. Cash and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered through the unlocked front door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jerry's Cir., 9000 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 3 to 11 a.m. Feb. 4. A laptop computer and tools were stolen from a business entered by prying open a rear door.

Richmond Ave., 8600 block, 2 a.m. Feb. 6. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a basement window. Nothing was reported missing.

Thornwood Lane, 9200 block, 12:50 a.m. Feb. 6. An attempt was made to break into a residence by prying a screen from a basement window. The intruder fled empty-handed after knocking over several trash cans and banging on the front door of the residence.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

ASSAULTS

Centreville Rd.,8400 block, 10:56 p.m. Jan. 29. Two females attacked a female at a pool hall. An 18-year-old Gainesville woman and a 17-year-old female were arrested.

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 194 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.  

 Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ROBBERY

BLAIR RD., 200 block, 12:45 a.m. May 26. A man grabbed a woman's purse and a bag containing money from her workplace and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHARLES ST., 100 block. 11:23 p.m. May 23. A man, 44, was driving a vehicle with stolen plates. He was charged with theft less than $ 500 and driving under the influence.

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

HADLEY DR., 2900 block. 11:02 a.m. May 28. A man entered a residence and sexually assaulted a woman.

ROBBERY

DRAKE CT., 4000 block, 10:45 p.m. May 26. Four people robbed two men, 28 and 37, at gunpoint.

-- Bonnie Smith

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1546 words


Montgomery County

The following information, provided by the Montgomery County Police Department, shows only initial calls for service received by the 911 center. Many of these reported incidents could turn out to be classified under a different crime category or determined to be unfounded. And some calls for service could be resolved with no further action needed.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

June 18, 2015 Thursday 9:43 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1593 words


Montgomery County

The following information, provided by the Montgomery County Police Department, shows only initial calls for service received by the 911 center. Many of these reported incidents could turn out to be classified under a different crime category or determined to be unfounded. And some calls for service could be resolved with no further action needed.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Loudoun County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 839 words


Loudoun County crime report

Reports from the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police.

Loudoun County

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

ASHBURN AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Thatcher and Dodge terraces, 9:20 p.m. June 14. A man approached a woman who was taking trash to a disposal bin at an apartment complex and tried to sexually assault her. He fled after being confronted by someone else.

ROBBERIES

Gala Cir., 44100 block, 5 p.m. June 13. Three male youths, one armed with a knife, robbed another male youth of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alexandras Grove Dr., 19900 block, 7 p.m. June 16 to 8 a.m. June 17. Cellphone accessories and sunglasses were taken from a vehicle.

Ferncliff Terr., 44000 block, 9 p.m. June 11 to 7:30 a.m. June 12. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle.

Frame Sq., 21600 block, 4 p.m. June 14 to 4:30 p.m. June 15. Cash was taken from a vehicle.

Leanne Terr., 22500 block, 4 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. June 14. A wallet and a cellphone were taken from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Agawam Terr., 44300 block, June 9 to June 16. A 1994 Ford pickup truck was stolen.

VANDALISM

Ashburn Village Blvd. and Fincastle Dr., 10:07 a.m. June 15. A pedestrian tunnel was painted with graffiti painted.

LEESBURG AREA ASSAULTS

Balls Bluff Rd., 700 block, 4:53 p.m. June 13. A domestic assault was reported.

Clubhouse Dr., 100 block, 4:44 p.m. June 13. A domestic assault was reported.

Clubhouse Dr., 100 block, 10:08 p.m. June 15. A domestic assault was reported.

Cornwall St., 200 block, 8:39 a.m. June 13. An assault was reported.

Edwards Ferry Rd., 900 block, 11:09 p.m. June 14. An assault was reported.

Fort Evans Rd., 200 block, 10:04 p.m. June 14. A domestic assault was reported.

Fort Evans Rd., unit block, 8:09 p.m. June 16. A domestic assault was reported.

Janney St., 1100 block, 2:15 p.m. June 14. A domestic assault was reported.

Plaza St., unit block, 1:16 p.m. June 15. Threats were reported.

Prosperity Ave., 100 block, 11:04 a.m. June 15. A domestic assault was reported.

Rock Spring Dr., 300 block, 4:23 a.m. June 15. An assault was reported.

Sparkleberry Terr., 400 block, 7:02 p.m. June 14. Threats were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catoctin Cir., unit block, 10:12 a.m. June 13. Shoplifting was reported.

Deerpath Ave., 400 block, 10:14 a.m. June 17. Fraud was reported.

Dry Mill Rd., 400 block, 9:52 a.m. June 13. A theft was reported.

Edwards Ferry Rd., 900 block, 5:12 p.m. June 12. Shoplifting was reported.

Edwards Ferry Rd., 1300 block, 10:58 a.m. June 13. Fraud was reported.

Edwards Ferry Rd., 1300 block, 11:31 a.m. June 13. Fraud was reported.

Edwards Ferry Rd., 1300 block, 11:32 a.m. June 13. Fraud was reported.

Edwards Ferry Rd., 900 block, 11:25 p.m. June 13. Shoplifting was reported.

Fieldstone Dr., 700 block, 7:21 a.m. June 17. A theft was reported.

Fort Evans Rd., 200 block, 3:03 p.m. June 14. Shoplifting was reported.

Fort Evans Rd., 500 block, 7:21 p.m. June 15. Shoplifting was reported.

Heritage Way, unit block, 4:06 p.m. June 16. Fraud was reported.

Ida Lee Dr., unit block, 12:49 p.m. June 13. A theft was reported.

Ida Lee Dr., unit block, 7:18 p.m. June 14. A theft was reported.

PURCELLVILLE AREA VANDALISM

Neer and Meadow lanes, 1 a.m. June 14. Several mailboxes and a street sign were damaged.

SOUTH RIDING AREA VANDALISM

Flannigan Terr., 42700 block, 11:20 p.m. June 15. A door lock at a house was damaged.

STERLING AREA ROBBERIES

Community Plaza, 47000 block, 4:52 a.m. June 14. A man got into a vehicle with an acquaintance and two other men. The acquaintance eventually forced the man at gunpoint to withdraw money from his bank account.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Regal Plaza, 45900 block, 2 to 3:45 p.m. June 15. Cash was taken from a vehicle entered by damaging a window.

Reserve Falls Terr., 20500 block, 2:30 to 3 p.m. June 15. An iPad was stolen from a residence.

Willoughby Sq., 20500 block, June 16 to June 17. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Cameron Ct. N., 200 block, 6:57 a.m. June 18. A vehicle window was damaged.

Quiet Brook Pl., 20700 block, 10 p.m. June 17 to 7:30 a.m. June 18. Tires on two vehicles were damaged.

Redwood Rd. W., 12:15 to 6 a.m. June 18. A vehicle window was damaged.

- Compiled by Sandy Mauck
