Loudoun County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 743 words


Loudoun County crime report Reports from the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police.

Loudoun County

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

ASHBURN AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Thatcher and Dodge terraces, 9:20 p.m. June 14. A man approached a woman who was taking trash to a disposal bin at an apartment complex and tried to sexually assault her. He fled after being confronted by someone else. 

ROBBERIES

Gala Cir., 44100 block, 5 p.m. June 13. Three male youths, one armed with a knife, robbed another male youth of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alexandras Grove Dr., 19900 block, 7 p.m. June 16 to 8 a.m. June 17. Cellphone accessories and sunglasses were taken from a vehicle.

Ferncliff Terr., 44000 block, 9 p.m. June 11 to 7:30 a.m. June 12. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle.

Frame Sq., 21600 block, 4 p.m. June 14 to 4:30 p.m. June 15. Cash was taken from a vehicle.

Leanne Terr., 22500 block, 4 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. June 14. A wallet and a cellphone were taken from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Agawam Terr., 44300 block, June 9 to June 16. A 1994 Ford pickup truck was stolen.

VANDALISM

Ashburn Village Blvd. and Fincastle Dr., 10:07 a.m. June 15. A pedestrian tunnel was painted with graffiti painted.

LEESBURG AREA

ASSAULTS

Washingtonpost.com


November 1, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1292 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fuller Heights and Mockingbird Heights roads, 10 p.m. Oct. 18. A gunman demanded property from three female pedestrians, then forced one of them to accompany him a short distance, where he sexually assaulted her.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

John Marshall Hwy., 14300 block, 7:30 a.m. Oct. 19 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 22. A residence was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen. 

Sudley Rd., 4400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Oct. 19. Jewelry and ammunition were among property stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass near the front door.

Trek Way, 7000 block, 4:30 p.m. Oct. 19 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 22. A dishwasher was stolen from a residence under construction.

MANASSAS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Boar Run Ct., 15500 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 18 to 11:27 a.m. Oct. 19. Three mountain bikes were stolen from an open garage at a residence.

Botsford Rd., 9800 block, 10 a.m. Oct. 19 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 22. Three firearms and a TV were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Dumfries Rd., 10600 block, Oct. 11. Horse saddles, a computer, a gas grill and a bicycle were among property stolen from two storage units entered by cutting locks.

Ellis Rd., 10000 block, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 22. Several firearms were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Roxbury Ave., 7400 block, 6:30 p.m. Oct. 18 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 21. Three TVs, a laptop computer, two video game systems and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence.

Vic Pl., 8300 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 19 to 5 p.m. Oct. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

NOKESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Nokesville Rd., 13000 block, 4:01 a.m. Oct. 21. During an argument at a party at a residence, a group of men attacked a man. A 19-year-old Nokesville man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA WEAPONS OFFENSES

Graham Park Rd., 3800 block, 6:09 a.m. Oct. 19. Two males tried their way into a residence at gunpoint, then fired several shots into a window.

ROBBERIES

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 3:15 p.m. Oct. 16. Two males argued with a juvenile acquaintance about money, then knocked him to the ground and searched his pockets. The assailants fled empty-handed when an acquaintance intervened. Two Triangle males, 15 and 18, were arrested. The victim was treated for minor injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jurgenson Dr., 3600 block, 12:26 p.m. Oct. 17. Two males tried to force their way into a residence at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed in a vehicle.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

River Ridge Golf Course area, 2900 block, Aug. to Oct. 21. A man attacked an acquaintance on several occasions. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested on sexual assault charges.

ASSAULTS

Cloverdale Rd., 15100 block, 9:35 p.m. Oct. 20. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. The victim was treated for minor injuries.

Fontaine Ct., 14400 block, 2:25 a.m. Oct. 20. During an argument, a man attacked an acquaintance, knocking her to the ground. He then attacked a man who intervened. A 47-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 6:56 p.m. Oct. 23. During an argument in a parking lot, a man shot a male acquaintance. When the victim ran way, he was struck by a vehicle, which left the scene without stopping. The victim was flown to a hospital for treatment of life-threatening injuries. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Old Bridge Rd., 3000 block, 9:30 a.m. Oct. 17. Two males attacked a male in a bathroom at a school. The victim was taken to a hospital. Two Woodbridge males, 15 and 17, were arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Annapolis Way, 900 block, 12:20 a.m. Oct. 18. Witnesses to a chase involving a silver truck and a blue station wagon said that they heard several gunshots.

Cuddy Loop, 14100 block, 11:57 p.m. Oct. 22. A man tried to enter a residence, then walked away. When an occupant confronted him at his vehicle, the man tried to force him back inside the residence at gunpoint. When another occupant refused to unlock the door, the man fired several shots at the residence, then fled empty-handed in the vehicle.

ROBBERIES

Old Bridge Rd., 1400 block, 10:12 a.m. Oct. 20. A man robbed a store of cash at knifepoint.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Perch Branch Way, 4500 block, 8:16 p.m. Oct. 22. A man naked from the waist down approached a pedestrian.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Essex Dr., 14000 block, 9:30 a.m. to 8:50 p.m. Oct. 16. A laptop computer, power tools, cash and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence.

Fairmont Ct., 14300 block, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 16. A laptop computer, a tablet computer and several video games were stolen from a residence.

Fayette Ct., 3600 block, 10 a.m. Oct. 20 to 12:01 a.m. Oct. 21. A break-in occurred at a residence. Cabinets were searched, but nothing was reported missing.

Fellmore Ct., 3600 block, 8:20 to 8:40 p.m. Oct. 17. A TV and shoes were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

Fern Pl., 16600 block, 6:30 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. Oct. 23. A video game system was among property stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Hetten Lane, 3700 block, 8:10 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Kenny Ct., 4700 block, 10:30 to 10:45 a.m. Oct. 22. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Kitty Hawk Way, 13600 block, 1 to 2 p.m. Oct. 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Live Oak Ct., 4900 block, 8:10 p.m. Oct. 20. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence through the front door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Stone Lined Cir., 12500 block, 8:50 p.m. Oct. 23. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a garage door. Nothing was reported missing.

Worth Ave., 13000 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 20 to 8 a.m. Oct. 21. An attempt was made to enter a business by damaging a front door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Taney Rd., 9300 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 19. A man who was seen kicking vehicles along a roadway attacked a motorist who intervened. A 25-year-old Fauquier County man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Wellington Rd., 9900 block, 6:58 p.m. Oct. 20. A man robbed a convenience store of cash at knifepoint.

Wellington Rd., 9900 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 23. A man robbed a convenience store of cash at knifepoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Taney Rd., 9400 block, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 16. An air compressor and a nail gun were stolen from a shed.

Tyler Ct., 9000 block, 12:30 to 2:50 p.m. Oct. 18. Cash, a tablet computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

VANDALISM

Sudley Rd., 8500 block, Oct. 19 to Oct. 21. The paint finish was damaged on six vehicles at a car dealership.

Manassas Park

No report was received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Loudoun County crime report

Reports from the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police.

Loudoun County

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ35


LENGTH: 2810 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received complete reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

DEWEY RD., 11600 block, 11:15 p.m. Oct. 9. A man grabbed a woman from behind, sexually assaulted her and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ADMIRAL WAY AND DOE LANE, Oct. 11 to Oct. 12. Property was stolen from five vehicles entered by force. 

BELLS MILL ROAD, HUNTER CREEK TRAIL AND DEMOCRACY LANE AREA, Oct. 11 to Oct. 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CHOKE CHERRY RD., 1 to 100 block, 9:15 a.m. to 1:15 p.m. Oct. 11. Vehicle parts were stolen from a 1997 Toyota 4Runner.

GAINSBOROUGH CT., Oct. 11 to Oct. 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GAINSBOROUGH CT., Oct. 15 to Oct. 16. Property was stolen from four vehicles.

GAITHER RD., 2000 block, 10:45 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 11. Vehicle parts were stolen from a 2002 Toyota Sequoia.

KING FARM BLVD., 200 block, noon to 3:15 p.m. Oct. 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LYNNFIELD DR. E., 600 block, Oct. 15. Property was stolen from a residence.

PARKLAWN DR., 11700 block, Oct. 17. Property was stolen from a restaurant entered by force.

ROUTE 355 AND INTERSTATE-370, Oct. 12 to Oct. 14. Property was stolen from two vehicles entered by force at a Metro-parking garage.

SOUTHLAWN LANE, 14800 block, Oct. 10. A theft occurred at a delicatessen.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

STRATHMORE AND KESWICK AVENUES, 5:15 p.m. Oct. 21. A man exposed himself to a female youth walking in the above location.

ROBBERIES

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BATTERY LANE, 4900 block, 1 to 10 a.m. Oct. 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

BURNING TREE VALLEY AREA, time and date unreported. Four vehicles were entered by force. Nothing was reported taken.

KENSINGTON AREA, 1:15 a.m. Oct. 11. Thefts from several vehicles occurred. Two people were arrested and charged with theft. Stolen property was recovered.

KENTBURY DRIVE, HILLANDALE ROAD AND S. CHELSEA LANE AREA, time and date unreported. Property was stolen from 16 vehicles. Most of the vehicles had been left unlocked.

WILSON LANE, 5100 block, Oct. 11 to Oct. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence. No entry was gained.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

MUIRFIELD CT., 7800 block, 1:30 a.m. Oct. 11. A car was vandalized, and the ignition was damaged in an attempt to steal the vehicle.

RANDOLPH RD., 5500 block, time and date unreported. A blue 2003 Dodge Caravan was stolen from a health and fitness center after the keys and property were stolen from a gym locker.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BROADBIRCH DR., 2300 block, 1:20 p.m. Oct. 9. A three-year-old boy in a home improvement retail store told his mother he was inappropriately touched by a man in an orange vest. The incident was reported the following day.

ASSAULTS

FENTON ST., 8400 block, 1:57 a.m. Oct. 12. A person in a parking lot was stabbed. An acquaintance of the person stabbed was later arrested and charged with assault in connection with the incident.

FENTON STREET AND COLESVILLE ROAD, 12:50 a.m. Oct. 9. A person sitting in an idling vehicle appeared to be unconscious. When approached by a police officer, the driver sped off, striking the officer with the vehicle. An arrest was made.

ROBBERIES

BLACKBURN LANE, 3900 block, 4:55 p.m. Oct. 11. Three male youths demanded cash from a male. When the male said he did not have any cash, he was struck, and the assailants fled.

CASTLE BLVD., 13800 block, 11:15 a.m. Oct. 12. Two males posing as deliverymen knocked on a door and entered a residence by force. They took property and fled in a Ford vehicle with a decal on the side.

CASTLE BLVD., 13800 block, 2:55 p.m. Oct. 16. Three males attempted to take property from a person, then fled.

COLESVILLE RD., 8400 block, 3:20 p.m. Oct. 11. A male armed with a knife at a Metro station robbed a person of property and fled.

COLESVILLE RD., 8500 block, 3 p.m. Oct. 10. A person inside a fast-food restaurant was robbed. An acquaintance has been identified as a suspect.

GEORGIA AVENUE AND FOREST GLEN ROAD, 6:50 a.m. Oct. 13. A man near a Metro station forced a woman to the ground in an unsuccessful attempt to snatch her purse.

GEORGIA AND SLIGO AVENUES, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 11. A person robbed a person of property and fled. An acquaintance of the person robbed was later arrested and charged with strong-armed robbery in connection with the incident.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 8800 block, 7:20 p.m. Oct. 15. A man took property from a person at a bus stop and fled.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9300 block, 8:55 p.m. Oct. 15. A man in a parking lot accosted a woman, took property and fled in a gold Toyota vehicle with Maryland tags.

PINEY BRANCH ROAD AND FLOWER AVENUE, 7:25 p.m. Oct. 10. Two males walked up to a pedestrian, took property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARRINGTON DR., 800 block, 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 16. Property was stolen from a residence.

CHILDRESS CT., 1 to 100 block, 9:45 a.m. to 8:34 p.m. Oct. 12. Two men confronted an occupant in a hallway of a residence, took property and fled in a 2001 white Honda Accord with Maryland tags.

COTTRELL TERR., 9300 block, Oct. 13 to Oct. 14. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GEORGIA AVE., 10300 block, time and date unknown. An attempt was made to steal a catalytic converter from a Toyota 4Runner.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COVE LANE, 14000 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 17 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 18. Cash was stolen from an apartment.

HUNGERFORD DR., 600 block, 7:15 to 7:35 p.m. Oct. 20. A purse was stolen from a customer's shopping cart at a grocery store.

MONROE ST., 700 block, 12:01 a.m. Sept. 18 to 5 a.m. Oct. 18. A digital scanner was stolen from a residence.

MONROE ST., 700 block, 11 to 11:30 p.m. Oct. 19. A cellphone, a backpack and a hand-held radio were taken from a person in a parking lot.

MONTGOMERY AVE. W., 1 to 100 block, 11:24 Oct. 19 to Oct. 20. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking through a side door.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 3:52 p.m. Oct. 21. Several items of clothing were stolen from a retail store.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 3:35 p.m. Oct. 19. A shoplifting occurred. A Wheaton woman, 28, was arrested and charged with shoplifting, two counts of possession of drug paraphernalia and possession of suspected marijuana.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ROBBERIES

EASTERN AVE., 6600 block, 10:24 p.m. Oct. 22. A person paid a deliveryman for several pizzas, called two other people armed with handguns and waiting around a corner. The robbers punched the deliveryman in the abdomen, took cash, his wallet and the pizzas, then fled on foot. No injuries were reported.

MAPLE AVE., 7100 block, 9:02 p.m. Oct. 22. Three males accosted a male pedestrian. One of the males stuck an unidentified object in the pedestrian's side. The attackers took his wallet and cellphone, then fled on foot.

MAPLE AND TULIP AVENUES, 11:53 p.m. Oct. 20. Three males in a white Jeep Cherokee approached a man and a woman at an intersection. Two of the males got out of the vehicle and demanded the couple hand over their wallets. One of the robbers pointed a silver handgun at them, while the other rifled through the man's pockets, took his property and woman's cellphone. The three men fled in the Jeep Cherokee. A witness provided police with a license plate number later traced to a vehicle that had been stolen in D.C. No injuries were reported.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7300 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 20. A group of four or five males were in an elevator when a youth got on. One of the males tried to grab the boy's digital music player, and when the boy tried to pull it back, he was punched in the face. The injured boy immediately fled the elevator.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GUDE AVE., 6700 block, 1:30 to 11:30 p.m. Oct. 25. Property was stolen from a residence. A window had been left open and a kitchen door, unlocked.

SYCAMORE AVE., 8:30 a.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

LEE AVE., 1 to 100 block, 10:31 a.m. Oct. 23 to 10:32 a.m. Oct. 25. A 2001 Honda Civic was stolen.

LOCKNEY AND KIRKLYN AVENUES, 5:50 p.m. Oct. 20. A theft occurred. A male youth was arrested and charged with theft from auto and theft under $500.

ROANOKE AND HOUSTON AVENUES, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 20 to 1 p.m. Oct. 21. A 1997 Honda Accord was stolen.

-- Compiled by LISA M. BOLTON

Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 558 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.  

PRINCE FREDERICK ASSAULTS

Prince Frederick, 6:33 a.m., April 8. A man made threats and damaged property at a convenience store. A Prince Frederick man, 52, was charged with disorderly conduct and destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Serenity Ct., 10:21 a.m., April 7. Cash was fraudulently removed from a man's bank account. The man's caretaker, a 57-year-old woman, was charged with theft and forgery.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities. HUGHESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Quicktree Farm Ct., 7000 block, 10:15 a.m., April 10. Nearly two dozen metal drywall liners were stolen. A 55-year-old man and a 56-year-old woman, both of Aquasco, were charged with burglary and theft.

INDIAN HEAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Indian Head Hwy., 4300 block, 12 to 11:30 a.m., April 9. Cash was stolen from a restaurant.

WALDORF AREA ASSAULTS

Crain Hwy., 2100 block, 3:47 a.m., April 7. Two men attacked acquaintances in a motel room. Two Waldorf men, ages 26 and 31, were charged with assault and destruction of property. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 4300 block, April 5. Fraudulent orders were placed with a building-supplies company. A White Plains man, 40, was charged with two counts of theft, theft scheme, forgery and with providing false identification.

VANDALISM

Waldorf, April 6 to 7. Several vehicle windows were broken in the Lancaster and Hampshire neighborhoods.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Three Notch Rd., April 9. A man groped someone at a retail store. An investigation determined that he had assaulted two other people at the store. A man, 54, was charged with third- and fourth-degree sex offenses and second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

St. Mary's County Crime


SECTION: Southern Maryland Extra; T17


LENGTH: 351 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.  

VEHICLE THEFT

THREE NOTCH RD., 9:52 p.m. Nov. 2. A 1987 Plymouth Horizon was stolen from the Wal-Mart parking lot. It was found two days later behind ABC Liquors.

ASSAULT

ROUTES 5 AND 246, 9:02 p.m. Nov. 11. A man, 45, assaulted a woman, 37, stopped in her vehicle at a traffic light. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREENERY LANE, 3 p.m. Nov. 4 to 2 p.m. Nov. 7. A Grasshopper lawn mower was stolen from a shed at the Swing and Swat.

ASSAULT

NORRIS ST., 11:33 a.m. Nov. 6. A man, 30, and a woman, 29, assaulted each other. They were charged with second-degree assault.

LAWRENCE AVE., 7:30 p.m. Nov. 7. A man, 46, assaulted a woman, 31, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEX OFFENSE

JOE BAKER CT., 5:17 p.m. Nov. 10. A man, 53, sexually assaulted a woman, 50, at her residence. He was charged with third- and fourth-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 1 p.m. Nov. 6. A man, 23, had sexual relations with a female youth, 15. He was charged with third-degree sex offense.

ASSAULT

LIBERTY ST., 10 a.m. Nov. 6. A woman, 44, assaulted another woman, 24, and damaged property. She was charged with second-degree assault and malicious destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FDR BLVD., 12:30 p.m. Nov. 5. A man, 45, was driving a vehicle displaying a stolen registration sticker. He was charged with theft of less than $500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PIN CUSHION RD., Oct. 6 to 4:30 a.m. Nov. 5. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

ASSAULT

MECHANICSVILLE, 2:40 a.m. Nov. 1. A man, 23, assaulted a woman, 23, during an argument. He was charged with second-degree assault and possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

-- Bonnie Smith

SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ21


LENGTH: 3301 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received complete reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6700 block, 12:10 p.m. Nov. 3. A male in a black hooded sweatshirt grabbed a purse from a woman boarding a Metrobus and fled down the street with several accomplices.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7400 block, 12:14 p.m. Nov. 6. A group of five males demanded cash at gunpoint from a man entering a motel room. After the victim surrendered his wallet, he saw the assailants flee in a white Jeep Liberty with tinted windows.

TULIP AVE., 200 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 7. A gunman demanded cash from a pedestrian. When the victim said she had no money, he held the gun to her head and went through her pockets. When she screamed, the assailant fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ELM AVE., 300 block, 3:30 to 9:30 p.m. Nov. 3. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

LINCOLN AVE., 400 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 1 to 4:30 p.m. Nov. 5. Property was stolen from a 1995 Honda Civic entered by prying open a window.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6400 block, 2:33 p.m. Nov. 6. Property was stolen from a building entered by breaking glass in a side door.

POPLAR AVE., 6700 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 27 to 4:30 p.m. Nov. 4. Property was stolen from a detached shed entered by forcing the lock.

ROANOKE AVE., 8100 block, 5 to 7:30 a.m. Nov. 2. Property was stolen from a 1997 Ford Crown Victoria.

WESTMORELAND AVE., 6500 block, 2:30 to 8:45 p.m. Nov. 7. Property was stolen from a residence entered by pushing up a screen on a window that had been left unlocked.

WESTMORELAND AVE., 7000 block, 11:37 p.m. Nov. 4. A man was charged with vandalism and theft from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7300 block, 3 to 5:30 p.m. Nov. 2. A Jeep Liberty was stolen.

-- Compiled by LISA M. BOLTON

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 910 words


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report Among incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

MANASSAS AREA

WEAPONS

Hidden Creek Dr., 13600 block, 10:35 p.m. Dec. 2. Several gunshots were heard. 

ROBBERIES

Warm Springs Lane and Fincastle Dr., 1:13 a.m. Nov. 23. A male was driven to the listed area with several other people, where they assaulted and robbed him.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Andes Ct., 6400 block, Nov. 23 to Nov. 24. Items were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bradys Hill Rd., 4000 block, 9:30 a.m. Nov. 24 to 2:20 p.m. Dec. 1. Items were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Blackburn Rd., 9:29 a.m. Nov. 27. Two male juveniles sexually assaulted a girl. Two Woodbridge boys, 12 and 13, were arrested.

ASSAULTS

Bayside Ave., 1200 block, 12:46 p.m. Nov. 28. During an argument, a man threatened a female acquaintance with a knife. When the woman attempted to take the knife, she was cut on the arm. A 22-year-old Stafford County man was arrested.

Winslow Ct., 1900 block, 8:28 p.m. Dec. 2. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance on the head with a metal chair. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Cheshire Station Plaza, 4100 block, 7:53 p.m. Dec. 2. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

Minnieville Rd., 14400 block, 12:15 a.m. Nov. 28. Two gunmen robbed a convenience store of cash.

Winding Loop, 14700 block, 6:42 a.m. Dec. 4. A gunman robbed a woman of a wallet and car keys, then fled on foot.

Wyndale Ct., 3300 block, 5:50 p.m. Dec. 1. A male pushed a male juvenile to the ground and robbed him of cash. He fled with a male acquaintance of the juvenile's. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Canada Goose Loop, 15900 block, 7:52 a.m. Nov. 26. A man attempted to enter a residence by breaking a window. When a male resident confronted him, the intruder pulled out a handgun and demanded to be let inside. The resident retrieved a gun, fired it inside the residence and fled.

Castile Ct., 12600 block, 9:40 a.m. Dec. 2. Three men attempted to enter a residence through a rear door. A witness called police. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man and a 23-year-old Rockville man were arrested.

Falmouth Dr., 14400 block, 11:36 p.m. Nov. 28. Two gunmen forcibly entered a residence. When a male resident chased them from the residence, they fired several bullets.

Fox Lair Dr., 2900 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 30 to 5 a.m. Dec. 1. A computer tablet, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Kirkdale Dr., 4700 block, 5:45 a.m. to 12:50 p.m. Nov. 29. A laptop computer, two TVs, a video game system and an MP3 player were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a kitchen window.

Lakota Dr., 7000 block, 10 a.m. Nov. 28 to 7:35 a.m. Dec. 1. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Mayflower Dr., 2100 block, 10:30 a.m. Nov. 26 to 7 a.m. Nov. 27. Tools were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Torrence Pl., 4500 block, 11:20 p.m. Nov. 29. A watch was stolen from a residence entered through a third-story window. During an investigation, police found marijuana and prescription medicine in the residence. A 40-year-old Woodbridge male resident was arrested.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

WEAPONS

Braxted Lane, 2:40 a.m. Dec. 4. Someone fired a weapon, damaging a window of an unoccupied vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cleary St., 10200 block, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 25. Medicine, jewelry and clothes were stolen from a residence.

Liberia Ave., 8800 block, Nov. 30. A female employee and a man stole merchandise from a store. A man and a woman, both 21 and from Manassas, were arrested.

Milic St., 9100 block, 2 to 4 p.m. Nov. 26. A laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Seventh Regiment Dr., 10200 block, 12:50 p.m. Nov. 25. Electronics, jewelry and a red 1997 Dodge Caravan were stolen from a residence.

Town Lane, 9800 block, 3 to 3:35 p.m. Dec. 1. A white bird cage containing two parakeets was stolen from a back yard of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Taney Rd., 9200 block, 10:30 a.m. Dec. 2 to 4 p.m. Dec. 4. A beige 1987 Nissan Maxima was stolen.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., 1-100 block, 6:15 p.m. Nov. 29. A cellphone was stolen from a table at a recreation center.

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 3:30 p.m. Nov. 27. A man at a store returned a carton of cigarettes purchased with a gift card. When he received the cash refund, he took the cigarettes and fled in a vehicle.

Euclid Ave., 8400 block, Dec. 1. Three males stole cases of beer from a convenience store.

Euclid Ct., 6:44 p.m. Nov. 18. Two men stole electrical wire from a truck inside a locked, fenced yard of a business. Tools from a business were also recovered. Two Manassas men were arrested.

Manassas Dr., 3:15 a.m. Nov. 29. A cash register and a power cord were stolen from a home business entered through a window.

Mathis Ave., 4:49 p.m. Nov. 28 to 10 a.m. Nov. 29. Cash, a laptop computer and a computer tablet were stolen from two businesses entered by forcing rear doors.

Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREAROBBERIES 

Elmwood Dr. and Darbydale Ave., 11 p.m. May 3. Five or six men assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of cash. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

DUMFRIES AREAASSAULTS

Sharon Rd., 18300 block, 6:49 p.m. May 6. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and prevented her from leaving a bedroom. A 20-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 6:50 to 11:30 p.m. May 7. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Mine Rd., 17400 block, 8 p.m. May 6 to 5 p.m. May 7. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

MANASSAS AREASEXUAL ASSAULTS

King George Dr., 7:45 p.m. May 3. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance at a residence, then sexually assaulted her at knifepoint. He also threatened to blow up the residence. A 53-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Loudoun Ave., 2:48 p.m. May 8. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 30-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sierra Ct., 6200 block, 4 p.m. April 26 to 9 a.m. May 4. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

WOODBRIDGE AREASEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd., 4900 block, 2:58 p.m. May 6. A man at a school inappropriately touched a female juvenile. A 33-year-old Alexandria man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Bombay Way, 12700 block, 12:29 a.m. May 8. A man fired a weapon inside a residence. Bullet holes were found in a nearby residence. A 53-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Haversack Lane, 13500 block, 10:05 a.m. May 11. Two males with shotguns forcibly entered a residence and robbed two men of a firearm, cash, a wallet and a cellphone. The robbers fled in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cleeve Ct., 2800 block, 11:32 a.m. May 6. A man attempted to enter a residence, then fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

Eisenhower Cir., 1300 block, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. May 5. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a front door.

Eisenhower Cir., 1300 block, 6:20 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. May 5. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Dale Blvd., 2900 block, 8:31 p.m. May 9. A man in a parking lot asked a male motorist for money. When the motorist refused, the man pulled out a gun and robbed the motorist of the vehicle, which was later recovered.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Code Way, 2700 block, 12:30 p.m. June 14 to 1 p.m. June 20. Clothes were stolen from a business.

GAINESVILLE AREA

WEAPONS

Linton Hall Rd., 7600 block, 3:01 p.m. June 17. The driver of a red vehicle shouted racial slurs at a man, a woman and a girl in front of a store, and another occupant of the vehicle pointed a handgun at them.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dunwoody Ct., 14400 block, 5 p.m. June 12 to 5 p.m. June 15. Someone attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear screen door.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bakerwood Pl., 14300 block, 12:01 a.m. June 13 to 11:30 a.m. June 14. Cash, a wallet and baseball hats were stolen from an unlocked vehicle inside an open garage.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

King George Drive, June 17. A male juvenile sexually assaulted a female juvenile relative. A Manassas teenager was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 6:49 p.m. June 16. Three males surrounded a man and a male juvenile and demanded money. After a brief argument, the robbers walked away empty-handed. Three Manassas residents, ages 14, 17 and 31, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Davis Ford Rd., 6500 block, 2 p.m. June 12 to 10 a.m. June 14. A house key was stolen from a residence entered through a rear screen door.

Dumfries Rd., 13600 block, midnight to 4:55 a.m. June 18. Cash was stolen from a store entered by prying open a rear door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Stanton Cir., 7600 block, 8:32 a.m. June 14. A vehicle was stolen from a residence. The vehicle, equipped with an electronic vehicle-tracking device, was found in Fairfax County. Two Manassas males, 16 and 17, and another male, 16, were arrested. During an investigation, other stolen property was recovered, including a firearm. Two other Manassas males, 16 and 18, were also arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

WEAPONS

Fuller Road and Jefferson Davis Highway, 1:37 a.m. June 18. Several gunshots were heard.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

ASSAULTS

Gideon Boulevard and Smoketown Road, 12:32 p.m. June 16. After an argument, a woman shot a male acquaintance in the arm with a BB gun. A 23-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 10 p.m. June 18. A group of about five males assaulted two male pedestrians.

West Longview Dr., 2300 block, 12:21 a.m. June 15. During an argument, a man hit a female acquaintance several times. She was treated for injuries. A 30-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Colchester Rd., 14500 block, 2:51 a.m. June 18. Several gunshots were heard.

Jefferson Davis Highway and Fox Lair Drive, 4:49 p.m. June 17. During a traffic altercation, a male motorist allegedly pointed a handgun at a female motorist. No injuries were reported. A 41-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Oakwood Drive and Dulcinea Place, 5:10 p.m. June 18. Several gunshots were heard. A bullet hit an unoccupied vehicle.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 2800 block, 2:19 p.m. June 21. A man armed with a hammer robbed a bank of cash.

Gableridge Turn, 1800 block, 12:55 a.m. June 16. A man entered a residence through an unlocked window and was in the living room when a resident saw him. The man fled empty-handed.

Gordon Boulevard, 5 p.m. June 15 to 8:30 a.m. June 20. Tools were stolen from a storage space in a building.

Harborview Ct., 12700 block, 10:51 a.m. June 16. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement door.

Page St., 14100 block, 1:15 a.m. June 20. A man broke three school windows. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

January 26, 2003 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 698 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ROBBERIES

INDIAN HEAD HWY., 7100 block, 2 a.m. Jan. 19. A suspect entered the Texaco/Dash-In, implied he had a weapon and demanded cartons of cigarettes. The clerk complied, and the suspect fled.

VEHICLE THEFTS

MARSHALL HALL RD., 3100 block, 9:30 p.m. Jan. 18. A 1995 Ford Bronco was stolen from the Safeway parking lot.

ASSAULTS

CHARLOTTE HALL, Jan. 22. A man, 24, who was apprehended at the Forest Hills Apartments in Oxon Hill, was charged in Charles County with several counts of first-degree assault and one count of violation of probation.

VEHICLE THEFTS

OAKS RD., 15000 block, Jan. 14 to 16. A 2000 Yamaha Bear Track all-terrain vehicle was stolen from a garage.

ROBBERIES

PATUXENT CT., 400 block, 6:15 p.m. Jan. 21. Someone approached a pizza deliveryman, 55, grabbed a pizza and ran into the woods.

HOMICIDES

GILLESPIE CIR., 12200 block. A man, 63, died Jan. 16 after being shot during a Jan. 8 robbery.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

WALDORF, 1:10 p.m. Jan. 15. A man, 40, asked one male youth, 12, inappropriate sexual questions and sexually abused another male youth. He was charged with two counts of failure to register as a sexual offender, sexual child abuse and fourth-degree sex offenses.

ASSAULTS

ENTERPRISE PL., 2500 block, 9:34 a.m. Jan. 18. A man, 29, assaulted a woman and another man and smashed a door at a residence. He was charged with second-degree domestic assault, second-degree assault and third-degree burglary.

PLAZA WAY, 3200 block, 6:58 p.m. Jan. 15. Officers responded to a prescription forgery call from Giant Food. The male suspect, 21, got in his vehicle and drove away. Officers attempted to stop the vehicle in the Shoppers World parking lot. The suspect drove his vehicle toward a police officer who jumped out of the way, but the suspect still hit a police vehicle. A child and controlled dangerous substances were found in the suspect's car after he was arrested. He was charged with two counts of first-degree assault, prescription fraud, reckless endangerment, controlled dangerous substance violation, having an unattended child and several traffic offenses.

QUIETFIELDS ST., 11300 block, 11:30 a.m. Jan. 19. A man, 35, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

WINTERGREEN PL., 3900 block, 4:15 a.m. Jan. 11. A man, 25, assaulted a woman at a residence and stole property. He was charged with second-degree assault, theft, resisting arrest and failure to obey a lawful order.

ROBBERIES

MALL CIR., 11000 block, 6:10 p.m. Jan. 19. A suspect grabbed a woman, 26, by the collar, pushed her against her vehicle and demanded money. She complied and the suspect fled on foot.

MALL CIR., 11000 block, 6:40 p.m. Dec. 30. Three suspects approached a man, 19, took his watch and fled. The man followed the suspects to get his watch back. Two of the suspects then assaulted him and stole money before fleeing again.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

AMBERLEAF PL., 2000 block, 7 p.m. Jan. 21 to 4 p.m. Jan. 22. Money, CDs and Sony stereo equipment were stolen from a vehicle entered by shattering two windows.

ST. CHARLES PARKWAY, 3900 block, 6:55 p.m. Jan. 14. A man, 29, was driving in a vehicle with stolen license plates. He was charged with theft of less than $ 500.

VEHICLE THEFTS

BERRY RD., 11500 block, 9:30 p.m. Jan. 12. Two male youths, ages 15 and 17, stole a GMC Yukon. They were charged with theft of a motor vehicle and malicious destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 11:57 p.m. Jan. 15. Intruders stole merchandise from Audio Tech after entering by smashing the front window.

-- Bonnie Smith

The Washington Post


September 10, 1998, Thursday, Final Edition


CRIME REPORT: St. Mary's


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. M14


LENGTH: 461 words


 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

CHAPTICO AREA

VANDALISM

LONGWOOD LANE, 10:02 p.m. Sept. 1. A motorist backed a white 1995 Pontiac Grand Prix into a man's yard and accelerated, leaving 10-foot-long tire tracks on the lawn. 

LEONARDTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN AREA, 4 p.m. Aug. 25 to 5 p.m. Aug. 28. A purple bicycle was stolen from the basement storage area of an apartment building.

ROUTE 5, Aug. 28. An orange Stihl masonry saw with a diamond cutting wheel was stolen from the bed of a truck parked at a grocery store.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

L EXINGTON PARK AREA, Aug. 7. A man, 28, sexually assaulted a girl, 9. He was charged with child abuse, second-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

EXQUISITE CT., 3:35 p.m. Sept. 1. A woman, 34, cut a man, 35, on the arm during an argument. The man was treated at the scene by ambulance personnel. The woman was charged with second-degree assault.

MILLISON PLAZA, 1:06 p.m. Aug. 30. A person inside a discount store struck an acquaintance during an argument. A store employee ordered them to leave the store. Once outside, the person struck the acquaintance again. Another person who joined them also struck the victim. Two people were charged with assault. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK AREA, Aug. 29 to Aug. 31. Building materials were stolen from a house under construction.

LOVEVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

ROUTE 5, Feb. 14 to Feb. 16. A man, 24, caught a 9-year-old boy playing with matches and forced the child to hold lighted matches until they burned out on his fingertips. The child suffered second- and third-degree burns on all of his fingers. The man later struck the youth with a belt and burned him. On Sept. 2, the man was charged with three counts of second-degree assault.

PINEY POINT AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PINEY POINT AREA, a male youth, 17, a female youth, 16, and a man, 28, were charged with the recent looting of local crab pots after a Maryland Department of Natural Resources officer observed them with someone else's crab pots. The male youth was operating a boat and also was cited for not carrying a boating safety certificate, not properly displaying boating registration information and failing to carry a sufficient number of personal flotation devices. Citing Potomac River Fisheries Commission law, officials seized the boat.

VALLEY LEE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

USHER LANE, 11 p.m. Aug. 28 to 12:30 a.m. Aug. 29. A man punched and sexually assaulted a woman, 35,. He then fled into a wooded area.

March 31, 2011 Thursday

Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 739 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Infantry Lane, 10:53 a.m. March 18. A man entered a residence and sexually assaulted a woman. He fled in a white truck.

ASSAULTS

Devlins Grove Pl., 9300 block, 5:09 p.m. March 18. Eight people assaulted a man, who was treated for injuries. 

DALE CITY AREA

ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd., 2800 block, 9:40 p.m. March 17. A man entered an office in the rear of a store. When an employee confronted the man, he sprayed the employee with a substance. The man fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Belvedere Dr., 14400 block, 3 to 5:15 p.m. March 20. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a kitchen window.

Belvedere Dr., 14400 block, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 16. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Dumfries Rd. and Jefferson Davis Hwy., 3:34 a.m. March 19. A man stabbed another man, who had broken up a fight between an acquaintance and a third man. The injured man was treated at a hospital.

ROBBERIES

Wexford Loop, 17200 block, 6:10 p.m. March 17. Four men demanded money from a man, then assaulted him. When a neighbor shouted at the men, they fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dumfries Rd., 17000 block, 3:35 a.m. March 16. Cigarette cartons were stolen from a business entered by breaking a front glass door.

La Maurice Loop, 4200 block, 11:15 a.m. to 2 p.m. March 18. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

GAINESVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Crescent Park Dr., 7900 block, 6:32 p.m. March 19. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 25-year-old Gainesville man, a county police officer, was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8100 block, 3:41 p.m. March 22. A man implied he had a weapon and robbed a bank of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8300 block, 1 to 9 a.m. March 15. A restaurant was entered by prying open a rear door. An office was entered.

Shelly Lane, 7600 block, 8 a.m. March 14 to midnight March 15. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy. and Joplin Rd., March 20. During a scheduled protest, some participants refused to move from the roadway. Thirty-five people were arrested and charged with unlawful assembly and careless interference with traffic. One person was charged with assaulting a law enforcement officer.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Potomac Crest,Pier Trail and Oakham Mount drives, 7:25 a.m. March 20. A yellow 2000 Nissan Xterra was stolen. Items, including a handgun and an MP3 player, were stolen from 11 other vehicles.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 3:39 p.m. March 2o. A man inappropriately touched a female juvenile in a mall.

ASSAULTS

Tassleford Lane, 15700 block, 1:41 a.m. March 18. During an argument, a man pointed a handgun at a male acquaintance. The gunman got into a vehicle. When the acquaintance attempted to stop him from driving, the driver put the vehicle in reverse and dragged the acquaintance a short distance. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 2:11 a.m. March 17. Several gunshots were heard.

Prince William Pkwy. and Summerland Dr., 2:22 a.m. March 17. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alabama Ave., 15000 block, 6:30 to 10 a.m. March 18. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement door.

Indiana Ave., 1400 block, 6 to 11:10 a.m. March 18. A residence was entered by forcing open a basement door and ransacked.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Gableridge Turn, 1800 block, 12:37 to 1:47 a.m. March 18. A 2006 Ford tow truck was stolen.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for the Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Yost St., 100 block, 8 p.m. March 18 to 11 a.m. March 19. A driveway marker, a gatepost and a latch from a fence were stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 7 p.m. March 18 to 7:45 a.m. March 19. Someone fired BB's at a business, breaking a front glass door.

Forrest St., 100 block, 6 p.m. March 20 to 8:52 a.m. March 21. A motorist hit a parked vehicle, damaging it, then drove away.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristow Rd., 10700 block, 4 p.m. May 15 to 9 a.m. May 17. A business was entered by forcing a rear door.

DALE CITY AREA ASSAULTS

Darbydale Ave., 14800 block, 5:10 p.m. May 20. Four males attacked two male pedestrians.  

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Kilpatrick Pl., 2400 block, 5:19 p.m. May 19. Two males robbed a male pedestrian of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Royale Terr., 17500 block, 11:30 p.m. May 18 to 5:30 a.m. May 19. A residence was entered by breaking a basement window. An attempt was made to remove a TV from a wall.

Toms River Loop, 16900 block, 5:40 a.m. to 7 p.m. May 20. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

GAINESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Cellar Door Dr., 7800 block, 12:15 a.m. May 22. During a dispute, two men attacked a man. Two Chantilly men, ages 18 and 22, were arrested. The victim was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Equinox Landing Ct., 7500 block, 2 p.m. May 20 to 11:30 a.m. May 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence by removing a screen from a rear window.

Rail Line Ct., 7200 block, 7 a.m. May 11 to 12:33 p.m. May 18. Cash was stolen from a commercial trailer.

LAKE RIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Golf Side Cir., 3600 block, 8 a.m. May 12 to 7:45 a.m. May 17. DVDs were stolen from a residence.

Old Bridge Rd., 3000 block, 1:25 to 2:30 a.m. May 21. During a break-in at a school, fire extinguishers were set off, liquid was dumped on a floor and coins were glued to door locks.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Yorkshire area, 5:44 a.m. May 17. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance at a residence. A 34-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Lomond and Garner drives, 8:59 a.m. May 14. The driver of a dump truck involved in a collision aggressively approached an investigating officer, then drove the vehicle at the officer, who had to move aside to avoid being hit. A 56-year-0ld Woodbridge man was charged with attempted malicious wounding of a law enforcement officer and obstruction of justice.

Sudley Rd., 8000 block, May 4. Three men attacked a male teenager walking in the area. The victim was treated for a head injury.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Emerald Dr., 7400 block, 12:30 p.m. May 17 to 11:59 p.m. May 18. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Westchester Dr., 9000 block, 9:09 p.m. May 23. As many as five men forced their way into a residence and attacked an occupant, then robbed him of cash at gunpoint.

NOKESVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Nokesville Road and Route 646 area, 10:27 p.m. May 18. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile. A 44-year-old Nokesville man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kilmer Lane, 18200 block, 6 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. May 20. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Cheshire Station Plaza area, 8:46 p.m. May 21. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile acquaintance. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Gableridge Turn, 1800 block, 6:39 p.m. May 21. A handgun was discharged inside an apartment, with the bullet going through the floor and into the apartment below. No injuries were reported. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Marina Way, 13100 block, 2:20 a.m. May 22. During an argument, a man made threats with a shotgun. Two security guards detained the man until police arrived. A 22-year-old Newport News man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Constellation Pl. and Oriskany Way, 1:02 a.m. May 22. Three males robbed a male juvenile of cash, a cellphone and a watch.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Haverford Loop, 2700 block, 8 p.m. May 17. A man inside a residence exposed himself to a juvenile walking a dog. A 60-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

Worchester Dr., 4400 block, 12:01 a.m. May 20. A man looking through a window at a residence fled when confronted.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aldrin St., 13200 block, 4:34 p.m. May 17. Two TVs and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a side door. Two men were seen fleeing with the property.

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 1 a.m. May 18. Property was stolen from five vehicles. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man and a 20-year-old Springfield man were arrested. The property was recovered.

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. May 18. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through a second-floor window accessed with a ladder.

Holly View Ct., 11900 block, 4 to 9 a.m. May 21. A TV and a computer monitor were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Jennings St., 2100 block, midnight to 5 a.m. May 19. A global positioning system device was stolen from a residence entered through a garage accessed by using an electronic door opener in an unlocked vehicle.

Knightsbridge Dr., 12500 block, 1 a.m. May 17 to noon May 18. A credit card was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Naylor Ct., 5600 block, 8:45 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 21. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Shingle Oak Dr., 16700 block, 7:30 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. May 17. Electronics and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Baker Street Park area, May 23. A 26-year-old Manassas Park man was charged with carnal knowledge of a child and contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 735 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fettler Park Dr., Jan. 31. A man allegedly sexually assaulted a female patient in September 2012. A 44-year-old Purcellville man was arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Piedmont Vista Dr., 14600 block, 2:30 a.m. Feb. 2. Several golf carts at a golf club were damaged. 

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Launch Cir., Feb. 1. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 57-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 4:01 p.m. Feb. 4. A group of male juveniles assaulted a male juvenile, who was cut several times with pocketknives. Two Manassas males, 16 and 17, were arrested.

ROBBERIES

Miramar Dr., 7300 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 29. A group of male juveniles attempted to pull two male juvenile pedestrians behind a building. One of the pedestrians was able to flee. The group assaulted the other pedestrian and robbed him at knifepoint. Three Manassas males, 14, 15 and 16, were arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barnette Cir., 18900 block, Dec. 11, Jan. 27 and Feb. 2. A residence was entered on three occasions. Cash, a purse and jewelry were reported stolen.

Mockingbird Heights Rd., 19200 block, 5 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Feb. 3. Several handguns, ammunition and DVDs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Cordell Ave., 3800 block, 9:51 p.m. Feb. 2. A man entered an acquaintance's residence through a window and hid in a closet. When a female resident entered the room, he grabbed her by the neck and held a broken bottle to her face. When she yelled, the man fled empty-handed. A 31-year-old man was arrested.

Guilford Lane, 4100 block, 10:30 p.m. Jan. 30. During an argument, a woman retrieved a knife and cut a male acquaintance on the arm. A 53-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

Otto Rd. and Opal Lane, 3:02 a.m. Feb. 1. Gunshots were heard. No injuries were reported.

Quade Lane, 13000 block, 12:54 a.m. Feb. 1. Investigating a report of a stabbing, police officers went to a residence and heard a gunshot. They were unable to locate the source of the gunfire but found a man who had accidentally cut himself with a knife during an altercation with another person. No other injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Bayside Ave., 1400 block, 8:47 p.m. Jan. 29. Four males assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of cash and a backpack.

Oscar Ct., 6200 block, 11:07 p.m. Jan. 30. Three women in a vehicle picked up a male passenger near Dale Boulevard and Hoadly Road. The man told the driver to drive to Oscar Court, where he robbed them of a wallet at gunpoint. He fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Augustus Ct., 12900 block, 4:40 a.m. Feb. 2. A man tried to enter a residence through a front door. He fled when a resident shouted at him.

Bjork Lane, 12900 block, 3:30 p.m. Jan. 31 to 9:55 a.m. Feb. 2. A laptop computer, a computer tablet and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Evansport Pl., 12800 block, 4:33 a.m. Feb. 2. A man tried to enter a residence through a basement door. He fled when a resident saw him. A 21-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

G St., 1400 block, noon Jan. 29 to 8 p.m. Jan. 30. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 17000 block, 7 p.m. Jan. 28 to 8:30 a.m. Jan. 29. Electronic hair clippers were stolen from a business entered through a rear door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crozier Dr., 8400 block, 5:30 p.m. Feb. 2 to 7:25 a.m. Feb. 3. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

Euclid Ave., 9000 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 1 to noon Feb. 2. Two diagnostic machines were stolen from a business.

Liberia Ave., 9900 block, 6 to 7:45 p.m. Jan. 29. Purses were stolen from two vehicles entered by breaking windows.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Whispering Pine Ct., 9000 block, 3:22 to 3:42 a.m. Feb. 2. A white 1998 Toyota Camry was stolen.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holden Dr., 7 p.m. Feb. 2 to 2 p.m. Feb. 3. Cash, candy and cases of soft drinks were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Manassas Dr., 11:50 a.m. Jan. 26 to 9:47 a.m. Jan. 27. Someone threw eggs and wrote on a vehicle.

LENGTH: 752 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hazel Circle Dr., 7:33 p.m. May 31. A girl sexually assaulted another girl. A 16-year-old Bristow girl was arrested.

DALE CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Patamon Way, 13000 block, 3 a.m. June 5. Six men assaulted a man and robbed him of a cellphone. 

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Fortuna Center Plaza, 4400 block, 10:15 p.m. June 1. A gunman demanded money from two female employees in a drugstore, then told one of the women to tie the hands of the other. He ordered both women to go into a bathroom and fled with cash. A police investigation determined that one of the women had let the gunman into the store. A 23-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wharf Lane, 3600 block, 11:16 p.m. June 5. A man entered a residence, then fled empty-handed when a resident returned home.

VANDALISM

Dumfries Rd., 16200 block, May 27 through June 2. Windows of five vehicles were broken, and someone tampered with the ignitions. Nothing was reported stolen.

GAINESVILLE AREA

WEAPONS

Tall Timber Dr., 8200 block, noon May 31 to 9 a.m. June 1. Someone fired a weapon, breaking a windshield of a vehicle and a window of a residence. No injuries were reported injured.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ontario Rd., 7800 block, 11:30 p.m. June 3 to 5 a.m. June 4. A laptop was a stolen from a residence entered through a window.

LAKE RIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hampstead Lane, 4100 block, 10 p.m. June 3 to noon June 5. Jewelry and a cellphone were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Rixlew Lane, 8800 block, between April 11 and April 15. A man at a school sexually assaulted a girl who was an acquaintance. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Lomond Dr., 10500 block, 6:55 p.m. June 1. Four males assaulted a man and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brandon Way, 10000 block, 7:10 to 9 p.m. June 3. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Fincastle Dr., 5900 block, 2:54 a.m. June 7. A man used a garage door opener in an unlocked vehicle to enter a garage, which was ransacked. Nothing was reported stolen.

Gold Leaf Cir., 11300 block, 12:19 a.m. June 7. A man entered a residence through an unlocked door. He fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pier Trail Dr., 18800 block, 1:01 a.m. June 4. A man entered a garage of a residence using a garage door opener in an unlocked vehicle. When a resident saw him, he fled empty-handed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Neabsco Mills Rd. and Potomac Branch Dr., 2:40 a.m. June 4. A man fired a handgun, then left in a vehicle with a woman. Police were later called to Opitz Boulevard and Neabsco Mills Road. During an argument, a man had held a woman at gunpoint. A 35-year-old Fort Belvoir man was arrested.

Worchester Dr., 4400 block, 5:16 p.m. June 1. During an argument in a parking lot, a man assaulted and choked a female acquaintance. The man followed the woman to a residence, where another man tried to prevent him from entering. He assaulted the man, entered the residence and assaulted the woman again. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14300 block, 11:45 a.m. June 5. During a service at a church, a gunman entered a rear office and robbed four people of cash that they were counting from the church collection. The gunman fled in a vehicle and went to a residence. A 19-year-old Dumfries man and an 18-year-old Lorton man were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bath Ct., 3500 block, noon to 4 p.m. June 1. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Catawba Dr., 12600 block, 1 to 2:30 p.m. May 31. Two laptops were stolen from a residence.

Endsley Turn, 14600 block, 9:09 p.m. June 2. Two men forcibly entered a residence while a third man waited outside. The intruders forced at gunpoint a male resident and four children to go into a bedroom and searched for a man who reportedly did not live there. The three men fled with a cellphone. No injuries were reported.

Marina Way, 13100 block, 4 to 11 a.m. June 5. Cash was stolen from a business.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kent Dr., 100 block, May 27 to May 28. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 2493 words


Montgomery County crime report Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Somerville Dr., 15900 block, 6:02 p.m. Dec. 12. A man inappropriately touched someone near a Metro station.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Basildon Cir., Dec. 9 to 11. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.  

Beall Ave., Bickford Ave., Bradford Dr., Carr Ave., Forest Ave., Grason Ct., Great Falls Rd., Montgomery Ave. and Smallwood Rd., Dec. 16 to 17. Cash and coins were stolen from 11 vehicles. Most of them were entered by force.

Lewis Ave., 900 block, midnight Dec. 15. An attempt was made to enter a vehicle.

Randolph Rd., 5400 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 11 to 10:11 a.m. Dec. 12. Property was stolen from a beer-and-wine store entered by force.

Willow Tree Terr., 9900 block, 2 a.m. Dec. 13. A vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

University Blvd. W., 1800 block, Dec. 12 to 13. An attempt was made to enter a synagogue.

Weller Rd., 2700 block, 5 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. Dec. 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

DISTRICT 5GERMANTOWN STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-840-2650

The District 5 report was unavailable.

DISTRICT 6GAITHERSBURG STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-5700

ASSAULTS

Muddy Branch Rd., 800 block, 3:20 p.m. Dec. 15. An aggravated assault occurred at a grocery store.

Quince Orchard Rd., 400 block, 6:40 a.m. Dec. 12. An aggravated assault occurred at a motel. A 34-year-old Gaithersburg man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bralan Ct., 100 block, 4:13 p.m. Dec. 17. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Frederick Ave. N., 18700 block, 5:15 p.m. Dec. 12 to 6:55 a.m. Dec. 13. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

Ivoryton Pl., 19900 block, 2:43 p.m. Dec. 17. A break-in occurred at a residence. There was no sign of forced entry, and nothing was reported missing.

Lindstrom Ct., 17600 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Premiere Ct., 18000 block, Dec. 12. Tools were stolen from two work vehicles entered by force.

Russell Ave., 800 block, 5:43 a.m. Dec. 17. A break-in occurred at a beer-and-wine store.

Shady Spring Pl., Dec. 15. A pair of sunglasses was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Sugar Maple Ct., 7200 block, midnight Dec. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Trento Ct., unit block, 12:18 p.m. Dec. 12. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

Crawford Dr., 5700 block, 4:40 a.m. Dec. 21. A 47-year-old man was arrested for first-degree burglary, theft and malicious destruction of property.

Elmcroft Blvd., 600 block, 8:13 to 8:18 a.m. Dec. 18. A 29-year-old man and a 28-year-old woman were arrested and charged with second-degree assault.

Monroe St., 700 block, 3:25 to 3:28 p.m. Dec. 22. A 27-year-old man was arrested for second-degree assault and hindering and obstructing a police investigation.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Atlantic Ave., 12800 block, 12:30 p.m. Dec. 19 to 12:30 p.m. Dec. 20. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by force through a back window.

College Pkwy., 400 block, Dec. 15 to 22. A residence was entered through an unlocked sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 8 a.m. Dec. 16 to 10:20 a.m. Dec. 18. A delivery package containing a cellphone was stolen from an office.

Henslowe Dr., 2400 block, 7:54 to 9:20 p.m. Dec. 17. A 16-year-old male was arrested for fourth-degree burglary and theft.

Highland Ave.,200 block, 11:42 to 11:45 a.m. Dec. 16. A man entered a residence and fled with a handgun and two Disney day passes.

Maryland Ave., unit block, 9 p.m. Nov. 15 to 7 a.m. Dec. 16. Two cellphone chargers were stolen from a vehicle.

Maryland Ave., unit block, noon Dec. 24 to 6:45 a.m. Dec. 26. Eleven televisions were stolen from an unsecured building under construction entered by prying open a storage room door.

Regal Oak Dr., 100 block, 12:18 p.m. Dec. 20. A residence was entered by force through a rear door.

Rockville Pike, 700 block, 4:30 p.m. Dec. 25. A woman reported her purse had been stolen after she placed it on a counter so she could tie her child's shoe.

Rockville Pike, 800 block, 3:38 to 6:41 a.m. Dec. 25. Forty-four keys and a vehicle were stolen from a business entered by prying open the front door.

Rockville Pike, 1500 block, midnight to 7 a.m. Dec. 28. One hundred storage crates were stolen from a rear parking lot at a business.

Smallwood Rd., 600 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 16 to 6:25 a.m. Dec. 17. A purse was stolen from a locked vehicle.

OTHER ARRESTS

Atlantic Ave., 13200 block, 5:46 p.m. Dec. 28. A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly obstructing and hindering a police investigation, drinking in public and making false statements to a police officer. During the investigation, it was learned that he also had an outstanding Metro Transit Police warrant for drinking in public. The man was served the warrant during processing.

Church St., unit block, noon Dec. 18 to 2:28 p.m. Dec. 19. A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly attempting to issue false documents with intent to defraud, conspiracy to issue false documents with intent to defraud, attempting to obtain money or goods by fraud, conspiracy to obtain money or goods by fraud, theft scheme and conspiracy to commit theft.

Gibbs St., 100 block, 12:34 to 1 a.m. Dec. 28. A 21-year-old man was arrested for alleged disorderly conduct and reckless endangerment.

Veirs Mill Rd., 2000 block, 9:27 a.m. Dec. 26. A 29-year-old man was arrested for alleged trespassing. During the investigation, it was learned that he had an outstanding warrant with Rockville City Police for failing to appear on a previous trespassing charge. The man was served the warrant during processing.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents recently reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

Flower Ave., 8300 block, 12:19 a.m. Jan. 1. Two women entered the apartment of a male acquaintance. An argument turned into a physical altercation, and one of the women cut the man. The women fled in a taxi.

Lockney Ave., 8100 block, 12:21 a.m. Dec. 22. A 22-year-old man was arrested for assaulting a female during an altercation that turned physical.

ROBBERIES

Elm Ave., 100 block, 8:30 p.m. Dec. 30. Two males accosted a female standing next to her vehicle. One of the males pulled out a handgun and demanded her car keys. The woman complied, and the males left in her silver 2014 Subaru Forrester, which was later recovered.

New Hampshire Ave., 6400 block, 1:15 a.m. Dec. 26. A 30-year-old man was arrested in the assault and robbery of a male at knifepoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eastern Ave., 6500 block, 6:49 p.m. Dec. 26. A person broke a window to enter a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Ethan Allen Ave., 500 block, 11:18 a.m. Dec. 29. A 52-year-old woman was arrested for violation of a protective order.

Flower Ave., 8000 block, noon Dec. 31. A 25-year-old man was arrested on warrants for burglary, theft and destruction of property.

Holt Pl., unit block, 10 p.m. Dec. 24. An unlocked vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

Holton Lane, 1300 block, 9:06 p.m. Jan. 2. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Kingwood Dr., 1100 block, 6:55 a.m. Jan. 2. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Maple Ave., 7600 block, 1 a.m. Dec. 27. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a front door.

New Hampshire Ave., 7600 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 24. An attempt was made to enter a business by force through a front door.

New Hampshire Ave., 7600 block, noon Dec. 30. Two women, 39 and 51, were arrested in connection with a theft scheme and conspiracy to commit theft.

University Blvd., 1100 block, 3:44 p.m. Dec. 29. A purse was stolen after it was left unattended on a table.

University Blvd., 1300 block, 12:42 a.m. Dec. 29. A 37-year-old man was arrested in connection with shoplifting and failure to obey a lawful order.

Westmoreland Ave., 6500 block, 8 p.m. Dec. 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked side door.

Westmoreland Ave., 6800 block, 6:19 p.m. Dec. 22. A male attempted to enter a residence by kicking in a door.

OTHER ARRESTS

Takoma Ave., 7600 block, 12:17 a.m. Dec. 20. A 20-year-old man was arrested in connection with disturbing school operations.
