Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report 


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1706 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Green Holly Dr., 1200 block, Nov. 15. Credit cards were stolen from a vehicle at a high school. The cards were later used to make purchases at the Annapolis Mall.

DAVIDSONVILLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Blackberry Lane and Governor Bridge Rd., 6:19 p.m. Nov. 27. A male got out of a small white car that had stopped near a vehicle in which the driver was programming a Global Position System device. He robbed her of cash, then got back in the car, which was driven by a female. 

EDGEWATER AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Selby-on-the-Bay area, 1:15 p.m. Nov. 21. An Edgewater man, 62, was arrested in connection with reports of a man in a pickup truck approaching students. The incidents took place Nov. 17 and 18, near the intersection of May Lane and Monarch Drive and near Colony Crossing and Antiqua Place. A registered sex offender, the man was charged with violating conditions of parole.

GAMBRILLS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Annapolis Rd., 1000 block, Nov. 28. A male student sexually assaulted a female student in a school bathroom. An investigation was continuing.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

HOMICIDES

Ritchie Hwy., 7100 block, 10:34 p.m. Nov. 13. Andrew Michael Johnson, 25, of Glen Burnie, was found in the parking lot of a restaurant suffering from a gunshot wound. He was taken to a hospital, where he died from his injuries. A suspect, being held on an unrelated charge in the Baltimore County Detention Center, was charged with first-degree murder on Nov. 18.

ASSAULTS

Mary Lane and Oakwood Rd., 6:04 p.m. Nov. 29. During an argument, a man stabbed an acquaintance in the abdomen. An Owings Mill man, 38, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and other offenses. The victim was taken to a hospital, where he was treated for non-life threatening injuries.

ROBBERIES

Pamela Rd., 400 block, 7:20 p.m. Nov. 25. Two males wearing ski masks robbed a pedestrian behind an apartment building of cash at gunpoint. The victim sustained minor injuries but did not require medical attention.

Ritchie St., 5800 block, 8:49 p.m. Nov. 25. A woman was robbed by two men who implied they were armed. A Baltimore man, 34, and a Glen Burnie man, 34, were arrested.

HANOVER AREA

ROBBERIES

Arundel Mills Cir., 7000 block, 6:10 p.m. Nov. 26. A male tried to rob a man in a parking lot at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed when the victim resisted.

LINTHICUM AREA

ROBBERIES

School Lane and Orchard Rd., 8:27 p.m. Nov. 24. Two male teenagers robbed three people in a vehicle that had stopped at an intersection. The assailants fled on foot with cash.

PASADENA AREA

ROBBERIES

Mountain Rd., 4400 block, 8:58 a.m. Nov. 21. Two men robbed a restaurant of cash at knifepoint.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

ROBBERIES

Atwater Dr., 300 block, 6:15 p.m. Nov. 28. Ten male teenagers robbed a pedestrian of a cellphone and his wallet at gunpoint. A 14-year-old male was arrested that same day on charges of robbery, assault and reckless endangerment. A 16-year-old male was arrested Nov. 30.

Croll Dr., 200 block, 6:30 a.m. Nov. 13. A man robbed an acquaintance of her cellphone, then fled in her vehicle, which was recovered the same day. On Nov. 29, an Annapolis man, 21, was charged with robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Boucher Ave., 1000 block, Nov. 28. A man was found inside a vehicle he had broken into. An Annapolis man, 40, was charged with rogue and vagabond and in connection with a theft from a vehicle in the unit block of Munroe Court the night of Nov. 11.

Bunche St., unit block, 8 p.m. Nov. 29 to 11 a.m. Nov. 30. A vehicle was entered by breaking a window.

Clay St., 200 block, Nov. 27. A bicycle was stolen. It was recovered the same day. A juvenile was charged with theft.

Hicks Ave., 1-99 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 24 to 8 a.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a screen door.

Old Solomons Island Rd., 200 block, 3:15 p.m. Nov. 28. A woman took a purse from a shopping cart, then dropped it to the ground when the victim gave chase.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Quiet Waters Pl., 100 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 18 to 4 p.m. Nov. 27. A gray Yamaha Zuma motor scooter was stolen from a parking space.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ten Oaks Rd., 6300 block, 3:56 a.m. Dec. 1. A safe was among property stolen from a tanning salon.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Centre Park Dr., 8700 block, 12:53 a.m. Nov. 26. A man robbed a convenience store of cash and cigarettes at gunpoint.

Clarksville Pike, 10900 block, 2:15 p.m. Nov. 25. Two male teenagers threatened a male and fled with a tablet PC. A male, 17, was arrested.

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 10:08 a.m. Nov. 24. Three males robbed someone at a gas station of cash at gunpoint.

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 26. Two males threatened a pedestrian on a footpath, then fled with a wallet.

Hickory Ridge Rd. and Campus Dr., 8:20 p.m. Nov. 28. A male waved down a vehicle, then forced the occupants out at gunpoint and robbed one of a wallet and cellphone. He then drove away in the car with a female accomplice.

Majors Lane, 6000 block, 7:53 p.m. Nov. 23. A teenager asked an acquaintance to meet her in a parking lot, where he was threatened by four people who robbed him of a cellphone, shoes and other property, then fled in her vehicle. A female and a male, both 17, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berrypick Lane, 11000 block, 9:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Nov. 20. A video game console was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a front door. An acquaintance is suspected.

Camelback Lane, 6000 block, 11:30 p.m. Nov. 25 to 9 a.m. Nov. 26. Two laptops, cash and a wallet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Columbia Rd., 5600 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 23 to 7:45 p.m. Nov. 27. Two TVs and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Green Meadow Dr., 12200 block, 2:45 a.m. Nov. 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Green Meadow Dr., 12200 block, 9 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. Nov. 26. Tools, medication and a shotgun were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass near a door.

High Hay Dr., 11400 block, 11 a.m. to 11:15 p.m. Nov. 25. A residence was entered by breaking glass in a back door.

New Country Lane, 11800 block, 4:23 p.m. Nov. 28. A residence was entered by removing boards from the front entrance. Former occupants who had been evicted were seen leaving the premises.

Quarterstaff Rd., 10600 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 23 to 3:36 p.m. Nov. 26. A residence was entered by breaking glass next to the front door.

Standon Pl., 9500 block, 7:56 a.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a door. An intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Swansfield Rd., 10900 block, 12:15 to 10:20 p.m. Nov. 26. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Wesleigh Dr., 10100 block, 11:42 a.m. Nov. 29. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a door.

Winter Moss Ct., 5300 block,, 10:30 p.m. Nov. 27 to 7:30 a.m. Nov. 28. A purse, a video game system and a backpack were stolen from a residence entered by using a garage door opener that was in an unlocked vehicle in the driveway.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Hickory Ridge Rd., 10200 block, 4:07 a.m. Nov. 26. A vehicle that had been reported stolen from this location was recovered in Baltimore.

Minstrel Way, 7100 block, 9:33 a.m. Nov. 28. An attempt was made to steal a vehicle by damaging the ignition.

ELKRIDGE AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Marshalee Dr., 6000 block, 11:49 a.m. Nov. 24. A male was seen exposing himself.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Waterloo Rd., 6700 block, 9 a.m. to 1:52 p.m. Nov. 28. A camcorder and car keys were stolen from an apartment entered by prying open the front door.

Old Waterloo Rd., 6700 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1:52 p.m. Nov. 28. An apartment was entered by prying open the front door.

Susans Pass, 7100 block, 4:15 p.m. Nov. 25 to 3 p.m. Nov. 28. Cabinets and flat trim were stolen from an unlocked house under construction.

Washington Blvd., 7500 block, 11:18 p.m. Nov. 29. A business was entered by forcing the front door.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Baltimore National Pike, 9300 block, 3:12 a.m. Nov. 24. A male robbed a convenience store at gunpoint, then fled on foot.

Old Columbia Pike, 4100 block, 12:36 p.m. Nov. 23. A male implied that he had a weapon and demanded cash from gas station employees. When they refused, he fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore National Pike, 10000 block, 3:55 a.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a liquor store by tampering with a door.

Rogers Ave., 3000 block, 11:27 p.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to break into an apartment. A male was seen fleeing empty-handed.

FULTON AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maple Lawn Blvd., 7800 block, Nov. 14 to Nov. 28. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a side window.

JESSUP AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Savage-Guilford Rd., 8600 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 23. A vehicle was stolen.

LAUREL AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Hitching Post Lane, 9100 block, 4:54 p.m. Nov. 23. A boy exposed himself outside a residence window, then fled with a group of boys.

ROBBERIES

All Saints Rd., 9100 block, 9:01 a.m. Nov. 25. A man robbed a flower shop of cash at knifepoint.

WOODBINE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lisbon Center Dr., 700 block, 12:19 a.m. Nov. 30. A safe was stolen from a business entered by forcing a back door. The safe was recovered behind the building.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 905 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULTS

Forest Park Dr., 15700 block, 11:02 p.m. Sept. 5. A man shoved two students in a high school parking lot. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was charged with two counts of assault and battery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

London Pl., 15700 block, 8:30 a.m. to 8:15 p.m. Sept. 8. A residence was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

GAINESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Somerset Crossing Dr., 7600 block, 12:03 p.m. Sept. 11. A motorist who was about to drive away from a gas station attacked a man. A 19-year-old Gainesville man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA WEAPONS OFFENSES

Old Centreville Rd., 8200 block, 6:52 p.m. Sept. 8. During an argument with two men, a man fired a handgun, then fled with an accomplice. Two Manassas Park men, 19 and 29, were arrested.

Sudley Rd., 8000 block, 1:53 a.m. Sept. 8. A male motorist threatened a restaurant employee at a drive-through window at gunpoint.

ROBBERIES

Garner Dr., 7800 block, 1:35 a.m. Sept. 8. Two males robbed a juvenile pedestrian of a backpack at knifepoint.

Old Centreville Rd., 7300 block, 11:59 p.m. Sept. 6. Two males attacked a man with wooden sticks and robbed him of cash and a cellphone. Two Manassas men, 22 and 17, were arrested. The victim was treated for minor injuries.

Stream Walk Lane, 7700 block, 9:11 p.m. Sept. 6. Two men threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hiram Ct., 10000 block, 5:30 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. Sept. 5. Three TVs, a laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Hiram Ct., 11000 block, 6:15 a.m. to 4 p.m. Sept. 5. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

NOKESVILLE AREA WEAPONS OFFENSES

Hooe Rd., 12100 block, 11:30 p.m. Sept. 7. A woman threatened to set off a bomb at a school-bus facility. A 32-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA ROBBERIES

Lions Field Rd. and Thomasson Crossing Dr., 5:45 p.m. Sept. 7. Two men robbed a pedestrian of a cellphone and his shoes at gunpoint.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd. area west of I-95, Sept. 5. A 33-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested on charges that he had exposed himself to a juvenile acquaintance on several occasions.

Old Bridge Rd., 1400 block, 5:20 p.m. Aug. 31. A man at a business groped a juvenile who was applying for a job. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Del Mar Dr., 3700 block, 8:58 p.m. Sept. 11. Two men forced their way into a residence, then stabbed a male occupant with a knife and fled in the victim's vehicle.

Felmore Ct., 3600 block, 11:44 p.m. Sept. 8. During an argument, a man tried to force an acquaintance into his vehicle. When the woman resisted, he got into the vehicle and crashed it into her vehicle, then drove away.

Dale Blvd., 4300 block, 6:41 p.m. Sept. 7. A male in a vehicle threatened a juvenile using a bank ATM, then robbed him of cash and drove away.

Grist Mill Terr., 15200 block, 11:02 p.m. Sept. 9. During a prearranged meeting to sell a pair of shoes, two men threatened two men and fled with the property.

Longview Dr. E., 1300 block, 6 a.m. Sept. 10. A man demanded property from a pedestrian at gunpoint, then struck him with the weapon when he tried to flee. A 21-year-old District man was arrested. The victim was treated for minor injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bancroft Lane, 4100 block, 6 to 9:45 p .m. Sept. 6. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Hoffman Dr., 4100 block, 2:30 to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 6. Cash and electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Hyatt Pl., 14800 block, 2:45 to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 6. A TV and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Mattapony Dr., 13900 block, 8:45 a.m. to 1 p.m. Sept. 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by removing a window screen. Nothing was reported missing.

Stratford Dr., 14700 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 8 to 7 p.m. Sept. 10. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door to a garage.

Tide St., 13700 block, 8 a.m. Sept. 2 to 3 p.m. Sept. 9. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

VANDALISM

Fairfax St., 8500 block, 2 a.m. Sept. 7. Two males were seen pulling a street sign from the ground. The sign was recovered in a yard nearby.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 11:34 p.m. Sept. 3. A cellphone and keys were stolen from a bar at a restaurant. A 29-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

Kent Dr., 8 p.m. Sept. 1 to 8 a.m. Sept. 2. Coins and a cellphone charger were stolen from a vehicle.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. LZ30


LENGTH: 785 words


Loudoun County 

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

Aldie Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

EXPECTATION SQ., 41700 block, 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 29. Cash, jewelry, a laptop computer and a video game system were stolen from a residence.

JOHN S. MOSBY HWY., 41100 block 5:30 p.m. Oct. 31 to 9 a.m. Nov. 1. Cash was stolen from a business entered by damaging a door. 

Ashburn Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FERNCLIFF TERR., 44000 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 2 to 7 a.m. Nov. 3. Coins were stolen from a vehicle.

FERNCLIFF TERR., 44000 block, 12:01 to 6 a.m. Nov. 3. Coins were stolen from a vehicle.

FERNCLIFF TERR., 44000 block, 3 to 7 a.m. Nov. 3. CDs and coins were stolen from a vehicle.

FERNCLIFF TERR., 44000 block, 3 to 7 a.m. Nov. 3. A vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

HEATHERSTONE TERR., 43800 block, 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 29. An attempt was made to break into a residence.

MERRY OAK WAY, 43800 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 2 to 8:30 a.m. Nov. 3. Coins were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

SHADY WOOD TERR., 21300 block, 11 p.m. Oct. 28. A window at a residence was damaged by a rock.

Chantilly Area

THEFTS.BREAK-INS

COMMONS SQ., 25800 block, 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Oct. 29. Cash, jewelry and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence.

Hamilton Area

VANDALISM

COLONIAL HWY. W., 1 to 100 block, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 28 to 10 a.m. Oct. 29. A paintball was discharged at a vehicle.

Lansdowne Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHARTIER DR., 19100 block, 5:30 p.m. Oct. 26 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 27. An inflatable Halloween decoration was stolen from outside a residence.

Leesburg Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

PLAZA STREET PARK AREA, 10:58 a.m. Nov. 2. A sexual assault occurred.

PLAZA STREET PARK AREA, 11:26 a.m. Nov. 3. A sexual assault occurred.

ASSAULTS

FORT EVANS RD., 100 block, 4:08 p.m. Oct. 31. Threats were reported.

FORT EVANS RD., 200 block, 11:22 a.m. Nov. 2. An incident of stalking was reported.

FORT EVANS RD., 200 block, 10:13 a.m. Nov. 3. An assault occurred.

FORT EVANS RD., 500 block, 2:15 p.m. Nov. 2. A theft occurred.

EVANS RIDGE TERR., 400 block, 1:27 a.m. Nov. 3. An assault occurred. Police said it was a domestic incident.

EVERGREEN MILL RD., 400 block, 9:56 a.m. Oct. 30. An assault occurred.

MARKET ST. E., 500 block, 12:57 a.m. Nov. 3. An assault occurred. Police said it was a domestic incident.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. LZ13

Loudoun County 

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

January 9, 2014 Thursday 8:14 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 2681 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Somerville Dr., 15900 block, 6:02 p.m. Dec. 12. A man inappropriately touched someone near a Metro station. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Basildon Cir., Dec. 9 to 11. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Beall Ave., Bickford Ave., Bradford Dr., Carr Ave., Forest Ave., Grason Ct., Great Falls Rd., Montgomery Ave. and Smallwood Rd., Dec. 16 to 17. Cash and coins were stolen from 11 vehicles. Most of them were entered by force.

Lewis Ave., 900 block, midnight Dec. 15. An attempt was made to enter a vehicle.

Randolph Rd., 5400 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 11 to 10:11 a.m. Dec. 12. Property was stolen from a beer-and-wine store entered by force.

Willow Tree Terr., 9900 block, 2 a.m. Dec. 13. A vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-652-9200 ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

Rosemary Hills Dr., 1900 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 16. Two males forcefully took property from a pedestrian and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Avondale St., 4500 block, 9 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. Dec. 12. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

Rockville Pike, 700 block, 4:30 p.m. Dec. 25. A woman reported her purse had been stolen after she placed it on a counter so she could tie her child's shoe.

OTHER ARRESTS

Atlantic Ave., 13200 block, 5:46 p.m. Dec. 28. A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly obstructing and hindering a police investigation, drinking in public and making false statements to a police officer. During the investigation, it was learned that he also had an outstanding Metro Transit Police warrant for drinking in public. The man was served the warrant during processing.

Church St., unit block, noon Dec. 18 to 2:28 p.m. Dec. 19. A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly attempting to issue false documents with intent to defraud, conspiracy to issue false documents with intent to defraud, attempting to obtain money or goods by fraud, conspiracy to obtain money or goods by fraud, theft scheme and conspiracy to commit theft.

Gibbs St., 100 block, 12:34 to 1 a.m. Dec. 28. A 21-year-old man was arrested for alleged disorderly conduct and reckless endangerment.

Veirs Mill Rd., 2000 block, 9:27 a.m. Dec. 26. A 29-year-old man was arrested for alleged trespassing. During the investigation, it was learned that he had an outstanding warrant with Rockville City Police for failing to appear on a previous trespassing charge. The man was served the warrant during processing.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents recently reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

Flower Ave., 8300 block, 12:19 a.m. Jan. 1. Two women entered the apartment of a male acquaintance. An argument turned into a physical altercation, and one of the women cut the man. The women fled in a taxi.

Lockney Ave., 8100 block, 12:21 a.m. Dec. 22. A 22-year-old man was arrested for assaulting a female during an altercation that turned physical.

ROBBERIES

Elm Ave., 100 block, 8:30 p.m. Dec. 30. Two males accosted a female standing next to her vehicle. One of the males pulled out a handgun and demanded her car keys. The woman complied, and the males left in her silver 2014 Subaru Forrester, which was later recovered.

New Hampshire Ave., 6400 block, 1:15 a.m. Dec. 26. A 30-year-old man was arrested in the assault and robbery of a male at knifepoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eastern Ave., 6500 block, 6:49 p.m. Dec. 26. A person broke a window to enter a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Ethan Allen Ave., 500 block, 11:18 a.m. Dec. 29. A 52-year-old woman was arrested for violation of a protective order.

Flower Ave., 8000 block, noon Dec. 31. A 25-year-old man was arrested on warrants for burglary, theft and destruction of property.

Kingwood Dr., 1100 block, 6:55 a.m. Jan. 2. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Maple Ave., 7600 block, 1 a.m. Dec. 27. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a front door.

New Hampshire Ave., 7600 block, noon Dec. 30. Two women, 39 and 51, were arrested in connection with a theft scheme and conspiracy to commit theft.

University Blvd., 1100 block, 3:44 p.m. Dec. 29. A purse was stolen after it was left unattended on a table.

University Blvd., 1300 block, 12:42 a.m. Dec. 29. A 37-year-old man was arrested in connection with shoplifting and failure to obey a lawful order.

OTHER ARRESTS

Washingtonpost.com


April 3, 2014 Thursday 12:37 AM EST 


Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 665 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA ROBBERIES

Columbia Springs Way and Falling Water Dr., 3:55 p.m. March 22. A male entered a vehicle occupied by two men. One of the men assaulted the male and took cash from his pocket. The male exited the vehicle and the two men fled.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Old Stage Rd., 16900 block, March 26. A 33-year-old Falls Church man was arrested in connection with the rape of a female juvenile acquaintance.

ASSAULTS

Stewart Lane, 3600 block, 1:06 a.m. March 23. A group of men confronted a male juvenile at a residence. One of the men shot the juvenile in the leg. The juvenile was treated for injuries. An 18-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Edgewood Dr., 16500 block, 7:30 p.m. March 2 to 8:30 a.m. March 23. A shop was entered by forcing a front door and a vending machine was damaged. Nothing was reported missing.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lomond Dr., March 21. A man reportedly sexually assaulted two female juveniles during the past few years. A 40-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Edgepark Cir., 11000 block, 5:35 p.m. March 20. A man knocked on a front door of a residence, then assaulted a male acquaintance who answered the door. As the two continued to fight outside, a relative of the man entered the residence and took several pairs of tennis shoes. An 18-year-old Nokesville man was arrested.

New Market Ct., 7100 block, Feb. 26. A female director of a day-care facility allegedly assaulted two children. A 39-year-old Haymarket woman was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Ranger Loop, 1400 block, 8:40 a.m. March 26. A man in an apartment complex hallway exposed himself to a woman.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dumfries Rd., 10600 block, 12:30 p.m. March 22 to 6:50 a.m. March 24. Several state vehicle inspection stickers were stolen from a business entered by breaking a window of a rear door.

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 1:20 a.m. March 24. Costume jewelry was stolen from a business entered by breaking a glass door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Potomac Mills Cir. and Nazarene Way, 9:29 p.m. March 20. A man approached a woman standing next to her vehicle and asked for directions. He then grabbed the woman and began to choke her. They both fell and the two struggled. He demanded her car keys and after an unsuccessful attempt to force her into the back seat of the vehicle, he fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Photo Dr., 13500 block, 11:46 p.m. March 22. A man entered a residence through a front door. A male resident and an acquaintance confronted the man and detained him until police arrived. A 30-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Winona Way, 12000 block, 6 p.m. March 18 to 8:20 a.m. March 19. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a side door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Mathis Ave., 9000 block, 5:45 p.m. March 19. A man grabbed a female acquaintance's purse and ran into a residence through a back yard. When the woman shouted, he returned the purse to her. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holden Dr., 10 p.m. March 18 to 11:08 a.m. March 19. A hammer drill was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Corbett Cir., 5 to 9 p.m. March 21. Rocks were thrown at the front door of a residence and the glass was broken.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 490 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400. 

PRINCE FREDERICK

ASSAULTS

Prince Frederick, 6:33 a.m., April 8. A man made threats and damaged property at a convenience store. A Prince Frederick man, 52, was charged with disorderly conduct and destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Serenity Ct., 10:21 a.m., April 7. Cash was fraudulently removed from a man's bank account. The man's caretaker, a 57-year-old woman, was charged with theft and forgery.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

HUGHESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Quicktree Farm Ct., 7000 block, 10:15 a.m., April 10. Nearly two dozen metal drywall liners were stolen. A 55-year-old man and a 56-year-old woman, both of Aquasco, were charged with burglary and theft.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Indian Head Hwy., 4300 block, 12 to 11:30 a.m., April 9. Cash was stolen from a restaurant.

WALDORF AREA

ASSAULTS

Crain Hwy., 2100 block, 3:47 a.m., April 7. Two men attacked acquaintances in a motel room. Two Waldorf men, ages 26 and 31, were charged with assault and destruction of property. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 4300 block, April 5. Fraudulent orders were placed with a building-supplies company. A White Plains man, 40, was charged with two counts of theft, theft scheme, forgery and with providing false identification.

VANDALISM

Waldorf, April 6 to 7. Several vehicle windows were broken in the Lancaster and Hampshire neighborhoods.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Three Notch Rd., April 9. A man groped someone at a retail store. An investigation determined that he had assaulted two other people at the store. A man, 54, was charged with third- and fourth-degree sex offenses and second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1031 words


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

MANASSAS AREA WEAPONS  

Hidden Creek Dr., 13600 block, 10:35 p.m. Dec. 2. Several gunshots were heard.

ROBBERIES

Warm Springs Lane and Fincastle Dr., 1:13 a.m. Nov. 23. A male was driven to the listed area with several other people, where they assaulted and robbed him.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Andes Ct., 6400 block, Nov. 23 to Nov. 24. Items were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bradys Hill Rd., 4000 block, 9:30 a.m. Nov. 24 to 2:20 p.m. Dec. 1. Items were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Blackburn Rd., 9:29 a.m. Nov. 27. Two male juveniles sexually assaulted a girl. Two Woodbridge boys, 12 and 13, were arrested.

ASSAULTS

Bayside Ave., 1200 block, 12:46 p.m. Nov. 28. During an argument, a man threatened a female acquaintance with a knife. When the woman attempted to take the knife, she was cut on the arm. A 22-year-old Stafford County man was arrested.

Winslow Ct., 1900 block, 8:28 p.m. Dec. 2. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance on the head with a metal chair. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Cheshire Station Plaza, 4100 block, 7:53 p.m. Dec. 2. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

Minnieville Rd., 14400 block, 12:15 a.m. Nov. 28. Two gunmen robbed a convenience store of cash.

Winding Loop, 14700 block, 6:42 a.m. Dec. 4. A gunman robbed a woman of a wallet and car keys, then fled on foot.

Wyndale Ct., 3300 block, 5:50 p.m. Dec. 1. A male pushed a male juvenile to the ground and robbed him of cash. He fled with a male acquaintance of the juvenile's. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Canada Goose Loop, 15900 block, 7:52 a.m. Nov. 26. A man attempted to enter a residence by breaking a window. When a male resident confronted him, the intruder pulled out a handgun and demanded to be let inside. The resident retrieved a gun, fired it inside the residence and fled.

Castile Ct., 12600 block, 9:40 a.m. Dec. 2. Three men attempted to enter a residence through a rear door. A witness called police. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man and a 23-year-old Rockville man were arrested.

Falmouth Dr., 14400 block, 11:36 p.m. Nov. 28. Two gunmen forcibly entered a residence. When a male resident chased them from the residence, they fired several bullets.

Fox Lair Dr., 2900 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 30 to 5 a.m. Dec. 1. A computer tablet, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Kirkdale Dr., 4700 block, 5:45 a.m. to 12:50 p.m. Nov. 29. A laptop computer, two TVs, a video game system and an MP3 player were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a kitchen window.

Lakota Dr., 7000 block, 10 a.m. Nov. 28 to 7:35 a.m. Dec. 1. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Mayflower Dr., 2100 block, 10:30 a.m. Nov. 26 to 7 a.m. Nov. 27. Tools were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Torrence Pl., 4500 block, 11:20 p.m. Nov. 29. A watch was stolen from a residence entered through a third-story window. During an investigation, police found marijuana and prescription medicine in the residence. A 40-year-old Woodbridge male resident was arrested.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

WEAPONS

Braxted Lane, 2:40 a.m. Dec. 4. Someone fired a weapon, damaging a window of an unoccupied vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cleary St., 10200 block, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 25. Medicine, jewelry and clothes were stolen from a residence.

Liberia Ave., 8800 block, Nov. 30. A female employee and a man stole merchandise from a store. A man and a woman, both 21 and from Manassas, were arrested.

Milic St., 9100 block, 2 to 4 p.m. Nov. 26. A laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Seventh Regiment Dr., 10200 block, 12:50 p.m. Nov. 25. Electronics, jewelry and a red 1997 Dodge Caravan were stolen from a residence.

Town Lane, 9800 block, 3 to 3:35 p.m. Dec. 1. A white bird cage containing two parakeets was stolen from a back yard of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Taney Rd., 9200 block, 10:30 a.m. Dec. 2 to 4 p.m. Dec. 4. A beige 1987 Nissan Maxima was stolen.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., 1-100 block, 6:15 p.m. Nov. 29. A cellphone was stolen from a table at a recreation center.

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 3:30 p.m. Nov. 27. A man at a store returned a carton of cigarettes purchased with a gift card. When he received the cash refund, he took the cigarettes and fled in a vehicle.

Euclid Ave., 8400 block, Dec. 1. Three males stole cases of beer from a convenience store.

Euclid Ct., 6:44 p.m. Nov. 18. Two men stole electrical wire from a truck inside a locked, fenced yard of a business. Tools from a business were also recovered. Two Manassas men were arrested.

Manassas Dr., 3:15 a.m. Nov. 29. A cash register and a power cord were stolen from a home business entered through a window.

Mathis Ave., 4:49 p.m. Nov. 28 to 10 a.m. Nov. 29. Cash, a laptop computer and a computer tablet were stolen from two businesses entered by forcing rear doors.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 594 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.charlescountysheriffsoffice.org. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ASSAULTS

THOMPSON LANE, 2:22 a.m. Oct. 20. A man, 35, assaulted a woman, 33. He was charged with second-degree assault, possession with intent to distribute, possession of marijuana and possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RAYMOND AVE., 12:50 a.m. Oct. 26. A man, 20, tried to enter a church by force. He had a knife and a two-way radio. He was charged with second-degree burglary.

HOMICIDES

WALDORF, 5 p.m. Oct. 31. A Lusby man, 21, incarcerated at the Calvert County Detention Center in an unrelated matter, was charged with first-degree murder, armed robbery and carrying a weapon with intent to injure in connection with the death of a 44-year-old Waldorf man on July 4 in Charles County. 

ASSAULTS

GALLERY PLACE, 3000 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 24. A man, 21, assaulted a woman and locked her in a closet. He was charged with second-degree assault and false imprisonment.

WALDORF, 1 a.m. Oct. 27. Two men, ages 31 and 33, were charged with second-degree assault of three other men.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

SMALLWOOD AND ST. ANTHONY'S DRIVES, 7 a.m. Oct. 30. Two male youths forced a female youth, 16, into a wooded area and sexually assaulted her. The first suspect is described as 17 to 19 years old and 5 feet 7 inches tall with a slender build, wearing a gray hooded sweat shirt and dark blue jeans, and having a slim face, a dark complexion, a thin mustache and bushy eyebrows. The other suspect was described as 5 feet and 9 or 10 inches tall, with a light complexion and wearing a black hooded sweat shirt and black pants.

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 3200 block, 5:30 p.m. Oct. 28. A man implied he had a gun and robbed a restaurant. He ordered an employee to the ground, stole an undisclosed amount of money and fled. The suspect was described as in his late twenties or early thirties, 6 feet 2 inches tall, wearing a black coat with a white shirt and black baggy pants. He also had a mustache and a goatee.

ST. IGNATIUS DR., 1000 block, 2:09 p.m. Oct. 29. A man armed with a gun robbed a convenience store. He stole money and fled on foot. He was described as being in his middle to late 20s, 5 feet 9 inches tall, about 180 to 190 pounds, had black hair in dreadlocks, wore a dark green coat over a gray sweat shirt and dark baggy pants and carried a handgun.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WALDORF, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 24. A man, 30, and a woman, 23, used false identification to obtain credit and purchase merchandise. They are charged with theft of more than $ 500. The man was additionally charged with a theft scheme.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

BALFOUR CT., 2000 block, 10 to 10:30 p.m. Oct. 26. A vehicle's window was shattered and its paint was scratched.

STREAMVIEW DR., 2400 block, midnight to 3 a.m. Oct. 28. Tires on 25 vehicles were slashed.

TIMBERBROOK DR., 11500 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 28 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 29. Racial, religious and ethnic graffiti were spray-painted on a vehicle.

-- Bonnie Smith

LANGUAGE: ENGLISH

April 20, 2003 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 584 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

 Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

VERNON RD., 11700 block, 3:33 a.m. April 14. Police officers responded to an alarm at Gardiner Equipment and located several suspects attempting to steal a vehicle on the property. The suspects fled in a Jeep Cherokee and police pursued the vehicle until it stopped in the area of Ballard Lane in Clinton. Four suspects, ages 13 to 18, were charged with second-degree burglary, fourth-degree burglary, destruction of property and possession of a stolen vehicle.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BRYANS ROAD AND INDIAN HEAD HWY., 2:30 a.m. April 14. A female pedestrian, 39, reported to police that she was sexually assaulted after accepting a ride at Savannah Road in Washington from a man who drove her to Indian Head. After the assault, the man forced her out of the vehicle and fled the scene.

ARSON

RADIO STATION RD., 6000 block, 8:25 a.m. April 15. An interior of a locker was set on fire. A male student, 17, was charged with first-degree arson.

VEHICLE THEFTS

SYLVAN TURN, 9800 block, 12:25 p.m. April 8. A truck that had been reported stolen was recovered.

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 2200 block, 1:15 a.m. April 15. Two men entered a Taco Bell, brandished a gun and demanded money. A woman, 19, and a man, also 19, complied and were forced into a walk-in cooler. The men fled the scene.

CRAIN HWY., 2500 block, 9:30 a.m. March 20. A driver struck another vehicle that was leaving a bank. The drivers, both men, exited their vehicles and the first driver demanded money from the other. A brief struggle ensued and the robber implied he had a weapon. The victim fled to the bank and told the teller to call police while the robber entered the victim's vehicle, removed cash and fled in a third vehicle.

JEFFERSON FARM PL., 12000 block, 2:30 p.m. April 14. A man entered Home Depot and attempted to leave the store with merchandise without paying for it. A loss prevention officer stopped the man, who then brandished a knife and fled the scene. Shortly after, police officers apprehended the man, 43, and charged him with armed robbery, theft and assault.

LEONARDTOWN RD., April 15. A man, 24, was charged with armed robbery in connection with a March 17 incident in which he posed as a police officer and robbed the Pizza Hut in Waldorf of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HENRY FORD CIR., 1-100 block, 5 p.m. April 12 to 12:45 p.m. April 13. Engine parts were stolen from three vehicles parked at Tempest Racing. Windows were smashed on two vehicles and the convertible roof of another vehicle was cut.

JEFFERSON FARM PL., 1200 block, 1:45 p.m. April 12. A man, 41, was detained by a loss prevention officer at Home Depot for shoplifting plants. He was charged with theft under $ 500.

SHEFFIELD CIR., 4700 block, 6 p.m. April 8 to 6:30 a.m. April 9. A refrigerator was stolen from a house under construction. Another house in the same area was entered but nothing was reported stolen.

-- Ria Manglapus

LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 1970 words


Montgomery County crime report Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

Marseille Dr., 9200 block, noon March 22. Several people assaulted an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Halpine Rd. and Ardennes Ave., 4:30 p.m. March 23. Three males robbed a person of property. 

Vandegrift Ave. and Lemay Rd., 12:45 p.m. March 23. Three males with a weapon threatened and robbed a person.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Arundel Ave., 5800 block, 6:30 p.m. March 21 to 10:30 a.m. March 22. A theft occurred outside a business.

Crookston Lane, 2:25 a.m. March 24. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Glen Rd. S., 11200 block, 12:15 to 2:40 p.m. March 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Indian Hills Terr., 4:28 a.m. March 24. A generator was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Rockville Pike, 12100 block, March 21 to 24. A theft occurred outside a business.

Rockville Pike, 12200 block, March 21 to 22. A theft occurred at a business.

Shady Grove Rd., 16000 block, March 26. Property was stolen from a construction site.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

First St., midnight to 6:15 a.m. March 26. A vehicle was stolen.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Royal Bonnet Terr., 9400 block, 5 to 6:45 p.m. March 21. Property was stolen from an unlocked garage at a residence.

Streamside Dr., 18300 block, March 19 to 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Washingtonian Blvd., March 18 to 19. Property was stolen from two vehicles entered by force.

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

On March 19, a 19-year-old man was arrested and charged with first- and second-degree assault in connection with the incident. On March 25, a 24-year-old man was arrested in connection with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

A 24-year-old man was arrested in connection with robbery, conspiracy to commit robbery, theft and conspiracy to commit theft after an incident that occurred earlier the same day. On March 28, a 20-year-old man was arrested in connection with robbery, conspiracy to commit robbery, theft and conspiracy to commit theft in relation to the incident.

218 of 507 DOCUMENTS


The Washington Post


November 1, 1990, Thursday, Final Edition


Montgomery Crime Rise


BYLINE: From news services and staff reports


SECTION: METRO; PAGE B11; AROUND THE REGION


LENGTH: 158 words


Serious crime increased by 11.8 percent in Montgomery County during the three-month period from July through September, although the reported incidents of homicide, rape and robbery dropped from the same period one year ago, county police announced yesterday.

Police Chief Donald E. Brooks said the department had no explanation for the double-digit increase occasioned by greater numbers of aggravated assaults, car thefts, burglaries and larcenies, which are also included in the serious crime category. 

For the nine-month period from January through September, serious crime rose 7.9 percent in the county, police reported.

Through September, 14 homicides had been reported in Montgomery, compared with 18 for the first nine months of 1989, police said.

From July through September, there were three homicides, the same as for the period a year ago; the number of rapes fell from 64 to 61; and robberies decreased from 218 to 194.


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


SERIES: Occasional


TYPE: MARYLAND NEWS


Copyright 1990 The Washington Post


219 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


September 6, 2001 Thursday  
Final Edition


MONTGOMERY IN BRIEF


SECTION: MONTGOMERY EXTRA; Pg. T02


LENGTH: 483 words


The Montgomery County Council wants residents to weigh in on the county's budget priorities as part of an extensive review of spending.

The council will hold a hearing from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sept. 26 on the seventh floor of the council office building, 100 Maryland Ave., Rockville. Residents who wish to speak should call 240-777-7931.  

"We want to hear what people think should be in the budget, as well as what we should take out," said council spokeswoman Jean Arthur.

The council usually does not begin budget deliberations until February. But bracing for tougher economic times ahead, the council is starting its review early. The council aims to review long-standing programs, rather than focusing primarily on new spending.

William L. Smith has been named the new warden of the Montgomery County Detention Center in Rockville, beginning Oct. 1. The jail's current warden, Robert F. Green, will become the head of the new Montgomery County Correctional Facility that is under construction in Clarksburg.

The $ 84.7 million Clarksburg facility, with 900 beds, is scheduled to open in February. During the next 18 months, Smith will manage the changeover of the Rockville jail into a central booking and intake center, where inmates will stay 72 hours or less before being released by the court or transferred to Clarksburg. Smith is a former acting warden of the center.

Two men robbed a Gaithersburg Subway shop and continually threatened to shoot the employees with their handguns, Montgomery County police said.

 Crime Solvers is offering a $ 1,000 reward for tips leading to the arrest and indictment of the suspects in the July 22 robbery of the Subway at 510 N. Frederick Ave. Police ask anyone with information to call 800-673-2777.

Montgomery County police would like to talk again to the anonymous caller who provided investigators information that led to the arrest of a man in connection with a sexual assault on a 13-year-old girl.

Based in part on the tip, John Kevin Hickman, 24, of Boyds, was charged in the July 9 sexual assault of the girl in her apartment, police said. Later, he was charged in incidents on March 24 and May 12 involving sexual attacks on teenage girls. Police said they want to talk to the caller about the information provided.

Police ask that the caller contact them at 240-773-5416.

Montgomery County's seventh annual Diversity Day Observance will be Oct. 18 in the Executive Office Building, 101 Monroe St., Rockville.

Paul M. Igasaki, vice chairman of the U.S. Equal Opportunity Commission, will give the keynote speech on diversity issues in the workplace. In addition, there will be entertainment and ethnic foods.

The program will be from 9:30 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. The registration deadline is tomorrow. Call the Diversity Day Info Line at 240-777-2705 for more information.

Staff writers Jo Becker and Phuong Ly contributed to this report. 


LOAD-DATE: September 6, 2001


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

Anne Arundel and Howard crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1779 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with these and other felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

POLICE IMPERSONATION

Forest Dr., 2300 block, 10:51 p.m. May 22. A male got out of a vehicle and displayed a badge to two people in a parking lot. Identifying himself as a detective, he asked for identification and directed one person to perform field sobriety tests. He then approached two men in the lot. They left in a vehicle and contacted police. An Odenton man, 31, was charged with impersonating a police officer and with disorderly conduct.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ROBBERIES

Tall Pines Ct., 7800 block, 11:19 p.m. May 20. A male grabbed a pedestrian by the pants and tried to take his wallet. After a brief struggle, the assailant fled empty-handed. 

MILLERSVILLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Waterwheel Ct., 600 block, 10:55 a.m. May 19. Three teenagers grabbed a woman getting into a vehicle and tried to pull her away from it. After a struggle, the assailants fled toward Patriot Lane. A short time later, a Brooklyn Park male, 15, and two Glen Burnie males, both 14, were arrested.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or other suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Duke of Gloucester St., 100 block, 1:30 a.m. May 19. A male pulled a pedestrian into an alley and sexually assaulted her. The victim resisted, and the assailant fled on foot.

ASSAULTS

Bens Dr. and Bay Ridge Ave., 2:30 a.m. May 24. A group of six women attacked a female pedestrian. She sustained abrasions and a cut that she said was inflicted by a weapon.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bethany Ct., 900 block, 5 p.m. May 21 to 8 a.m. May 22. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

East St., unit block, 6:30 p.m. May 19 to 1:30 p.m. May 20. A vehicle was entered by cutting through the convertible soft-top. Nothing was reported missing.

Ford Cir., unit block, 6 p.m. May 19 to 10:30 a.m. May 20. A digital media player, a GPS device and cash were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Market St., 100 block, 12:45 to 10:30 a.m. May 13. A clutch purse was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked ground-floor window.

Nimitz Dr., 1700 block, 9 p.m. May 22 to 9:30 a.m. May 23. A purse, keys, cash, a cellphone battery charger, two BB guns and a garment bag were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle. The property was recovered May 23 inside a vehicle that had been reported stolen from the unit block of Randys Lane.

Old Solomons Island Rd., 100 block, 6 p.m. May 18 to 9 a.m. May 21. Five aluminum downspouts were removed from a building.

Peters Way, unit block, 10 p.m. May 21 to 8 a.m. May 22. An orange Electra Townie bike was stolen from a porch at a residence. Police recovered the bicycle May 22 near Newtowne Drive and Juliana Circle. A juvenile riding the bike was charged with theft.

President St., 500 block, 5:50 a.m. May 22. A man entered an occupied residence through an unlocked window. An Annapolis man, 23, was charged with first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary and possession of burglary tools.

Skippers Ct., unit block, noon May 16 to 9 a.m. May 19. Prescription drugs, gas cards and cash were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Virginia Ave., 1600 block, 10 p.m. May 20. A man tried to break into a residence through a back door. His pants were down, and during his arrest he said that he had intended to sexually assault an occupant. An Annapolis man, 40, was charged with first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary and disorderly conduct.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Randys Lane, unit block, 12:01 to 3 a.m. May 23. A 2009 Honda CR-V was stolen from a driveway using a key that had been left in the ignition. It was recovered at 2:30 p.m. in the 1900 block of Moreland Parkway. Property reported stolen from a residence in the 1700 block of Nimitz Drive was found inside the vehicle.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other crimes, call the Stop Crime tip line, 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Dobbin Rd., 6300 block, 9:50 a.m. May 16. A gunman jumped into a truck, then fled empty-handed when the motorist yelled.

Foreland Garth, 6000 block, 3:30 a.m. May 19. Three males robbed a male in a parking lot of cash at gunpoint. The victim said one of the assailants displayed a knife.

Talisman Lane, 7200 block, 4:30 p.m. May 22. A male who had asked an acquaintance for a ride to a shopping center was instead taken to a residence, where a man struck him with a gun. He was then robbed of cash and a cellphone. An Elkridge man, 22, and a Columbia man, 23, were charged with robbery. No serious injuries were reported.

The Washington Post


June 2, 2002 Sunday  
Final Edition


Calvert County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T10


LENGTH: 238 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Calvert County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigations Section, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solver's Line, 410-535-2880.  

You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the State Police at 410-535-1400.

ASSAULTS

27TH ST., 10:59 p.m. May 22. A man, 31, stabbed another man, 30, in the chest, neck and face. He was taken to Prince George's Hospital Center for treatment. His attacker was charged with first- and second-degree assault and malicious destruction of property.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

PORT REPUBLIC, May 28. A man, 50, inappropriately touched a 4-year-old girl. He was charged with two counts of child abuse and third-degree sex offense.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DARES BEACH RD., 9:15 p.m. May 23 to 8:30 a.m. May 25. A trailer used as a concession stand at Mount Olive United Methodist Church was damaged.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

PRINCE FREDERICK, May 21 to May 22. The night deposit box at Calvert Bank was damaged.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

SOLOMONS ISLAND RD., 11:34 p.m. May 25. Two men, both 21, were asked to leave an establishment after an altercation. They refused to leave and were arrested. One of the men kicked and damaged the interior of a patrol car. They were charged with disorderly conduct, resisting arrest and destruction of property.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1027 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hope Rd., 12:12 p.m. Nov. 10. A man raped a female acquaintance. A 46-year-old Fairfax man was arrested.

DALE CITY AREA

ASSAULTS

Kingsman Rd., 13600 block, 3:11 a.m. Nov. 12. During an argument, a woman threw a vase, which struck a female acquaintance in the face. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 41-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

Eames Lane, 4400 block, 8:46 p.m. Nov. 9. A male at a residence pointed a handgun at a female juvenile, who had arrived at the residence to retrieve money owed to her. The juvenile struck the male and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Colverdale Rd., 15100 block, 10 a.m. Nov. 8 to 3:50 p.m. Nov. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by breaking a side window. 

Colder Lane, 15100 block, 5:37 p.m. Nov. 12. Someone entered a vacant residence by forcing open a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Panther Pride Dr. and Jefferson Davis Hwy., 6:43 p.m. Nov. 14. Four male juveniles assaulted a male juvenile pedestrian and robbed him of a hat.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antrim Cir., 3100 block, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Nov. 14. Cash, electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

Briarwood Dr., 3500 block, 9:16 a.m. Nov. 13. Electronics were stolen from five unlocked vehicles.

Old Stage Rd., 17400 block, 12:29 a.m. Nov. 14. Two men entered a business by cutting a fence and attempted to steal catalytic converters. A 29-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA

WEAPONS

Mill Creek Rd., 3700 block, 8:45 p.m. Nov. 9. During an argument between two men, one fired a rifle at a ceiling. No injuries were reported. A 33-year-old Haymarket man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Evans Ford Rd., 9600 block, 3:07 p.m. Nov. 13. During an argument, a male hit a female relative several times in the face with a phone. The woman was treated for injuries. A 16-year-old Manassas male was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crestwood and Elsinore drives, 3:22 a.m. Nov. 13. Two males were seen looking into parked vehicles.

Trundle Pl., 10300 block, 7:07 p.m. Nov. 13. Someone entered a residence through a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

TRIANGLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Warf and Olde Port lanes, 2:32 p.m. Nov. 10. A gunman robbed a man of a backpack containing cash and a cellphone.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Annapolis Way, 900 block, 2:19 a.m. Nov. 12. A man in a hotel parking lot fired a gun at a man sitting in a vehicle with a door open. The injured man was taken to a hospital.

Occoquan Rd., 13200 block, 6:12 p.m. Nov. 9. A male juvenile attempted to take property from a store. A male employee stopped the juvenile and told him leave. The juvenile left, then returned and cut the employee's abdomen with a broken bottle.

WEAPONS

Hunterbrook Dr., 12700 block, 8:07 p.m. Nov. 12. A man used a BB gun to threaten two women who had gone to a residence to talk to a relative. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Darbydale Ave., 14700 block, 3:43 a.m. Nov. 12. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 4:04 p.m. Nov. 12. A male juvenile grabbed a cellphone from a woman's hand and fled.

Minnieville Rd., 14400 block, 6:13 p.m. Nov. 14. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

Occoquan Rd., 13200 block, 5:50 p.m. Nov. 12. A man robbed a woman of cash at knifepoint.

Old Bridge and Tanyard Hill roads, 6:43 a.m. Nov. 14. A male driver of a vehicle struck a vehicle in front of him. When the two drivers stopped, the first driver robbed the other driver of cash at gunpoint.

Tobacco Way and Estate Dr., 1:56 p.m. Nov. 8. After an altercation, two male juveniles robbed another male juvenile of cash at knifepoint. Two males, 16 and 17, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bedford Cove Lane, 4400 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 9 to 8 a.m. Nov. 10. Appliances were stolen from a residence under construction. The residence was entered through an unlocked door.

Boatswain Cir., 16300 block, 11 a.m. Nov. 2 to 8 a.m. Nov. 3. Appliances were stolen from a residence under construction.

Carlsbad Rd., 15000 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 8 to 3 p.m. Nov. 9. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Georgetown Rd., 16600 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 10 to 8 p.m. Nov. 11. A jacket and a pair of shoes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Hendricks Dr., 4500 block, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 8. Cash, a TV and a laptop were stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 5:30 a.m. Nov. 11. Two men stole tools and equipment from a business. They fled when employees saw them.

Samantha Ct., 14200 block, 6 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. Nov. 14. A TV, a laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a basement pet door.

Sunny Ridge Ct., 15000 block, 3:45 p.m. Nov. 12. Someone entered a residence through a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cannon Ridge Dr., 8900 block, 8 p.m. Nov. 12 to 8 a.m. Nov. 13. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Diane Ct., 8600 block, 11:10 p.m. Nov. 13. Property was stolen from a vehicle. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Coriander Cir., 9000 block, 11:20 p.m. Nov. 13. A man drove away in an acquaintance's vehicle. He returned the vehicle the next day. A 50-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Manassas Park

The following incident was reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Inyo Pl., 8000 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 5. Four or five males took a cellphone and other property from a vehicle.

Calvert County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T17


LENGTH: 222 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Calvert County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigations Section, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solver's Line, 410-535-2880.  

You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the State Police at 410-535-1400.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

BAYSIDE RD., 1 to 3 a.m. Oct. 13. A man beat, sexually assaulted and held a woman, 18, against her will. He was charged with second-degree rape, false imprisonment and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOLOMONS ISLAND RD., 6:30 p.m. Oct. 13 to 9 a.m. Oct. 14. A cash register containing a small amount of cash was stolen from Bears by the Bay.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COVENANT CT., 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 10. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

ROBBERIES

PRINCE FREDERICK, 2:40 a.m. Oct. 13. The Super 8 Motel was robbed at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PRINCE FREDERICK, Oct. 15. A small amount of cash was stolen from a soda machine at Wentworth Nursery.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HALLOWING POINT RD. AND THUNDER HILL DR., Oct. 1. A real estate sign was vandalized three times in the past month.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOLOMONS, Oct. 7. A propeller, a small refrigerator and a compass were stolen from a boat docked at Calvert Marina.

-- Bonnie Smith

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 2130 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 ASSAULTS

Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 990 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Frisco Ct., 14600 block, May 12. A man sexually assaulted a female relative. A 20-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULTS  

Toms River Loop, 16800 block, 4:30 a.m. May 14. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and held her in a basement. A 32-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Buell Ct., 2900 block, 12:43 a.m. May 17. Someone fired a BB gun at a residence.

Spriggs Rd. and Ewells Mill Way, 3500 block, 12:08 a.m. May 17. A rear passenger in a vehicle pointed a gun at a motorist, then fired the weapon, striking the side of the motorist's vehicle. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antrim Cir., 3000 block, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. May 12. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an open window.

Camelia Lane, 15000 block, noon May 8 to 10 a.m. May 10. Two handgun magazine clips were stolen from a police vehicle.

Winding Creek Dr., 15600 block, 10:45 a.m. to 1 p.m. May 12. A shotgun, a laptop computer, jewelry and other items were stolen from a residence.

Yost Lane, 3300 block, 4 to 7:45 a.m. May 9. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a door.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sheringham Way, 16000 block, noon April 23 to 5 p.m. May 11. Equipment was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage door.

Antietam and Woodfern roads, 3:51 p.m. May 11. A man knocked a male pedestrian to the ground and robbed him of a wallet.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Butterfield St., 4:54 a.m. May 14. During an argument, a man choked and raped a female acquaintance. A 38-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Joplin Rd., 14800 block, 12:06 p.m. May 13. A female school bus driver assaulted two male students. A 49-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Coverstone Dr., 10700 block, 3:13 a.m. May 13. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash. A 26-year-old man was arrested.

Festival Lane, 10300 block, 5:39 p.m. May 10. Three males surrounded a male pedestrian and demanded money at gunpoint. A passerby called police, and the three fled.

Sudley Rd., 7800 block, 11:51 p.m. May 12. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash. A 26-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Notes Dr., 7900 block, 11:13 p.m. May 9. A man forcibly entered an office at a business.

Portsmouth Rd., 10000 block, 5 a.m. to 4:15 p.m. May 16. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Jergensen Pl., 3600 block, 4 to 11 p.m. May 10. Electronics and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd., 4200 block, 6:04 a.m. May 14. During a fight, a man was stabbed. He was treated for injuries.

Foothill St., 3200 block, 4:27 p.m. May 16. During an argument, a male motorist refused to let a female acquaintance out of a vehicle. When she attempted to call police, the man threw her cellphone out the vehicle. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Neabsco Mills Rd., 15200 block, 12:06 p.m. May 13. A female juvenile threatened to blow up a school. A 17-year-old female was arrested.

WEAPONS

Newbold Ct., 4200 block, 8 a.m. May 1 to 5:32 p.m. May 13. Someone fired a BB gun at a residence, damaging a window.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 4300 block, 11:54 a.m. May 14. A man pushed a male juvenile against a wall and took a pair of shoes the juvenile had just bought.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cloverdale Rd., 14600 block, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. May 12. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear basement door.

Georgia Rd., 15100 block, 12:25 p.m. May 12. A man attempted to enter a residence through a front door. When a resident approached, the man fled.

Russell Rd., Beaver Ford Rd. and Eskew Ct.,5 p.m. May 10 to 9 a.m. May 11. A handgun, two police vests, a police radio and other items were stolen from several vehicles, including law enforcement vehicles.

Manassas

No report was received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

ASSAULTS

Centreville Rd., 8300 block, 4:38 p.m. May 5. A male assaulted a woman who was in the back seat of a vehicle tending to her children, then fled.

Meeker Ct., unit block, 1 a.m. May 6. A woman pushed, hit and pulled the hair of a female acquaintance. A 29-year-old Manassas Park woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 2:40 p.m. May 6. A man stole beer from a convenience store. A 22-year-old man was arrested.

Denver Dr., 100 block, noon May 6 to 8 p.m. May 8. Someone stole gas from a vehicle.

Rosebud Ct., 9400 block, May 4 to May 6. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Colfax Dr., 100 block, 10:16 a.m. May 10. Someone sprayed gang-related graffiti on a vacant residence.

Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visitwww.alexandriava.gov/police.

ASSAULTS

Park Center Dr., 2800 block, 5:07 p.m. May 5. A moped was stolen.

Van Dorn St. S., 400 block, 10:49 a.m. May 5. A 1999 Ford was stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visitwww.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

Highland St. N., 1100 block, 2:30 a.m. May 8. A man walked toward a female pedestrian and touched her inappropriately.

ASSAULTS

Wilson Blvd., 3100 block, 1 a.m. May 7. A man assaulted a male in a bar. A Westminster man, 27, was charged with assault.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Seventh Rd. S., 5200 block, 8 p.m. May 10. A man was seen exposing himself in view of children. An Arlington man, 63, was charged with taking indecent liberties.

ROBBERIES

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St. N., 2000 block, 2:40 a.m. May 9. A woman awoke and saw a female standing in her bedroom. The intruder fled when she was confronted.

Adams St. S., 2700 block, 4:30 to 11:30 a.m. May 7. Electronics were stolen from an apartment.

Jackson St. N., 600 block, 2:44 p.m. May 7. An off-duty officer allegedly saw a man steal a bicycle from a house. The man fled when he was confronted. An Arlington man, 48, was located and charged with grand larceny.

Joyce St. S., 1100 block, noon May 2 to noon May 7. Property was stolen from an apartment.

Richmond St. N., 2300 block, 4 p.m. May 6 to 7:30 a.m. May 7. Tools were stolen from a residence under construction. The residence was entered by force.

24th St. N., 3800 block, 9 p.m. May 5 to 7:30 a.m. May 6. Tools were stolen from a residence under construction. The residence was entered by force.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Columbia Pike, 2200 block, May 8. A maroon Dodge Caravan was stolen.

Columbia Pike, 4900 block, May 5. A black 2008 Honda motorcycle, was stolen.

Meade St. S., 2800 block, May 8. A black Ford Crown Victoria was stolen.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. 11


LENGTH: 587 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or Crime Solvers, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Chesapeake Beach Area

ASSAULTS

GORDON STINNETT AVE., 1:34 a.m. Jan. 17. A woman was struck in the face and suffered an eye injury. A man, 49, was charged with assault. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SILVERTON LANE, 10:30 a.m. Jan. 19. A stolen credit card was used to make numerous unauthorized purchases over the Internet.

Huntingtown Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LOWERY RD., noon, Jan. 14. An iPod was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a rear window.

Owings Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FIFTH ST., Jan. 11 to 14. A generator, a weed whacker and a leaf blower were stolen from a shed behind a residence.

SKINNERS TURN RD., 3 p.m. Jan. 16 to 7:15 a.m. Jan. 19. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a commercial truck.

Prince Frederick Area

ASSAULTS

STAMPER CT., 4:45 p.m. Jan. 17. A man and a woman were assaulted at a residence. A man, 21, was charged with assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PRINCE FREDERICK BLVD. N., 3:45 p.m. Jan. 20. A man who said that he worked for a county agency gained access to back offices at a business and stole cash and a personal check.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. At the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics and information about community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Indian Head Area

SEX OFFENSES

INDIAN HEAD, 10:20 a.m. Jan. 18. A boy, 14, and other juveniles said they were sexually abused during music lessons over a period of years. A man, 44, was charged with second-degree child abuse, third- and fourth-degree sex offense and possession of child pornography.

White Plains Area

ROBBERIES

THEODORE GREEN BLVD., 10000 block, 11:57 a.m. Jan. 15. A man dressed as a woman robbed a bank after handing a note to a teller that said that he had a gun.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or Crime Solvers, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

California Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

BIRCH MANOR CT., 4:02 p.m. Jan. 20. An unknown object was used to scratch the bumper and fender of a vehicle.

Leonardtown Area

ASSAULTS

WASHINGTON ST., Jan. 15. A woman was pushed to the ground during a dispute. A man, 34, was charged with second-degree assault.

Lexington Park Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LIBERTY ST., 8 a.m. Jan. 14. A purse was stolen from a vehicle.

Piney Point Area

ASSAULTS

PINEY POINT, Jan. 19. A person was punched in the face several times during a dispute. A man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1870 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

No report was available from the Rockville Station for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 240-773-5030.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATION301-652-9200

ROBBERIES

East-West Hwy. and Pearl St., 7:50 p.m. June 15. A man threatened a pedestrian and fled with property. A 20-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested.  

Edgemoor Lane, 4800 block, June 15. A man armed with a weapon robbed a beer-and-wine store.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chestnut St., 400 block, and Rosedale Ave., 4500 block, June 14 to 15. Cash was stolen from two unlocked vehicles.

Glen Echo area, June 11. Cash was stolen from 16 unlocked vehicles during the early-morning hours. Two 17-year-old Silver Spring males, a 19-year-old Hyattsville man and a 20-year-old Bladensburg woman were arrested.

Glueck Lane, 11000 block and Howard Ave, 400 block, June 11 to 12. Automotive stereo systems were among property stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

La Duke Dr., Palisades Ct. and Littledale Rd., June 13 to 14. Global Positioning System units were among property stolen from four unlocked vehicles.

Rollingwood and Chevy Chase Village neighborhoods, June 12 to 15. GPS units and cash were among property stolen from 12 vehicles, all but one of which had been left unlocked.

Wyoming Rd., 5200 block, 1:30 a.m. June 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cummings Way, 3500 block, June 12 to 13. A vehicle was stolen using a key that had been left inside it.
