Shady Grove Rd.,14900 block, 2 p.m. June 23. A cellphone was stolen from a person working at a retail business. The victim said that a man who had been loitering near a counter had been asked to leave the premises a short time before the theft was discovered.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Casey Lane, 500 block, 10 p.m. June 17 to 10:18 a.m. June 18. A toll-payment transponder, a bag of groceries and a food voucher were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Coral Sea Dr., 1600 block, 2:08 to 2:16 a.m. June 22. Three male teenagers were arrested. Charges included theft and with being rogue and vagabond.

Crawford Dr., 6000 block, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. June 19. A DVD player, a safe, stereo equipment, tools, two watches and a necklace were among property stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear window.

Fallsgrove Dr., 700 block, 10:30 a.m. June 16 to 1 p.m. June 18. A package that had been delivered to a residence was stolen.

Fallsgrove Dr., 700 block, 10:30 p.m. June 17 to 10 a.m. June 18. A wallet and keys were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Hungerford Dr., 600 block, 10:48 a.m. to 3:35 p.m. June 19. A 36-year-old man was arrested. Charges included theft and credit-card fraud.

Julian Pl., 1000 block, 8:30 p.m. June 18 to 4:40 a.m. June 19. A DVD player, a GPS unit and a cellphone charger were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

King Farm Blvd., 100 block, 1 p.m. June 21 to 8:30 p.m. June 22. In two separate incidents, GPS units were stolen from unlocked vehicles.

Lincoln Ave., 300 block, 9 to 10:45 p.m. June 22. A 50-year-old woman was arrested for burglary and stalking.

Mannakee St., unit block, 11:35 a.m. June 21. A cellphone was stolen from a restroom at a college.

Montgomery Ave. W., 1200 block, 12:01 a.m. June 17 to 8:49 p.m. June 18. A concrete polisher, a grinder, a vacuum cleaner and an edger were among property stolen from a trailer entered by force.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

New Hampshire Ave., 6800 block, 2:21 a.m. June 24. Following an incident, a 21-year-old woman was arrested. Charges included assault, disorderly conduct and public intoxication.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Buffalo Ave., 7400 block, 8:34 p.m. June 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a back door.

Maple Ave., 7500 block, 4:30 p.m. June 25. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Fourth Ave., 6400 block, 11:39 a.m. June 25. A bicycle was stolen from beneath a porch at a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Circle Ave., 400 block, 6:44 a.m. June 22. A silver-colored 2002 Mercedes-Benz ML320 was stolen from a driveway at a residence.

- Compiled by Lisa M. Bolton

LENGTH: 2354 words


Fairfax County

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For information, call 703-246-2253.

FAIR OAKS DISTRICT THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dixie Hill Rd., 4400 block. Patio items were stolen from a residence.

Fair Lakes Shopping Center, 13000 block. A purse was stolen from a business.

Lee Hwy., 12100 block. Merchandise was stolen from a business.

Metrotech Dr., 13900 block. A purse was stolen from a business.  

Millpond Ct., 3700 block, 2:45 p.m. May 23. Jewelry and cash were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a side door.

Roman Mill Ct., 3200 block. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Southfield Dr., 3100 block. A cellphone was stolen from a residence.

FRANCONIA DISTRICT INDECENT EXPOSURE

Victoria Dr., 6900 block, 3 a.m. May 17. A female awoke hearing a knock on her bedroom window and saw a man exposing himself. The man fled before police arrived.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Gunston Plaza, 7700 block, 4:30 p.m. May 23. A stranger grabbed a female's buttocks, then fled.

Perry Penny Dr., 6700 block. A Nissan Versa was stolen.

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For more information, call 703-385-7809.

Fairfax Blvd., 9700 block, 9:45 to 11:35 p.m. May 16. Windows of two vehicles were smashed, and a wallet containing cash was stolen from one.

Fairfax Blvd., 11100 block, noon to 1:30 p.m. May 19. Cash and checks were stolen from a desk at an auto dealership.

Lee Hwy., 11000 block, 6:19 p.m. May 19. A purse, left in a booth at a restaurant, was stolen. The purse contained wallets, cash, credit cards, checks and keys.

Lee Hwy., 11000 block, 6:34 p.m. May 18. An iPhone, accidentally left in a restaurant, was stolen. Using the tracking program on the phone, police located it at a basketball court. A 22-year-old Fairfax area man was charged with grand larceny.

Main St., 10500 block, May 11 to May 17. Two iPads, a laptop computer and three walkie-talkies were stolen from a business.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

VANDALISM

Draper Dr., 3100 block, 12:21 p.m. May 22. During an argument with an employee, a man threw the employee's possessions, damaging them. A 56-year-old Maryland man was charged with destruction of property.

Hill St., 3700-3800 blocks, Egan St., 3800-3900 blocks, Orchard St., 10700-10900 blocks, 7:36 a.m. to 3:10 p.m. May 20. At several residences, mailboxes were destroyed, lights were broken and real estate signs were destroyed.

Old Lee Hwy. and Willard Way, 8:10 a.m. May 22. The glass of a bus stop shelter was shattered.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1618 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beaver Dam Rd., Jan. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a home.

DUNKIRK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maplewood Dr., Jan 8 to Jan. 16. Nail guns, a generator and a carving kit were stolen from a shed behind a house.  

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Route 4, 9:07 p.m. Jan. 17. A police officer sitting in his cruiser saw a man with a flashlight looking into vehicles, after which he then saw the man inside a vehicle. A Prince Frederick man, 26, was charged with rogue and vagabond and possession of burglary tools.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hoofbeat Trail, Jan. 13. Property in a home was stolen and damaged.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MF Bowen Rd., 6:16 p.m. Jan. 13. A house was entered through a rear window.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Patuxent Dr., 5:51 p.m. Jan. 15. Heating fuel was stolen from a tank.

Rose Ct., Jan. 15 to Jan. 17. A circular saw and an air compressor were stolen from a vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site, www.ccso.us, has daily news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

BRYANS ROAD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Heather Dr., 6900 block, Jan. 18. A man posted four chrome tire rims for sale on a Web site. Someone responded to the post and indicated that he was interested. A short time later, the rims were stolen. The incident was under investigation.

LA PLATA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Rd., Jan. 18 to Jan. 19. A stereo and four tires and rims were taken from a vehicle.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

Heathcote Rd., 3000 block, 12:04 a.m. Jan. 19. Two teenagers were robbed at gunpoint of cellphones and cash. The robbers fled in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holly Auto Center Lane, Jan. 20. Electronic items were stolen from a vehicle parked near an auto repair shop.

Sherman Rd., 100 block, 3 to 7:30 p.m. Jan. 20. Several guns, a computer and some games were taken from a home.

Washington Sq., 12000 block, Jan. 18 to Jan. 20. An attempt was made to steal a stereo from a vehicle parked near an auto repair shop.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, Jan. 16. During a fight at a detention center, an inmate threw a cup of liquid on a fellow inmate. A man, 49, was charged with second-degree assault of an inmate.

Leonardtown, Jan. 21. During a basketball game at a detention center, an inmate hit another inmate in the face. A Clinton man, 38, was charged with second-degree assault of an inmate.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, Jan. 19. During an argument, a man shoved a female acquaintance against a shower door. The man followed the woman into a bedroom, forced her to the floor and got on her back. The woman was seven months pregnant. A Lusby man, 25, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

Midway Dr., Jan. 21. During an argument, a man pushed an acquaintance onto a bed, and they struggled, causing injury. A Lexington Park man, 27, was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Mechanicsville, Jan. 19. A woman, 19, was at a party at a home when she was sexually assaulted by a man, who then fled. A Mechanicsville man, 18, was charged with second-degree rape.

ASSAULTS

Mechanicsville, Jan. 19. During an argument, a man punched an acquaintance in the face and burned the acquaintance with a cigarette. The man also grabbed a juvenile by the neck. A Mechanicsville man, 33, was charged with second-degree assault and child abuse and second-degree assault by a custodian.

WILDEWOOD AREA

ASSAULTS

Three Notch Rd., Jan. 22. While being arrested in connection with a protective order, a woman allegedly kicked a deputy in the face. A Ridge woman, 23, was charged with second-degree assault of a law enforcement officer, violation of a protective order and resisting arrest.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

A Mechanicsville man, 33, was charged with second-degree assault and child abuse and second-degree assault by a custodian.

June 30, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T19


LENGTH: 982 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Code Way, 2700 block, 12:30 p.m. June 14 to 1 p.m. June 20. Clothes were stolen from a business.

GAINESVILLE AREA WEAPONS  

Linton Hall Rd., 7600 block, 3:01 p.m. June 17. The driver of a red vehicle shouted racial slurs at a man, a woman and a girl in front of a store, and another occupant of the vehicle pointed a handgun at them.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dunwoody Ct., 14400 block, 5 p.m. June 12 to 5 p.m. June 15. Someone attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear screen door.

HAYMARKET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bakerwood Pl., 14300 block, 12:01 a.m. June 13 to 11:30 a.m. June 14. Cash, a wallet and baseball hats were stolen from an unlocked vehicle inside an open garage.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

King George Drive, June 17. A male juvenile sexually assaulted a female juvenile relative. A Manassas teenager was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 6:49 p.m. June 16. Three males surrounded a man and a male juvenile and demanded money. After a brief argument, the robbers walked away empty-handed. Three Manassas residents, ages 14, 17 and 31, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Davis Ford Rd., 6500 block, 2 p.m. June 12 to 10 a.m. June 14. A house key was stolen from a residence entered through a rear screen door.

Dumfries Rd., 13600 block, midnight to 4:55 a.m. June 18. Cash was stolen from a store entered by prying open a rear door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Stanton Cir., 7600 block, 8:32 a.m. June 14. A vehicle was stolen from a residence. The vehicle, equipped with an electronic vehicle-tracking device, was found in Fairfax County. Two Manassas males, 16 and 17, and another male, 16, were arrested. During an investigation, other stolen property was recovered, including a firearm. Two other Manassas males, 16 and 18, were also arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA WEAPONS

Fuller Road and Jefferson Davis Highway, 1:37 a.m. June 18. Several gunshots were heard.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Gableridge Turn, 6:45 a.m. June 16. A man entered a residence through an unlocked window and ordered a female resident to remove her clothes at knifepoint. He inappropriately touched her, then fled.

ARSON

Kilbane Rd., 4800 block, 7:25 a.m. June 19. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear door and started a fire.

ASSAULTS

Gideon Boulevard and Smoketown Road, 12:32 p.m. June 16. After an argument, a woman shot a male acquaintance in the arm with a BB gun. A 23-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 10 p.m. June 18. A group of about five males assaulted two male pedestrians.

West Longview Dr., 2300 block, 12:21 a.m. June 15. During an argument, a man hit a female acquaintance several times. She was treated for injuries. A 30-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Colchester Rd., 14500 block, 2:51 a.m. June 18. Several gunshots were heard.

Jefferson Davis Highway and Fox Lair Drive, 4:49 p.m. June 17. During a traffic altercation, a male motorist allegedly pointed a handgun at a female motorist. No injuries were reported. A 41-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Oakwood Drive and Dulcinea Place, 5:10 p.m. June 18. Several gunshots were heard. A bullet hit an unoccupied vehicle.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 2800 block, 2:19 p.m. June 21. A man armed with a hammer robbed a bank of cash.

Mathews Dr., 14100 block, 10:05 p.m. June 18. A group of about five men assaulted a pizza deliveryman and robbed him of pizzas. The deliveryman was treated for injuries.

West Longview Dr., 2200 block, 6:12 p.m. June 14. A male grabbed a cellphone from a woman's hands and fled. A 14-year-old Woodbridge male was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Armstead St., 13200 block, 10 a.m. to 1:40 p.m. June 18. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear window.

Beaver Ford Dr., 3700 block, 6 p.m. June 15 to 9 a.m. June 16. A cooler was stolen from a garage of a residence.

Gableridge Turn, 1800 block, 12:55 a.m. June 16. A man entered a residence through an unlocked window and was in the living room when a resident saw him. The man fled empty-handed.

Gordon Boulevard, 5 p.m. June 15 to 8:30 a.m. June 20. Tools were stolen from a storage space in a building.

Harborview Ct., 12700 block, 10:51 a.m. June 16. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14500 block, 8 p.m. June 19 to 5:20 a.m. June 20. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing open a rear door.

Packard Dr., 13300 block, midnight to 3 a.m. June 17. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a front door.

Quaint Dr., 5400 block, 4:30 p.m. May 26 to 2:45 p.m. June 19. A handgun, magazine and bullets were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Page St., 14100 block, 1:15 a.m. June 20. A man broke three school windows. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Moseby Ct., 300 block, 10:50 a.m. June 14. A man stole a video game system from a residence. An 18-year-old man was arrested.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

June 16, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 851 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hazel Circle Dr., 7:33 p.m. May 31. A girl sexually assaulted another girl. A 16-year-old Bristow girl was arrested.

DALE CITY AREA ROBBERIES  

Patamon Way, 13000 block, 3 a.m. June 5. Six men assaulted a man and robbed him of a cellphone.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Fortuna Center Plaza, 4400 block, 10:15 p.m. June 1. A gunman demanded money from two female employees in a drugstore, then told one of the women to tie the hands of the other. He ordered both women to go into a bathroom and fled with cash. A police investigation determined that one of the women had let the gunman into the store. A 23-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wharf Lane, 3600 block, 11:16 p.m. June 5. A man entered a residence, then fled empty-handed when a resident returned home.

VANDALISM

Dumfries Rd., 16200 block, May 27 through June 2. Windows of five vehicles were broken, and someone tampered with the ignitions. Nothing was reported stolen.

GAINESVILLE AREA WEAPONS

Tall Timber Dr., 8200 block, noon May 31 to 9 a.m. June 1. Someone fired a weapon, breaking a windshield of a vehicle and a window of a residence. No injuries were reported injured.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ontario Rd., 7800 block, 11:30 p.m. June 3 to 5 a.m. June 4. A laptop was a stolen from a residence entered through a window.

LAKE RIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hampstead Lane, 4100 block, 10 p.m. June 3 to noon June 5. Jewelry and a cellphone were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Rixlew Lane, 8800 block, between April 11 and April 15. A man at a school sexually assaulted a girl who was an acquaintance. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Lomond Dr., 10500 block, 6:55 p.m. June 1. Four males assaulted a man and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brandon Way, 10000 block, 7:10 to 9 p.m. June 3. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Fincastle Dr., 5900 block, 2:54 a.m. June 7. A man used a garage door opener in an unlocked vehicle to enter a garage, which was ransacked. Nothing was reported stolen.

Gold Leaf Cir., 11300 block, 12:19 a.m. June 7. A man entered a residence through an unlocked door. He fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pier Trail Dr., 18800 block, 1:01 a.m. June 4. A man entered a garage of a residence using a garage door opener in an unlocked vehicle. When a resident saw him, he fled empty-handed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Neabsco Mills Rd. and Potomac Branch Dr., 2:40 a.m. June 4. A man fired a handgun, then left in a vehicle with a woman. Police were later called to Opitz Boulevard and Neabsco Mills Road. During an argument, a man had held a woman at gunpoint. A 35-year-old Fort Belvoir man was arrested.

Worchester Dr., 4400 block, 5:16 p.m. June 1. During an argument in a parking lot, a man assaulted and choked a female acquaintance. The man followed the woman to a residence, where another man tried to prevent him from entering. He assaulted the man, entered the residence and assaulted the woman again. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14300 block, 11:45 a.m. June 5. During a service at a church, a gunman entered a rear office and robbed four people of cash that they were counting from the church collection. The gunman fled in a vehicle and went to a residence. A 19-year-old Dumfries man and an 18-year-old Lorton man were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bath Ct., 3500 block, noon to 4 p.m. June 1. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Catawba Dr., 12600 block, 1 to 2:30 p.m. May 31. Two laptops were stolen from a residence.

Endsley Turn, 14600 block, 9:09 p.m. June 2. Two men forcibly entered a residence while a third man waited outside. The intruders forced at gunpoint a male resident and four children to go into a bedroom and searched for a man who reportedly did not live there. The three men fled with a cellphone. No injuries were reported.

Marina Way, 13100 block, 4 to 11 a.m. June 5. Cash was stolen from a business.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kent Dr., 100 block, May 27 to May 28. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Washingtonpost.com


September 29, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 2049 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA VIOLENT CRIME AND DRUG ARRESTS  

Ritchie Hwy., 4800 block, Aug. 1 to 31. On Sept. 16, police announced that a sting operation at a motel resulted in 16 arrests, including one for sexual assault, two for assault and one for motor vehicle thefts, and the seizure of heroin, crack cocaine, drug paraphernalia and cash. An Annapolis man, 24, was arrested on a warrant for a sexual assault in North Carolina. A 30-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with possession of PCP and on outstanding warrants for assault, robbery and burglary. A Hamden man, 23, was charged with assault, failure to obey a lawful order, disorderly conduct and destruction of property. A Severna Park man, 38, was charged in three motor vehicle thefts. Three Baltimore men, ages 29, 47 and 63; two Baltimore women, ages 29 and 38; two Glen Burnie women, ages 22 and 46; a Huntington man, 53; and a Halethorpe woman, 36, were charged with drug-related offenses. In addition, two Baltimore women, ages 31 and 46, and a Glen Burnie woman, 30, were charged with soliciting prostitution.

ROBBERIES

Brookwood Rd. and E. 11th Ave., 8:03 p.m. Sept. 17. A man pushed a boy from a bicycle, then rode away on the bike.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES

Somerset Bay Dr., 200 block, 10:39 p.m. Sept. 18. Two men robbed a motorist at an apartment complex of clothes, a cellphone, a wallet and a 1997 Audi. An acquaintance of the victim followed the vehicle to Hospital Drive and Crain Highway and notified police at a nearby gas station. The vehicle was abandoned at a fast-food restaurant on Crain Highway.

Quarterfield Rd., 7600 block, 12:06 a.m. Sept. 18. A man wearing a ski mask robbed a convenience store at gunpoint, then fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Furnace Branch Rd., 7400 block, 10:02 p.m. Sept. 15. Two male teenagers robbed a male and a female of a purse and other property outside a store, then fled on foot.

JESSUP AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Jessup Rd., 2900 block, 10:21 p.m. Sept. 14. Copper wire was stolen from two work vans. A Laurel man, 43, was charged with theft, theft-scheme and tampering with a vehicle. An investigation linked the man to two other vehicle break-ins on Sept. 13.

LINTHICUM AREA ROBBERIES

Camp Meade Rd. S., 400 block, 8:30 a.m. Sept. 20. A man who implied that he had a weapon robbed a market of cash, then fled on foot.

PASADENA AREA ASSAULTS

Mountain Rd., 4200 block, 3:42 p.m. Sept. 18. A motorist accelerated toward a pedestrian in a grocery-store parking lot, grazing him with a mirror as the victim jumped out of the way. The motorist then put the car into reverse and tried again to hit the pedestrian, but instead hit a parked car. He then parked and went inside the grocery store. A Glen Burnie man, 36, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and several traffic violations.

SEVERN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Delmont Rd., 1200 block, 8:30 a.m. Sept. 20. A man was seen tampering with an air-conditioning unit at a church. Based on a witness description, police arrested a Severn man, 20, at his home, and recovered the air-conditioner, which had been sold to a recycling center. Charges included burglary, theft, possession of heroin and possession with intent to distribute. His 2007 Nissan SUV was seized.

Meade Village Cir., 1700 block, 2:34 a.m. Sept. 18. Three men forced their way into an occupied residence, then fled empty-handed in a vehicle. Two Severn men, ages 22 and 23, were charged with first- and fourth-degree burglary and malicious destruction of property. An investigation is continuing.

SEVERNA PARK ROBBERIES

Ritchie Hwy., 900 block, 9:12 p.m. Sept. 18. Three males robbed a male outside a convenience store of a cellphone and other property at knifepoint, then fled on foot into a wooded area.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. Call 410-280-2583o to anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity.

ROBBERIES

President St., 1000 block, Sept. 2. A male was attacked and robbed by a fellow passenger after they got out of a cab. On Sept. 15, an Annapolis man, 28, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broach Ct., 600 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 10 to 12:30 p.m. Sept. 17. A maroon-and-gray mountain bike and a maroon child's bike were stolen from a shed entered by prying open a door.

Hudson St., unit block, 6:30 to 7 a.m. Sept. 17. A blue-and-silver Trek mountain bike was stolen from a sidewalk.

Somerset Ct., 1-99 block, 2 to 5 a.m. Sept. 18. A navigator was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Second St., 300 block, 5 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Sept. 17. A duffle bag and a satchel were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. Call 410-313-2236 for information. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bright Flow Mews, 5900 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 13 to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 14. Cash was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Cedar Lane, 5400 block, 4:40 p.m. Sept. 20. A group of people attacked a person. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Better Hours Ct., 7300 block, 2 p.m. Sept. 15 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 19. Jewelry, a laptop and a Tablet PC were stolen from a residence.

Bullring Lane, 9400 block, 7:38 p.m. Sept. 17. A residence was entered through a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Copperwood Way, 7000 block, 11:50 a.m. to 12:05 p.m. Sept. 14. A laptop was stolen form a residence entered through a basement window.

Durham Rd. E., 5200 block, late July. A bicycle was stolen from a garage.

Early April Way, 8900 block, 7:45 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. Sept. 14. A purse and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Ridgeview Dr., 9400 block, 10:45 a.m. Sept. 19. A residence was entered by breaking a window. A Columbia man, 18, was charged with first-, second-, third- and fourth-degree burglary. Two juvenile males also were arrested.

Rutland Round Rd., 10200 block, 1:28 a.m. Sept. 17. A blue Schwinn bicycle was stolen from an open garage.

Waiting Spring, 6100 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 12 to 10 a.m. Sept. 19. A bicycle was stolen from an unlocked garage.

Wheatsheaf Way, 9300 block, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sept. 14. Two video game controllers were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Berger Road and Gerwig Lane, 6:32 p.m. Sept. 18. A trailer was stolen.

Cradlerock Way and Melting Shadows Lane, 12:27 a.m. Sept. 16. A vehicle was stolen.

Early April Way, 8900 block, 8:22 p.m. Sept. 16. A 2000 Mercedes CLK 430 was stolen. The vehicle was recovered at the home of a 35-year-old Columbia woman, who was charged with motor vehicle theft and unauthorized removal of property.

Early April Way, 9700 block, 6:10 a.m. Sept. 17. A black 2007 Nissan Murano was stolen.

Smooth Meadow Way, 5300 block, 10:41 a.m. Sept. 14. An attempt was made to steal a 2011 Honda Accord by tampering with the ignition.

ELKRIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Keeton Rd., 8000 block, 8 to 11 a.m. Sept. 19. Medication and cash were stolen from a residence.

Pheasant Dr., 6600 block, 5 p.m. Sept. 13 to 3 p.m. Sept. 16. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a basement door.

Washington Blvd., 7400 block, Aug. 15 to Sept. 19. Auto parts were stolen from vehicles in a salvage yard.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Bayberry Ct., 6300 block, 12:27 a.m. Sept. 16. A 2007 Suzuki motorcycle was stolen. The motorcycle was found in the bed of a pickup truck, one of two vehicle stopped nearby. A Landover man, 23, a Hyattsville man, 24, a Columbia man, 19, and a District man, 27, were arrested. Charges included motor vehicle theft and unauthorized removal of property.

Dorsey Run Rd., 7100 block, 1:49 p.m. Sept. 20. A red Toyota Corolla was stolen.

Hunt Club Rd., 5800 block, 7:26 a.m. Sept. 16. An attempt was made to steal a 2001 Suzuki motorcycle.

Old Washington Rd., 6300 block, 7:55 p.m. Sept. 19. A silver 1985 Oldsmobile Cutlass was stolen.

Washington Blvd., 7200 block, 12:39 p.m. Sept. 15. A 2000 Volvo was stolen.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Normandy Woods Dr., 3100 block, 1:58 p.m. Sept. 17. A man driving a 1977 Datsun followed a female into a parking lot and exposed himself. A Halethorpe man, 28, was charged with indecent exposure.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bracken Dr., 10100 block, 7:30 to 10:30 p.m. Sept. 15. A digital media player, a credit card and sunglasses were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle in an open garage.

St. Johns Lane, 2800 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 19 to 5:45 p.m. Sept. 20. A TV and a camera were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Montgomery Rd., 7200 block, 12:06 p.m. Sept. 20. A white 2000 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

JESSUP AREA ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd., 8600 block, 12:52 p.m. Sept. 18. A man wearing a mask robbed a convenience store of cash, then fled on foot.

Washington Blvd., 8600 block, 11:56 a.m. Sept. 19. A man robbed a pharmacy of prescription medication at gunpoint, then fled into a wooded area.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Guilford Rd., 10700 block, 10:39 p.m. Sept. 14. Fiber wheels were stolen and two motorcycles were moved at a dealership entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Washington Blvd., 7900 block, 1:38 a.m. Sept. 14. Cigarettes were stolen from a market entered by breaking glass in a front door. At 3:40 a.m. on Sept. 16, cigarettes again were stolen after the market was broken into the same way. Shortly after the second incident, a Jessup man, 34, was arrested. Charges included burglary, theft and malicious destruction of property.

LAUREL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jennifer Ct., 8600 block, 12:30 to 2:45 p.m. Sept. 20. A residence was entered by breaking glass in a sliding door.

Moonshine Hollow, 9000 block, 7:50 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 14. A digital media player and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MARRIOTTSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Marriottsville Rd., 1200 block, 4:30 p.m. Sept. 16 to 2:30 p.m. Sept. 19. Lawn equipment and tools were stolen from a garage.

SAVAGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Washington Blvd., 9000 block, 6:44 a.m. Sept. 19. An attempt was made to enter a convenience store by breaking glass in a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Greenwood Pl., 8800 block, 11:39 a.m. Sept. 17. A trailer was stolen.

Larkin Rd., 8600 block, 2:08 p.m. Sept. 14. A red 2006 Dodge Magnum was stolen from a business.

WEST FRIENDSHIP AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Routes 70 and 32, 2:31 a.m. Sept. 17. A gray 2007 Ford F-250 truck was stolen.

WOODSTOCK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gretchen Nicole Ct., 10300 block, 8:55 p.m. Sept. 17. Property was stolen from a vehicle in a garage.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1884 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

VIOLENT CRIME AND DRUG ARRESTS
 

Ritchie Hwy., 4800 block, Aug. 1 to 31. On Sept. 16, police announced that a sting operation at a motel resulted in 16 arrests, including one for sexual assault, two for assault and one for motor vehicle thefts, and the seizure of heroin, crack cocaine, drug paraphernalia and cash. An Annapolis man, 24, was arrested on a warrant for a sexual assault in North Carolina. A 30-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with possession of PCP and on outstanding warrants for assault, robbery and burglary. A Hamden man, 23, was charged with assault, failure to obey a lawful order, disorderly conduct and destruction of property. A Severna Park man, 38, was charged in three motor vehicle thefts. Three Baltimore men, ages 29, 47 and 63; two Baltimore women, ages 29 and 38; two Glen Burnie women, ages 22 and 46; a Huntington man, 53; and a Halethorpe woman, 36, were charged with drug-related offenses. In addition, two Baltimore women, ages 31 and 46, and a Glen Burnie woman, 30, were charged with soliciting prostitution.

ROBBERIES

Brookwood Rd. and E. 11th Ave., 8:03 p.m. Sept. 17. A man pushed a boy from a bicycle, then rode away on the bike.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ROBBERIES

LINTHICUM AREA

PASADENA AREA

ASSAULTS

The motorist then put the car into reverse and tried again to hit the pedestrian, but instead hit a parked car. He then parked and went inside the grocery store. A Glen Burnie man, 36, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and several traffic violations.

SEVERN AREA

Delmont Rd., 1200 block, 8:30 a.m. Sept. 20. A man was seen tampering with an air-conditioning unit at a church. Based on a witness description, police arrested a Severn man, 20, at his home, and recovered the air-conditioner, which had been sold to a recycling center. Charges included burglary, theft, possession of heroin and possession with intent to distribute. His 2007 Nissan SUV was seized.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. Call 410-280-2583o to anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broach Ct., 600 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 10 to 12:30 p.m. Sept. 17. A maroon-and-gray mountain bike and a maroon child's bike were stolen from a shed entered by prying open a door.

Hudson St., unit block, 6:30 to 7 a.m. Sept. 17. A blue-and-silver Trek mountain bike was stolen from a sidewalk.

Second St., 300 block, 5 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Sept. 17. A duffle bag and a satchel were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. Call 410-313-2236 for information. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bright Flow Mews, 5900 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 13 to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 14. Cash was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Cedar Lane, 5400 block, 4:40 p.m. Sept. 20. A group of people attacked a person. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Better Hours Ct., 7300 block, 2 p.m. Sept. 15 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 19. Jewelry, a laptop and a Tablet PC were stolen from a residence.

Bullring Lane, 9400 block, 7:38 p.m. Sept. 17. A residence was entered through a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Copperwood Way, 7000 block, 11:50 a.m. to 12:05 p.m. Sept. 14. A laptop was stolen form a residence entered through a basement window.

Durham Rd. E., 5200 block, late July. A bicycle was stolen from a garage.

Early April Way, 8900 block, 7:45 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. Sept. 14. A purse and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Ridgeview Dr., 9400 block, 10:45 a.m. Sept. 19. A residence was entered by breaking a window. A Columbia man, 18, was charged with first-, second-, third- and fourth-degree burglary. Two juvenile males also were arrested.

Rutland Round Rd., 10200 block, 1:28 a.m. Sept. 17. A blue Schwinn bicycle was stolen from an open garage.

Waiting Spring, 6100 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 12 to 10 a.m. Sept. 19. A bicycle was stolen from an unlocked garage.

Wheatsheaf Way, 9300 block, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sept. 14. Two video game controllers were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Berger Road and Gerwig Lane, 6:32 p.m. Sept. 18. A trailer was stolen.

Cradlerock Way and Melting Shadows Lane, 12:27 a.m. Sept. 16. A vehicle was stolen.

Early April Way, 8900 block, 8:22 p.m. Sept. 16. A 2000 Mercedes CLK 430 was stolen. The vehicle was recovered at the home of a 35-year-old Columbia woman, who was charged with motor vehicle theft and unauthorized removal of property.

Early April Way, 9700 block, 6:10 a.m. Sept. 17. A black 2007 Nissan Murano was stolen.

Smooth Meadow Way, 5300 block, 10:41 a.m. Sept. 14. An attempt was made to steal a 2011 Honda Accord by tampering with the ignition.

ELKRIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Keeton Rd., 8000 block, 8 to 11 a.m. Sept. 19. Medication and cash were stolen from a residence.

Pheasant Dr., 6600 block, 5 p.m. Sept. 13 to 3 p.m. Sept. 16. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a basement door.

Washington Blvd., 7400 block, Aug. 15 to Sept. 19. Auto parts were stolen from vehicles in a salvage yard.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Bayberry Ct., 6300 block, 12:27 a.m. Sept. 16. A 2007 Suzuki motorcycle was stolen. The motorcycle was found in the bed of a pickup truck, one of two vehicle stopped nearby. A Landover man, 23, a Hyattsville man, 24, a Columbia man, 19, and a District man, 27, were arrested. Charges included motor vehicle theft and unauthorized removal of property.

Dorsey Run Rd., 7100 block, 1:49 p.m. Sept. 20. A red Toyota Corolla was stolen.

Hunt Club Rd., 5800 block, 7:26 a.m. Sept. 16. An attempt was made to steal a 2001 Suzuki motorcycle.

Old Washington Rd., 6300 block, 7:55 p.m. Sept. 19. A silver 1985 Oldsmobile Cutlass was stolen.

Washington Blvd., 7200 block, 12:39 p.m. Sept. 15. A 2000 Volvo was stolen.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Normandy Woods Dr., 3100 block, 1:58 p.m. Sept. 17. A man driving a 1977 Datsun followed a female into a parking lot and exposed himself. A Halethorpe man, 28, was charged with indecent exposure.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bracken Dr., 10100 block, 7:30 to 10:30 p.m. Sept. 15. A digital media player, a credit card and sunglasses were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle in an open garage.

St. Johns Lane, 2800 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 19 to 5:45 p.m. Sept. 20. A TV and a camera were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Montgomery Rd., 7200 block, 12:06 p.m. Sept. 20. A white 2000 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

JESSUP AREA

ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd., 8600 block, 12:52 p.m. Sept. 18. A man wearing a mask robbed a convenience store of cash, then fled on foot.

Washington Blvd., 8600 block, 11:56 a.m. Sept. 19. A man robbed a pharmacy of prescription medication at gunpoint, then fled into a wooded area.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Guilford Rd., 10700 block, 10:39 p.m. Sept. 14. Fiber wheels were stolen and two motorcycles were moved at a dealership entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Washington Blvd., 7900 block, 1:38 a.m. Sept. 14. Cigarettes were stolen from a market entered by breaking glass in a front door. At 3:40 a.m. on Sept. 16, cigarettes again were stolen after the market was broken into the same way. Shortly after the second incident, a Jessup man, 34, was arrested. Charges included burglary, theft and malicious destruction of property.

LAUREL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jennifer Ct., 8600 block, 12:30 to 2:45 p.m. Sept. 20. A residence was entered by breaking glass in a sliding door.

Moonshine Hollow, 9000 block, 7:50 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 14. A digital media player and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MARRIOTTSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Marriottsville Rd., 1200 block, 4:30 p.m. Sept. 16 to 2:30 p.m. Sept. 19. Lawn equipment and tools were stolen from a garage.

SAVAGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Washington Blvd., 9000 block, 6:44 a.m. Sept. 19. An attempt was made to enter a convenience store by breaking glass in a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Greenwood Pl., 8800 block, 11:39 a.m. Sept. 17. A trailer was stolen.

Larkin Rd., 8600 block, 2:08 p.m. Sept. 14. A red 2006 Dodge Magnum was stolen from a business.

WEST FRIENDSHIP AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Routes 70 and 32, 2:31 a.m. Sept. 17. A gray 2007 Ford F-250 truck was stolen.

WOODSTOCK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gretchen Nicole Ct., 10300 block, 8:55 p.m. Sept. 17. Property was stolen from a vehicle in a garage.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Fairfax County crime report Fairfax County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 2610 words


Fairfax County

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For information, call 703-246-2253.

FAIR OAKS DISTRICT SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Country Creek Rd. and Shawn Leigh Dr., 6:50 p.m. July 18. A man approached a female pedestrian, reached up her dress and grabbed her buttocks, then fled.

Metrotech Dr., 13900 block, 8:35 p.m. July 17. A woman said a man had taken pictures of her while she was trying on clothes in a fitting room.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Branch Side Lane, 9300 block, 10:15 p.m. July 17. Laptop computers were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Chain Bridge Rd., 2900 block. Beer was stolen from a business.

Fair Lakes Cir., 12500 block. Merchandise was stolen from a business.

James Swart Cir., 11200 block. A cellphone was stolen from a business.

Metrotech Dr., 13900 block. A credit card was stolen from a business.

Metrotech Dr., 13900 block. Car keys were stolen from a vehicle.

Waples Mill Rd., 11200 block. Brass was stolen from a business.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Mission Square Dr., 3000 block. A Kawasaki motorcycle was stolen.

Oakdale Crescent Ct., 4400 block. A Ford Mustang was stolen.

Pender Creek Cir., 12200 block. A Ford Escape was stolen.

Atteentee Rd., 5900 block. A wallet was stolen from a business.

Commerce St., 7200 block. A cellphone was stolen from a residence.

Fairfax City

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For more information, call 703-385-7809.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chain Bridge Rd., 4000 block, 6:04 p.m. July 12. A male took a bottle of liquor from a bar in a business, drank from it, returned it to the bar area and left. A 23-year-old Fairfax man was charged with petty larceny.

Fairchester Dr., 10800 block, 6:39 a.m. July 11. A man stole a bottle of alcohol from a convenience store. A 59-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with larceny.

Fairfax Blvd., 10300 block, 4:30 p.m. July 14 to 2 a.m. July 15. Cash, a small pouch and two debit cards were stolen from a gym bag at a restaurant.

Fairfax Blvd., 10700 block, 9:47 a.m. July 14. A person lost a credit card at a restaurant, and the card was subsequently used at several businesses in the area.

Jermantown Rd., 3900 block, 12:45 p.m. July 12. A male concealed merchandise and left a convenience store.

Woodland Dr., 4100 block, 5:18 p.m. July 13. Computers, a camera and a cellphone were stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Main St., 9700 block, midnight to 3 a.m. July 14. A vehicle was scratched with a key.

Providence Pl., 3900 block, 10:27 a.m. July 14. A fence and shrubs at a residence were damaged.

Falls Church

The following incidents were recently reported by the Falls Church Police Department. For more information, call 703-248-5056.

HOMICIDES

Wilson Blvd., 6700 block, July 14. Peter Phan, 49, of Falls Church was shot to death in a rear parking lot of a shopping center. Police later found another dead person with a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The investigation was continuing.

ASSAULTS

Broad St. W., 500 block, July 4. A 41-year-old Falls Church man was arrested in connection with assaulting a family member.

Maple Ave. S., 400 block, July 13. A 56-year-old Falls Church woman was arrested in connection with assaulting a family member.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broad St. E., 100 block, July 16. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Broad St. W., 1100 block, July 15. A wallet, hidden in a pair of shoes at a business, was stolen.

Broad St. W., 1200 block, July 16. A wallet was stolen from a cart in a grocery store.

Broad St. W., 400 block, July 10. A window of a business was broken with a cinder block. Nothing was reported missing.

Gundry Dr., 200 block, July 16. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Sherrow Ave., 400 block, July 16. Global Positioning System devices and cash were stolen from two unlocked vehicles.

Washington St. N., 200 block, June 29. A video camera was stolen from an office.

Washington St. S., 600 block, July 13. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

Herndon

The following incidents were recently reported by the Herndon Police Department. For more information, call 703-435-6846.

November 24, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1127 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hope Rd., 12:12 p.m. Nov. 10. A man raped a female acquaintance. A 46-year-old Fairfax man was arrested.

DALE CITY AREA ASSAULTS

Kingsman Rd., 13600 block, 3:11 a.m. Nov. 12. During an argument, a woman threw a vase, which struck a female acquaintance in the face. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 41-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested. 

WEAPONS

Eames Lane, 4400 block, 8:46 p.m. Nov. 9. A male at a residence pointed a handgun at a female juvenile, who had arrived at the residence to retrieve money owed to her. The juvenile struck the male and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Colverdale Rd., 15100 block, 10 a.m. Nov. 8 to 3:50 p.m. Nov. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by breaking a side window.

Colder Lane, 15100 block, 5:37 p.m. Nov. 12. Someone entered a vacant residence by forcing open a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Panther Pride Dr. and Jefferson Davis Hwy., 6:43 p.m. Nov. 14. Four male juveniles assaulted a male juvenile pedestrian and robbed him of a hat.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antrim Cir., 3100 block, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Nov. 14. Cash, electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

Briarwood Dr., 3500 block, 9:16 a.m. Nov. 13. Electronics were stolen from five unlocked vehicles.

Old Stage Rd., 17400 block, 12:29 a.m. Nov. 14. Two men entered a business by cutting a fence and attempted to steal catalytic converters. A 29-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA WEAPONS

Mill Creek Rd., 3700 block, 8:45 p.m. Nov. 9. During an argument between two men, one fired a rifle at a ceiling. No injuries were reported. A 33-year-old Haymarket man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Evans Ford Rd., 9600 block, 3:07 p.m. Nov. 13. During an argument, a male hit a female relative several times in the face with a phone. The woman was treated for injuries. A 16-year-old Manassas male was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crestwood and Elsinore drives, 3:22 a.m. Nov. 13. Two males were seen looking into parked vehicles.

Trundle Pl., 10300 block, 7:07 p.m. Nov. 13. Someone entered a residence through a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

TRIANGLE AREA ROBBERIES

Warf and Olde Port lanes, 2:32 p.m. Nov. 10. A gunman robbed a man of a backpack containing cash and a cellphone.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Annapolis Way, 900 block, 2:19 a.m. Nov. 12. A man in a hotel parking lot fired a gun at a man sitting in a vehicle with a door open. The injured man was taken to a hospital.

Occoquan Rd., 13200 block, 6:12 p.m. Nov. 9. A male juvenile attempted to take property from a store. A male employee stopped the juvenile and told him leave. The juvenile left, then returned and cut the employee's abdomen with a broken bottle.

WEAPONS

Hunterbrook Dr., 12700 block, 8:07 p.m. Nov. 12. A man used a BB gun to threaten two women who had gone to a residence to talk to a relative. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Darbydale Ave., 14700 block, 3:43 a.m. Nov. 12. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 4:04 p.m. Nov. 12. A male juvenile grabbed a cellphone from a woman's hand and fled.

Minnieville Rd., 14400 block, 6:13 p.m. Nov. 14. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

Occoquan Rd., 13200 block, 5:50 p.m. Nov. 12. A man robbed a woman of cash at knifepoint.

Old Bridge and Tanyard Hill roads, 6:43 a.m. Nov. 14. A male driver of a vehicle struck a vehicle in front of him. When the two drivers stopped, the first driver robbed the other driver of cash at gunpoint.

Tobacco Way and Estate Dr., 1:56 p.m. Nov. 8. After an altercation, two male juveniles robbed another male juvenile of cash at knifepoint. Two males, 16 and 17, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bedford Cove Lane, 4400 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 9 to 8 a.m. Nov. 10. Appliances were stolen from a residence under construction. The residence was entered through an unlocked door.

Boatswain Cir., 16300 block, 11 a.m. Nov. 2 to 8 a.m. Nov. 3. Appliances were stolen from a residence under construction.

Carlsbad Rd., 15000 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 8 to 3 p.m. Nov. 9. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Georgetown Rd., 16600 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 10 to 8 p.m. Nov. 11. A jacket and a pair of shoes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Hendricks Dr., 4500 block, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 8. Cash, a TV and a laptop were stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 5:30 a.m. Nov. 11. Two men stole tools and equipment from a business. They fled when employees saw them.

Samantha Ct., 14200 block, 6 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. Nov. 14. A TV, a laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a basement pet door.

Sunny Ridge Ct., 15000 block, 3:45 p.m. Nov. 12. Someone entered a residence through a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cannon Ridge Dr., 8900 block, 8 p.m. Nov. 12 to 8 a.m. Nov. 13. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Diane Ct., 8600 block, 11:10 p.m. Nov. 13. Property was stolen from a vehicle. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Kamlea Dr., 8900 block, 11:30 p.m. Nov. 12 to 1:10 a.m. Nov. 13. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Quarry Rd., 8500 block, midnight Nov. 12 to midnight Nov. 13. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Coriander Cir., 9000 block, 11:20 p.m. Nov. 13. A man drove away in an acquaintance's vehicle. He returned the vehicle the next day. A 50-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Manassas Park

The following incident was reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Inyo Pl., 8000 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 5. Four or five males took a cellphone and other property from a vehicle.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1359 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

ROBBERIES

Bay Dale Drive and Route 50, 5:45 p.m. Feb. 12. A man forced an acquaintance to drive him from her residence in the District to an ATM, where he forced her to withdraw cash. He then made her drive to this location in Arnold, where he got out of the vehicle and walked away. At 3:30 p.m. Feb. 13, an arrest was made at a residence near M&T Bank Stadium in Baltimore. An Annapolis man, 30, was charged with robbery, theft, false imprisonment and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Harker Place, 200 block, Feb. 11. A wallet was stolen from a locker at a gym. A credit card from the wallet was used to purchase merchandise at Annapolis locations. Three other incidents involving fraudulent use of credit cards from wallets stolen at the gym have occurred since early November.  

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Townsend Ave. and Alley 7, 1 p.m. Feb. 15. A handgun and illegal drugs found in a 2009 Ford Flex were seized by police, as was the vehicle. A Baltimore man, 61, was charged with several firearm violations and possession of drugs with intent to distribute.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block, 12:04 p.m. Feb. 11. A man groped a woman inside a business. A 60-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested a short time later. Charges included second-degree assault, fourth-degree sex offense and disorderly conduct.

ASSAULTS

Silent Shadow Ct., 7900 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 11. A man went to an acquaintance's residence and threatened her at knifepoint. Another man intervened and was cut on the hand. A Severna Park man, 28, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore and Annapolis Blvd., 7600 block, 12:12 a.m. Feb. 16. A man was confronted while tampering with an ATM at a gas station. A Pasadena man, 27, was charged with destruction of property and attempted theft.

MILLERSVILLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Cloverleaf Dr., 8200 block, 10:45 a.m. Feb. 15. A man robbed a business, then was chased into a wooded area by employees. When police arrived, a man tried to speed away in a vehicle and was stopped. A Glen Burnie man, 42, and a 29-year-old man of no fixed address were arrested.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

ASSAULTS

Madison St., 1100 block, 2:30 a.m. Feb. 15. A male was found on a sidewalk, suffering from a stab wound. He was flown to a hospital, where he was treated for a serious injury. An investigation was continuing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burnside St., 600 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 11 to noon Feb. 12. A Global Positioning System device and loose change were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Center St., 200 block, 1:30 to 2 p.m. Feb. 12. Four pairs of sneakers, a video game system and two controllers were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Clay St., unit block, 2 p.m. Feb. 15. A vacant apartment was entered by forcing a door. An Annapolis man, 32, was arrested.

Gorman St., 100 block, 9:30 p.m. Feb. 13. A man tried to steal a vehicle in a parking garage, then fled on foot and was chased down by an acquaintance of the vehicle's owner. An Annapolis man, 26, was charged with assault, resisting arrest and with being rogue and vagabond.

Spa View Cir., unit block, 12:20 a.m. Feb. 13. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked door. A man fled empty-handed when confronted.

West St., 1100 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 14 to 9 a.m. Feb. 15. Wheels and tires were stolen from two vehicles.

West St., 1400 block, Feb. 12. Two unlocked bicycles were stolen from a bike rack. The bikes were recovered that same day in the 1700 block of Forest Drive.

West St., 2000 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 12 to 9:30 a.m. Feb. 13. Wheels and tires were stolen from two vehicles.

Westgate Cir., 100 block, 1 p.m. Feb. 8 to 9 a.m. Feb. 9. A laptop that had been left under a table was stolen from a business.

Fifth St. and Chesapeake Ave., 7:30 to 7:40 p.m. Feb. 11. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Smithville St., 1000 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 11 to 9:30 a.m. Feb. 12. A silver-and-black 1997 Honda Civic was stolen.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other felonies, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

ANNAPOLIS JUNCTION AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Guilford Rd., 10900 block, 5 p.m. Feb. 13 to 9 a.m. Feb. 14. A 2001 International truck was stolen. It was recovered in Anne Arundel County. Its tires were missing.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Harpers Farm Rd., 5400 block, Feb. 1. Two males threatened a motorist and robbed her of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Overheart Lane, 6500 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 11. A residence was entered by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Peace Chimes Ct.,7100 block, 8:39 p.m. Feb. 15. A break-in occurred.

Trotting Ridge Way, 10900 block, 7:30 to 10 a.m. Feb. 3. A vacant residence was entered by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cordage Walk, 10700 block, 9 a.m. Feb. 11. A blue-and-black 2000 Honda Civic was stolen.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 11300 block, 11:28 a.m. Feb. 12. A silver 2006 Nissan Sentra was stolen.

Peartree Way, 11200 block, 11:57 a.m. Feb. 12. A blue 2003 Honda Civic was stolen.

Sunny Spring, 6000 block, 5:45 a.m. Feb. 14. A gold 1997 Ford Expedition was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Macaw Ct., 6300 block, 6:30 a.m. Feb. 13. Someone was seen fleeing a business with property taken from inside. There was no sign of forced entry.

Old Waterloo Rd., 6900 block, 10 a.m. Feb. 11 to 12:25 p.m. Feb. 12. A bathroom at a park facility was entered by forcing a door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Business Pkwy., 6600 block, 2:36 p.m. Feb. 13. A yellow International cargo truck was stolen.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Frederick Rd., 15000 block, 5 p.m. Feb. 10 to 3:30 p.m. Feb. 15. A minibike was stolen from an unlocked garage.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Court House Dr., 3400 block, 10:05 p.m. Feb. 10. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen.

Washington Blvd., 8000 block, 12:44 a.m. Feb. 12. A blue 2001 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

JESSUP AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Assateague Dr., 7300 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 9 to 10:30 a.m. Feb. 10. Tools and equipment were stolen from a business entered through a front door. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Montevideo Rd., 7500 block, 11:12 a.m. Feb. 13. Two 20-foot containers were stolen.

LAUREL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Helmart Dr., 7900 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Feb. 13. A residence was entered by kicking in the front door. The premises were ransacked, but nothing was reported missing.

Scaggsville Rd., 11900 block, 7 to 8 p.m. Feb. 10. A gun, cash, jewelry and a digital media player were stolen from a residence.

Washington Blvd., 8300 block, 5:30 p.m. Feb. 9 to 7:50 a.m. Feb. 10. A safe and cash were stolen from a business entered through a back door.

MOUNT AIRY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ridge Rd., 900 block, 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Gun cases and accessories were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

SAVAGE AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Foxborough Dr., 8500 block, 8:42 a.m. Feb. 10. A black trailer was stolen.

WOODBINE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Susan Marie Way, 14700 block, 3:40 to 7 p.m. Feb. 15. A safe containing cash and jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

September 5, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 2071 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, Inc., a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULT

Parklawn Dr., 12300 block, 11:45 p.m. Aug. 6 to 1:30 a.m. Aug. 7. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

Elsdale Ct., 13100 block, 9:30 p.m. Aug. 6. A male was seen peeking into a window at a residence.

ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

Veirs Mill Rd., 200 block, 7:29 p.m. Aug. 21. A 43-year-old man was arrested for obstructing and hindering a police investigation, making false statements to a police officer, consuming an alcoholic beverage at a retail establishment, possession of an open container at a retail establishment, intoxicated in a public place, and trespassing.

June 17, 2010 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW36


LENGTH: 738 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

WEAPONS

GLENDALE RD., 4100 block, 2:50 a.m. June 2. A man swung a sword at a moving vehicle. No injuries were reported. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GOLANSKY BLVD., 3100 block, 7:15 p.m. June 4. A box of hot dogs was stolen from a business entered by forcing open a garage door. A 34-year-old Triangle man was arrested. 

KITTREDGE CT., 13100 block, 9 p.m. June 1 to 5:30 p.m. June 6. A pressure washer, power drills and four tires were stolen from a shed in the back yard of a residence.

Dumfries area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ISLIP LOOP, 17000 block, midnight to 12:20 a.m. June 9. Property was stolen from a residence.

Haymarket area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WATERFALL RD., 15900 block, 10:30 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. June 1. Two handguns, jewelry and other items were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

Lake Ridge area

ASSAULTS

OLD BRIDGE AND MINNIEVILLE ROADS, 5 a.m. June 7. Someone threw an object at a moving vehicle, breaking a window. No injuries were reported.

Manassas area

ASSAULTS

TUMBLING BROOK LANE, 12800 block, 4:45 a.m. June 4. During an argument, a woman stabbed an acquaintance. A 26-year-old Manassas woman was arrested. The acquaintance was treated for injuries.

WEAPONS

JULIET CT., 8000 block, 12:10 a.m. June 2. A man fired a bullet from a rifle at the ceiling in an apartment. The bullet went through the ceiling into the above apartment, through a mattress in a child's bedroom and into the ceiling. No injuries were reported. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

ASHTON AVE. AND PETERSBURG CT., 8:45 p.m. May 31. A male teenager demanded a bike from a male cyclist, who refused. The teenager swung a knife toward the man, then took the bike.

COVERSTONE DR., 10700 block, 11 a.m. June 4. A man assaulted another man and robbed him of cash. The injured man was taken to a hospital.

PROSTITUTION

GAMBRIL DR. AND SUDLEY MANOR DR., 10:19 p.m. June 1. During an investigation after a traffic stop, a 24-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with soliciting a prostitute, pandering, forging public documents and providing a false identity to law enforcement. A 25-year-old Richmond woman was arrested and charged with prostitution.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COMMUNITY DR., 7900 block, 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. June 3. Cash, three laptops, a cellphone, a digital camera, a video game system, video games and a wallet were stolen from a residence.

Nokesville area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

SCHAEFFER LANE, June 2009 to January 2010. A man had sexual contact with a girl. A 65-year-old Nokesville man was arrested.

Triangle area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

JURGENSEN DR., June 6. A man had sexual relations with a girl. An 18-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

Woodbridge area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BLACKBURN RD., 5:46 p.m. June 8. A man inappropriately touched a juvenile relative at a school playground. A 19-year-old man from Bowie, Md., was arrested.

ASSAULTS

BERLIN CT., 3200 block, 3:13 a.m. June 1. During a fight at a residence, a man stabbed a male relative with a knife. The relative was armed with a bat. Both men were treated for injuries. A 21-year-old man was arrested.

OLD BRIDGE RD., 1300 block, 6:21 a.m. June 8. During a fight involving two men in a convenience store, a chemical was sprayed. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13600 block, 1:42 p.m. May 28. Two men implied they were armed and robbed a man of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GRAN DEUR DR., 13700 block, 8:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. June 2. A cellphone was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for today's Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.
