The Washington Post


December 22, 2011 Thursday  
Every Edition


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 2164 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Riverwalk Dr., 3000 block, night of Dec. 7 to 6:57 a.m. Dec. 8. A 2005 Mitsubishi Eclipse was stolen from an unlocked garage. The vehicle was recovered at Harbor Drive and Carrollton Road. Credit cards had been taken from the vehicle and used at several Annapolis locations, including a convenience store in the 900 block of Bay Ridge Road. Anyone with information is asked to contact Detective Mark Ottey at 410-222-1965.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

ROBBERy

Belle Grove and W. Arden roads, 10:40 p.m. Dec. 14. Three males assaulted and robbed a male teenager who was walking with a female. A phone was taken. 

GAMBRILLS AREA

ROBBERy

Brandermill Blvd., 2400 block, 6:50 a.m. Dec. 11. A masked gunman robbed a restaurant of cash, then fled on foot.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Eugenia Ave., Dec. 3. A female said she observed a male acquaintance perform a sexual act on a boy inside a residence. An investigation determined that a man had sexually assaulted a boy on two other occasions in the past month. A Glen Burnie man, 52, was charged with sexual abuse of a minor, three counts of second-degree assault and other violations. Anyone with information is asked to contact Detective Vincent Carbonaro at 410-222-3484.

Hospital Dr., 300 block, 1:40 a.m. Dec. 14. A male sexually assaulted a woman as they were walking from a bar on Crain Highway. They had met at the bar earlier in the evening. Anyone with information is asked to contact Detective Justin Widup at 410-222-3468.

WEAPON

Hideaway Loop Rd., 400 block, 1:20 p.m. Dec. 9. During a police traffic stop of a motorist, two knives, crack cocaine and marijuana were found. A Glen Burnie man, 35, was charged with possession of a dangerous and deadly weapon and marijuana, and possession of crack cocaine with intent to distribute. A 2011 Hyundai Sonata was seized.

ROBBERy

Pamela Rd., 400 block, 6:36 p.m. Dec. 13. A male hit a pedestrian in the face with an object, knocking him down. The assailant and another male robbed the pedestrian of cash, a cellphone and other items, then fled on foot toward Old Stage Road.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Crain Hwy., 7900 block, 3:36 a.m. Dec. 8. Police responded to an alarm at a hardware store and saw a male driving away in a Chevy Cavalier. The driver initially refused to stop but eventually got out of the vehicle. Power tools and other merchandise were discovered in the car. A Glen Burnie man, 48, was arrested and charged with second-degree burglary, theft, destruction of property and resisting arrest.

LAUREL AREA

DRUG-RELATED INCIDENT

Whiskey Bottom Rd. near Yellow Flower Rd., Dec. 10. Investigating a report, police found a group of males walking behind a business. One ran and threw down a bag containing 12 smaller bags of marijuana. An Upper Marlboro man, 20, was arrested and charged with possession of marijuana and resisting arrest.

ODENTON AREA

ROBBERIES

Breitwert and Oakton roads, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 10. Two juveniles were robbed of cash and a cellphone at knifepoint. During an investigation, the driver of a vehicle was stopped at Monterey Avenue and Murray Road. Three suspects were identified, and the cash and cell phone were recovered. Two Odenton men, 19 and 22, and a Gambrills man, 21, were arrested and charged with armed robbery and theft.

Conquest Dr., 2200 block, 12:58 a.m. Dec. 9. A group assaulted a pizza-delivery driver making a delivery. The driver dropped the food, then fled in his vehicle. Five people were charged with robbery and related offenses: a Glen Burnie man, 18, a Severn male, 17, two Odenton men, 20 and 18, and an Odenton woman, 19.

SEVERNA PARK AREA

ROBBERy

Redwood Rd., unit block, 8:50 p.m. Aug. 14. A male asked a resident for a bottle of water at a house, then forced his way into the residence at knifepoint. He robbed residents of cash, credit cards and car keys. He drove away in a resident's 2002 Mercury Grand Marquis. The car was found during an investigation at the Park Plaza Shopping Center. On Nov. 29, DNA evidence was used to identify a suspect. A Severna Park man, 42, was charged with robbery, assault and theft. He was incarcerated in Hagerstown for an unrelated burglary conviction.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Madison St., Dec. 8. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. The female escaped and ran into an apartment, where she called police. An Annapolis man, 29, was arrested Dec. 12 and charged with a third- and fourth-degree sexual offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULT

Cherry Grove Ave. S., 500 block, 1:45 a.m. Dec. 13. A pedestrian suffering from five stab wounds was taken to a hospital. The pedestrian refused to provide information about the incident.

ROBBERy

Washington St. W., unit block, 7 p.m. Nov. 18. A man attempted to rob a man and injured him. An Annapolis man, 42, was arrested Dec. 8 and charged with robbery, first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bay Ridge Ave., 700 block, 5:30 p.m. Dec. 9. A man took a purse from a vehicle while the owner was unloading the vehicle.

Boucher Ave., 900 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 10 to 9 a.m. Dec. 11. A digital media player, a navigator and a pair of sunglasses were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Boucher Ave., 900 block, 5 p.m. Dec. 10 to 9:30 a.m. Dec. 11. A jacket, sunglasses, tennis shoes and a battery charger were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Chesapeake Ave., unit block, 5 p.m. Nov. 17 to 7 a.m. Nov. 25. A miter saw and other property were stolen from an unlocked garage.

Lincoln Dr., 1900 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 10 to 8:45 a.m. Dec. 11. A front door was smashed at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Madison St., 1100 block, noon to 3 p.m. Dec. 14. A handgun and a video game console were stolen from a residence, which might have been entered through a balcony window.

Main St., 100 block, 7:58 p.m. Dec. 10. A man pretended to browse in a store and left with several hats.

Main St., 100 block, Dec. 13. A woman shoplifted several items from a pharmacy. A woman was located in the unit block of West Street with stolen items. An Annapolis woman, 41, was charged with theft.

Taylor Ave., 600 block, 8:30 p.m. Dec. 6 to 5:30 a.m. Dec. 7. A business foyer was entered by damaging a front-door lock. A locked interior door prevented entry to the main area of the business.

West St., 1800 block, 10 p.m. Dec. 9 to 7:30 a.m. Dec. 12. CDs, cash and papers were stolen from a truck entered by breaking a rear window.

West St., 1800 block, 2 a.m. to noon Dec. 11. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by smashing a window.

Sixth St., 400 block, 9 p.m. Dec. 8. Crab meat was stolen from a restaurant kitchen. A suspect was identified when a restaurant in the 400 block of Fourth Street reported a man entering its kitchen. Police arrived, and a man fled on foot while throwing several cans of crab meat. An Annapolis man, 51, was arrested and charged with theft.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Forest Dr., 1000 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 9. A vehicle was stolen after it was left with its engine running. The vehicle was found at 1:30 a.m. Dec. 10 in the 200 block of Janwall Street.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line at 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Macbeth Farm Lane, 12800 block, 9:30 to 10 p.m. Dec. 9. A safe containing cash, jewelry, stamps and collectible coins was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Moorland Dr., 7100 block, 4:30 to 6:30 p.m. Dec. 9. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Sandy Creek Ct., 6900 block, 2 to 8:30 p.m. Dec. 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a back door.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERy

Phelps Luck Dr., 5600 block, 6:07 p.m. Dec. 8. Three male teenagers on bicycles attacked a male on a scooter and robbed him of the scooter, headphones and cash. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Columbia Crossing Cir., 6200 block, 5:32 a.m. Dec. 10. Clothing was stolen from a store entered by breaking a side window.

Columbia Crossing Cir., 6200 block, 12:44 to 5:22 a.m. Dec. 12. Cash was stolen from a safe at a restaurant entered by forcing a door.

Cradlerock Way, 6800 block, 3:20 a.m. Dec. 10. Cash and a computer were stolen from a market entered by forcing a back door.

Emersons Reach, 9100 block, 10:53 p.m. Dec. 12. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by tampering with a back door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10800 block, 11:30 a.m. Dec. 12. A computer, a CD player and a router were stolen from a child-care center. There was no sign of forced entry.

Mission Rd., 8100 block, 5:40 to 10 p.m. Dec. 10. Diesel fuel was stolen from gas pumps at a secured lot.

Old Tucker Row,5400 block, 10:07 a.m. Dec. 12. A break-in occurred.

Winter Rose Path, 7100 block, 11 a.m. to noon Dec. 13. A laptop was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Launcelot Lane, 10300 block, 4:54 to 5:04 a.m. Dec. 12. A white 2010 Chevrolet pickup was stolen.

Rumsey Rd., 9200 block, 2:21 p.m. Dec. 10. A vehicle was stolen. It was found nearby with damage to the windshield and tires and with its air bags deployed.

ELKRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Green Field Rd., 6400 block, 12:53 a.m. Dec. 13. A gunman wearing a bandanna over his face robbed a person getting out of a vehicle of a wallet, a cellphone and a book bag.

Old Waterloo Rd., 6500 block, 10:12 p.m. Dec. 11. A gunman demanded cash at a convenience store, then fled empty-handed after a clerk showed that there was little in the cash register.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Forest Kelly Ct., 5900 block, 8:30 a.m. Dec. 7 to 11:05 a.m. Dec. 8. Cash and collectible coins were stolen from a residence entered by removing glass from a back door.

Montgomery Rd., 6300 block, 12:47 p.m. Dec. 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Aspern Dr., 6600 block, 5:03 p.m. Dec. 10. A blue 1994 Toyota Camry was stolen.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chestnut Farm Lane, 8300 block, 8 a.m. to 3:10 p.m. Dec. 8. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Longview Dr., 9800 block, 11:56 a.m. Dec. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Michael's Way, 9500 block, 11 a.m. to 4:50 p.m. Dec. 12. A gun, jewelry, a camera and cash were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Reynard Dr., 3500 block, Nov. 19 to Dec. 12. A residence was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

Winchester Lane E., 11500 block, 9:54 p.m. Dec. 12. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked back door. After being confronted by an acquaintance, the intruder fled empty-handed.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Long Gate Pkwy., 4400 block, 11:50 p.m. Dec. 10. A silver 2001 Chrysler Town and Country van was stolen.

GLENELG AREA

ROBBERy

Triadelphia Rd., 13700 block, 7:08 p.m. Dec. 11. Three males forced their way into a residence at gunpoint, tied up an occupant, then fled with cash from a safe.

GLENWOOD AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Glenwood Springs Dr., 2800 block, 5:23 p.m. Dec. 8. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen.

HANOVER AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Skipton Dr., 6400 block, Nov. 30. A black 1990 GMC Sierra was stolen.

JESSUP AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Patuxent Range Rd., 8200 block, 11:32 a.m. Dec. 12. An attempt was made to steal a van parked on a college campus.

Preston Ct., 8200 block, 3:17 p.m. Dec. 13. A 1998 Ford E-350 van was stolen from a business.

LAUREL AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Ridings Way, 9300 block, 8:23 a.m. Dec. 13. A 2000 Acura Integra was stolen.

SYKESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Underwood Rd., 1100 block, 6:15 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Dec. 8. A jar of coins was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Underwood Rd., 1100 block, 6:20 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Dec. 13. A laptop was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Underwood Rd.,1200 block, 12:45 to 2:30 p.m. Dec. 13. A residence was entered through an unlocked basement door. Nothing was reported missing.

WOODSTOCK AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Enfield Dr., 10800 block, 8:40 p.m. Dec. 13. A black Lincoln Navigator was stolen.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Washingtonpost.com


January 30, 2014 Thursday 8:14 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1832 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beaver Dam Rd.,Jan. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a home.  

DUNKIRK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maplewood Dr.,Jan 8 to Jan. 16. Nail guns, a generator and a carving kit were stolen from a shed behind a house.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Route 4,9:07 p.m. Jan. 17. A police officer sitting in his cruiser saw a man with a flashlight looking into vehicles, after which he then saw the man inside a vehicle. A Prince Frederick man, 26, was charged with rogue and vagabond and possession of burglary tools.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hoofbeat Trail,Jan. 13. Property in a home was stolen and damaged.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MF Bowen Rd., 6:16 p.m. Jan. 13. A house was entered through a rear window.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Patuxent Dr., 5:51 p.m. Jan. 15. Heating fuel was stolen from a tank.

Rose Ct.,Jan. 15 to Jan. 17. A circular saw and an air compressor were stolen from a vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site, www.ccso.us, has daily news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

BRYANS ROAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Heather Dr.,6900 block, Jan. 18. A man posted four chrome tire rims for sale on a Web site. Someone responded to the post and indicated that he was interested. A short time later, the rims were stolen. The incident was under investigation.

LA PLATA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Rd., Jan. 18 to Jan. 19. A stereo and four tires and rims were taken from a vehicle.

WALDORF AREA ROBBERIES

Heathcote Rd.,3000 block, 12:04 a.m. Jan. 19. Two teenagers were robbed at gunpoint of cellphones and cash. The robbers fled in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holly Auto Center Lane,Jan. 20. Electronic items were stolen from a vehicle parked near an auto repair shop.

Sherman Rd.,100 block, 3 to 7:30 p.m. Jan. 20. Several guns, a computer and some games were taken from a home.

Washington Sq.,12000 block, Jan. 18 to Jan. 20. An attempt was made to steal a stereo from a vehicle parked near an auto repair shop.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS

Leonardtown,Jan. 16. During a fight at a detention center, an inmate threw a cup of liquid on a fellow inmate. A man, 49, was charged with second-degree assault of an inmate.

Leonardtown, Jan. 21. During a basketball game at a detention center, an inmate hit another inmate in the face. A Clinton man, 38, was charged with second-degree assault of an inmate.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Lexington Park,Jan. 19. During an argument, a man shoved a female acquaintance against a shower door. The man followed the woman into a bedroom, forced her to the floor and got on her back. The woman was seven months pregnant. A Lusby man, 25, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

Midway Dr., Jan. 21. During an argument, a man pushed an acquaintance onto a bed, and they struggled, causing injury. A Lexington Park man, 27, was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Mechanicsville,Jan. 19. A woman, 19, was at a party at a home when she was sexually assaulted by a man, who then fled. A Mechanicsville man, 18, was charged with second-degree rape.

ASSAULTS

Mechanicsville,Jan. 19. During an argument, a man punched an acquaintance in the face and burned the acquaintance with a cigarette. The man also grabbed a juvenile by the neck. A Mechanicsville man, 33, was charged with second-degree assault and child abuse and second-degree assault by a custodian.

WILDEWOOD AREA ASSAULTS

Three Notch Rd., Jan. 22. While being arrested in connection with a protective order, a woman allegedly kicked a deputy in the face. A Ridge woman, 23, was charged with second-degree assault of a law enforcement officer, violation of a protective order and resisting arrest.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beaver Dam Rd.,Jan. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a home.

DUNKIRK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maplewood Dr.,Jan 8 to Jan. 16. Nail guns, a generator and a carving kit were stolen from a shed behind a house.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Route 4,9:07 p.m. Jan. 17. A police officer sitting in his cruiser saw a man with a flashlight looking into vehicles, after which he then saw the man inside a vehicle. A Prince Frederick man, 26, was charged with rogue and vagabond and possession of burglary tools.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hoofbeat Trail,Jan. 13. Property in a home was stolen and damaged.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MF Bowen Rd., 6:16 p.m. Jan. 13. A house was entered through a rear window.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Patuxent Dr., 5:51 p.m. Jan. 15. Heating fuel was stolen from a tank.

Rose Ct.,Jan. 15 to Jan. 17. A circular saw and an air compressor were stolen from a vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site, www.ccso.us, has daily news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

BRYANS ROAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Heather Dr.,6900 block, Jan. 18. A man posted four chrome tire rims for sale on a Web site. Someone responded to the post and indicated that he was interested. A short time later, the rims were stolen. The incident was under investigation.

LA PLATA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Rd., Jan. 18 to Jan. 19. A stereo and four tires and rims were taken from a vehicle.

WALDORF AREA ROBBERIES

Heathcote Rd.,3000 block, 12:04 a.m. Jan. 19. Two teenagers were robbed at gunpoint of cellphones and cash. The robbers fled in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holly Auto Center Lane,Jan. 20. Electronic items were stolen from a vehicle parked near an auto repair shop.

Sherman Rd.,100 block, 3 to 7:30 p.m. Jan. 20. Several guns, a computer and some games were taken from a home.

Washington Sq.,12000 block, Jan. 18 to Jan. 20. An attempt was made to steal a stereo from a vehicle parked near an auto repair shop.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS

Leonardtown,Jan. 16. During a fight at a detention center, an inmate threw a cup of liquid on a fellow inmate. A man, 49, was charged with second-degree assault of an inmate.

Leonardtown, Jan. 21. During a basketball game at a detention center, an inmate hit another inmate in the face. A Clinton man, 38, was charged with second-degree assault of an inmate.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Lexington Park,Jan. 19. During an argument, a man shoved a female acquaintance against a shower door. The man followed the woman into a bedroom, forced her to the floor and got on her back. The woman was seven months pregnant. A Lusby man, 25, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

Midway Dr., Jan. 21. During an argument, a man pushed an acquaintance onto a bed, and they struggled, causing injury. A Lexington Park man, 27, was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Mechanicsville,Jan. 19. A woman, 19, was at a party at a home when she was sexually assaulted by a man, who then fled. A Mechanicsville man, 18, was charged with second-degree rape.

ASSAULTS

Mechanicsville,Jan. 19. During an argument, a man punched an acquaintance in the face and burned the acquaintance with a cigarette. The man also grabbed a juvenile by the neck. A Mechanicsville man, 33, was charged with second-degree assault and child abuse and second-degree assault by a custodian.

WILDEWOOD AREA ASSAULTS

Three Notch Rd., Jan. 22. While being arrested in connection with a protective order, a woman allegedly kicked a deputy in the face. A Ridge woman, 23, was charged with second-degree assault of a law enforcement officer, violation of a protective order and resisting arrest.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

246 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


June 3, 2001 Sunday  
Final Edition


CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 229 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police.  

For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, 5:50 p.m. May 11. A man, 35, stole license plates from a vehicle and put them on another vehicle. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

LEONARDTOWN, 10:20 a.m. May 24. A man, 21, in District Court for sentencing, fled the courtroom after the penalty was imposed, knocking down a court employee. He was charged with second-degree assault and escape.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

SPRING VALLEY CT., 11 p.m. May 25 to 6:57 a.m. May 26. Two tires on a vehicle were cut.

THREE NOTCH RD., 11 p.m. May 22 to 6:30 a.m. May 23. Obscenities were written on the door of Spring Ridge Middle School and benches and signs were knocked over.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

PINEY POINT, 2 a.m. May 28. A man, 37, sexually assaulted a male youth, 14, while he was sleeping. The man had supplied the youth and several other juveniles with alcohol and marijuana. He was charged with third-degree sex offense, second-degree assault and possession of marijuana.

-- Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: June 3, 2001


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DOCUMENT-TYPE: LIST


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

The Washington Post


February 2, 2012 Thursday  
Every Edition


Montgomery County crime report 


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1977 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, Inc., a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Rockville Pike, 1500 block, 9:17 p.m. Jan. 14. A man groped a person at a retail store. A 32-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Lawrence Dr., 300 block, 8:50 p.m. Jan. 15. Two men armed with a weapon threatened a person and fled with property. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Congressional Lane, 200 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 15 to 1:01 a.m. Jan. 16. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Gude Dr. E., 700 block, 7:45 to 9:30 p.m. Jan. 12. Three vehicle break-ins occurred. A 41-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested.

Ivy League Lane, 600 block, 4 to 4:30 a.m. Jan. 11. Property was stolen from two residences.

Little Tree Ct., 13900 block, 11:59 p.m. Jan. 13 to 7:29 a.m. Jan. 14. An iPod was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Loblolly Terr., 14000 block, 1 a.m. Jan. 13 to 10 a.m. Jan. 14. Two cellphones and an iPod were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Middle Rd., 12300 block, 7 p.m. Jan. 11 to 8:25 a.m. Jan. 12. A Global Positioning System device, a stereo and speakers were among property stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Preserve Pkwy., unit block, 8:45 to 9 p.m. Jan. 13. A vehicle break-in occurred near a restaurant.

Randolph Rd., 5200 block, Jan. 11. Two men distracted a person with a scam in a grocery store, then fled with property.

Safe Harbor Ct., 13700 block, 11:25 p.m. Jan. 13 to 11:25 a.m. Jan. 14. A pair of sunglasses and a cellphone accessory were stolen from a vehicle.

Selfridge Rd., 12200 block, 12:01 to 7 a.m. Jan. 14. An attempt was made to break into a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Elmcroft Blvd., 400 block, Jan. 9 to 17. A golf cart was stolen from an apartment complex.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATION301-652-9200

ROBBERIES

Nicholson Lane, 5200 block, 10:30 p.m. Jan. 12. A man wearing a mask robbed a pizza restaurant at gunpoint.

Nicholson Lane, 5200 block, 8:10 p.m. Jan. 14. A man wearing a mask robbed a sandwich shop of property.

Rockville Pike, 11800 block, 8:30 p.m. Jan. 17. Two males armed with a weapon and wearing scarves over their faces robbed a coffee shop of property.

Weymouth St., 10500 block, 6:55 p.m. Jan. 15. Two men armed with a weapon and wearing masks robbed a motorist of a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Battery Lane, 4800 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:10 p.m. Jan. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Dorset Ave., 5300 block, 6 to 11:30 a.m. Jan. 12. Property was stolen from outside a residence.

Fairfax Rd., 6800 block, 5:30 p.m. Jan. 13. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Goldsboro Rd., 5400 block, 9:30 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. Jan. 16. Property was stolen from outside a residence.

River Road area, Nov 1 to Jan. 24. Copper gutters and downspouts were stolen from more than 20 residences in Potomac, Rockville and Bethesda. Police said that in several of the incidents, a light brown pickup truck has been seen in the area and that some men who were confronted with the stolen property said that they were working for a gutter company.

Saul Rd., 3600 block, 9:30 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Jan. 12. Property was stolen from outside a residence.

Warwick Pl., 5500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 4:15 p.m. Jan. 12. Property was stolen from a residence.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 3344 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Preserve Pkwy., unit block, 10 p.m. Feb. 2. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance at a restaurant.

ASSAULTS

White Cliff Terr., 7800 block, 12:22 p.m. Feb. 1. An aggravated assault occurred. A 25-year-old Silver Spring woman was arrested. 

ROBBERIES

Waringwood Way, 20100 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 7 to 4 p.m. Feb. 8. A vehicle was stolen.

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police D epartment. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore Rd., 400 block, 10:25 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. Feb. 4. A 33-year-old man was arrested Feb. 12 in connection with a first-degree burglary that occurred at the reported time and location.

Casey Lane, 500 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 8 to 6:15 a.m. Feb. 10. A knife, a tool kit, loose change and several CDs were stolen from a vehicle.

Highwood Rd., 1200 block, 12:48 p.m. Feb. 10. Two males, ages 15 and 16, and two females, both 14, were arrested and charged with fourth-degree burglary. A 16-year-old male was charged with resisting arrest.

Research Ct., unit block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 12 to 6 a.m. Feb. 13. A backpack containing clothing was stolen from a vehicle.

Southlawn Ct., unit block, Dec. 22 to Jan. 13. On Feb. 6, a 21-year-old man was arrested and charged with second- and fourth-degree burglary, theft and malicious destruction of property in connection with three incidents that occurred at the reported time and location.

Washington St. N., 400 block, 2:40 to 4:23 p.m. Feb. 11. A laptop and an iPod were reported stolen from a vehicle.

OTHER ARRESTS

Hungerford Dr. and Beall Ave. , 9 to 9:30 a.m. Feb. 11. A 29-year-old man was arrested for possession of marijuana and paraphernalia, disorderly conduct, resisting arrest, obstructing and hindering a police investigation and failing to obey a lawful order.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents recently reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

Maple Ave., 7500 block, 1:30 p.m. Feb. 8. A 29-year-old man was arrested on an open warrant for assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Allegheny Ave., 6700 block, 9:30 a.m. Feb. 7. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Carroll Ave., 7500 block, 1:04 p.m. Feb. 10. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Flower Ave., 8500 block, 6:30 a.m. Feb. 9. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

New Hampshire Ave., 6800 block, 5:52 a.m. Feb. 10. Two males pried open a front door to a business, took property and fled.

Piney Branch Rd., 7400 block, 9:58 a.m. Feb. 12. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Piney Branch Rd., 8400 block, 6:17 p.m. Feb. 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Ritchie Ave., unit block, 4:19 p.m. Feb. 10. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Sligo Creek Pkwy., 8500 block, 6:16 p.m. Feb. 10. A residence was entered by force through a basement. Nothing was reported missing.

Takoma Ave., 700 block, 10:29 a.m. Feb. 12. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

University Blvd., 1100 block, 7:20 a.m. Feb. 10. Three males entered a business by force, took property and fled.

Walnut Ave., unit block, 1:30 p.m. Feb. 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force through a front door.

Westmoreland Ave., 6900 block, 3:57 p.m. Feb. 7. Property left on a front porch was stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Eastridge Ave. and Wabash Ave. , 11:01 p.m. Feb. 13. A 29-year-old man was arrested in connection with auto theft, theft over $10,000 and traffic offenses.

Flower Ave., 8500 block, 11:43 a.m. Feb. 10. A 48-year-old man was arrested in connection with auto theft and related charges.

Holton Lane, 1300 block, 1:17 a.m. Feb. 11. A male stole a gray 2013 Toyota Highlander while it was being cleaned at a car wash.

Roanoke Ave., 8200 block, 2:30 a.m. Feb. 13. A green 2005 Ford F350 pickup truck was stolen when it was left unattended in a parking lot with the engine running.

OTHER ARRESTS

New Hampshire Ave., 7300 block, midnight Feb. 12. A 47-year-old man was arrested for driving a rental vehicle in violation of the rental agreement.

University Blvd., 1100 block, 12:23 a.m. Feb. 11. A 51-year-old man was arrested for forgery, identity theft and driving without a license.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 811 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fettler Park Dr., Jan. 31. A man allegedly sexually assaulted a female patient in September 2012. A 44-year-old Purcellville man was arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Piedmont Vista Dr., 14600 block, 2:30 a.m. Feb. 2. Several golf carts at a golf club were damaged.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Launch Cir., Feb. 1. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 57-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 4:01 p.m. Feb. 4. A group of male juveniles assaulted a male juvenile, who was cut several times with pocketknives. Two Manassas males, 16 and 17, were arrested.

ROBBERIES

Miramar Dr., 7300 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 29. A group of male juveniles attempted to pull two male juvenile pedestrians behind a building. One of the pedestrians was able to flee. The group assaulted the other pedestrian and robbed him at knifepoint. Three Manassas males, 14, 15 and 16, were arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barnette Cir., 18900 block, Dec. 11, Jan. 27 and Feb. 2. A residence was entered on three occasions. Cash, a purse and jewelry were reported stolen.

Mockingbird Heights Rd., 19200 block, 5 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Feb. 3. Several handguns, ammunition and DVDs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Cordell Ave., 3800 block, 9:51 p.m. Feb. 2. A man entered an acquaintance's residence through a window and hid in a closet. When a female resident entered the room, he grabbed her by the neck and held a broken bottle to her face. When she yelled, the man fled empty-handed. A 31-year-old man was arrested.

Guilford Lane, 4100 block, 10:30 p.m. Jan. 30. During an argument, a woman retrieved a knife and cut a male acquaintance on the arm. A 53-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

Otto Rd. and Opal Lane, 3:02 a.m. Feb. 1. Gunshots were heard. No injuries were reported.

Quade Lane, 13000 block, 12:54 a.m. Feb. 1. Investigating a report of a stabbing, police officers went to a residence and heard a gunshot. They were unable to locate the source of the gunfire but found a man who had accidentally cut himself with a knife during an altercation with another person. No other injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Bayside Ave., 1400 block, 8:47 p.m. Jan. 29. Four males assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of cash and a backpack.

Oscar Ct., 6200 block, 11:07 p.m. Jan. 30. Three women in a vehicle picked up a male passenger near Dale Boulevard and Hoadly Road. The man told the driver to drive to Oscar Court, where he robbed them of a wallet at gunpoint. He fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Augustus Ct., 12900 block, 4:40 a.m. Feb. 2. A man tried to enter a residence through a front door. He fled when a resident shouted at him.

Bjork Lane, 12900 block, 3:30 p.m. Jan. 31 to 9:55 a.m. Feb. 2. A laptop computer, a computer tablet and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Evansport Pl., 12800 block, 4:33 a.m. Feb. 2. A man tried to enter a residence through a basement door. He fled when a resident saw him. A 21-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

G St., 1400 block, noon Jan. 29 to 8 p.m. Jan. 30. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 17000 block, 7 p.m. Jan. 28 to 8:30 a.m. Jan. 29. Electronic hair clippers were stolen from a business entered through a rear door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crozier Dr., 8400 block, 5:30 p.m. Feb. 2 to 7:25 a.m. Feb. 3. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

Euclid Ave., 9000 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 1 to noon Feb. 2. Two diagnostic machines were stolen from a business.

Liberia Ave., 9900 block, 6 to 7:45 p.m. Jan. 29. Purses were stolen from two vehicles entered by breaking windows.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Whispering Pine Ct., 9000 block, 3:22 to 3:42 a.m. Feb. 2. A white 1998 Toyota Camry was stolen.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holden Dr., 7 p.m. Feb. 2 to 2 p.m. Feb. 3. Cash, candy and cases of soft drinks were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Manassas Dr., 11:50 a.m. Jan. 26 to 9:47 a.m. Jan. 27. Someone threw eggs and wrote on a vehicle.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 875 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Bristow and Nokesville roads, 11:30 p.m. April 30. A male motorist offered a ride to a woman, then sexually assaulted her before driving her home. A 47-year-old West Virginia man was arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Banks Ct., 2800 block, 9:58 p.m. May 3. Four men assaulted a male pedestrian, who was treated for injuries. 

Denali Pl. and Acadia Dr., 5:54 p.m. April 28. A group of males assaulted a male pedestrian, then fled in three vehicles. The man was treated for injuries.

Reservoir Loop and Hourglass Dr., 11:45 p.m. April 30. A group of males assaulted two male juvenile pedestrians, who were treated for injuries.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashby Grove Loop, 6400 block, 11:01 p.m. April 27. A man attempted to enter a residence by crawling under a partially opened garage door. The man fled empty-handed when a resident confronted him.

Thoroughfare Rd., 15400 block, 10:30 a.m. April 28 to 10:15 a.m. April 30. Four guns were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door. A fire was also started in the house, causing damage.

HAYMARKET AREA

ASSAULTS

Kanawha Way, 10:30 a.m. April 25. A male juvenile assaulted a female relative, prevented her from leaving a residence and broke a door. A 14-year-old boy was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bencrest Way, 5700 block, 7 p.m. April 28 to 1 a.m. April 29. Golf clubs were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

LAKE RIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Inglebrook Dr., 1900 block, 3 to 4:30 a.m. April 27. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Portsmouth Rd., 10000 block, 8:17 p.m. May 1. A man abducted a female acquaintance from a parking lot, took her to a residence and raped her. A 34-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Margate Ct., 7500 block, 6:11 p.m. April 28. Two men assaulted two male pedestrians. One of the men held a knife to the throat of one of the pedestrians, then both men fled. Two Manassas men, 20 and 21, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Battleview Pkwy., 10500 block, 7 a.m. April 26 to 1:30 p.m. April 27. Someone attempted to enter a building by prying a fire door.

Chaddsford Terr., 13000 block, 10:47 a.m. April 27. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear basement door.

Prince Charles Ct., 7400 block, 1:18 a.m. April 28. A man attempted to enter a residence. When a resident confronted him, the man fled empty-handed.

Williamson Blvd., 7300 block, noon April 23 to 10 a.m. April 24. A TV was stolen from a hotel room.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Belle Grae Dr., 7500 block, 11:18 p.m. April 24 to 7:20 p.m. April 25. A residence was entered through an unlocked front door, and a vehicle key was taken. The key was then used to take a 2004 Infiniti G35.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fuller Heights Rd., 19000 block, 4 a.m. to 4 p.m. April 26. Cash and electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a bedroom window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Beaumont Rd., 5:33 p.m. April 27. A man raped a female juvenile acquaintance. A 29-year-old man was arrested.

Wadsworth Way, 5:35 p.m. May 2. A man raped a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. A 22-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Brookville Lane, 3500 block, 8:50 p.m. May 3. Five male juveniles assaulted a man, who was treated for injuries.

James St., 1500 block, 3:47 a.m. May 1. A man entered a residence by breaking a window to unlock a door, then assaulted a female acquaintance. He fled with her phone.

Marina Way, 13100 block, 1:56 a.m. April 30. A group of men assaulted a man, who was treated for injuries. Less than two hours later, gunshots were heard.

WEAPONS

Fairhope Rd., 3800 block, April 4 to April 27. Someone fired BBs at a residence, hitting a front window.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Acorn Ct., 3000 block, 6:34 p.m. April 26. Someone attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door.

Anchorstone Dr., 5000 block, 2 p.m. April 20 to 1 p.m. April 28. Electronics were stolen from a residence.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14500 block, 9 p.m. April 26 to 6:45 a.m. April 27. Tires were stolen from three vehicles at a business, and three other vehicles were entered by breaking windows.

Langer Lane, 4800 block, 7:15 a.m. to 2:15 p.m. April 27. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Lynwood Dr., 5000 block, 5:44 a.m. April 28. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door. He fled empty-handed when a female resident on a couch woke up.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enterprise Ct., 9200 block, 1:30 a.m. April 14 to 9 a.m. April 28. License plate tags were stolen from a vehicle.

Holmes Pl., 9700 block, April 13. An MP3 player was stolen from a vehicle that had been towed.

Market St., 100 block, April 28. A camera and a wallet were stolen from an unlocked residence.

Polk Dr., 100 block, 11:30 p.m. April 23. Two teenagers stole a mountain bike.

Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 447 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JEROME'S NECK RD., 6 p.m. May 5 to 4 p.m. May 8. A cell phone and gasoline were stolen from a vehicle.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

GREAT MILLS, May 11. A man, 18, and a male youth, 13, sexually assaulted a mentally disabled girl, 11, on various occasions. They were charged with second- and third-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

HOLLYWOOD, 9:50 p.m. May 9. A man, 29, assaulted a female and damaged a vehicle at the residence on March 18. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, various times in May. A man, 24, broke into garages and stole property. He was charged with two counts of second-degree burglary, theft of more than $ 300 and theft less than $ 300.

ASSAULTS

ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH RD., 8:03 p.m. May 12. Two men, 37 and 25, assaulted each other. Each was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LAWRENCE AVE., 10:30 p.m. May 12. A man, 39, performed a sexual act and had intercourse with a girl, 11. He was charged with second-degree rape, second- and third-degree sex offense, child abuse and possession of marijuana and paraphernalia.

ARSON

ROGERS DR., 12:22 a.m. May 15. Two Molotov cocktails were thrown into the back yard of a residence.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 2:37 a.m. May 11. A man, 28, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SUBURBAN DR., 4:21 p.m. May 13. A woman, 56, assaulted a man at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

WINDING WAY, 6:53 a.m. May 11. The front and side windows of a vehicle were broken.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, March 1 to May 10. A man, 27, stole a checkbook from a woman, 31, and forged her signature to obtain about $ 3,700. He was charged with theft of more than $ 500.

MIDWAY DR., 9:30 a.m. May 13. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

MECHANICSVILLE, May 9. A man, 19, broke a window at a residence on Feb. 27. He was charged with malicious destruction of property less than $ 500.

ARSON

PINEY POINT RD., May 14. Two youths, ages 12 and 10, set fire to Swann's Hotel. They were charged with first-degree arson.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HEWITT RD., 6 to 6:30 a.m. May 8 and 6 to 6:30 a.m. May 9. Money was stolen from an unlocked residence.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 2049 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Shady Grove Metro Station area,1 a.m. July 28. A sexual assault occurred in a residence. The people involved are acquainted.

ROBBERIES

Bou Ave., 5700 block, 6:24 p.m. July 26. A male and a female assaulted and tried to rob a person near a craft store. A District male, 13, and a female, 14, of unknown address, were arrested. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cambridge St., 16800 block, 7 p.m. July 28 to 8:30 a.m. July 29. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Cervantes Ave., 14600 block, July 28 to July 29. Property was stolen from a shed on residential property. The shed was entered by force.

Dunleith St., 14800 block, July 22 to July 24. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Frederick Rd., 15800 block, 8 p.m. July 24 to 7 a.m. July 25. Property was stolen from a dry cleaning business. There was no sign of forced entry.

Outpost Dr., 10900 block, 1:50 to 2 a.m. July 23. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

Travilah Rd., 14000 block, July 29 to July 30. Property was stolen from a pizza restaurant entered by force.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

Hungerford Dr., 700 block, 10:37 a.m. July 27. A man assaulted a person at a grocery store. A Wheaton man, 23, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Grubb Rd., 8300 block, July 29 to July 30. Property was stolen from a catering company entered by force.

Jolly Way, 10900 block, July 26 to July 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Parklawn Dr., 11700 block, 4 to 5 p.m. July 24. Property was removed from a purse.

Pembroke Terr., 5500 block, July 26. An attempted break-in was reported at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Symphony Park Dr., 10800 block, 3:30 to 5:30 p.m. July 25. Property was stolen from two businesses.

West Virginia Ave., 4400 block, 2:15 a.m. July 27. A GPS device was stolen from a vehicle.

16th St., 8600 block, July 29 to July 30. A tablet computer was among items stolen in connection with three vehicle break-ins overnight.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-565-7740

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Fidler Lane, 1100 block, 3:45 p.m. July 25. A male exposed himself and fled on foot.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 624 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Barnacle Pl., 5000 block, 4:05 p.m. Nov. 18. During an argument, a woman cut a male acquaintance with a knife. A 25-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

American Elm, 17200 block, 4:36 a.m. Nov. 16. Four unlocked vehicles were entered. Nothing was reported missing. 

Yorktown Dr., 15400 and 15500 blocks, 11 p.m. Nov. 15 to 2 a.m. Nov. 16. Two cameras and cash were stolen from an unlocked vehicle. Nothing was reported missing from six other unlocked vehicles entered.

GAINESVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Old Linton Hall Rd., 7500 block, 12:31 a.m. Nov. 20. A man attacked a woman who had gotten into his vehicle, then tried to prevent her from leaving. A 44-year-old Gainesville man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Winfield Loop, 10500 block, 3:25 a.m. Nov. 20. A man wearing a uniform and displaying a badge sexually assaulted a woman, then fled to a nearby home. A 52-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Sudley Rd., 7400 block, 2:38 p.m. Nov. 19. Three women attacked a woman outside a restaurant. The victim said that they had argued with her earlier, inside the restaurant. No serious injuries were reported.

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 5:22 p.m. Nov. 17. A man argued with an acquaintance inside a store, then struck him with a baseball bat in the parking lot. The victim was taken to a hospital. A 19-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Balls Ford Rd., 10800 block, 9:18 p.m. Nov. 18. A bank was robbed by a woman who implied that she had a handgun.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 2:53 a.m. Nov. 20. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance as she approached her vehicle in a parking lot. A 38-year-old Stafford man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Aldrin St., 13200 block, 11:30 p.m. Nov. 19. During an argument, a man punched a male acquaintance in the face several times. A 29-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested.

Kirkdale Dr., 4700 block, 2:38 p.m. Nov. 16. During an argument, a group of males attacked an 18-year-old man. A 17-year-old Woodbridge male was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Cressida Pl., 4100 block, 3:58 p.m. Nov. 17. At a meeting to conduct an Internet sales transaction, a man robbed a man of a cellphone at gunpoint.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 5:59 p.m. Nov. 15. A male snatched a cellphone from a woman, then fled on foot.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 11:39 a.m. Nov. 18. Three males threatened a man getting off a bus and tried to rob him of a cellphone, then fled with its battery when the device broke after being dropped.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Langstone Dr., 13800 block, 7 a.m. to noon Nov. 16. A TV, a laptop, jewelry and other electronics were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chervil Ct., 10200 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 15. Responding to a report of an attempted break-in, police confronted a man in the back yard of a residence. The man threw a pair of pliers at police and struggled with officers during his arrest. A 47-year-old Culpeper man was charged with two counts of assault on a law enforcement officer, resisting arrest by force, breaking and entering and possession of tools used in a burglary.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Scott Dr., 12:30 to 9 a.m. Nov. 13. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T13


LENGTH: 376 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, 9 a.m. Dec. 3. A girl, 16, stole property from an employee at the Walden Sierra House. She was charged with theft less than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHARLOTTE HALL, 7:20 a.m. Nov. 26 to 9:30 a.m. Nov. 27. License plates were stolen from a vehicle parked at a commuter parking lot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DAMERON, 6 p.m. Nov. 30. A man, 19, used a stolen calling card to make phone calls. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

HOLLYWOOD, 11:50 a.m. Dec. 2. A man, 23, raped a female youth, 17, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree rape.

HOMICIDES

LEONARDTOWN, Nov. 25 to Nov. 28. Two men, both 21, provided shelter and clothing to two men who were wanted in connection with the shooting death of a Leonardtown man. They were charged with accessory to first- and second-degree murder.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BALDRIDGE ST., Oct. 30 to Nov. 29. A lectern was stolen from the county maintenance building.

LEONARDTOWN, 3:25 a.m. Dec. 1. A man, 19, was caught inside a residence with property belonging to the owners. He was charged with first-degree burglary and theft.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 11:49 a.m. Nov. 25. A man, 40, and a woman, 32, assaulted each other. Both were charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, 10 p.m. Nov. 20 to 6:45 a.m. Nov. 26. A brick was thrown through the window of an elementary school to gain entry. Money was stolen from a snack box.

ASSAULTS

MRS. GRAVES RD., 4:15 a.m. Dec. 5. A man, 31, shot another man, 23, in the face with a handgun. He then fled on foot to a neighbor's house. Three children were removed from the residence and a search was made. The man was found dead on the back porch of the residence with a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head. The victim was listed in critical condition at Washington Hospital Center.

-- Bonnie Smith

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1991 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

No report was available from the Rockville Station for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Hungerford Dr., 600 block, 10:48 a.m. to 3:35 p.m. June 19. A 36-year-old man was arrested. Charges included theft and credit-card fraud.

Julian Pl., 1000 block, 8:30 p.m. June 18 to 4:40 a.m. June 19. A DVD player, a GPS unit and a cellphone charger were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

King Farm Blvd., 100 block, 1 p.m. June 21 to 8:30 p.m. June 22. In two separate incidents, GPS units were stolen from unlocked vehicles.

Lincoln Ave., 300 block, 9 to 10:45 p.m. June 22. A 50-year-old woman was arrested for burglary and stalking.

Mannakee St., unit block, 11:35 a.m. June 21. A cellphone was stolen from a restroom at a college.

Montgomery Ave. W., 1200 block, 12:01 a.m. June 17 to 8:49 p.m. June 18. A concrete polisher, a grinder, a vacuum cleaner and an edger were among property stolen from a trailer entered by force.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

New Hampshire Ave., 6800 block, 2:21 a.m. June 24. Following an incident, a 21-year-old woman was arrested. Charges included assault, disorderly conduct and public intoxication.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Buffalo Ave., 7400 block, 8:34 p.m. June 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a back door.

Maple Ave., 7500 block, 4:30 p.m. June 25. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Fourth Ave., 6400 block, 11:39 a.m. June 25. A bicycle was stolen from beneath a porch at a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Circle Ave., 400 block, 6:44 a.m. June 22. A silver-colored 2002 Mercedes-Benz ML320 was stolen from a driveway at a residence.

- Compiled by Lisa M. Bolton

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ13


LENGTH: 1993 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GAINSBORO RD., 1900 block, Jan. 11. A 44-year-old man turned himself in to police to face charges of second-degree assault and theft over $500 in connection with an attempted rape of a woman at a motel in Gaithersburg. While she was in a hospital, numerous items were stolen from her home.

PARKLAWN TERRACE, 4:50 a.m. March 22. A man got out of his parked vehicle and grabbed a 20-year-old woman who was walking through an apartment driveway on her way to work. He grabbed her in a sexual manner, and pushed her against a tree. The woman used pepper spray on the man and escaped. 

ROBBERIES

NATIVE DANCER, 1 to 100 block, 10:18 p.m. March 24. A man armed with a knife in a basement at a party demanded cash from a 22-year-old Clarksburg man. The Clarksburg man refused and the man punched him in the eye, causing an injury, while a second assailant went through the man's pockets.

PARKLAND DR., 13900 block, 12:30 a.m. March 17. A woman smashed a window to break into a home and demanded money from residents. Officers arrived and arrested a 21-year-old woman. She was charged with possessing burglary tools, disorderly conduct, disorderly intoxication, malicious destruction of property under $500, and resisting arrest.

WOOTTON PKWY., 2100 block, 3:35 p.m. March 22. A 14-year-old Gaithersburg youth was arrested and charged with strong arm robbery in connection with a robbery of a calculator of a fellow student across the street from a high school.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CARROLTON RD., 14700 block, 6 a.m. to 1:49 p.m. Feb. 22. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

VEIRS MILL RD., 12200 block, 3:15 a.m. March 23 to 3:35 a.m. March 28. Property was stolen from a thrift store entered by force.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

MACARTHUR BLVD., 6000 block, 11:45 p.m. March 25. Two Washington, D.C. women, ages 22 and 23 reported being picked up by two men and driven to a private residence with a private access driveway. When they arrived, one of the men pulled out a gun and demanded the women get out of the car. They refused and he threatened to kill them. The women fled the vehicle and escaped by running into the woods.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

STEWART LANE AREA, 1 a.m. March 28. A 19-year-old Silver Spring woman and an 18-year-old Burtonsville woman reported that one of them had been raped by a 23-year-old male acquaintance who had picked them up at the above location. An investigation was continuing.

ASSAULTS

MOUNT PISGAH RD., 9700 block, 3:45 a.m. March 22. A 22-year-old man was arrested and charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment in connection with a domestic violence assault at a residence in the 12500 block of Montclair Rd.

THAYER AVE., 900 block, 9:02 p.m. March 22. An intoxicated man attempted to buy beer at a beer-and-wine store. A clerk refused to sell it to him, and the man left the store. Shortly thereafter, he returned with two others, pulled out a knife and made slashing motions toward the clerk. The three fled the scene.

ROBBERIES

RHAPSODY LANE AREA, 4:55 p.m. March 22. Two males in a car were blocking a lane with their vehicle and got into an argument with a 62 year-old man. One of the males pulled out a gun and demanded the man's wallet. He complied, and the two males sped off in an unknown direction.

WAYNE AVENUE AND RAMSEY AVENUE, 4:05 p.m. March 26. A male and a female purchased a hot dog from a female street vendor across from an upper Metro station parking lot, and left without paying. The vendor ran after them, and was then robbed of the cash from her apron. The robbers fled in the direction of the Metro trains.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREENERY LANE, 2300 block, midnight March 14 to noon March 24. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

HERMITAGE AVE., 2100 block, 8 a.m. March 4 to 8 a.m. March 24. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WATERGATE RD., 15100 block, 1:30 a.m. March 21. An attempt was made to enter a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

WOODSIDE PKWY., 1200 block, 3 p.m. March 5 to 3 p.m. March 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 4 Wheaton Station Telephone: 240-773-5500

ROBBERIES

AMHERST AVE., 2100 block, 8:45 p.m. March 19. Four or five males confronted a 23-year-old Wheaton man walking past a bus stop. One of the males demanded money from the man, punched him in the face and took property. The group then ran up University Boulevard toward Georgia Avenue.

GEORGIA AVE., 14200 block, 9:30 p.m. March 12. Three males wearing black sweatshirts, hats and blue jeans attacked a 37-year-old man walking between two apartment complexes. They forced him into the woods between the complexes, forced him to the ground and took property. They fled on foot through the center of one of the apartment complexes.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HYDE RD., 800 block, 4 to 6 p.m. March 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SHERRIE LANE, 11400 block, noon to 2:50 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence.

District 5 Germantown Station Telephone: 301-840-2650

ROBBERIES

GUNNERFIELD LAKE AREA, midnight March 27. Three to four males jumped a 22-year-old man after he left a restaurant and was walking home along the lake. They took cash and property then fled. The man reportedly refused medical treatment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BAY LEAF WAY, 18500 block, 12:33 a.m. March 28. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

MAIN ST., 9880 block, 9:45 p.m. March 27 to 9:49 a.m. March 28. Property was stolen from a stained glass shop entered by force.

QUEENS CROSS LANE, 19000 block, 1:01 a.m. Oct. 1, 2006 to 1:01 a.m. Nov. 30, 2006. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SPARKLING WATER DR., 18800 block, 1:01 a.m. Feb. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

THYME CT., 13000 block, 12:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. March 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

ROYAL WOODS CT., 10300 block, 6:08 p.m. March 28. A 15-year-old girl reported that she was raped by a male who lured her into the woods March 26. The male lied and said he had a girlfriend who was hurt and lying well back in the woods. The girl believed him and agreed to help. She was raped by the male when they entered the woods. An investigation was continuing.

SUNNYSIDE CT., 1 to 100 block, 11:03 p.m. March 22. A thin male grabbed a 55-year-old woman in front of her residence by the shoulders and touched her inappropriately. The woman screamed and the male fled.

ASSAULTS

FREDERICK AVE. S., 500 block, 6:30 p.m. March 27. A 24-year-old woman reported she had been assaulted at the above location. A suspect has been identified, and an investigation was continuing.

LOST KNIFE CIR., 9600 block, 7:48 p.m. March 25. Five men attacked a 28-year-old Montgomery Village man when he left a grocery store. They attempted to rob him, but the man escaped. He was taken to a local hospital with injuries.

ROBBERIES

FREDERICK AVENUE AREA, 7 p.m. Jan. 15. Two males behind the student parking lot of a high school jumped out and assaulted a 17-year-old male. They demanded money, but gave up after several minutes and fled.

GIRARD STREET AND FEDERAL AVENUE, 3:30 p.m. Jan. 15. Two male youths attacked an 18-year-old man walking near a recreational park and took his property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DEER PARK RD. W., 100 block, 6:10 to 6:21 p.m. March 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

FREDERICK AVE., 200 block, 7:30 p.m. March 23 to 7:15 a.m. March 24. A church was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

FREDERICK AVE., 300 block, 12:30 to 2:12 a.m. March 27. A high school was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

FREDERICK AVE. N, 500 block, 5:30 p.m. March 30 to 12:03 a.m. March 31. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

KENTLANDS BLVD., 200 block, 1:15 to 1:33 a.m. March 24. Property was stolen from a pet store entered by force.

KING JAMES WAY, 17000 block, noon March 20 to 2:50 p.m. March 31. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

OLNEY-LAYTONSVILLE RD., 5000 block, 5 p.m. March 21 to 6 a.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence.

WATKINS MILL RD., 19200 block, 3:05 a.m. March 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

PICCARD DR., 1300 block, March 31. A 32-year-old man was arrested and charged with domestic assault and battery in connection with an incident at the above location.

WEAPONS VIOLATIONS

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, 1:59 p.m. March 27. An 18-year-old man was arrested and charged with possession of a concealed weapon following an incident involving a knife at the above location.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COURTHOUSE SQ., 1 to 100 block, 3:15 p.m. March 30. A cellphone and a memory card was stolen from a government office.

FALLSGROVE BLVD., 700 block, 8 p.m. March 25 to 8 a.m. March 26. A Global Positioning System device and a car stereo system were stolen from a vehicle.

FALLSGROVE BLVD., 700 block, 8:30 p.m. March 25 to 7:40 a.m. March 26. A car stereo system was stolen from a vehicle.

HALPINE RD., 100 block, 3 a.m. March 30 to 4:30 p.m. March 31. A bag containing clothing and a toolbox were stolen from a vehicle.

HUNGERFORD DR., 600 block, 1:20 to 1:25 p.m. April 1. A wallet and a cellphone with carrying case were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

MCCORMICK RD., 2400 block, 5 p.m. March 30 to 8:30 a.m. March 31. A computer, two monitors, a computer unit, a printer, several telephones, a laptop computer, a projector and a cabinet were stolen from a residence.

MONROE ST., 300 block, 10 to 11 a.m. March 28. Two portable video game systems, a video game console, a video game headset and controllers and several video games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1500 block, 2:15 to 2:35 p.m. March 27. Several dozen razor blades were stolen from a retail store.

STONESTREET AVE. N., 200 block, 8:30 p.m. March 26 to 6 a.m. March 27. A jackhammer, a band saw, a torque wrench, a torque multiplier, a jumper box and a wrench set were stolen from a retail store entered by breaking out a garage door.

WESTMORE DR., 7300 block, 3 to 4 p.m. March 29. Stainless steel tubing and polishing equipment were stolen from a business.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

FLOWER AVE., 8600 block, 9:58 p.m., April 6. A man was arrested on charges of second-degree assault and false imprisonment in connection with a March 23 incident at the above location.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7600 block, 8:45 p.m. March 31. A male youth was arrested and charged with first-degree assault in connection with an incident at the above location.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOUSTON AVE., 600 block, April 4. Property was stolen from an apartment.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7600 block, 8:44 p.m. March 30. A male youth was arrested and charged with fourth-degree burglary and destruction of property.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

EAST-WEST HWY., 9500 block, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. March 31. A 1995 Toyota 4Runner was stolen.

WILDWOOD DR., 7900 block, 9 p.m. March 30 to 5:30 a.m. March 31. A 1996 Honda Civic was stolen.

-- Compiled by LISA M. BOLTON

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 2426 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

Lincoln Ave., 400 block, 3:20 p.m. Aug. 5. A man attacked a person in the parking lot of a pizza restaurant. A 35-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested.

Parklawn Dr., 12500 block, 9:45 a.m. Aug. 3. A person armed with a weapon threatened a female acquaintance at a business. 

First St., 1300 block, 3:30 a.m. Aug. 4. A man forced his way into a residence, attacked an acquaintance and destroyed property.

ROBBERIES

Somerville Dr., 15900 block, 1:25 a.m. Aug. 6. Two males attacked a man and robbed him of property. A 17-year-old from Brookeville and a 14-year-old from Montgomery Village were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashley Dr., 5 p.m. Aug. 6 to 7 a.m. Aug. 6. A pair of cufflinks was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Church St., unit block, 5 p.m. Aug. 4 to 9 a.m. Aug. 5. Property was stolen from a business.

Cove Lane, 14000 block, 2:55 a.m. Aug. 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force. A 30-year-old man was arrested.

Falls Rd., 11400 block, 3:35 a.m. Aug. 6. Property was stolen from a fire station.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 12:01 to 7:30 a.m. Aug. 6. Two iPods and a suitcase with clothing were stolen from a vehicle in a parking garage.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 6 to 10 a.m. Aug. 7. A just-purchased radio was stolen from the trunk of a vehicle in a parking garage.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 6 to 10:20 a.m. Aug. 7. A spare tire and antennae were stolen from an unlocked vehicle in a parking garage.

Jefferson St. E., noon Aug. 4 to 1 p.m. Aug. 5. A Global Positioning System unit was stolen from a vehicle in a parking garage.

Nicholson Ct., 4900 block, 12:30 a.m. Aug. 6. Property was stolen from a business entered by force. A 42-year-old Takoma Park man and a 50-year-old Mitchellville man were arrested.

The Washington Post


July 21, 2002 Sunday  
Final Edition


CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 506 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, April 16. Two men, ages 19 and 25, broke into several storage containers at Blue Wind bicycle store and stole merchandise. They were charged with second- and fourth-degree burglary and theft over $ 500.

CALIFORNIA, 9 p.m. July 15 to 4:30 a.m. July 16. Tools were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALLAWAY, 7:53 a.m. July 13. A man, 50, broke into a residence and assaulted a man, 28. As he was leaving, he also scratched a vehicle with a key. He was charged with first-degree burglary, two counts of malicious destruction of property under $ 500, second-degree assault and resisting arrest.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LONG RD., July 8 to July 9. Two motorcycles were stolen from a shed.

ASSAULTS

DAMERON, July 12. A woman, 39, and a man, 20, were involved in a shooting; the victim, a 44-year-old man, was not injured. They were charged with being accessories to first-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

GREAT MILLS, December 2001 to July 2002. A man, 33, sexually abused and assaulted two women, ages 44 and 19, and a female youth, 16. He was charged with second-degree rape, second-degree sex offense, two counts of third-degree sex offense, child abuse and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, July 10. A man, 34, stole a cashier's check and cashed it. He is charged with theft under $ 500, theft over $ 500 and uttering.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 1:45 p.m. July 11. A man, 21, broke into a residence and stole property. He was charged with first-degree burglary and theft over $ 500.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 11:06 a.m. July 12. A man, 21, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEXINGTON PARK, July 14 and 15. A man, 34, committed numerous sex offenses involving a female youth, 15. He was charged with five counts of third-degree sex offense and two counts of second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, July 2001 to July 2002. A man, 28, committed sexual offenses involving a female youth, 7. He was charged with child abuse and second- and third-degree sex offenses.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 6:14 p.m. July 7. A male youth, 17, assaulted a male victim at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE, July 8 to 11. Two men, ages 46 and 65, assaulted each other. They were charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE, 2:55 p.m. July 16. A man, 44, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE RD., 7 a.m. to 5:24 p.m. July 10. A motorcycle was stolen from a barn.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DOCUMENT-TYPE: LIST
