261 of 507 DOCUMENTS




Washingtonpost.com


January 31, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1570 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA ASSAULTS

Shallow Creek Loop, 9800 block, 12:17 a.m. Jan. 22. Three men wearing masks forced their way inside a residence and attacked an occupant, who followed them out of the home and fired a weapon, striking three parked vehicles. The victim was treated for injuries that were not life-threatening.

DUMFRIES AREA HOMICIDES

Washington St., 17600 block, 3:26 a.m. Jan. 17. Tasheka Lashon Leavell, 35, of Dumfries was found in her home suffering from gunshot wounds to the upper body. She was pronounced dead at the scene. A 38-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested Jan. 21. Two Dumfries men, ages 27 and 29, were arrested in Palm Beach County, Fla., on Jan. 23. The three men, who are brothers, are being charged with first-degree murder. 

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Montclair area, Jan. 19. A 34-year-old Dumfries man was arrested in connection with the sexual assaults of two juvenile acquaintances.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Vineland Pl., 3300 block, 11:59 p.m. Jan. 20. Three bullet holes were found in an exterior wall at a residence. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 17400 block, 8:58 p.m. Jan. 19. Two men robbed a grocery store of cash at gunpoint.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Dumfries Rd., 14900 block, 1:02 a.m. Jan. 20. During an argument, a man attacked an acquaintance and broke her cellphone. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

Ridgeway Dr., 7200 block, 12:22 a.m. Jan. 16. A man driving a truck ran down a pedestrian, and the driver and a passenger exited the vehicle and robbed the victim of his wallet and cellphone. The victim was treated for injuries that were not life-threatening.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Black Forest Lane, 12700 block, 2:20 a.m. Jan. 16. During an argument at a restaurant, a man shot a man in the leg, then fled with a male accomplice. The victim was taken to a hospital for treatment. An investigation was ongoing.

Gordon Blvd., 12500 block, 8:07 p.m. Jan. 14. During an argument at a residence, a man attacked an acquaintance and took her cellphone. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Corbett Pl., 1200 block, 8:25 a.m. Jan. 18. A man fired a gun at a vehicle, striking a tire. No injuries were reported.

Telegraph Rd., 14600 block, 5:30 to 6 a.m. Jan. 18. Several gunshots were heard. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Quick Pl., 13100 block, 3:49 p.m. Jan. 18. A male robbed a man of cash.

Ramrod Rd., 11200 block, 1:53 p.m. Jan. 18. A man robbed a male acquaintance of cash at gunpoint. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Whitaker Pl., 4600 block, 5:43 p.m. Jan. 19. Two males demanded cash from two people at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed when the victims resisted. A shot was fired into the ground during the incident. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antietam Rd., 12300 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 11 to 11 a.m. Jan. 17. Two TVs, a laptop computer, a video game system and a cellphone were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Evansdale Rd., 4500 block, 6:40 to 8:45 a.m. Jan. 14. A residence was entered by breaking a laundry-room window. Nothing was reported missing.

Holly View Dr., 11900 block, 12:30 to 1:15 p.m. Jan. 18. A residence was entered through an unlocked door. Nothing was reported missing.

Marlboro Ct., 12200 block, 8:45 p.m. Jan. 20. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence through a window. A man fled empty-handed when confronted.

Marsala Ct., 3800 block, 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. Jan. 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Rollingwood Dr., 3300 block, 1:08 p.m. Jan. 18. An attempt was made to enter a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Industry Dr., 9100 block, Jan. 12 to 8:40 a.m. Jan. 14. An air-conditioning unit was stolen from a building.

Kent Dr., 4:36 to 7:36 a.m. Jan. 14. Two Global Positioning System devices were stolen from a vehicle.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

ROBBERIES

Quick Pl., 13100 block, 3:49 p.m. Jan. 18. A male robbed a man of cash.

Ramrod Rd., 11200 block, 1:53 p.m. Jan. 18. A man robbed a male acquaintance of cash at gunpoint. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Whitaker Pl., 4600 block, 5:43 p.m. Jan. 19. Two males demanded cash from two people at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed when the victims resisted. A shot was fired into the ground during the incident. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antietam Rd., 12300 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 11 to 11 a.m. Jan. 17. Two TVs, a laptop computer, a video game system and a cellphone were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Evansdale Rd., 4500 block, 6:40 to 8:45 a.m. Jan. 14. A residence was entered by breaking a laundry-room window.

Holly View Dr., 11900 block, 12:30 to 1:15 p.m. Jan. 18. A residence was entered through an unlocked door. Nothing was reported missing.

Marlboro Ct., 12200 block, 8:45 p.m. Jan. 20. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence through a window. A man fled empty-handed when confronted.

Marsala Ct., 3800 block, 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. Jan. 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging the front door.

Rollingwood Dr., 3300 block, 1:08 p.m. Jan. 18. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Industry Dr., 9100 block, Jan. 12 to 8:40 a.m. Jan. 14. An air-conditioning unit was stolen from a building.

Kent Dr., 4:36 to 7:36 a.m. Jan. 14. Two Global Positioning System devices were stolen from a vehicle.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 304 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, 2:08 p.m. Feb. 24. A woman, 21, stole property from a business. She was charged with theft more than $ 500.

CALIFORNIA, 6 to 7 p.m. Feb. 20. A cell phone was stolen from a locker at a gym.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

CLEMENTS, January 2001 to January 2002. A boy, 14, touched a girl, 11, in a sexual manner. He was charged with fourth-degree sexual offense and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DAMERON, 5 p.m. Feb. 17 to 5 p.m. Feb. 23. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle at a residence.

ASSAULTS

GREAT MILLS, 8:41 a.m. Feb. 21. A man, 35, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 2:30 p.m. Feb. 23. A man, 19, stole money and jewelry from a residence Feb. 11. He was charged with theft more than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 8:12 a.m. Feb. 22. A woman, 24, assaulted a man at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEXINGTON PARK, 12:30 to 6 p.m. Feb. 9. A man, 19, sexually assaulted a youth, 14. He was charged with fourth-degree sex offense.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, Dec. 7 to 11. Refrigerators were stolen from construction sites.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LEXINGTON PARK, 8 to 8:30 p.m. A rock was thrown through the rear window of a vehicle.

LEXINGTON PARK, 5 p.m. Feb. 20 to 4:10 p.m. Feb. 21. A storm door was damaged at a residence when someone tried to gain entry.

-- Bonnie Smith

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW15


LENGTH: 614 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City Area

ASSAULTS

FILARETE ST., 14400 block, 7:30 p.m. May 20. A male youth punched another male youth in the face and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CATALPA CT., 14900 block, 4 p.m. May 19 to 5 p.m. May 20. Three saws, three hammer drills and a welding torch were stolen from a construction trailer entered by breaking a locked door. 

EVERGREEN DR., 4300 block, 6:30 a.m. to 4:20 p.m. May 19. Cash, two laptop computers, a TV, an MP3 player, jewelry and DVDs were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window. A bedroom was entered by forcing open a door and ransacked.

ISLAND HOUSE LOOP, 12800 block, 4:44 a.m. to 5 p.m. May 20. Cash and a digital camera were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

KENWOOD DR., 4600 block, 9:30 a.m. May 19 to 3:15 p.m. May 20. A laptop computer and two video game systems were stolen from a residence.

Haymarket Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COX CREEK CT., 8:20 p.m. May 20. A youth allegedly sexually assaulted two female relatives during a three-year period. An 18-year-old Haymarket man was arrested.

Manassas Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LARIAT LANE, 7:25 a.m. May 24. A man armed with a knife entered a residence, tied up a male resident and raped a female resident. The woman was taken to a hospital.

PROSTITUTION

BUTTERFIELD ST., 10400 block, 7 p.m. May 25. A 27-year-old West New York, N.J., woman was arrested and charged with prostitution. A 27-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with pandering and maintaining a bawdy place.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

STATION RD., 8000 block, 9 a.m. to 12:20 p.m. May 19. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

STONEHOUSE AND COPPERMINE ROADS, 3 p.m. May 16 to 4 p.m. May 17. A green 2005 Lowe Roughneck boat was stolen.

Woodbridge Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

FISHER AVE., 14100 block, 10:41 p.m. May 17. A man allegedly entered an acquaintance's residence, touched a female occupant inappropriately and fled. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 14400 block, 9:15 p.m. May 17. During a fight in a restaurant, a man allegedly assaulted an employee, who was treated for injuries. A 47-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CULPEPER DR., 2200 block, 9:30 p.m. May 18 to 5:30 a.m. May 19. Two air bags and other property were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

DAVIS ST., 1200 block, 9 p.m. May 18 to 7 a.m. May 19. A Global Positioning System device, two DVD players and a front grille were stolen from a vehicle.

EXPRESS DR., 1000 block, 7:20 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. May 19. A Global Positioning System device and an MP3 player were stolen from a vehicle entered by unzipping a window.

LYNN ST., 13700 block, 2 to 10 p.m. May 19. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CEDAR RIDGE DR., 10200 block, 9 a.m. May 22. Two males allegedly attempted to enter a residence by breaking a window. The two allegedly stole an MP3 player, jewelry, beer and soda from a second residence. A 19-year-old man and a 17-year-old male, both of Manassas, were arrested.

PRINCE WILLIAM ST., 9600 block, 12:01 a.m. May 25. Cash was stolen from a cash register in a school cafeteria. The school was entered by breaking a window.

Manassas Park

The following incident was reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CENTREVILLE RD., 8500 block, 10:17 p.m. May 19. Two men stole cigars and soda from a gas station store.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1994 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hungerford Dr., 200 block, 9:15 p.m. June 6. A man groped a person at a Metro station bus stop.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bald Cypress Dr., 9800 block, 6 p.m. June 8 to 1 p.m. June 9. Property was stolen from a garage at a residence. 

Charles St., 300 block, 10:30 p.m. June 8. Property was stolen from a residence. A male was seen leaving the premises.

Glynshire Way, 9700 block, 12:15 p.m. June 10. A break-in occurred at a residence. A 42-year-old Rockville man was arrested.

Maryland Ave., unit block, 1 p.m. June 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Sunset Dr., 9900 block, 12:01 to 9:20 a.m. June 8. Property was stolen from a residence.

Tuckerman Lane, 7900 block, 1 p.m. June 10. A man in a silver-colored Volkswagen SUV was paid cash to do a job, then fled in the vehicle without performing the work.

Vandegrift Ave., 5900 block, June 4 to 8. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Rockville Pike, 1000 block, June 8 to 11. A vehicle was stolen.

Rockville Pike, 1300 block, 12:01 to 11:31 a.m. June 12. A vehicle was stolen from a car dealership.

Wyngate and Oakmont neighborhoods, June 5 to 6. A vehicle was stolen. Laptop computers, iPods, cash and CDs were among property stolen from nine other vehicles.

Southern Maryland crime reportSouthern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 605 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

ASSAULTS

Shore Acres Way, 9:38 p.m. March 29. A man wielding a box cutter broke into a residence and threatened and attacked an occupant. A man, 21, was charged with assault, burglary and trespassing. No serious injuries were reported. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Whispering Dr., 2:55 a.m. April 3. In what police said was a domestic incident, a man stole property from an acquaintance at a residence. A man, 33, was charged with burglary.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Timber View Lane, 11:50 a.m. March 29. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked door. Nothing was reported missing.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA

CAR JACKING

Indian Head Hwy., 1:30 a.m. April 4. Two males approached a motorist near a convenience store and demanded his vehicle at gunpoint. The motorist refused to give up keys, and ran away.

HUGHESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burnt Store Rd., 15100 block, 1:15 a.m. April 3. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle. Two men seen breaking into the vehicle fled when confronted. Two men, ages 29 and 30, were charged with theft. The property was recovered.

NANJEMOY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Greenleek Hill Rd., 4 a.m.-9 p.m., April 4. A flat-screen television was stolen from a residence.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

Bannister Cir., 1000 block, 8:10 p.m. April 3. A group of people attacked a man, 18, after he refused to give them cash.

WHITE PLAINS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

White Plains, March 30. A man was arrested in connection with a Jan. 31 incident at a landscaping company. A man, 29, was charged with burglary and theft.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

GREAT MILLS AREA

ASSAULTS

Point Lookout Rd., April 2. During a dispute at a residence, a man struck an acquaintance in the face. A man, 34, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS

Megan Lane, April 4. During a dispute at a residence, a woman struck an acquaintance in the face. A woman, 43, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, March 21. An employee at a school tried to have an inappropriate relationship with a student. A man, 26, was charged with fourth-degree sexual offense.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., March 30. During a traffic stop, it was determined that a registration sticker had been stolen. A man, 34, was charged with theft less than $100.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

 Arlington County 

These were among incidents reported recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

EADS ST. S., 1100 block, 8:50 a.m. Oct. 25. After an argument involving two men in a vehicle, a person got out and attempted to take a picture of the vehicle. The driver then allegedly struck the person with the vehicle. A Manassas man, 59, was charged with attempted malicious wounding.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 2800 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 7. During an argument, a male assaulted another male.

April 22, 2001 Sunday

Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 516 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

AVENUE, 8:40 p.m. April 12. A man, 48, sexually abused a female youth, 14. He was charged with second- and third-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, 1:28 a.m. April 16. A female youth, 15, was arrested at the Walden Sierra House. She was charged with second-degree assault and disorderly conduct. 1:31 a.m. April 16. Two female youths, 17 and 15, were arrested at the Walden Sierra House. The 17-year-old was charged with second-degree assault, failing to obey a lawful order and resisting arrest. The 15-year-old was charged with malicious destruction of property, failing to obey a lawful order and resisting arrest.

ARSON

MOUNT WOLFE RD., 5:14 a.m. April 18. A barn was set on fire.

THREE NOTCH RD., 2:40 a.m. April 18. Two cars in the parking lot of Lighthouse Liquors were set on fire.

ASSAULTS

CHURCH DR., 1:20 a.m. April 10. A man, 31, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

GREAT MILLS, noon April 8. A male youth, 16, became disorderly and assaulted two troopers as they dispersed a large crowd at Chancellors Run Regional Park Teen Center. He was charged with second-degree assault, hindering, resisting arrest and disorderly conduct.

ASSAULTS

FOREST LANDING RD., 6:02 p.m. April 10. A man, 37, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 5:55 a.m. April 12. A door at St. John's Pharmacy was pried open. Nothing appeared to be missing.

SANDGATES RD. S., 6:10 p.m. April 5. Miscellaneous items were stolen from a shed.

ASSAULTS

THREE NOTCH RD., 8:45 p.m. April 12. A man, 26, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, April 13. A man, 21, stole money from a residence. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

ROBBERIES

MECHANICSVILLE, 6:15 p.m. April 17. A man, 34, threw a comforter over the head of another man, 88, and stole money from him. He was charged with robbery.

VEHICLE THEFTS

MECHANICSVILLE RD., April 18. A man, 38, had a stolen vehicle parked in his driveway. When confronted, the man fled from the residence and into the woods. He was apprehended and charged with theft more than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WHITAKER COURT, 2:08 p.m. April 9. A purse and its contents was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

ASSAULTS

DRAYDEN RD., 1:54 a.m. April 14. A man, 36, stabbed another man, 32, in the eye with a pair of scissors. He also hit a woman, 31, in the face with his fist. He was charged with first-degree assault and two counts of second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

ST. GEORGE'S CHURCH RD., 7:17 a.m. April 5. A vehicle was spray-painted.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T17


LENGTH: 1029 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Iona Sound Dr., 12300 block, 11:41 a.m. Oct. 6. A man exposed himself to a female pedestrian.

DALE CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

General Washington Dr. andTwo Chimneys and Three Dormers courts, 2:56 a.m. Oct. 4. Seven vehicles were tampered with or entered. Cash and electronics were recovered. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man and a 17-year-old Dale City male were arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Rocky Mount Lane, 3:54 a.m. Oct. 5. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile. A 54-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antrim Ct., 3000 block, 1 p.m. Sept. 30 to 1 p.m. Oct. 2. Someone dismantled an air conditioner at a residence and stole copper. 

Bridgeport Dr., 15000 block, 2:10 to 2:30 p.m. Oct. 9. A video game system, games and a headset were stolen from a residence.

Chogburn Lane, 3000 block, 6:05 to 6:10 a.m. Oct. 4. Two mountain bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage.

Steele Ct., 2700 block, 4:15 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Oct. 4. A DVD player and other property were stolen from a residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tullamore Estate Rd., 4500 block, 5:30 a.m. to 6:35 p.m. Oct. 5. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Pointer Lane, 8100 block, 2:40 a.m. Oct. 12. One of two men shot a man sitting in a vehicle in a drug-related matter. The motorist drove himself to a hospital. A 26-year-old Sterling man and a 21-year-old Herndon man were arrested.

ROBBERIES

Irongate Way, 11:43 p.m. Oct. 11. One of three men knocked a female pedestrian to the ground and robbed her at knifepoint of a purse containing cash. A 24-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Amberview Ct., 5400 block, 11:13 a.m. Oct. 3. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a rear basement window.

Centreville Rd., 7200 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 23 to 4:56 p.m. Oct. 8. Catalytic converters were stolen from 40 vehicles.

Forrester Lane, 7500 block, 6:45 to 10:15 p.m. Oct. 4. Four handguns, a laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Gateway Ct., 6900 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 4 to 8 a.m. Oct. 5. Someone attempted to enter a business by tampering with a rear door.

Rumson Pl., 15000 block, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 6. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Sudley Rd., 8500 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 8 to 9 a.m. Oct. 10. Cash was stolen from a business.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Home Guard Dr., 11900 block, 2 a.m. Oct. 9. During an argument, a man assaulted a male acquaintance. A 34-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Opitz Blvd. and Potomac Mills Cir., 10:32 p.m. Oct. 6. During an argument, a man cut a male acquaintance with a box cutter. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 46-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Yellow Turtle Pl., 5300 block, 11:03 p.m. Oct. 5. A vehicle seller and two men went to the residence of the seller to pick up paperwork for the vehicle that the men had purchased from the resident. An argument occurred, and the resident fired a weapon at the ground near the two men. Injuries were reported. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Maryland Ave., 1600 block, 11:15 p.m. Oct. 10. Two gunmen demanded money from a man, then assaulted him. The man escaped and called police. Nothing was reported taken.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14300 block, 1:08 a.m. Oct. 6. Two gunmen in a parking lot robbed a man of a wallet and a watch.

Sunny Ridge Ct., 15000 block, 2:30 a.m. Oct. 6. Two males robbed two men of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cordell Ave., 3800 block, noon Sept. 24 to 10:24 a.m. Oct. 10. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by prying open a rear door.

Delaney Rd., 13400 block, 6 a.m. to 6:45 p.m. Oct. 6. A TV and other property were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear door.

Forestdale Ave., 3500 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 7 to 6 p.m. Oct. 9. Car parts and equipment were stolen from a shed entered by forcing open a door.

Kinnicutt Dr., 13100 block, 1:20 to 4 p.m. Oct. 1. Two mountain bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage.

Londonderry Ct., 13800 block, 4:45 to 9:30 p.m. Oct. 4. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

Merchants Plaza, 4100 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 2 to 1:22 p.m. Oct. 8. Someone attempted to enter a business by tampering with a rear door.

Ranger Loop, 1400 block, 7 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Oct. 10. A TV was stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

Saratoga Lane, 5200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 7 to 9 p.m. Oct. 10. Someone attempted to enter a church by damaging several window screens and breaking a window of a rear door.

West Longview Dr., 2300 block, 8:45 a.m. Oct. 6. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear patio door.

 Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aspen Pl., 9700 block, midnight Oct. 9. A male and a female kicked open a locked bedroom door, hit a male resident on the back of the head and fled with a wallet containing cash.

Chervil Ct., 10200 block, 9:15 p.m. Oct. 8. A male attempted to enter a residence by prying a rear door. He fled when a resident yelled at him.

Liberia Ave., 9500 block, 3:05 to 3:55 a.m. Oct. 6. A male and a female dressed as security guards stole cigarettes from a grocery store.

Taney Rd., 9200 block, 10 a.m. to 2:40 p.m. Oct. 7. Cash, jewelry and beer were stolen from an unlocked residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Mathis Ave., 8900 block, 6:30 p.m. Oct. 9 to 10:25 p.m. Oct. 10. A black 1999 Honda Civic was stolen from a vehicle dealership.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enterprise Ct., 9200 block, 3 p.m. Oct. 9 to 1:07 a.m. Oct. 10. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Forrest St., 100 block, 3 p.m. Oct. 9 to 8 a.m. Oct. 10. A window of a vehicle was broken.

Venture Ct., 9200 block, 5:30 p.m. Oct. 7 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 10. Windows of two vehicles were broken.

SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 3481 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 2105 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fisher Ave., Jan. 27. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance. 

ROBBERIES

Randolph Rd. and Lauderdale Dr., 9:22 p.m. Jan. 28. Two men with a weapon threatened and robbed a person.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 611 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brigstock Ct., 12900 block, 2:30 p.m. July 26 to 10:15 p.m. Aug. 31. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement window.

Cunard Ct., 13400 block, 6 a.m. Aug. 23 to 11 a.m. Aug. 30. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through a basement window. 

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Formby St., Aug. 17. A 2004 Hyundai Elantra was stolen. The vehicle was identified during a police traffic stop in Manassas. A 17-year-old Manassas male was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Wallace Drive area, June. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 43-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Livingston Rd., 12100 block, 10:45 a.m. Aug. 28. During an argument, a man assaulted a male acquaintance, who was later treated for injuries.

CHILD CARE INCIDENT

Notes Dr. and Balls Ford Rd., 8:05 p.m. Aug. 31. Police stopped the male driver of a vehicle and determined that he was under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Four children, 13 months old to 13 years old, were in the vehicle. A 32-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with driving under the influence and child neglect.

ROBBERIES

Stream Walk Dr., 7700 block, 8:30 a.m. Aug. 27. A man and a woman in a vehicle offered to hire a man in a parking lot for landscaping work. The man was driven to a wooded lot, where he was robbed of cash at knifepoint.

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 9:48 a.m. Sept. 1. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Galveston Ct., 12700 block, 6:30 p.m. Aug. 26. A man in a grocery store exposed himself to a woman.

Sudley Rd., 8100 block, 3:40 p.m. Aug. 24. A man sitting in the children's section of a bookstore exposed himself several times.

TRIANGLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Fort Pickens Ct. area, Aug. 28. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance at gunpoint. A 31-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ATTEMPTING KIDNAPPING

Geraldine Ct., 1400 block, 6:41 p.m. Aug. 31. A man picked up a 2-year-old child and attempted to walk away. The child's older brother was able to get the child away from the man. A 26-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULT

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 9:43 a.m. Aug. 30. A man was stabbed during a fight. He was treated at a hospital.

CHILD CARE INCIDENT

Braddock Rd., 3000 block, 2:01 p.m. Aug. 27. A woman left four children, ages 3 to 10, alone in a residence. A 34-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

ROBBERY

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 2:47 a.m. Sept. 3. Three men, including two who wore masks, robbed a male at a residence of a safe. They were armed with a handgun, a machete and a bat.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hill Meade Lane, 11500 block, 5:55 a.m. Aug. 28. A man entered a residence and fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

Still Pl., 4700 block, 8:53 a.m. Aug. 26. A man attempted to enter a residence.

Telegraph Rd., 14500 block, 8:33 p.m. Sept. 1. Cash was stolen from a business entered through an unlocked rear door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Confederate Trail, 6 p.m. Aug. 30. Four males assaulted two male juvenile pedestrians.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bragg Lane, 9700 block, 11:25 p.m. Aug. 29. A male attempted to enter a residence through a second-floor window.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Euclid Ave., 8 p.m. Aug. 29 to 10 a.m. Aug. 30. License plates were stolen from vehicles at a business.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Washingtonpost.com


August 25, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 2569 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 ASSAULTS

Lincoln Ave., 400 block, 3:20 p.m. Aug. 5. A man attacked a person in the parking lot of a pizza restaurant. A 35-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested.  

Parklawn Dr., 12500 block, 9:45 a.m. Aug. 3. A person armed with a weapon threatened a female acquaintance at a business.

First St., 1300 block, 3:30 a.m. Aug. 4. A man forced his way into a residence, attacked an acquaintance and destroyed property.

ROBBERIES

Somerville Dr., 15900 block, 1:25 a.m. Aug. 6. Two males attacked a man and robbed him of property. A 17-year-old from Brookeville and a 14-year-old from Montgomery Village were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashley Dr., 5 p.m. Aug. 6 to 7 a.m. Aug. 6. A pair of cufflinks was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Church St., unit block, 5 p.m. Aug. 4 to 9 a.m. Aug. 5. Property was stolen from a business.

Cove Lane, 14000 block, 2:55 a.m. Aug. 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force. A 30-year-old man was arrested.

Falls Rd., 11400 block, 3:35 a.m. Aug. 6. Property was stolen from a fire station.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 12:01 to 7:30 a.m. Aug. 6. Two iPods and a suitcase with clothing were stolen from a vehicle in a parking garage.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 6 to 10 a.m. Aug. 7. A just-purchased radio was stolen from the trunk of a vehicle in a parking garage.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 6 to 10:20 a.m. Aug. 7. A spare tire and antennae were stolen from an unlocked vehicle in a parking garage.

Jefferson St. E., noon Aug. 4 to 1 p.m. Aug. 5. A Global Positioning System unit was stolen from a vehicle in a parking garage.

Middle Rd., 12300 block, 1:27 a.m. Aug. 7. An attempt was made to break into a vehicle.

Montrose Rd., 6000 block, 4:46 a.m. Aug. 9. Property was stolen from a parking-lot booth entered by force.

Norbeck Rd., 4100 block, 2:10 p.m. Aug. 6. Property was stolen from a church rectory.

Olden Rd., 4700 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 6 to 7 a.m. Aug. 6. Two laptop computers were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

River Rd., 10300 block, Aug. 5 to 7. Property was stolen from a church. The premises were marked with graffiti during the incident.

Twinbrook Pkwy., 600 block, 9:30 p.m. Aug. 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATION301-652-9200 ROBBERIES

Adams Dr., 4000 block, Aug. 5 to 8. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

Bradley Lane, 3400 and 3500 blocks, Aug. 1. Sound equipment, a GPS unit, cellphone accessories and cash were among property stolen from two unlocked vehicles.

Chevy Chase Lake Dr., 3700 block, Aug. 5 to 8. A GPS unit was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Connecticut Ave., 7300 block, 1:30 to 7:30 a.m. Aug. 5. Four tires were stolen from a 2007 Cadillac, which was left mounted on bricks.

Elm St., 4300 block, Aug. 9. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Ewell St., 10400 block, Aug. 8. GPS units were stolen from two unlocked vehicles.

Grosvenor Pl., 10400 block, Aug. 2. Parts were stolen from a vehicle.

Kensington Pkwy., 8800 block, Aug. 4 to 5. Parts were stolen from a vehicle.

Kentbury Dr., 5300 block, Lynbrook Dr., 7900 block, Kentbury Way, unit block, and Stanford St., 400 block, Aug. 1 to 9. GPS units and cash were among property stolen from unlocked vehicles.

Nicholson Ct., 4900 block, 12:30 a.m. Aug. 6. Property was stolen from a business entered by force. A 42-year-old Takoma Park man and a 50-year-old Mitchellville man were arrested.

The Washington Post


June 11, 2009 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA19


LENGTH: 3282 words


Fairfax County 

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For information, call 703-246-2253.

Fair Oaks District

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

ROGER STOVER DR., 4400 block, 3 p.m. May 26. A man pulled an 18-year-old female acquaintance close to him as they were ending a conversation. He attempted to kiss her, and she resisted and attempted to pull away. They struggled briefly, and he released her. A 74-year-old Fairfax man was charged with sexual battery.

ROBBERIES

MAJESTIC LANE, 4000 block, 2:30 p.m. June 1. Two males approached a 30-year-old woman in a parking lot, and one grabbed her purse. When she resisted, the other male pushed her. The woman let go of the purse, and the men fled with it.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BLAKE LANE, 9500 block. Cash was stolen from a residence. 

MIDDLETON FARM CT., 2700 block, 1:48 a.m. May 29. A man awoke hearing noise from his garage and saw a man walking outside. An investigation revealed that the garage had been entered by using an electric garage-door opener that had been in an unlocked vehicle at the residence. The vehicle was located nearby. An 18-year-old Herndon man was charged with grand larceny and unlawful entry.

MONUMENT DR., 11600 block. Medicine and a blow dryer were stolen from a business.

OAKTON MANOR CT., 2800 block. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle.

POLO DR., 12100 block. CDs were stolen from a vehicle.

ST. REGENTS DR., 3000 block. A bumper was stolen from a vehicle.

VIRGINIA CENTER BLVD., 9400 block. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

DEER HOLLOW WAY, 2900 block. A 2004 Acura RSX was stolen.

TUCKAWAY CT., 3300 block. A 2006 Toyota Avalon was stolen.

Franconia District

HOMICIDES

HAGEL CIR., 9600 block, 2 p.m. May 29. Two bodies were found inside a residence by a relative who went there to check on a woman. An investigation preliminarily determined that Robert J. Neal, Jr., 54, had shot his wife, Jacqueline Y. Neal, 45, in the upper body and then shot himself.

ASSAULTS

CASTLEWELLAN DR., 5800 block, 8:20 a.m. June 1. A couple argued in a vehicle. The man got out and walked over to the woman and attempted to take her cellphone. As they struggled over it, the man grabbed the woman's hair and shirt. A 34-year-old male bystander separated the two. When the man got back into the car and started to drive away, the woman tried to get their 6-month-old baby out of a car seat in the vehicle. The car struck the bystander in the lower body, and the baby fell out of the vehicle. A 26-year-old Alexandria area man was charged with child neglect, assault, hit and run, reckless driving and driving with a suspended license. The baby was treated at Inova Fairfax Hospital. The injured bystander was treated at the scene. The woman reportedly was not injured.

ROBBERIES

FARRINGTON AVE., 6000 block, 11:20 p.m. May 31. A passenger in a taxi demanded cash from the driver when they arrived at the passenger's destination. The driver gave the passenger cash, and the passenger got out of the vehicle, threatened the driver and demanded that he get out. The robber then got into the driver's seat and drove away. No injuries were reported. The cab was later located at the hotel in Alexandria where the driver had picked up the robber.

METROPOLITAN CENTER DR., 6700 block, 4:35 p.m. June 3. A group of males asked a 27-year-old male pedestrian for cash. When he declined, they followed him a short distance, assaulted him and took cash, a hat and earphones and fled. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRADDOCK RD., 6800 block. A passport was stolen from a residence.

COVERDALE WAY, 5900 block. Badges were stolen from a vehicle.

ELECTRONIC DR., 6600 block. A radio, a wallet and a cellphone were stolen from a vehicle.

FOUNDERS HILL DR., 5900 block. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

FRANCONIA RD., 5200 block. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle.

GLOUCESTER AVE., 5900 block. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

HECHINGER DR., 6900 block. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

JULIET ST., 5400 block. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

KINGSTOWNE BLVD., 5800 block. Video games were stolen from a business.

LITTLE RIVER TPK., 7100 block. Vehicle brake pads were stolen from a business.

SOUTH VAN DORN ST., 5700 block. Cameras were stolen from a vehicle.

SPRINGFIELD PLAZA, 6400 block. Liquor was stolen from a business.

TEA TABLE DR., 7700 block. A temporary tag was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BLAND ST. AND BACKLICK RD. A 1995 Toyota Previa was stolen.

HEATHERWOOD DR., 6000 block. A 2003 Dodge Ram 1500 was stolen.

LORTON STATION BLVD., 9000 block. A 2000 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

LORTON STATION BLVD., 9000 block. A 2006 Infiniti was stolen.

LORTON STATION BLVD., 9000 block. An Infiniti Q45 was stolen.

RICHMOND HWY. AND CHERWEK DR., 2:50 a.m. May 30. A police officer attempted to stop a motorist who was driving a vehicle without headlights. The driver continued and lost control and struck several parked cars. The driver and a passenger fled on foot. They were later identified as juveniles. The case was under investigation.

SEATREND WAY AND FRANCONIA RD. A 1997 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

Mason District

ASSAULTS

KNOLLWOOD DR., 6100 block, 7:39 p.m. May 28. A group of males was playing basketball when another group of males started a fight with them. The first group attempted to flee when police arrived but were detained. No injuries were reported. Two men, ages 23 and 24, and 16-year-old Falls Church area youth were charged with assault by mob and gang participation.

OAKVIEW GARDENS DR., 5800 block, 11 p.m. June 2. A man allegedly stabbed a male relative in the leg with a knife during an argument while they were cooking. A 24-year-old Falls Church man was charged with malicious wounding.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARCADIA RD., 4100 block. A cellphone was stolen from a business.

ARLINGTON BLVD., 6100 block. A purse was stolen from a business.

ARLINGTON BLVD., 6100 block. Cash was stolen from a business.

GALLOWS RD., 3300 block. An iPod was stolen from a business.

GRAHAM RD., 3100 block. Hedge trimmers, a weed trimmer, a blower and stone cutters were stolen from a vehicle.

HICKORY HILL RD., 7000 block. Tools were stolen from a residence.

LEESBURG PIKE, 5500 block. A wallet was stolen from a business.

LEESBURG PIKE, 5500 block. A bicycle was stolen from a business.

LEESBURG PIKE, 5800 block. Shirts were stolen from a business.

SLEEPY HOLLOW RD., 3800 block. Air bags were stolen from a vehicle.

SOUTH GEORGE MASON DR., 3700 block. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

MANITOBA DR., 4900 block. A 2006 Suzuki motorcycle was stolen.

SOUTHLAND AVE., 4900 block. A 2003 Yamaha motorcycle was stolen.

McLean District

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DORR AVE., 2800 block. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle.

ESKRIDGE RD., 2900 block. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

GALLOWS RD., 1900 block. A phone and a Global Positioning System device were stolen from a vehicle.

LEE HWY., 7400 block. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

PARK ST., 8600 block. A purse was stolen from a business.

PROVINCIAL DR., 7600 block. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

SPRING HILL RD., 1500 block. A cellphone was stolen from a business.

TYSONS CORNER CENTER, 8000 block. Jeans were stolen from a business.

WESTMORELAND ST., 1600 block. A wallet was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

GRAHAM RD., 3000 block. A 2007 Toyota was stolen.

Mount Vernon District

ROBBERIES

VAN DYKE ST., 3400 block, June 2. A man stepped outside his home and spoke to three males standing nearby. The next thing he said he remembers is being inside his house and discovering that his wallet and cellphone were missing. The man was treated at the scene for injuries to the upper body.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BERKSHIRE CT., 5800 block. A ring was stolen from a residence.

FAIRHAVEN AVE., 2400 block. Beer was stolen from a business.

FORT HUNT RD., 8700 block. Radio equipment was stolen from a residence.

HUNTINGTON AVE., 2000 block. A computer was stolen from a business.

PICKETT ST., 6400 block. A cellphone was stolen from a residence.

RICHMOND HWY., 5900 block. Tires were stolen from a vehicle.

RICHMOND HWY., 5900 block. Tires and rims were stolen from a vehicle.

RICHMOND HWY., 6600 block. DVDs were stolen from a business.

RICHMOND HWY., 7600 block. A purse was stolen from a business.

SKY VIEW DR., 8400 block. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

SOUTH KINGS HWY., 6300 block. Beer was stolen from a business.

WAKEFIELD DR., 6600 block. A radio was stolen from a vehicle.

WINDBREAK DR., 2600 block. A printer was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

JANNA LEE AND AUDUBON AVENUES, 10:10 p.m. May 30. A police officer observed a motorist driving a vehicle with no headlights on and attempted to make a traffic stop. Two occupants ran from the vehicle. An investigation revealed that both occupants were juveniles, and one had allegedly stolen a set of car keys and had taken the vehicle without permission. They were released to a family member.

Reston District

ROBBERIES

OLD RESTON AVE., 1800 block, 5:30 p.m. May 29. A man approached a 15-year-old boy walking on a path with a friend. He put an object to the boy's head and demanded that the boy put his property on the ground. The men fled with the boy's wallet and cellphone. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BOWMAN TOWNE DR., 11900 block. A bicycle was stolen from a business.

FELDMAN PL., 13300 block, 2:56 a.m. June 1. A woman heard a noise on her patio and found a naked man attempting to open a sliding-glass door. The woman screamed, and the man fled on foot.

FREEDOM DR., 11900 block. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

GLADE DR., 11400 block. A purse was stolen from a business.

GREYWING SQ., 12000 block. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

LOCUST ST., 900 block. A cellphone was stolen from a school.

LOCUST ST., 900 block. A wallet was stolen from a school.

LOCUST ST., 900 block. An iPod and a camera were stolen from a school.

SEAMAN CT., 2100 block. A purse was stolen from a residence.

STONE FENCE LANE, 2300 block. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

SUNRISE VALLEY DR., 11700 block. Purses were stolen from a business.

SUNSET HILLS RD., 12100 block. Spray paint was stolen from a business.

Sully District

ROBBERIES

FIELD FLOWER TR., 6300 block, 5:15 p.m. June 2. Three male acquaintances argued, and two of the males allegedly assaulted the third and robbed him of cash and an MP3 player. Two Centreville men, ages 22 and 24, were charged with robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CENTREVILLE SQ., 14200 block. Property was stolen from a business.

West Springfield District

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BURKE CENTRE PKWY., 5700 block. A purse was stolen from a business.

CASABLANCA CT., 4500 block. An air bag was stolen from a vehicle.

LITTLE RIVER TPK., 7400 block. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

POHICK RD., 8700 block. Wallets were stolen from a church.

REXFORD CT., 5700 block. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

ROLLING RD., 6010 block. A purse and a Global Positioning System device were stolen from a business.

SEDGEWICK LANE, 5600 block. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

SIDEBURN RD., 5000 block. An iPod was stolen from a school.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

TICONDEROGA CT., 6000 block. A 2002 Chevrolet Prism was stolen.

 Fairfax City

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For information, call 703-385-7809.

ASSAULTS

JERMANTOWN RD., 3900 block, 2:08 a.m. May 29. Two males punched and kicked a 50-year-old man at a convenience store and fled in a vehicle. The man was treated for injuries at a hospital.

MAIN ST., 980 block, 2:40 a.m. May 30. A man allegedly assaulted a woman during an argument. A 23-year-old Alexandria area man was charged with assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FAIRFAX BLVD., 9400 block, 5:20 p.m. June 2. A store manager reported two men concealing merchandise in the business. Two Fairfax City men, ages 20 and 23, were charged with petty larceny and possession of burglary tools.

FAIRFAX BLVD., 9800 block, 10 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. May 27. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle in a parking lot.

FAIRFAX BLVD., 10000 block, 4:14 p.m. May 27. Two men concealed alcohol in a business and fled without paying.

FAIRFAX BLVD., 11000 block, 10:30 p.m. May 29 to 9 a.m. May 30. Two tires of a vehicle at an auto dealership were stolen.

MAIN ST., 9900 block, 2:22 p.m. June 2. A person stole cash from a cash box at a business.

MORTH ST., 10300 block, 5 to 5:30 p.m. June 2. A purse was stolen from a library.

NORTH ST., 10300 block, 6:09 p.m. May 28. A laptop computer was stolen from a work area in a public library while the owner was in a restroom.

PICKETT RD., 3400 block, 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. May 27. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle in a parking lot of a park.

UNIVERSITY DR., 3900 block, 4:22 p.m. May 28. A woman told a police officer on patrol that a man had just stolen her purse at a nearby office building. A man was located nearby with the woman's purse and credit cards belonging to another person. A 55-year-old District man was charged with grand larceny.

WILLARD WAY, 10300 block, 7:28 to 8:21 p.m. June 2. An iPod nano was stolen from an unlocked vehicle in a parking lot.

VANDALISM

JERMANTOWN RD., 3800 block, 7 a.m. to noon May 30. A window of a vehicle at a school was broken.

UNIVERSITY DR., 3900 block, 9 p.m. May 28 to noon May 29. A fire extinguisher was discharged into the mail slot of a business.

Falls Church

The following incidents were recently reported by the Falls Church Police Department. For information, call 703-248-5056.

ROBBERIES

WILSON BLVD., 6700 block, 8:56 p.m. May 27. A person at a club struggled with another person and took cash. Minor injuries were reported.

BROAD ST. W., 1100 block, May 22 to May 26. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

HILLWOOD AVE., 200 block, 6:20 a.m. May 26. A briefcase containing documents, a Defense Department ID, a parking pass and other property was stolen from a vehicle entered by smashing a window.

HILLWOOD AVE., 200 block, 7:13 a.m. May 29. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

WILSON BLVD., 6700 block, 11:59 a.m. May 27. A vehicle, stolen Feb. 9, was recovered.

VANDALISM

OAK ST. S., 600 block, 9:53 a.m. May 26. A lock on a trailer at an elementary school was damaged.

WILSON BLVD., 6700 block, 1 p.m. May 31 to 7 a.m. June 1. A sink in a men's restroom was broken.

 Herndon

The following incidents were recently reported by the Herndon Police Department. For information, call 703-435-6846.

ASSAULTS

SUNSET PARK DR., 200 block, 9:16 a.m. May 28. Catalytic converters were stolen from two vehicles.

Vienna

The following incidents were recently reported by the Vienna Police Department. For information, call 703-255-6396.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BIRCH AND OAK STREETS SW, 11:34 a.m. June 4. Police were called to assist Vienna town employees in locating a person who had allegedly illegally drawn water from a town hydrant. The person fled when the employees approached and was located a short time later. A 40-year-old Falls Church man was charged with petty larceny of water.

CENTER ST. S., 400 block, May 26 to May 31. A trash can was stolen from an alley behind a residence.

MAPLE AVE. E., 300 block, 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. May 30. A wallet was stolen from a purse in a grocery store. Credit cards from the wallet were used to make purchases.

MAPLE AVE. E., 400 block, 9:46 p.m. May 31. A police officer observed a man in a convenience store stuffing a bottle of wine down his pants. An investigation revealed that the man was intoxicated. A 24-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with concealment and public drunkenness.

MAPLE AVE. E., 800 block, 10:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 25. Credit cards were stolen from the trunk of a vehicle while the owner was playing golf.

PLUM ST. SW, 700 block, 11 a.m. to 2:47 p.m. May 3. A laptop computer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ29


LENGTH: 2315 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by Montgomery County police. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

WOOTTEN MILL PARK AREA, 5:30 p.m. Feb. 25. A male sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

ASSAULTS

KING FARM DR., 100 block, 7:33 to 8:03 p.m. Feb. 25. During a domestic dispute, a person was stabbed. A woman, 41, was arrested. No major injuries were reported. 

LONGWOOD DR., 700 block, 5:34 a.m. March 2. A man assaulted a female acquaintance. A Potomac man, 39, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

CALVIN LANE, 300 block, 12:53 p.m. Feb. 26. A man met with a person to sell a TV and robbed him at gunpoint of property. A man, 19, was arrested.

RICHARD MONTGOMERY DR., 200 block, 11:30 a.m. Feb. 26. A student at a school took property from a student.

TWINBROOK PKWY., 12400 block, 1:24 a.m. Feb. 27. Three males attacked a pedestrian and robbed him of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BEALL AVE., 500 block, 2:10 a.m. Feb. 28. A break-in occurred at a residence. There was no sign of forced entry. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

EMDEN ST., 4400 block, 6:10 a.m. to 4:05 p.m. March 1. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

FREDERICK RD., 16000 block, 3 to 3:10 a.m. Feb. 25. A business was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

HEATHERFORD CT., 6700 block, 1:10 p.m. Feb. 26. A female tried to break into a residence, then fled empty-handed.

HUNGERFORD DR., 800 block, March 2. A break-in occurred at a restaurant. Nothing was reported missing.

LUVIE CT., 11600 block, 1:50 p.m. March 1. An attempt was made to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

REDLAND RD., 16200 block, 2 to 8:46 a.m. Feb. 24. A suitcase was among property stolen from two vehicles.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

REDLAND RD., 16200 block, March 24. A woman was seen inside a vehicle trying to start the engine with the wrong key. An Olney woman, 18, was arrested.

District 2 Bethesda Station 301-652-9200

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

ROCK CREEK STREAM VALLEY PARK AREA, 4:45 p.m. March 1. A man in an apartment tried to sexually assault an acquaintance at knifepoint, then fled when confronted by another acquaintance. A Silver Spring man, 35, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

FRIENDSHIP BLVD., 5300 block, 4:10 p.m. Feb. 25. Two males attacked two male youths and demanded property. After a struggle, the assailants fled empty-handed.

16TH ST. AND EAST WEST HWY., 2 a.m. Feb. 27. A gunman robbed a female of a purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ANDERSON RD., 3500 block, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Feb. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

BETHESDA AVE., 4800 block, 4 a.m. Feb. 24. Property was stolen from a computer business. Two males were seen fleeing with the property.

DANVILLE DR., 11600 block, 1 to 7:20 p.m. Feb. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

DEMOCRACY BLVD., 7100 block, 4:40 a.m. Feb. 22. Property was stolen from a cellphone business entered by force.

DORSETT AVE., 4800 block, DALECARLIA DR., 5100 block, ALBEMARLE ST., 5300 block, and BOXWOOD RD., 4400 block, Feb. 28 to March 1. Property was stolen from four vehicles, three of which had been left unlocked.

GREENVALE ST., 2800 block, Feb. 26 to 27. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 10500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 12:40 p.m. Feb. 25. Two airbags were stolen from a 2006 Honda Odyssey parked at a Metro station.

SNOW POINT DR., 10400 block, 8:30 a.m. to 8:45 p.m. Feb. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WALNUT HILL RD., 8800 block, 1 to 9 a.m. Feb. 25. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

WESTBARD AVE., 5:30 to 8:15 p.m. Feb. 27. A wallet was stolen from a store customer.

WISCONSIN AVE., 5400 block, 1:30 p.m. March 1. A woman in an elevator was robbed of a wallet. She said that she was holding her baby and that the wallet was taken from a baby bag that she was carrying.

WISCONSIN AVE., 5400 block, 2:45 p.m. March 2. A woman who had been bumped while riding in an elevator later discovered that her wallet was missing from her purse.

WISCONSIN AVE., 5500 block, 2:15 p.m. Feb. 22. A man distracted by a man in a parking lot was bumped from behind by another man and robbed of his wallet. When he yelled, the property was tossed to the ground and recovered. The assailants fled on foot.

WOODMONT AVE., 7900 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 24. Property was stolen from a business. A District man, 44, seen running in the area was arrested.

16TH ST., 8500 block, 10 a.m. to 8:45 p.m. Feb. 27. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BETHESDA AVE., 4800 block, 12:30 to 9:30 p.m. Feb. 24. Attempts were made to steal two Plymouth Neons in a municipal parking garage.

LITTLE FALLS DR., 4900 block, Feb. 26 to 27. A gray 1996 Toyota Avalon was stolen.

District 3 Silver Spring Station 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COLESVILLE RD., 8500 block, 11:54 p.m. Feb. 23. A man riding on a bus spoke with a passenger, groped her and fled.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

ROBBERIES

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

 Arlington County 

These were among incidents reported recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

WILSON BLVD., 2900 block, 8:20 p.m. Feb. 13. A man in a costume slammed his body against an exterior window of a restaurant, causing it to shatter. A customer was cut by falling glass.

WILSON BLVD., 3100 block, 2 a.m. Feb. 14. A man assaulted a cabdriver and punched a window of the cab. Police located a suspect. A Reston man, 26, was charged with assault.

WILSON BLVD., 4200 block, 8:30 p.m. Feb. 14. A man assaulted several people at a bus stop. A man, 29, of no fixed address was charged with assault.

10TH ST. S., 4800 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 10. Two men allegedly assaulted a male acquaintance, who was stabbed in the back. An Arlington man, 18, was charged with malicious wounding, and an Arlington man, 20, was charged with assault.

ABDUCTIONS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2300 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 12. A woman allegedly restrained a female in her apartment to prevent her from leaving and damaged the female's cellphone. An Arlington woman, 38, was charged with abduction and destruction of property.

ROBBERIES

VEITCH ST. N., 1400 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 10. A man pushed a female pedestrian to the ground and took her jacket.

HENDERSON RD. N., 4100 block, 11:30 p.m. Feb. 13. A man accepted a ride in a vehicle, then two male occupants robbed him of cash and forced him out of the vehicle.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2100 block, 3 a.m. Feb. 12. Two men leaving a vehicle were assaulted with a beer bottle after they were approached by four males who demanded cash. The four males then left in another vehicle.

WILSON BLVD., 6100 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 12. Four males assaulted a man, attempted to steal his gold chain and then fled.

24TH ST. S., 3200 block, 8:40 p.m. Feb. 5. A man pushed a female pedestrian from behind and took her purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARLINGTON RIDGE RD. S., 1500 block, 10 to 11 p.m. Feb. 5. A man entered an apartment complex by force, then entered several unlocked vehicles in a parking area.

KENSINGTON ST. N., 1100 block, 11:30 a.m. to noon Feb. 14. Property was stolen from an apartment.

KIRKWOOD ST. N., 1100 block, 10 a.m. to noon Feb. 12. Purses were stolen from two vehicles.

LEE HWY., 5000 block, 3:30 p.m. Feb. 13 to 8 a.m. Feb. 14. Property was stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

LORCOM LANE N., 4300 block, 9:20 p.m. Feb. 15. A man entered a residence and was detained by police. A man, 43, of no fixed address was charged with burglary.

PERSHING DR. N., 4300 block, 1 a.m. Feb. 9. A woman awoke and saw a man standing in her bedroom. When she shouted, the man fled.

WILSON BLVD., 4200 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 14 to 12:30 a.m. Feb. 15. Property was stolen from three mall kiosks.

NINTH ST. N., 6100 block, and 12TH ST. N., 6200 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 4 to 6 a.m. Feb. 5. Property was stolen from five vehicles.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

HIGHLAND ST. N., 1200 block, Feb. 7. A white 2006 Ford U-Haul truck was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2600 block, Feb. 13. A blue 1998 Chevrolet Tahoe was stolen.

LEXINGTON ST. N., 900 block, Feb. 15. A gray 2005 Audi A4 was stolen.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 2800 block, Feb. 9. A gray 2003 Nissan Murano was stolen.

-- Compiled by Ria Manglapus

Montgomery County crime reportMontgomery County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Lisa M. Bolton


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 2165 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Rockville area, March 18. A man sexually assaulted a person at gunpoint.

ASSAULTS

Atlantic Ave. and Crawford Dr., 11:02 a.m. March 18. A woman who had been fighting with a female nearly struck a police officer as she fled the scene in a vehicle. She later returned and grazed the officer with her vehicle. A 23-year-old Mitchellville woman was arrested. 

Beall and Maryland avenues,12:30 p.m. March 17. A man snatched a purse from a female pedestrian.

Lincoln Ave., 300 block, 10:24 p.m. March 21. A pedestrian threatened a group of people at knifepoint. A 20-year-old man was arrested.

Rockville Pike,1200 block, 1:30 p.m. March 15. A man in an electronics store who acted as if he were an employee took cash from a customer and fled.

ROBBERIES

Veirs Mill Rd. and Connecticut Ave., 7:40 a.m. March 20. A man attacked a person at a bus stop and fled with property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aintree Dr., 1400 block, 7 p.m. March 19 to 1:30 p.m. March 20. Property was stolen from a garage at a residence.

Baltimore Rd., 300 block, 7:46 p.m. March 16. Three males tried to break into a residence.

Beall Ave., 500 block, 4:45 p.m. March 16. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Blackberry Dr., 15600 block, 10 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence.

Broadwood Dr., 1500 block, 9:15 to 10 p.m. March 17. A residence was entered by force.

Keats Terr., 16500 block, 10:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. March 16. Property was stolen from a residence.

Powder Horn Dr., 11100 block, 10:30 p.m. March 20 to 4:30 a.m. March 21. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

Quelway Rd., 11200 block, 9 a.m. to 5:56 p.m. March 15. Property was stolen from a residence.

Rockville Pike, 800 block, 2:45 to 8:45 a.m. March 19. Property was stolen from a market.

Rockville Pike, 1400 block, 10 p.m. March 20 to 6 a.m. March 21. Property was stolen from a sandwich shop.

Rockville Pike, 1700 block, 1:30 to 6 p.m. March 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

Southlawn Lane, 600 block, 11 p.m. March 21 to 6:30 a.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a construction site.

Tower Oaks Blvd., 2000 block, 6 to 6:26 a.m. March 18. Property was stolen from a vehicle in the loading dock area of an office building.

Tuckerman Lane, 8400 block, 9 p.m. March 20 to 8:54 a.m. March 21. Property and cash were stolen from a vehicle.

Twinbrook Pkwy., 13200 block, 10 a.m. to 12:12 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence.

Valley Oak Cir., 13600 block, 8 a.m. to 6:15 p.m. March 18. Property was stolen from a residence.

Wootton Oaks Ct., 100 block, 8 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. March 17. Property was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Maryland Ave., 1 to 100 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 15. A 2007 Yamaha R1 motorcycle and a red 2007 Suzuki GSX R-1000 motorcycle were stolen from the same area of a parking garage.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATION 301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

University Blvd., 3700 block, 5:15 a.m. March 21. Two people attacked a motorist sitting in her vehicle outside a pharmacy.

ROBBERIES

Arlington Rd., 6900 block, 10 a.m. March 22. A person robbed a bank at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Auto Park Ave., 10400 block, 6 to 6:45 p.m. March 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

Auto Park Ave., 10400 block, 3 a.m. March 20. A shifter knob was removed from a vehicle at a car dealership. Two males were seen fleeing the area in a gray two-door Nissan.

Branch Ave., 5700 block, 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. March 17. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

Cummings Lane, 3400 block, 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. March 21. Property was stolen from a residence.

Friendship Blvd., 5300 block, 4 to 10 p.m. March 17. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle.

Hills Plaza and S. Park Ave.,6:30 to 7:30 p.m. March 15. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle.

Inman Park Cir., 5800 block, 9 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. March 16. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Wayside Dr., 6100 block, 5 a.m. March 15. An attempt was made to steal property from a vehicle. A man fled empty-handed when the car's alarm sounded.

Williams Lane, 3700 block, 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. March 16. Property was stolen from a residence.

Wisconsin Ave., 7400 block, 8:20 p.m. March 14. A group of females jostled a woman on a train station escalator. The woman later discovered that her wallet had been taken from her purse.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Rockville Pike, 11400 block, March 14 to 16. A blue 2003 Lexus was stolen using a stolen key.

16th St., 8600 block, March 18 to 19. A 2006 Honda Civic was stolen.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATION301-565-7740

ASSAULTS

Colesville Rd., 9900 block, 9:16 p.m. March 16. A male driving a white Chevrolet van struck another vehicle, threatened the driver at knifepoint, then drove away.

Valleywood Dr., 12000 block, 9 to 11 a.m. March 20. Property was stolen from a residence. A man was seen fleeing the area in a red, four-door Toyota.

DISTRICT 5GERMANTOWN STATION240-773-6200

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

INDECENT EXPOSURE

ROBBERIES

Churchill Ridge Cir., 12900 block, 1:17 a.m. March 19. Two males tried to rob a male at knifepoint.

Crystal Rock Dr. and Century Blvd., 8:40 p.m. March 18. Three men attacked a pedestrian and robbed him of property. The victim was knocked to the ground. No serious injuries were reported.

Grey Eagle Ct., 12600 block, 11:18 p.m. March 18. Four males got out of a blue four-door Ford Focus, attacked a teenager and robbed him of property, then fled in the vehicle.

Ridge Rd., 26500 block, 2:45 a.m. March 21. A man opened the door of a vehicle, threatened a motorist at knifepoint, and fled with cash. The victim said he had been asleep when the incident began.

Laytonsville Rd., 21500 block, 2:36 a.m. March 19. A man at a convenience store demanded cash from an employee at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed when confronted by a second employee.

Royal Crown Dr., 12600 block, 6:55 p.m. March 19. Four males were seen taking personal property from an area outside a school. When the property owner confronted them, he was assaulted. Three 17-year-olds, one from Gaithersburg, and a Clarksburg man, 18, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sesame Seed Ct., 12700 block, 4 to 7:45 p.m. March 14. Property was stolen from a residence.

Village Green Cir., 21300 block, 5 to 6 p.m. March 17. Property was stolen from a residence.

DISTRICT 6GAITHERSBURG STATION240-773-5700

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Saybrooke View Dr., 600 block, 3:30 p.m. March 18. A man fondled a female waiting for a ride near a middle school. A member of the victim's family was at the scene a short time later. A 19-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Washington Grove Lane and Flower Hill Way, 4:45 p.m. March 18. Two females attacked two people outside a fast-food restaurant. One of the victims was struck with a heavy stick. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Marquis Dr., 1 to 100 block, March 17 to 18. A shed near an elementary school was entered by forcing a lock.

Muncaster Mill Rd., 7200 block, March 17 to 18. A break-in occurred at a restaurant.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

Holley Ave., 7300 block, 9:45 p.m. March 27. A residence was entered by forcing open a kitchen door.

Merwood Dr., 1200 block, 5:49 p.m. March 25. Copper gutters were stolen from a house under renovation.

New Hampshire Ave., 7400 block, 9:30 a.m. March 29. An occupied apartment was entered by force. Intruders fled empty-handed when confronted.

Philadelphia Ave., 1 to 100 block, 5:30 to 9:30 p.m. March 27. Property was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Roanoke Ave., 8000 block, 4:30 p.m. March 27. An 18-year-old man was arrested on an open warrant. Charges included theft.

Roanoke Ave., 8000 block, 4:30 p.m. March 27. License plates were stolen from a vehicle. A 20-year-old woman was charged with possession of stolen property.

Westmoreland Ave., 7000 block, 5 p.m. March 27. Glass was broken in a rear door at a business.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Maple Ave., 7700 block, 9:15 p.m. March 25 to 2:36 p.m. March 26. A 2003 Dodge Stratus was stolen. It was recovered in Takoma Park.

Tulip Ave., 100 block, 7 p.m. March 29 to 8:40 a.m. March 30. A dark-green 1997 Nissan Maxima was stolen.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Bouldercrest Ct., unit block, May 25. An 18-year-old man was arrested in connection with an incident that occurred May 10. Charges included first-degree burglary, theft, malicious destruction of property and possession of paraphernalia.

Baltimore Rd., 2100 block, 4 to 4:55 p.m. June 5. A cellphone was stolen from a backpack in a locker room at a school.

Charles St., 300 block, 10:20 p.m. June 8. A laptop computer and a Metro pass were stolen from a residence entered through a sliding-glass door. A male was seen fleeing the premises with the property.

Congressional Lane, 300 block, 9 p.m. June 2 to 8 a.m. June 3. A remote-access device and a set of keys were stolen from a vehicle.

Gibbs St., 100 block, 11 p.m. June 8 to 1 a.m. June 9. A cellphone was stolen from a female at a nightclub.

King Farm Blvd., 800 block, 10:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. June 4. Cash was stolen from two purses in office cubicles.

Rockville Pike, 1200 block, noon May 27 to noon June 3. Thirteen flagpoles were stolen from a golf course.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

New Hampshire Ave., 7600 block, 5:13 a.m. June 10. A 24-year-old man was arrested on two warrants for violating a protection order.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Carroll Ave., 7000 block, 2:10 p.m. June 10. Property was stolen from a retail business.

Carroll Ave., 7000 block, 2:34 p.m. June 10. Property was stolen from a retail business.

Darwin Ave., unit block, 6:05 p.m. June 8. A male riding a bicycle borrowed a cellphone from a person, then fled with the property, with two male accomplices, also on bicycles.

Holly Ave., 7200 block, 1:39 p.m. June 8. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Walnut Ave., unit block, 9 p.m. June 11 to 9 a.m. June 12. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

- Compiled by Lisa M. Bolton

The Washington Post


September 20, 2007 Thursday
