Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA06


LENGTH: 1054 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported recently by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

ASSAULTS

ASCOT CT., 5500 block, 11:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Sept. 3. Three men in a car allegedly attempted to shoot an Alexandria woman and her friends. No injuries were reported.

KING AND SOUTH WEST STREETS, 1:56 a.m. Sept. 6. Two males assaulted a 26-year-old Alexandria man. The man suffered head injuries and was taken to a hospital by helicopter.

SANGER AVE., 5400 block, 6:45 to 7 p.m. Sept. 3. An Alexandria man, 23, was assaulted by several persons and reportedly received minor injuries. A short time later, a Dunn Loring man, 23, was charged with assault and battery by mob. 

INDECENT EXPOSURE

WEST ST. N., 600 block, 10 to 10:30 a.m. Sept. 11. A man in a parked car exposed himself to a 49-year-old Alexandria woman.

ROBBERIES

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 3500 block, 7:35 a.m. Sept. 9. A male displayed a pistol and robbed a Prince George's County man, 24, of cash, electronic items and other property. The robber fled with another male.

TOWER CT., 6000 block, 9:50 to 10:10 p.m. Sept. 7. In separate incidents, a man claiming to be an undercover Alexandria police officer robbed a boy, 15, and a woman, 42, of cash and electronic equipment.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

MARTHA CUSTIS DR., 1200 block, 3:05 a.m. Sept. 9. A man and another person were seen peering through a rear window. A man, 18, was charged with being a peeping tom, possession of marijuana, possession of alcohol by a person younger than 21 and public drunkenness. The other person was not located.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

EDSALL RD., 6000 block, 10:04 p.m. Sept. 4. Property was stolen from a residence.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3800 block, 5 a.m. Sept. 3. Cash was stolen from a business entered by force.

REYNOLDS ST. S., 100 block, 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

REYNOLDS ST. S., 100 block, 6:45 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a residence.

ROBINSON CT., 500 block, 2:25 a.m. Sept. 10. A man accosted a woman in her residence. She fled to where family members were sleeping. The man took cash, electronic items and other property.

SEMINARY RD., 4000 block, 1 a.m. Sept. 6. Electronic items were stolen from a residence entered by force.

28TH ST. S., 3300 block, 12:01 a.m. July 1 to 7:11 p.m. Sept. 9. Power tools were stolen from a storage unit.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

EDISON ST., 3600 block, 10 a.m. Aug. 29 to 11:30 a.m. Sept. 6. A gray 2004 Toyota Camry was stolen.

SEMINARY RD., 4600 block, 6:30 to 9:30 p.m. Sept. 10. A dark blue 1991 Toyota Camry was stolen.

UNION ST. N., 400 block, noon to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 6. A maroon 2006 Hyundai Sonata was stolen.

VANDALISM

WHITING ST. S., 300 block, 2:04 a.m. Sept. 6. A gun was fired at a patio door of an occupied residence. No injuries were reported.

 Arlington

These were among incidents reported recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

HENDERSON ROAD AND NORTH THOMAS STREET, 5:10 p.m. Sept. 6. A man grabbed a girl in a sexual manner and fled. An Arlington man, 28, was charged with sexual assault and battery.

ASSAULTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5000 block, 5:05 p.m. Sept. 8. During an argument, a man punched a male, knocking him to the floor, and then kicked him in the head and fled on foot. The male was taken to a hospital.

HENDERSON RD. N., 4300 block, 4:20 p.m. Sept. 9. A man allegedly attacked a female acquaintance with a sharp instrument. She fled and was later taken to a hospital for cuts on the upper body. An Arlington man, 33, was charged with malicious wounding after he was allegedly found with self-inflicted cuts on the upper body and taken to a hospital.

SECOND RD. N., 4200 block, 11:50 a.m. Sept. 9. A woman allegedly stabbed a man once in the upper body during an argument in an apartment. The man was treated by medics at the scene. An Arlington woman, 25, was charged with malicious wounding after being treated at a hospital for a hand cut.

ROBBERIES

GREENBRIER ST. S., 800 block, 12:25 a.m. Sept. 10. A man assaulted a male acquaintance, displayed a knife and demanded money. After a struggle, the robber fled empty-handed.

SCOTT ST. N., 1200 block, 2:20 p.m. Sept. 11. A man assaulted a female acquaintance, damaged her apartment and possessions and then fled in a vehicle owned by a relative of the woman. The case was under investigation.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

NASH ST. N., 1200 block, 9:20 p.m. Sept. 5. A man was seen peering through a window.

SEVENTH ST. N., 3800 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 8. A man was seen standing on the patio of an apartment looking through a glass door. He then fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HARRISON ST. N., 3600 block; 19TH ST. N., 5900 block; 22ND RD. N., 6000 block; and 38TH ST. N., 5100 block, Sept. 4 to Sept. 5. Cash, credit cards and other property were stolen from 10 vehicles. A man, 26, of no fixed address, was charged with credit card theft, destruction of property and petty theft.

JOYCE ST. S., 1400 block. A license plate was stolen.

JOYCE ST. S., 1600 block. License plates were stolen.

KING ST. S., 4600 block, 12:15 to 8 a.m. Sept. 11. Cash was stolen from a business.

FIFTH ST. S., 5700 block, 6:28 a.m. Sept. 11. A resident of a house awoke, saw a man walking through the residence and called police. The man left before police arrived. Nothing was reported missing.

17TH ST. S., 3700 block, 9:55 p.m. Sept. 5. An occupant of a residence heard noises and found a front door open and damaged. A man was seen leaving the scene.

21ST AVE. N., 3600 block, 3:30 p.m. Sept. 8 to 7:30 a.m. Sept. 10. Power tools were stolen from a residence under renovation that was entered by someone damaging a door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 4900 block. A red 1992 Toyota Camry was stolen.

COURTHOUSE RD. S., 1200 block. A silver 2002 Mitsubishi Eclipse was stolen.

QUINCY ST. S., 2000 block. A red 2007 Piaggio Fly 50 motorcycle was stolen.

10TH ST. N., 3200 block. A green 1996 Mazda Protege was stolen.

VANDALISM

ARLINGTON MILL DR. S., 800 and 900 blocks; FREDERICK ST. S., 1000 block; and COLUMBIA PIKE, 4700 block, 5:30 a.m. Sept. 9. A man was seen slashing the tires of 18 vehicles. An Arlington man, 57, was charged with destruction of property.

-- Compiled by RIA MANGLAPUS

Montgomery Crime Watch


SECTION: MONTGOMERY EXTRA; Pg. T19


LENGTH: 1866 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASHBURTON LANE, 10100 block, 4 p.m. June 5 to 10:55 a.m. June 23. An attempt was made to enter a residence by prying a sliding glass door. Nothing was reported stolen.

BATTERY LANE, 4800 block, noon to 4 p.m. June 21. A residence was entered by prying a door lock. Nothing was reported stolen.

ERICCSON RD., 1 to 100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 4:15 p.m. June 25. A residence was entered through a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

HATHERLEIGH DR., 10200 block, 9 p.m. June 24 to 7:55 a.m. June 25. Stereo equipment was stolen from a residence entered through a window.

OLD GEORGETOWN RD., 7700 block, 6 p.m. June 23 to 8 a.m. June 24. Computer equipment was stolen from a business entered by prying a door lock.

ST. ELMO AVE., 4900 block, 3 p.m. June 20 to 7 a.m. June 24. A business was entered by cutting a door. Nothing was reported stolen.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BRISTLECONE WAY, 13200 block, 1 a.m. June 22. A resident of an apartment building was awakened by a sound described as a thud and a girl's voice repeatedly yelling "No!" The man went outside to investigate and realized that the commotion was coming from a ground-level apartment, where he could see through a window that a man was having intercourse with a teenaged girl. He also saw another teenage girl and boy, both partially clothed and apparently unconscious. The witness called 911 and police responded to find a 14-year-old girl passed out on a bed and another 14-year-old girl and a 15-year-old boy naked and unconscious. Several bottles of alcohol were in plain view. The three children were transported to an area hospital for physical examinations and medical assessment. The teenagers were found to be intoxicated from consumption of a large quantity of alcohol. An investigation also revealed that they had been invited into the man's apartment and reportedly entered of their own free will. A 32-year-old Germantown man was arrested on the scene and charged with second-degree rape.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DRUMCASTLE CT., 1 to 100 block, 7 a.m. to 4:35 p.m. June 24. A back door at a residence was pried open. Nothing was reported stolen.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

FARMINGTON DR., 19700 block, 3 p.m. June 25. A 45-year-old Gaithersburg man was arrested and charged with indecent exposure in connection with an incident that occurred at his home at the above.

ROBBERIES

QUINCE ORCHARD RD., 600 block, 9:08 p.m. June 27. A man posing as a customer in a business approached a clerk as if to make a purchase, then drew a handgun, reached over a counter, took cash from an open register and fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLUBHOUSE RD., 18600 block, 4 p.m. June 24 to 8:25 a.m. June 25. Cash, a handgun and a stereo were stolen from an office entered through a window.

THOMAS FARM RD., 19200 block, 1:30 p.m. June 29. A TV/VCR combo was stolen from an elementary school entered by breaking a door.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

FREDERICK RD., 15100 block, 11:30 p.m. June 29. A boy claiming to have a gun approached a 40-year-old woman sitting on a bench in front of a store and forced her to disrobe, then raped her. On July 2, investigators arrested a 13-year-old Rockville boy and charged him with first-degree rape.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASHLEY DR., 11300 block, noon to 3 p.m. June 21. A purse, a wallet and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

BEDFORDSHIRE AVE., 11500 block, 11:30 p.m. June 21 to 6:30 a.m. June 22. A DVD player and a garage door opener were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

KORMAN CT., 9800 block, 5 p.m. June 22 to 6:30 a.m. June 23. A car key and a cell phone were stolen from a residence entered through a garage door.

PARKLAWN DR., 11800 block, 10 p.m. June 24 to 6 a.m. June 25. Computer equipment was stolen from a business.

PEBBLE HILL LANE, 14500 block, 7 p.m. June 23 to 8:30 a.m. June 24. Hockey goalie equipment was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage.

RED CLOVER DR., 15200 block, 6 p.m. June 24 to 11:45 a.m. June 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

RIVER RD., 8500 block, 6 p.m. June 25 to 10 a.m. June 26. Liquor, beer and cigarettes were stolen from a country club entered through an air conditioner opening.

SUNFLOWER DR., 4300 block, 6:05 a.m. to 4:50 p.m. June 24. Computer equipment and digital cameras were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

ROBBERIES

CAMERON ST., 8600 block, 9:50 p.m. June 26. A man entered a parking lot security office, displayed and gun and robbed the employees of cash.

UNIVERSITY BLVD. W., 100 block, 8:40 a.m. June 30. An armored money truck stopped at the rear of a bank and, as one of the two armed security guards got out of the truck and opened the rear doors, a man with a large, chrome-plated, semi-automatic pistol accosted the guard, reached into the truck, grabbed one of the money bags, took the guard's 9mm Ruger semi-automatic pistol and fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 10200 block, 5:15 a.m. June 26. Cash and a cash register were stolen from a gas station entered by breaking a side window.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 10200 block, 5:15 a.m. June 26. Cash and a gum-ball machine were stolen from a business entered by breaking a side window.

OLD COLUMBIA PIKE, 12700 block, 4:40 a.m. June 26. A window in a door at an animal hospital was broken. Nothing was reported stolen.

PLYERS MILL RD., 2700 block, 2 to 2:20 a.m. June 25. A side window at an elementary school was broken. Nothing was reported stolen.

SHEFFIELD MANOR TER., 3500 block, 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. June 25. Cash, credit cards and a computer were stolen from a residence entered by prying a sliding glass door.

ROBBERIES

COLTRANE DR., 25600 block, 1:34 p.m. June 26. Two men, one armed with a handgun and one wearing a camouflage mask, entered a residence and demanded marijuana from one of the occupants, then hit the occupant with the handgun and fled. The victim was transported to a local hospital.

MUNCASTER RD., 17700 block, 2:21 a.m. June 30. A man in a 24-hour convenience store asked for change. When a clerk reached into the register for change, the man jumped over the counter, pushed the clerk out of the way and removed cash, then jumped back over the counter and ran off.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASPEN HILL RD., 3800 block, noon June 22. Cash and clothing were stolen from a business entered by breaking a front window.

EAGLES ROOST DR., 18500 block, July 1. A 45-year-old man of the above location was arrested and charged with one count of second-degree burglary, one count of theft and one count of malicious destruction of property in connection with a June 21 burglary at a store in the 23000 block of Woodfield Road. A surveillance camera at the store recorded a man breaking a window, entering the store and stealing cigarettes, then reentering the store about 45 minutes later and taking more property. A detective said the man on the tape was the same man the detective had arrested in connection with a March 15 break-in at the store.

EVANGELINE LANE, 17400 block, 12:50 p.m. June 23. An 8-week-old puppy was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 13400 block, 11 p.m. June 24 to 7 a.m. June 25. Keys and a Chevy pick-up truck were stolen from an exterminating business entered by breaking a front door.

URBANA DR., 2500 block, 3:30 to 4:30 p.m. June 22. A credit card and a wallet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

VENTURA AVE., 1900 block, 11:30 a.m. June 23 to 6 a.m. June 25. A window at a residence was pried. Nothing was reported stolen.

VILLAGE MART DR., 18300 block, 2:30 June 20 to 6:30 a.m. June 23. Equipment was stolen from a sprinkler company entered through an unlocked door.

The following were among crime reports recently received by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COLLEGE PKWY., 500 block, 4:10 to 4:23 a.m. June 26. A male youth entered a residence and tried to sexually assault two of the female residents. One of the residents said she was going to call the police and the boy fled down a staircase and out a back door.

ASSAULTS

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, 1 to 1:10 a.m. June 23. An 18-year-old Chelsea, Mass. man was arrested and charged with second-degree assault, resisting arrest and disorderly conduct in connection with an incident at the above location.

VEIRS MILL RD., 600 block, 7:35 to 7:40 p.m. June 26. A 48-year-old Wheaton man was arrested and charged with first-degree assault in connection with an incident at the above location.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MARTINS LANE, 300 block, 2:45 to 3:15 p.m. June 27. A wallet was stolen from a locker.

MARYLAND AVE., 600 block, 12:30 to 9:40 p.m. June 28. Cash was stolen from the above location, entered through an unlocked side window.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 700 block, 7 p.m. June 24 to 7 a.m. June 25. Four wheel assemblies were removed from a vehicle.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 11:21 a.m. May 10 to 10:42 a.m. June 10. A 25-year-old Rockville woman was arrested and charged with theft in connection with an incident at the above location.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1500 block, 4:40 p.m. June 26. A male activated an alarm as he was leaving a business and abandoned the backpack he was carrying, which contained 14 stolen print cartridges.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 1:20 p.m. June 28. A wallet was stolen from a purse.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 3 to 4 p.m. June 29. A backpack left in a "break room" at a business was stolen. The backpack, emptied of its contents, was later found inside a trash can in a women's bathroom at the above location.

VEIRS MILL RD., 2100 block, 4 to 4:15 p.m. June 27. Four people entered a business and stole clothing.

WASHINGTON ST. N., 200 block, 11:40 to 11:50 a.m. June 29. A purse inadvertently left at the above location was stolen.

The following were among crime reports recently received by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

KENNEWICK AVE., 7800 block, 5 p.m. June 28 to 6 a.m. June 30. A 1987 Oldsmobile Cutlass was stolen.

LARCH AVE., 900 block, 10:05 p.m. June 27. A 1986 GMC Suburban was stolen.

MAPLE AVE., 7600 block, 8:44 p.m. June 27. A man was arrested and charged with auto theft, theft over $ 500 and unauthorized use of a motor vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MAPLEWOOD AVE., 700 block, noon June 22 to 8:15 p.m. June 30. Property was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a front window.

ARSON

PINEY BRANCH RD., 8400 block, 3:53 a.m. June 29. The owner of three Chevrolet Caprice vehicles awoke and discovered his vehicles were on fire. The Montgomery County Fire Marshall's Office is investigating the origin of the fires as suspected arson.

-- Christine Swerda

Walnut Lane NW, 200 block, 7 p.m. July 5 to 9 a.m. July 6. A driver's side mirror of a vehicle was broken.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 463 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH RD., 5:34 a.m. March 14. A woman, 47, assaulted a male at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

CALIFORNIA, 4:15 a.m. March 14. A man, 25, raped a female youth, 15. He was charged with second-degree rape and possession of marijuana.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUTE 5 AND THOMPSON CORNER RD., 12:45 p.m. A man driving a car was stopped for not wearing a seat belt. A computer check revealed that the car's plates were stolen. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

VANDALISM

CHESTNUT RD., March 17. Three tires were slashed on a vehicle parked in the driveway of a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLEMENTS, 8:37 a.m. March 15. Four tractor tires were stolen from Guy Brothers Implements.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PARK PLACE, Feb. 25 to March 10. Someone forced their way through a residence's side door. Three inside doors were damaged.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREAT MILLS, between 7 p.m. March 14 and 11 a.m. March 16. The interior of a residence was damaged.

ASSAULTS

RICKEY DR., 3:46 p.m. March 18. A woman, 42, assaulted a male at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

SALAMAUA DR., 3:46 a.m. March 18. After being arrested for disorderly conduct, a man, 20, spit on and kicked a deputy, attempted to kick another deputy and damaged a police car. He was charged with two counts of second-degree assault, two counts of property destruction and disorderly conduct.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 9:51 p.m. March 20. A woman, 30, and a man, 33, assaulted each other at a residence. They were charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

COLTON POINT RD., 10:15 a.m. March 19. A male youth, 17, e-mailed death threats to various students at Chopticon High School. The nature of the e-mails and the number of students involved disrupted school activities. He was charged with second-degree assault, reckless endangerment, e-mail harassment, telephone misuse and disruption of school activities.

VANDALISM

DUFFY'S WAY, March 16. Following his eviction from a residence, a 31-year-old Gettysburg, Pa., man severed a line on a 275-gallon fuel oil tank at the residence. He was charged with property destruction.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ST. MARY'S CITY, March 9 to 18. While students were away on spring break, several St. Mary's College dorm rooms were entered by force. Property and cash were stolen.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 540 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

ABELL, July 28 to Aug. 2. A residence was entered by force and ransacked. Nothing appeared to be stolen.

ASSAULTS

AVENUE, 11:25 p.m. Aug. 12. A man, 38, driving a vehicle attempted to hit another moving vehicle. He was charged with second-degree assault and reckless driving.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CALIFORNIA, 4 p.m. Aug. 4 to 8 a.m. Aug. 5. A wooden walkway between the Super 8 motel and Century 21 real estate office was damaged.

CALIFORNIA, Aug. 8. A man, 23, jumped on the roof and hood of a vehicle, causing damage. He was charged with malicious destruction of property.

GREAT MILLS, 5 to 6 p.m. Aug. 6. A silver Mongoose bicycle was stolen from the front yard of residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 7:27 a.m. Aug. 1. Two sheds and a storage trailer at Southern Maryland Wood Treating Co. were entered. A hammer and change were stolen. At the same location, Country Dogs was entered, and two sodas were stolen.

HOLLYWOOD, 10:30 p.m. Aug. 11. A man, 19, was stopped for a traffic violation. Marijuana was found in the vehicle. A computer check also revealed the license plates were stolen. He was charged with possession of stolen plates and possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

ASSAULTS

LEONARDTOWN, 1:10 a.m. Aug. 14. A man, 32, choked a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHURCH ST., 2:45 to 6:18 p.m. Aug. 11. A black and red mountain bike was stolen from the driveway of a residence.

LEONARDTOWN, 1 to 3 a.m. Aug. 11. A computer, cell phone, necklace and a purse containing a checkbook and credit cards were stolen from a residence.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 9 p.m. Aug. 7. A woman, 25, stabbed a man, 35, in the chest. She was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 4:56 p.m. Aug. 31. A man, 21, assaulted two woman at a residence and fled. He returned to the residence and threatened a women with a knife. He was charged with two counts of first- and second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEXINGTON PARK, 2 a.m. Aug. 12. A male youth, 11, sexually assaulted a male youth, 5. He was charged with second-, third- and fourth-degree sex offenses and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 3:35 p.m. Aug. 7. A woman, 53, choked another woman at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, 6 to 9 a.m. A Winchester shotgun, a Remington rifle and a handgun were stolen from a residence.

MECHANICSVILLE, 7:30 p.m. Aug. 10 to 7:55 p.m. Aug. 11. A Bosch saw and a portable Skil saw were stolen from a work van.

MECHANICSVILLE, 5 p.m. Aug. 11. A Stanley coping saw and a six-foot level were stolen from a house under construction.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

RIDGE, Aug. 7 to 9. The windows on two vehicles parked at Joy's Auto Service were broken.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 2533 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

Boiling Brook Pkwy., 4900 block, 5:45 a.m. Sept. 16. Two acquaintances fought each other. A 21-year-old Rockville man was charged with aggravated assault.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 4:59 p.m. Sept. 12. Two acquaintances fought each other. A 30-year-old Rockville man was charged with aggravated assault.  

Little Creek Dr., 12100 block, 11:30 a.m. Sept. 17. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Rockville Pike, 12000 block, 7:50 a.m. Sept. 13. During an argument in front of a coffee shop, a male attacked an acquaintance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Accord Dr., 9600 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 13 to 8 a.m. Sept. 14. A purse and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle.

Beall Ave., 700 block, 5 p.m. Sept. 16 to 8 a.m. Sept. 17. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Beall Ave., 700 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 16 to 8 p.m. Sept. 17. An iPod was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Fallsmead Way, 1900 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 16 to 11:30 a.m. Sept. 17. A scooter and a bicycle were stolen from a porch at a residence.

Halpine Rd., 200 block, Sept. 11 to 12. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T15


LENGTH: 453 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

VEHICLE THEFTS

GREAT MILLS, 3 p.m. July 26. A 1997 Chevrolet Cavalier was stolen from a residence. The vehicle was found nearby the next day.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HOLLYWOOD, 12:15 a.m. July 24. Two male youths, ages 13 and 14, damaged construction equipment at Woodburn's Construction. They were charged with destruction of property and trespassing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 10:04 a.m. July 22. Two weed trimmers, a chain saw and two lawn mowers were stolen from a shed at a business.

HOLLYWOOD, 5 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. July 24. A video recorder, a television, a speaker and two wheels were stolen from the trunk of a car parked at a commuter parking lot. The car was entered by breaking a window and pressing a trunk lid release button.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CHESTNUT HILLS, 4:30 p.m. July 26 to 1 a.m. July 28. Six wood slats on a gazebo were damaged.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 11:40 p.m. July 28. A man, 36, stole a license plate from a vehicle parked at a residence. He was charged with theft under $ 500.

LEONARDTOWN RD., July 11-14. Two male youths damaged an office and stole property at the St. Mary's County Fairgrounds. The two suspects were charged with felony burglary, felony theft and property destruction.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

GREAT MILLS RD., 5 p.m. July 29 to 8:30 a.m. July 30. A piece of plywood siding at a business was damaged.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, July 2002. Three male youths, all 17, broke into a business and damaged property. They were charged with felony burglary, felony theft and property destruction.

LEXINGTON PARK, 3:30 p.m. May 17. A man, 31, stole personal checks from a woman, 50, and cashed them at First National Bank of St. Mary's. He was charged with theft over $ 500 and uttering.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

MECHANICSVILLE, June 1999 to July 2002. A man, 43, sexually assaulted a female youth, 12. He was charged with second- and third-degree sex offense, child abuse and assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, 1 p.m. June 24 to 1 p.m. June 27. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle parked at B & B Auto Sales.

MECHANICSVILLE, 11 p.m. July 26 to noon July 27. An air conditioner was stolen from Faith Bible Church.

MECHANICSVILLE, 11:30 a.m. July 28. A tile saw and power tools were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in the front door.

-- Bonnie Smith

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. LZ06


LENGTH: 703 words


Loudoun County 

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

Ashburn Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BLUE ELDER TERR., 22600 block, 6 p.m. July 31 to 2 a.m. Aug. 1. A purse was stolen from a residence.

CAPILANO CT., 20900 block, 11 p.m. July 30 to 7:40 a.m. July 31. A camera and camera equipment, shoes and clothing were stolen from a vehicle. 

HARMONY CT., 20300 block, 10 p.m. July 30 to 7:30 a.m. July 31. A vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

SWEETGRASS WAY, 21200 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 4 to 7:30 a.m. Aug. 5. Cash was stolen from a wallet in an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 2269 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Creek Valley Lane and Grand Champion Dr., 9:15 p.m. Sept. 6. A man attacked a person.

Frederick Rd., 15100 block, 3:30 p.m. Sept. 8. A man groped a person at a grocery store. 

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Parklawn Dr., 11700 block, 7:15 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 6. A man exposed himself at a rental car business.

ASSAULTS

Redland Blvd., 200 block, 6:25 p.m. Sept. 9. A woman attacked an acquaintance. A 39-year-old Rockville woman was charged with aggravated assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Randolph Rd., 4400 block, 8:23 p.m. Sept. 8. A woman attacked an acquaintance. A 22-year-old District woman was charged with aggravated assault. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T17


LENGTH: 1124 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE

Iona Sound Dr., 12300 block, 11:41 a.m. Oct. 6. A man exposed himself to a female pedestrian.

DALE CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

General Washington Dr. andTwo Chimneys and Three Dormers courts,2:56 a.m. Oct. 4. Seven vehicles were tampered with or entered. Cash and electronics were recovered. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man and a 17-year-old Dale City male were arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Rocky Mount Lane, 3:54 a.m. Oct. 5. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile. A 54-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antrim Ct., 3000 block, 1 p.m. Sept. 30 to 1 p.m. Oct. 2. Someone dismantled an air conditioner at a residence and stole copper.

Bridgeport Dr., 15000 block, 2:10 to 2:30 p.m. Oct. 9. A video game system, games and a headset were stolen from a residence.

Chogburn Lane, 3000 block, 6:05 to 6:10 a.m. Oct. 4. Two mountain bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage.

Steele Ct., 2700 block, 4:15 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Oct. 4. A DVD player and other property were stolen from a residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tullamore Estate Rd., 4500 block, 5:30 a.m. to 6:35 p.m. Oct. 5. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Pointer Lane, 8100 block, 2:40 a.m. Oct. 12. One of two men shot a man sitting in a vehicle in a drug-related matter. The motorist drove himself to a hospital. A 26-year-old Sterling man and a 21-year-old Herndon man were arrested.

ROBBERIES

Irongate Way, 11:43 p.m. Oct. 11. One of three men knocked a female pedestrian to the ground and robbed her at knifepoint of a purse containing cash. A 24-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Amberview Ct., 5400 block, 11:13 a.m. Oct. 3. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a rear basement window.

Centreville Rd., 7200 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 23 to 4:56 p.m. Oct. 8. Catalytic converters were stolen from 40 vehicles.

Forrester Lane, 7500 block, 6:45 to 10:15 p.m. Oct. 4. Four handguns, a laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Gateway Ct., 6900 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 4 to 8 a.m. Oct. 5. Someone attempted to enter a business by tampering with a rear door.

Rumson Pl., 15000 block, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 6. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Sudley Rd., 8500 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 8 to 9 a.m. Oct. 10. Cash was stolen from a business.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Home Guard Dr., 11900 block, 2 a.m. Oct. 9. During an argument, a man assaulted a male acquaintance. A 34-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Opitz Blvd. and Potomac Mills Cir., 10:32 p.m. Oct. 6. During an argument, a man cut a male acquaintance with a box cutter. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 46-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Yellow Turtle Pl., 5300 block, 11:03 p.m. Oct. 5. A vehicle seller and two men went to the residence of the seller to pick up paperwork for the vehicle that the men had purchased from the resident. An argument occurred, and the resident fired a weapon at the ground near the two men. Injuries were reported. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Maryland Ave., 1600 block, 11:15 p.m. Oct. 10. Two gunmen demanded money from a man, then assaulted him. The man escaped and called police. Nothing was reported taken.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14300 block, 1:08 a.m. Oct. 6. Two gunmen in a parking lot robbed a man of a wallet and a watch.

Sunny Ridge Ct., 15000 block, 2:30 a.m. Oct. 6. Two males robbed two men of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cordell Ave., 3800 block, noon Sept. 24 to 10:24 a.m. Oct. 10. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by prying open a rear door.

Delaney Rd., 13400 block, 6 a.m. to 6:45 p.m. Oct. 6. A TV and other property were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear door.

Forestdale Ave., 3500 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 7 to 6 p.m. Oct. 9. Car parts and equipment were stolen from a shed entered by forcing open a door.

Kinnicutt Dr., 13100 block, 1:20 to 4 p.m. Oct. 1. Two mountain bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage.

Londonderry Ct., 13800 block, 4:45 to 9:30 p.m. Oct. 4. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

Merchants Plaza, 4100 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 2 to 1:22 p.m. Oct. 8. Someone attempted to enter a business by tampering with a rear door.

Ranger Loop, 1400 block, 7 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Oct. 10. A TV was stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

Saratoga Lane, 5200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 7 to 9 p.m. Oct. 10. Someone attempted to enter a church by damaging several window screens and breaking a window of a rear door.

West Longview Dr., 2300 block, 8:45 a.m. Oct. 6. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear patio door.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aspen Pl., 9700 block, midnight Oct. 9. A male and a female kicked open a locked bedroom door, hit a male resident on the back of the head and fled with a wallet containing cash.

Chervil Ct., 10200 block, 9:15 p.m. Oct. 8. A male attempted to enter a residence by prying a rear door. He fled when a resident yelled at him.

Liberia Ave., 9500 block, 3:05 to 3:55 a.m. Oct. 6. A male and a female dressed as security guards stole cigarettes from a grocery store.

Taney Rd., 9200 block, 10 a.m. to 2:40 p.m. Oct. 7. Cash, jewelry and beer were stolen from an unlocked residence.

Manassas Park

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

The Washington Post


August 26, 2010 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW17


LENGTH: 1220 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

ASSAULTS

CHERRYDALE DR., 15000 block, 3:39 a.m. Aug. 14. During an argument, a woman allegedly bit the finger of a female acquaintance. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 20-year-old Dale City woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ENDSLEY TURN, 14700 block, 6:15 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Aug. 16. Electronic items were stolen from a residence entered through a rear sliding door.

VANDALISM

DALE BLVD., 3500 block, 9:10 a.m. Aug. 11. Someone fired a BB gun at a church, breaking a front glass door. 

Dumfries area

ASSAULTS

TOMS RIVER LOOP, 16800 block, 5:49 a.m. Aug. 11. During an argument, a woman allegedly hit a male relative on the head with a bottle. The man was treated for injuries. A 32-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

POINT PLEASANT LANE, 16900 block, noon Aug. 1 to 4:15 p.m. Aug. 11. Electronic items were stolen from a residence entered by kicking open a rear door.

RIDGECREST DR., 15500 block, 8:45 p.m. Aug. 9 to 1 p.m. Aug. 10. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage door.

TUCKAHOE CT., 3400 block, noon to 4 p.m. Aug. 16. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a glass door.

Gainesville area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

DEMING DR., March to May. A man allegedly inappropriately touched a girl. A 22-year-old Remington man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SNICKERSVILLE DR., 14100 block, 9 to 11 p.m. Aug. 10. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Lake Ridge area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MAYFLOWER DR., 2000 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 11 to 1:30 p.m. Aug. 15. Someone attempted to enter a vacant building through a rear basement window.

Manassas area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COMMUNITY DR., 7900 block, 9:04 p.m. Aug. 15. A male juvenile allegedly inappropriately touched a girl. A 17-year-old Manassas male was arrested.

ASSAULTS

CAMPAIGN CT., 10800 block, 10:41 p.m. Aug. 12. A man traveled in a cab from Reston to Manassas, then cut the driver across the throat, causing the cab to hit a parked car. The man fled. The driver was treated for injuries.

KEARA CT., 7700 block, 4:28 a.m. Aug. 15. A man allegedly pushed open a door of a residence when a male resident opened it, then cut the resident with a knife. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

MCLEAN ST., 7800 block, Aug. 16. Two males assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GAMBRIL DR., 10800 block, 12:01 to 4 a.m. Aug. 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered by prying open a front door.

IRONGATE WAY, 8300 block, 6:30 a.m. to 11:45 p.m. Aug. 12. Electronics, jewelry and other property were stolen from a residence entered through a sliding-glass door.

MEADOW GROVE CT., 10600 block, 1 to 8:50 p.m. Aug. 14. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through a front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

POND CREST TRAIL, 8100 block, 2:12 p.m. Aug. 12. A man attempted to take a motorcycle from a garage. A resident went out to confront the man, who fled empty-handed.

VANDALISM

LOMOND DR., 10100 block, 4:49 a.m. Aug. 14. Someone sprayed graffiti on a concession stand near a football field at a school.

Quantico area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

POTOMAC AVE., 400 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 16 to 5 a.m. Aug. 17. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by forcing open a rear door.

Triangle area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

C ST., 500 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 15 to 4:30 a.m. Aug. 16. A business was entered through an unlocked second-story window. Nothing was reported stolen.

WHARF LANE, 3600 block, 10:45 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. Aug. 11. Electronic items and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

Woodbridge area

ASSAULTS

BELFRY LANE, 3400 block, 12:16 p.m. Aug. 16. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance.

FERRARA TERR., 4100 block, 3:12 a.m. Aug. 17. A man allegedly poured gasoline on a fence in front of a relative's residence and threatened to burn down the house. A 20-year-old man was arrested.

MERCHANT PLAZA, 4300 block, 12:15 p.m. Aug. 11. A female motorist shouted at a woman and her two children as they crossed a street at a crosswalk. When the motorist allegedly accelerated toward them, the three jumped out of the way. No injuries were reported. A 47-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

PROSTITUTION

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13600 block, Aug. 13. A 55-year-old Annandale woman and a 50-year-old Springfield woman were arrested and charged with keeping a bawdy place.

ROBBERIES

DALE BLVD., 4100 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 13. A man in a grocery store robbed a woman of cash at gunpoint. He fled on a bike.

DALE BLVD., 4100 block, 7:33 p.m. Aug. 16. A man in a grocery store asked a man standing in line for money. When he refused, the man pulled out a gun. The other man continued to refuse, and the gunman fled.

DALE BLVD., 4200 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 13. A gunman robbed a store of cash and fled on a bike.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13900 block, 9:39 p.m. Aug. 13. A male armed with a knife demanded money from a man standing in front of a convenience store. The male attempted to stab the man, who blocked the knife. The male fled when a witness chased him.

SHOPPERS BEST WAY, 14000 block, 11:39 p.m. Aug. 15. Two males at a hotel demanded money from a woman at gunpoint. The woman fled to a back room and called police. The robbers fled empty-handed.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

GRANBY RD., 4200 block, 8:15 p.m. Aug. 12. A man got out of a vehicle and exposed himself to a woman.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BUFFALO CT., 3500 block, 9:45 a.m. to 1:10 p.m. Aug. 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered through a sliding-glass door.

CALIFORNIA ST., 1400 block, 6:45 a.m. to 7 p.m. Aug. 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered through a kitchen window.

CALIFORNIA ST., 1400 block, 7 a.m. Aug. 10 to noon to Aug. 12. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a sliding-glass door.

OCCOQUAN RD., 13400 block, 2 a.m. Aug. 9 to 10:35 a.m. Aug. 11. A vacant car dealership was entered by breaking a garage window. A 27-year-old Fredericksburg man was arrested.

PURVIS DR., 18000 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. Aug. 17. Electronic items were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear glass door.

SMOKETOWN RD., 13800 block, 11:30 p.m. Aug. 13 to 8 a.m. Aug. 14. Someone attempted to enter a restaurant by breaking a front window.

VANDALISM

SPRIGGS RD., 14000 block, 8:23 a.m. Aug. 13. Someone entered a school bus, cut 12 seats and took a fire extinguisher.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

TRAFFIC INCIDENTS

CENTER ST., 9000 block, 9:30 a.m. Aug. 13. A male motorist hit a building, then drove away.

QUARRY RD., 9000 block, 1:43 a.m. Aug. 15. Police officers observed a male motorist drive in reverse on a one-way street and hit a telephone pole and a residence. The motorist fled on foot. A 29-year-old Madison, Va., man was arrested.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CONNER DR., 8200 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 12 to 8 p.m. Aug. 13. A DVD player, speakers and other property were stolen from a vehicle.

SUMTER CT., 8600 block, 12:01 to 7:30 a.m. Aug. 11. A CD player and a bag of hair salon supplies were stolen from a vehicle.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 704 words


Southern Maryland crime report

Reports from the Maryland State Police and the Calvert, Charles and St. Mary's counties sheriff's offices.

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about the crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the Maryland State police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eighth St., Sept. 7 to Sept. 9. Someone entered a home. Nothing was reported stolen.  

DUNKIRK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd., 1:34 a.m. Sept. 12. Tools were stolen from a storage container at a construction site in a shopping center.

Southern Maryland Blvd., 8:54 p.m. Sept. 15. Glass in a front door was smashed, and cellphones and cash were stolen from a business.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holland Cliff Rd., 9:30 a.m. Sept. 9. A safe was stolen from a closet at a residence.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Calvert Ct., 11:17 a.m. Sept. 9. A homeowner saw a man inside his garage. A screen was cut, and a rear window was opened in the garage. Nothing was reported stolen.

Grover Rd., Sept. 6 to Sept. 13. Farm equipment was stolen from a residential yard.

H.G. Trueman Rd., 11:48 a.m. Sept. 10. A wallet was stolen from an employee's purse at a convenience store.

OWINGS AREA

VANDALISM

Owings, 9:34 a.m. Sept. 13. A vehicle's engine and gas tank were tampered with at an auto repair business.

Charles County 

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us, featuring daily news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA

WEAPONS

Springhill Newtown Rd., Sept. 11. Police are searching for a Pomfret man, 29, who crashed his vehicle while driving it and then fled. A stolen firearm was found in the vehicle.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

St. Ignatius Dr., 1000 block, 4:04 p.m. Sept. 11. Three men robbed a convenience store at gunpoint and assaulted a clerk.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berry Rd., 10100 block, 3 to 4 a.m. Sept. 18. A hundred packs of cigarettes and cash were stolen from a business.

Freemantle Ct., 2100 block, 1 p.m. Sept. 13. Two men were seen tampering with a heating, ventilation, and air conditioning unit at a home. Police later stopped a vehicle in which the two men were riding. Inside the vehicle, police found a heating, ventilation, and air conditioning unit. The two men were charged with theft. The unit inside the vehicle was not the one being tampered with at the home.

Dr. Samuel Mudd Rd., 3700 block, 2:16 a.m. Sept. 14. A lock was missing, and a door was opened at a museum. Burglary tools were found. Nothing was reported stolen.

VANDALISM

Crain Hwy., 3300 block, 3:19 a.m. Sept. 17. A front door was damaged at a business, but the business was not entered.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line at 301-475-2936, which people can use to anonymously report information.

CALIFORNIA AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

California, Sept. 6. A California man, 45, was arrested in connection with sexual conduct involving an 8-year-old in August. The man was charged with fourth-degree sex offense and sexual abuse of a minor.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, Sept. 18. A man hit a woman on the head and scratched her wrist when she attempted to get her cellphone. A California man, 30, was charged with second-degree assault.

Sheriff Miedzinski Way, Sept. 15. During a foot chase, a man assaulted a police officer. A man, 28, was charged with assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 236 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police.  

For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFTS

AVENUE, Oct. 5. A woman, 40, attempted to cash a counterfeit check. She was charged with theft and attempted uttering of more than $ 500.

HOMICIDES

GOLDENROD DR., 11:22 a.m. Oct. 8. A man, 32, shot and killed two men, ages 38 and 39. He was charged with two counts of first-degree murder.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

CALIFORNIA, June 11 through July 7. A male youth, 17, was involved in a sexual relationship with a female youth, 12. He was charged with second-degree rape.

VEHICLE THEFTS

CALIFORNIA, Oct. 4. A man, 30, rented a vehicle and failed to return it. He was charged with theft of more than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

McINTOSH RD., 12:28 p.m. Oct. 7. A man, 18, assaulted two woman at a residence. He was charged with two counts of second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, Oct. 6. A man, 25, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 1:01 p.m. Oct. 2. A man, 34, assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

-- Bonnie Smith

Montgomery County Crime


BYLINE: REWARDS FOR INFORMATION


SECTION: Montgomery Extra; T26


LENGTH: 2104 words


The following were among incidents recently reported by the Montgomery County Police Department. No reports from the Wheaton/Glenmont District were available for this week's Montgomery Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

 Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

BRIERLY CT., 8700 block, 6 to 11 p.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

OLD GEORGETOWN RD., 8800 block, 5 p.m. Sept. 20 to 1:48 a.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a store entered by force.

PARKWOOD DR., 10300 block, 6 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WISCONSIN AVE., 7300 block, 12:15 p.m. Sept. 4 to 8 a.m. Sept. 5. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GERMANTOWN AREA, Sept. 19. A Germantown woman, 31, was raped repeatedly between Sept. 13 and Sept. 15 in her home by someone she knows.

RIDGE AND SKYLARK ROADS, 5:50 p.m. Sept. 19. A man struck a Silver Spring co-worker, 21, over the head with a shovel. The co-worker was treated at a local hospital for injuries. No arrest was reported.

BARNESVILLE RD., 15100 block, 7:08 p.m. Sept. 19. Two gunmen demanded cash from an employee of a store; the employee complied, and the robbers fled.

BONNIEBANK TERR., 16000 block, 9:30 p.m. Sept. 18 to 12:30 p.m. Sept. 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GOLF COURSE DR., 20500 block, 5 to 8 p.m. Sept. 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

PIEDMONT TRAIL RD., 12600 block, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Sept. 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GAITHERSBURG AREA, 11 a.m. Sept. 19. A Gaithersburg boy, 13, was arrested and charged as a juvenile with fourth-degree sex offense, second-degree assault and stalking in connection with several incidents that occurred between June 5 and Sept. 19 at the above location.

HARMONY HALL ROAD, 7 a.m. Sept. 22. A man shot a Gaithersburg boy, 15, with a BB gun numerous times as he walked along a path toward Gaithersburg High School. The boy ran home and called the police.

LOST KNIFE AND CONTOUR ROADS, 6:04 a.m. Sept. 17. A man confronted a Montgomery Village woman, 51, with a knife as she was waiting at a bus stop. A struggle followed, the woman was injured, and the man fled into nearby woods. The woman was treated by fire and rescue personnel.

RUSSELL AVE., 700 block, 3:20 p.m. Sept. 17. Two men shot a Gaithersburg man, 51, with a BB gun and fled. The man was injured but reportedly did not require medical treatment.

WATKINS MILL ROAD AND MILL STREAM DRIVE, 4 p.m. Sept. 19. Someone struck a male acquaintance, 19, of Gaithersburg in the head with his fist, grabbed the man's wallet and fled.

BROKEN RIDGE PL., 9700 block, 6:45 a.m. to 5:50 p.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CHRISTOPHER AVE., 400 block, 10:15 to 10:30 a.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CINNABAR TERR., 7500 block, 9 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

DIAMOND AVE., 500 block, 4 p.m. Sept 23 to 8:30 p.m. Sept. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

FROSTBURG WAY, 9200 block, 1 to 10 p.m. Sept. 13. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LEE ST., 200 block, 8:30 Sept. 16 to 10 a.m. Sept. 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

MAIN ST., 300 block, 4 to 4:23 a.m. Sept. 19. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

MEADERIDGE PL., 19300 block, 8:20 a.m. Sept. 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

PARK AVE., 100 block, 4:30 p.m. Sept. 18 to 9:30 a.m. Sept. 19. Property was stolen from an apartment building office entered by force.

SANDY LAKE DR., 19300 block, 2:20 to 2:30 p.m. Sept. 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SEQUOIA DR., 17600 block, 6 to 6:30 a.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

THOMAS FARM RD., 19400 block, 7:30 a.m. Sept. 24 to 2 a.m. Sept. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

TRAVIS LANE, 1000 block, 6:55 a.m. Sept. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WASHINGTONIAN BLVD., 9800 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 13. Property was stolen from a residence.

BOILING BROOK PKWY., 4800 block, 1:25 to 1:35 a.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a convenience store entered by force.

FOREST RIDGE DR., 14100 block, 9 a.m. to 2:15 p.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GREENPLACE TERR., 1800 block, 5:45 to 6 p.m. Sept. 23. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

NATIA MANOR DR., 14000 block, 6:45 to 10:30 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a residence.

SLEEPY HOLLOW LANE, 8800 block, 4:10 a.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

TRAILRIDGE DR., 12100 block, noon Sept. 3 to 4 p.m. Sept. 18. Property was stolen from a residence.

THAYER AVE., 500 block, 5:29 p.m. Sept. 18. A Silver Spring man, 28, was arrested and charged with indecent exposure in connection with an incident that occurred at the above location.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9000 block, 7:52 p.m. Sept. 7. A male motorist attempted to choke his female passenger, 23, after arguing with her during dinner in a restaurant. They arrived at the motorist's apartment, where he hit the woman and threatened her with a gun, then fled. The woman, of Adelphi, reportedly refused treatment for injuries.

UNIVERSITY BLVD. W., 100 block, 9:15 p.m. Sept. 15. A Silver Spring resident, 17, was arrested and charged with first- and second-degree assault in connection with an incident that occurred at the above location.

CHATHLAKE LANE AND AUTUMN DRIVE, 11:30 p.m. Sept. 19. Two gunmen entered a vehicle and took property from an Annapolis driver, 19, and a Georgia passenger, 20. The gunmen forced the driver to drive around, then had the pair get out of the vehicle at Route 29 and Dustin Road. The gunmen fled in the car, a green, four-door 2000 Audi A6 with Georgia tag number 537-PEK.

COLESVILLE RD., 8400 block, 5:30 a.m. Sept. 14. Two men reached through the window of a taxicab, grabbed cash from the driver's hands and ran off with it. The driver was not injured.

FALKLAND LANE E., 1500 block, 8:10 p.m. Sept. 21. Two gunmen demanded property from two Silver Spring pedestrians, a 26-year-old man and a 25-year-old woman, took it and fled.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 8700 block, 5 a.m. Sept. 18. Two men grabbed a Takoma Park pedestrian, 19, and a third man, armed with a knife, punched him. The assailants took money from the pedestrian's pocket and fled. The pedestrian was treated at a local hospital for injuries.

SOUTHAMPTON DR., 400 block, 7:20 p.m. Sept. 19. Three men got out of a white, four-door Honda and demanded money at knifepoint from a Silver Spring pedestrian, 21. The robbers took his cash and cell phone, then fled.

BROADMORE RD., 13000 block, 9:30 a.m. to 12:20 p.m. Sept. 20. An attempt was made to break into a residence.

BURSLEM TERR., 14400 block, 8:15 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Sept. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CASTLE BLVD., 13900 block, 7:10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sept. 20. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

CASTLE BLVD., 13900 block, 8:30 a.m. to 7:45 p.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CHATHLAKE LANE, 12900 block, 10:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

HAMPSHIRE WEST CT., 1400 block, 6:30 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

HOLLYHOCK WAY, 14300 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LOCKWOOD DR., 11200 block, 8 a.m. to 4:15 p.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LOCKWOOD DR., 11200 block, 9:15 a.m. Sept. 16. Property was stolen from a residence.

MARLOW FARM TERR., 2900 block and SUMMER HILL DR., 12900 block, 2:18 p.m. Sept. 17. A boy, 17, was arrested on the above date and charged with three counts of first-degree burglary, three counts of malicious destruction of property, possession of a concealed deadly weapon, second-degree assault and obstruction and hindering in connection with incidents that occurred at the above locations.

MOUNT PISCAH LANE, 1700 block, 6:30 to 10 p.m. Sept. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MOUNT PISCAH LANE, 1700 block, 7:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. Sept. 24. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

NOVEMBER CIR., 1500 block, 11:45 to 11:52 a.m. Sept. 21. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

PLYMOUTH ST., 8800 block, 6:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

RED LION LANE, 2800 block, 8:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SHEPPERTON TERR., 2800 block, 8:20 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SOLMAR DR., 2200 block, 10:45 a.m. to 2:50 p.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

STALEY MANOR DR., 1700 block, 6 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Sept. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

TREETOP LANE, 2000 block, 8:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. Sept. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

10TH AVE., 8400 block, 11:50 a.m. to 2:17 p.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence.

The following were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

GRAND CHAMPION DR., 1100 block, 9 to 10:15 a.m. Sept. 22. A Germantown man, 45, was arrested and charged with being a peeping Tom and trespassing in connection with an incident that occurred at the above location.

BICKFORD AVE., 500 block, 1:30 to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 20. Cash was stolen from a residence.

FREDERICK RD., 15100 block, 12:30 to 12:40 p.m. Sept. 21. A Gaithersburg man, 25, was arrested and charged with shoplifting in connection with an incident that occurred at the above location.

MARTINS LANE, 300 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 16 to 7:30 a.m. Sept. 19. Cash, a computer, a keyboard, a mouse and a monitor were stolen from a commercial business.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1000 block, midnight Aug. 4 to noon Aug. 5. Cash was stolen from a retail store.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 800 block, 11 a.m. Sept. 21 to 7 a.m. Sept. 22. Cash, a cell phone, a hand-held radio and a baseball cap were stolen from a resident.

SHADY GROVE RD., 15200 block, noon Sept. 21. A laptop computer was stolen from an office building.

STONESTREET AVE. N., 200 block, 9:15 p.m. Sept. 19 to 8 a.m. Sept. 20. Two digital cameras with charging stations, a stereo system (a turntable, amplifier, a receiver, a cassette deck and one speaker), a CD player-radio, a 35 mm camera and postage stamps were stolen from a commercial business.

WINDY KNOLL CT., 3000 block, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Sept. 23. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

WOODLAND RD., 900 block, 9:30 p.m. Sept. 23 to 8:50 a.m. Sept. 24. Two tires, wheels and hubcaps were stolen from a vehicle.

The following were among incidents recently reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

SPRUCE AVE., 7200 block, 10:44 p.m. Sept. 26. A man got out of a small, two-door, dark-colored vehicle and demanded money from a pedestrian. The pedestrian shouted and ran. The vehicle fled with two occupants.

ETHAN ALLEN AVE., 400 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 28 to 7:30 a.m. Sept. 29. Property was stolen from a building under construction.

MAPLE AVE., 7600 block, 12:01 a.m. Sept 29 to 4:30 a.m. Sept. 30. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

ALBANY AVE., 500 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 27 to 11:40 a.m. Sept. 28. A 1996 Honda Civic was stolen.

MAPLE AVE., 7500 block, 9:30 p.m. Sept. 25 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 27. A door lock and ignition were damaged in an attempt to steal a vehicle.

MAPLE AVE., 7700 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 28 to 6:45 a.m. Sept. 29. A 2001 Chrysler Sebring was stolen.

October 10, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Fairfax County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 3355 words


Fairfax County

These were among incidents reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For information, call 703-246-2253.

FAIR OAKS DISTRICT THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blake Lane, 9500 block. A side door of a vehicle was stolen.

Buccaneer Ct., 3100 block. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Davinci Lane, 13500 block. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

Fair Lakes Shopping Center, 13000 block. A wallet was stolen from a business.  

Fair Oaks Shopping Center, 11900 block. Merchandise was stolen from a business.

Alexandria

295 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


June 24, 2010 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW21


LENGTH: 1171 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

EDGEWATER DR., 14800 block, 3:30 to 10:30 p.m. June 12. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

Dumfries area

ROBBERIES

ALLEN DENT RD. AND JOHN PARY WAY, 8:24 p.m. June 11. A group of males approached a male juvenile pedestrian. One of the males punched the pedestrian and robbed him of a cellphone and headphones. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

OLIVIA WAY AND IBSEN PL., 8 p.m. June 9. A man riding a bike with his pants around his ankles exposed himself.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BOXWOOD DR., CANDLESTICK CT., FAIRWAY DR. AND SPILLWAY CT., June 14. Several vehicles were entered, and property was stolen. 

MAPLE GLEN CT., 15000 block, 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. June 12. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a sliding-glass door.

PORT HOPE POINT, 3800 block, 8 a.m. June 8 to 8 a.m. June 15. Someone entered an unoccupied residence through a window. Nothing was reported stolen.

SILVER GLEN DR., 15400 block, 8:30 to 10 a.m. June 12. Property was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CHERRY HILL RD., 1800 block, 7:55 a.m. June 12. Someone entered a residence and stole vehicle keys, then took a 2010 Toyota Rav4.

Gainesville area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHIPPER CT., 13500 block, 4:50 p.m. June 9. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing window screens.

Haymarket area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARNOLD PALMER DR., 15200 block, 9:41 a.m. June 14. Someone entered a golf cart area and damaged golf carts.

PARKERS FORD CT., 15700 block, 7 to 11 a.m. June 14. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Manassas area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

SUDLEY RD., 7600 block, 1:31 p.m. June 13. A man allegedly approached a female juvenile in a bathroom stall in a store, then held the restroom door closed when she attempted to leave. When a customer entered the restroom, the juvenile screamed, and the man fled. A 51-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

BEAMER WAY, 11100 block, 9:27 p.m. June 14. A man and a woman argued in a vehicle, and the woman got out. The man fired a weapon, injuring a female pedestrian's leg. The first woman got back into the vehicle, and the pair fled in it. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

HINSON MILL LANE, 11400 block, 3:04 a.m. June 12. Someone fired a weapon at a parked vehicle, hitting the windows and tires. A man and a woman were asleep inside the vehicle. The woman was treated for injuries from broken glass.

VANDALISM

HUME SCHOOL CT., 15800 block, 1:30 to 5 a.m. June 14. "MS13" was scratched on the door of a vehicle.

SPRING DR., 12500 block, midnight to 8 a.m. June 12. An unmarked county police vehicle was vandalized.

Triangle area

ROBBERIES

FULLER HEIGHTS RD., 18700 block, 12:46 a.m. June 11. A man in a store grabbed the store owner by the neck, grabbed cash and fled. A 21-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DONDIS CREEK DR., 3300 block, 2:03 p.m. June 14. Someone entered a residence. Nothing was reported stolen.

SOUTHWAY LANE, 4100 block, 1:20 to 2:40 p.m. June 9. Jewelry and other items were stolen from a residence entered through a living room window.

Woodbridge area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BLACKSMITH TERR., 15300 block, 9:50 p.m. June 11. A male juvenile touched a female juvenile inappropriately.

ASSAULTS

CARDIN PL., 15000 block, 5:35 p.m. June 8. A male juvenile fired a BB gun, striking a female juvenile in the buttocks.

DALE BLVD. AND I-95, 9 p.m. June 13. During an argument, a man allegedly fired a weapon at a male acquaintance, hitting his left ear. The acquaintance was treated for injuries.

DALE BLVD., 2800 block, 8:58 p.m. June 10. A man at a homeless camp allegedly cut another man's tent, then threatened to kill him. A 36-year-old man was arrested.

MARQUIS PL., 3800 block, 7:30 p.m. June 8. During an argument involving two juveniles, one was injured. The injured juvenile was treated at a hospital.

MERCHANTS PLAZA, 1400 block, 1:33 a.m. June 13. During a fight, someone hit a man in the face with a bottle after the man had attempted to break up the fight.

OLD BRIDGE RD. AND GORDON BLVD., 8:42 p.m. June 13. A woman driving a vehicle allegedly hit a female passenger several times in the face. The passenger was treated for injuries. A 24-year-old Centreville woman was arrested.

PATAMON WAY, 13000 block, 7:52 p.m. June 10. A male juvenile on a basketball court hit a man in the face.

YOSOCOMICO LANE, 2700 block, 11:30 p.m. June 12. A man allegedly hit a female acquaintance. A 29-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS

MOUNT PLEASANT DR. AND PARTRIDGE RD., 3:31 a.m. June 14. Several gunshots were fired. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

EASTLAWN AVE. AND EVANSDALE RD., 3 a.m. June 10. A male pedestrian was assaulted and robbed of cash. He did not see the assailants.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ALABAMA AVE., 15000 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. June 9. Electronic equipment was stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

BEAVERWOOD PL., 12100 block, 6 p.m. June 6 to 1:30 p.m. June 8. Electronic equipment was stolen from a residence.

DALE BLVD., 4100 block, 7:30 p.m. June 8 to 9 a.m. June 9. Merchandise was stolen from a store entered through a front window.

EASTLAWN AVE., 4400 block, 2:14 a.m. June 9. Electronic equipment and other property were stolen from a building entered through a basement door.

HARBOR DR., 12900 block, 5:30 p.m. June 8 to 8 a.m. June 9. Electronic equipment was stolen from a business entered through an unlocked door.

RANGER LOOP, 1400 block, 4:30 p.m. June 11 to 7:30 a.m. June 14. Someone entered a residence and put graffiti on walls.

STAFFORD ST., 1900 block, noon to 7 p.m. June 11. Electronic equipment and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

VANDALISM

HEDGES RUN DR. AND CRITTON CIR., 8:44 a.m. June 14. Several neighborhood signs and electrical boxes were tagged with gang graffiti.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

LIBERIA AVE., 8800 block, 10:30 p.m. June 14. Two males knocked a male pedestrian to the ground, punched him, robbed him of a wallet and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRACKETS FORD CIR., 10400 block, 3 a.m. to 5 p.m. June 9. A generator, two weed trimmers, a leaf blower, an air compressor, saws, three acetylene tanks and tools were stolen from a van and a garage.

CLEARY ST., 10200 block, June 6 to 10. A TV was taken from a residence.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COLBURN DR., 100 block, 2:10 p.m. June 7. A man allegedly knocked on a door of a residence and attempted to enter. He was pushed back outside. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with public drunkenness and unlawful entry.

WEST CARONDELET DR., 9200 block, 3:15 a.m. June 5 to 3:06 p.m. June 7. Someone pried open a shed door. Nothing was reported stolen.

-- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 1399 words


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel and Howard counties and Annapolis.

Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Annapolis area, March 27. An Annapolis man, 22, was arrested in connection with the alleged sexual abuse of a child he had been hired to babysit at the parents' home on numerous occasions between April and October 2013. He was charged with sex abuse of a minor, third- and fourth-degree sex offenses and second-degree assault. He was released on bail.

BROOKLYN AREA

ROBBERIES

Franklin Ave. and Alley 7, 1:47 a.m. April 1. A gunman told a male teenager to empty his pockets. The gunman fled on foot with a wallet and cellphone. 

Ritchie Hwy., 4000 block, 5:08 a.m. March 30. A male shot a convenience store clerk with a BB gun during an attempted robbery. He fled on foot empty-handed. The clerk was taken to a hospital with injuries that were not considered life-threatening. On April 2, a Baltimore man, 29, was arrested and charged with attempted armed robbery, reckless endangerment and first-degree assault. He was also identified as a suspect wanted for the unprovoked slashing of a pedestrian's face March 13 at Meadow and Belle Grove roads. He was charged with first- and second-degree assault, reckless endangerment and possession of a deadly weapon with intent to injure in connection with that attack.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 1700 block, 8:37 p.m. March 30. A man robbed a pedestrian of prescription drugs and a cellphone at gunpoint. The robber fled on foot.

Ritchie Hwy., 6700 block, 2:55 p.m. March 30. A man robbed a card shop of cash and fled on foot. On April 1, a Glen Burnie man, 21, was arrested and charged with robbery and theft.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Holly Creek Dr., 3400 block, March 23. A gunman robbed a female of her purse, car keys and cellphone. A man and a woman used the credit cards at a store immediately after the robbery, leading to the capture of a suspect. A warrant for a District Heights man, 32, has been issued for armed robbery and additional charges. He has been linked to two other armed robberies, one in Howard County, on March 26.

JESSUP AREA

INMATE ESCAPE

Toulson Rd., 2000 block, 4:50 a.m. March 31. A minimum security inmate scaled a perimeter fence by covering the razor wire with blankets. The blankets were noticed by staff at 6:15 a.m. The inmate, who was sentenced in Prince George's County in 2002 for attempted murder, was recaptured that day.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

TRAFFIC INCIDENTS

Forest Dr. at Tyler Ave., 11:19 a.m. March 31. A Ford Explorer hit an electrical pole, destroying it. The driver fled in the vehicle. It was found unoccupied on Rosecrest Drive near Roselawn Drive. An Edgewater man, 24, was arrested and charged with leaving the scene of an accident and driving with a revoked license. Utility crews worked until 4:35 a.m. the next morning to repair the pole and damaged lines.

ROBBERIES

Madison St., 1100 block, 2 a.m. March 27. Two men knocked on an apartment door and forced their way inside. They threatened to shoot the residents if they didn't give them money. They took a cellphone, hit one resident and fled through a back door. An Annapolis man, 19, and a Halethorpe man, 20, were arrested and charged with robbery, burglary, assault and theft. The younger man was also charged with drug possession.

West St., 200 block, 3 a.m. March 29. A man took a bag of chips from a gas station. An attendant inside a locked booth asked him to pay, and the man banged on the booth, telling him to come out. The man then attempted to steal the attendant's bike. The attendant came out, and the man punched him several times. An Annapolis man, 30, was arrested and charged with robbery, second-degree assault, theft and reckless endangerment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burnside St., 300 block, 11:30 p.m. March 31 to 8:20 a.m. April 1. An unlocked vehicle was ransacked. Nothing was reported stolen.

College Ave., 1-99 block, 10 a.m. to 5:20 p.m. March 29. Cash, a laptop computer, a travel bag, sunglasses, a camera, a watch, a necklace and a ring were stolen from a residence.

Garden Gate Lane, 200 block, 10:20 a.m. March 30. A male teenager was seen entering a home by forcing open a back door. An Annapolis male, 16, was arrested and charged with burglary and assault.

Market Space, 1-99 block, March 15. Cash was stolen from a restaurant. On March 27, a suspect was arrested. An Annapolis man, 29, was charged with theft and burglary. He was released on bond.

Murray Ave., 1-99 block, noon March 29 to 7 p.m. March 30. Cash and sunglasses were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Prince George St., 200 block, 9:30 p.m. March 31 to 10:15 a.m. April 1. A tote bag containing a computer speaker, a power cord and clothing was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Shipwright St., 1-99 block, noon Feb. 10 to 4 p.m. March 21. Three kayaks were stolen from a marina.

Westbridge Dr., 1900 block, 6 p.m. March 29 to 1 p.m. March 30. A laptop computer and a GPS device were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Westcott Pl., 7000 block, 12:43 p.m. April 2. A residence was entered by force. Extensive damage was caused.

COLUMBIA AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Nightmist Ct., 10300 block, 8:33 a.m. March 27. A woman left a residence, stood on the porch, yelled obscenities and exposed herself. A Columbia woman, 71, was arrested and charged with indecent exposure and harassment.

ROBBERIES

Macomber Lane, 9400 block, 11 p.m. March 27. Two boys pushed another boy on a footpath and took his shoes, cellphone and other property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bird Song Pass, 10800 block, 4:27 p.m. March 28. A bike was stolen from a garage.

Fruitgift Pl., 6500 block, noon to 12:45 p.m. March 31. A video game system and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10100 block, 3:19 a.m. March 31. Cigarettes, cigars and lottery tickets were stolen from a store entered by smashing a front glass door. An attempt was made to pry open an ATM.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Broken Land Pkwy. near Route 32, 5:36 p.m. March 30. A burgundy 2009 Range Rover SUV was stolen.

Cobblefield Dr., 8600 block, 11:20 p.m. March 31. A green 2005 Lincoln Aviator was stolen.

Cradlerock Way, 6700 block, 4:46 p.m. March 30. A green Kawasaki KX60 motorcycle was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Pirch Way, 6600 block, 11:32 p.m. March 31. Three people with guns attempted to enter a residence by kicking a front door. Entry was not gained.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Argent Path, 3100 block, 5 p.m. March 26 to 8:30 a.m. March 27. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a kitchen window.

Plumtree Dr., 3400 block, 6:15 p.m. March 27. Two boys tried to enter a home through a window and were caught by a resident. Two Ellicott City males, 13 and 14, were arrested and charged with breaking and entering.

HANOVER AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hanover Rd., 6400 block, March 27 to March 29. A residence was ransacked. The home was entered by forcing a front door.

HIGHLAND AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clarksville Pike, 13900 block, noon to 3:55 p.m. April 1. Electronics and guns were stolen from a home entered through an unlocked door.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Stebbing Way, 9100 block, 1:40 a.m. April 2. A gunman searched someone's pockets and fled empty-handed.

 THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Covered Wagon, 9700 block, 7 a.m. to 2 p.m. April 2. Electronics were stolen from a home entered through an unlocked window.

Lynn Buff Ct., 9500 block, 2:10 a.m. March 27. Two men entered a storage container. Two Laurel men, 51 and 33, were arrested and charged with second- and fourth-degree burglary.

Mary Lee Lane, 8300 block, 7:40 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. March 31. Jewelry and electronics were stolen from a home entered by forcing open a back door.

SEVERN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barnet Ct., 2200 block, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. March 27. A residence was entered by breaking a window. Nothing was reported taken.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan
