Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 2827 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Aberdeen Park area, 3:22 p.m. Aug. 1. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Martins Lane, 300 block, 3:15 p.m. Aug. 1. A man exposed himself at a swim center.  

ASSAULTS

Parklawn Dr., 12500 block, 9:45 a.m. Aug. 3. A person at a business threatened an acquaintance with a weapon.

First St., 1300 block, 3:40 a.m. Aug. 4. A person attacked a person, then damaged property.

ROBBERIES

Crabbs Branch Way, 500 block, 8:45 p.m. Aug. 1. Three men attacked a person and fled with property.

Fordham St., 700 block, 9:40 to 11 p.m. July 27. Three males, one armed with a weapon, threatened a person, then fled with property.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Crabb Avenue and Longwood Drive, 11:59 p.m. Aug. 1. Gunshots were reported. Three males were seen fleeing the area.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beechknoll Lane, 10600 block, 12:24 a.m. July 30. A residence was entered by force.

Bradford Dr., 500 block, 7 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Aug. 1. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Chinkapin Dr., 14100 block, 8 p.m. July 28 to 9 a.m. July 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Choke Cherry Rd., unit block, 5 p.m. July 28 to 5 a.m. July 29. Property was stolen from a construction site.

Hungerford Dr., 600 block, July 26 to 28. Property was stolen from an office.

Global Positioning System units, an iPod, sneakers and cash were among property stolen from several vehicles, most of them entered by force.

DISTRICT 4WHEATON STATION240-773-5500

Fairland area, 3 to 9:30 p.m. July 29. A juvenile was sexually assaulted.

Olney Square Park area, 1:11 a.m. Aug. 5. A man attacked a woman exiting her vehicle, grabbed her around the neck and forced her to walk to a common area and raped her. After the assault, the assailant fled, and the female called police.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Briggs Ct., unit block, July 29 to 31. Property was stolen from a residence.

ASSAULTS

Middlebrook Rd., 11500 block, 12:10 a.m. July 29. A male who had been asked to leave a restaurant threatened a security officer at knifepoint, then fled in a Ford Explorer.

ROBBERIES

Willow Springs Ct., 12500 block, 6:05 p.m. July 25. Five males seen trespassing in the yard at a residence attacked a homeowner who confronted them, then robbed him of a cellphone. Five males, ages 10, 13, 13, 14 and 16, were arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Frederick Rd., 21000 block, 10:45 p.m. July 28. During a traffic stop, police discovered a loaded handgun beneath the driver's seat. A 21-year-old Germantown man was arrested.

DISTRICT 6 GAITHERSBURG STATION240-773-5700

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

William Hurley Park area, 8:45 to 9:04 p.m. July 29. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance. Police said it was a domestic incident.

ASSAULTS

Nathan's Pl., 18700 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 1. During a domestic dispute, a handgun was fired. The person who fired the gun and an accomplice fled the scene.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chelsey Knoll Ct. and Chelsey Knoll Terr., 4:35 a.m. July 26. Property was stolen from several unlocked vehicles. Officers responding to a report saw two people enter a vehicle on Chelsey Knoll Court. After a brief foot chase, an 18-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested.

Cherry Laurel Lane, 18500 block, July 31. Property was stolen from a vehicle. An arrest was made.

Dew Wood Dr., 7700 block, July 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Ironclad Ct., 8200 block, July 25. Property was stolen from a residence.

Longdraft Rd., July 30 to Aug. 1. Medication was stolen from a veterinary clinic entered by force.

Quince Orchard Blvd., 700 block, 11:34 a.m. Aug. 2. A man of no fixed address was found inside a property under foreclosure.

Rothbury Dr., 9100 block, July 26 to 27. Attempts were made to enter two vehicles by force in a parking lot at a shopping plaza.

Sawgrass Dr., 20400 block, 12:45 a.m. July 25. A GPS unit and a wallet were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Spring St., 100 block, Aug. 1. Property was stolen from a residence.

Wayridge Ct., unit block, 1:30 to 6 a.m. July 28. A vehicle key stolen during a break-in at a residence was used to steal a blue 2006 Honda Odyssey.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Briar Glen Way, 9500 block, July 28 to 29. An Acura was stolen. On July 29, the vehicle was recovered at the Montgomery Village Golf Course. All four wheels had been removed.

Mandolin Ct., 500 block, July 28 to 29. A Honda Accord was stolen. On July 29, the vehicle was recovered at the Montgomery Village Golf Course. All four wheels had been removed.

Ravenglass Way, 8700 block, July 28 to 29. An Acura was stolen. On July 29, the vehicle was recovered at the Montgomery Village Golf Course. All four wheels had been removed.

Streamside Dr., 18300 block, July 27 to 28. A 2006 Suzuki Colt was stolen.

Streamside Pl., 8200 block, July 28 to 29. A vehicle was stolen. The vehicle was later recovered. All four wheels had been removed.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

Lincoln Ave., 400 block, 3:25 p.m. Aug. 5. A 35-year-old Silver Spring man was charged with two counts of first-degree assault and two counts of second-degree assault.

Mannakee St., unit block, 2:20 p.m. Aug. 2. A 63-year-old woman was charged with second-degree assault, resisting arrest and disorderly conduct.

Maryland Ave., 1 to 100 block, 9:38 a.m. Aug. 3. A 51-year-old man was charged with second-degree assault.

Smallwood Rd., 600 block, 7:14 p.m. Aug. 6. A 34-year-old man was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bradford Dr., 500 block, 7 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Aug. 1. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door.

Broadwood Dr., 6:50 to 7 p.m. Aug. 4. Two cellphones, a wallet and cash were stolen from an area near a basketball court at a park.

Chapman Ave., 1900 block, 4 to 4:30 p.m. Aug. 6. A wallet was stolen from a dressing room at a retail store.

Church St., unit block, 5 p.m. Aug. 4 to 9 a.m. Aug. 5. Cash, an iPod and two cameras were stolen from an office suite at a business.

Clagett Dr., 1200 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 2 to 1 p.m. Aug. 3. A tree was stolen from a yard.

Cove Lane, 14000 block, 2:55 to 3:01 a.m. Aug. 7. A 30-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with fourth-degree burglary and disorderly conduct.

Frederick Ave., 300 block, 12:01 a.m. Aug. 4 to 1 p.m. Aug. 5. A seven-piece buffet set was stolen from a vehicle.

Frederick Ave., 15100 block, noon to 12:15 p.m. Aug. 3. A wallet containing cash and credit cards was stolen from a bathroom at a restaurant.

Garden View Way, 500 block, 9 a.m. July 25 to 6 p.m. Aug. 1. Jewelry, silver flatware and a Civil War-era sword were among property stolen from a residence.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 3 a.m. Aug. 6 to 10 a.m. Aug. 7. A car stereo and an iPod cable were stolen from a vehicle.

Jefferson St. E., 1600 block, noon Aug. 4 to 1 p.m. Aug. 5. A GPS unit was stolen from a vehicle.

King Farm Blvd., 700 block, 1 p.m. July 20 to 8 a.m. July 29. Cash was stolen from a wallet inside an apartment. There was no sign of a break-in.

Monroe St., unit block, 9 a.m. July 27 to noon Aug. 3. A laptop computer was stolen from an office.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 5 p.m. July 3 to 9 a.m. July 5. Jewelry was stolen from a store.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 3:16 to 3:21 p.m. Aug. 6. A 50-year-old woman was charged with shoplifting.

Selworthy Rd., 1400 block, 10 p.m. July 31 to 7 a.m. Aug. 1. A laptop computer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Elm Ave., 400 block, 10:50 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. Aug. 9. Property was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a lock to a basement door.

Elm Ave., 1000 block, 11:50 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. Aug. 9. Property was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a kitchen door.

Kirklynn and Hammond avenues, 11 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Aug. 7. A motorist sleeping in an unlocked vehicle was robbed of her wallet.

Manor Cir., 200 block, Aug. 8 to 9. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Merrimac Dr., 900 block, 5:40 p.m. Aug. 10. An 18-year-old man was charged with burglary and theft.

New Hampshire Ave., 7000 block, 1:08 p.m. Aug. 6. A residence was entered by breaking a basement window.

University Blvd., 1300 block, 1:36 p.m. Aug. 8. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle. The motorist had stopped briefly at a nearby store.

Wildwood Ave., 8000 block, 10:05 a.m. Aug. 8. A 21-year-old man was charged with theft, driving without a license and other charges.

Woodland Ave., 7000 block, 9:30 p.m. Aug. 9 to 6:48 a.m. Aug. 10. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle. The property was abandoned in another location and was recovered.

Woodland Ave., 7000 block, 2 to 6 a.m. Aug. 10. An unlocked vehicle was entered.

Woodland Ave., 7100 block, Aug. 9 to 10. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Elm Ave., 500 block, 3:45 a.m. Aug. 9. A green 2001 BMW 330i and a blue 2000 Subaru Legacy were stolen from a driveway. Keys had been left inside both vehicles. Maple Ave., 7300 block, 6 to 8:30 p.m. Aug. 6. An attempt was made to steal a motorcycle from an unlocked garage at a residence.

Poplar Ave., 7000 block, 9:45 a.m. Aug. 4 to 8 a.m. Aug. 5. A silver-colored 2004 Honda Odyssey was stolen from a driveway.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW26


LENGTH: 575 words


Prince William

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

ASSAULTS

WOODWAY PL., 4600 block, 12:24 a.m. March 21. Two males pushed a male juvenile pedestrian to the ground and threatened him with a knife. When the youth put his hands up to block the knife, it cut his hand. The assailants fled. The youth was treated for injuries.

Gainesville area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

DEMING DR., January and February. A man allegedly sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance more than once. A 25-year-old Gainesville man was arrested March 23. 

YELLOWLEG CT., Feb. 20. A male teacher allegedly had a sexual relationship with a female juvenile who was not his student. A 34-year-old Gainesville man was arrested and charged with contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

ASSAULTS

RAINY DAY WAY, 12200 block, 9:47 p.m. March 19. During an argument, a man allegedly threatened a female relative with a knife. The woman jumped through a window to escape, injuring her heel and hand. She was treated for injuries. A 21-year-old Gainesville man was arrested.

Lake Ridge area

ASSAULTS

COTTON MILL DR., 12300 block, 9:10 a.m. March 25. A man wearing a ski mask and armed with a knife grabbed a female jogger and pushed her to the ground. The woman yelled, and her dog barked. The man fled.

Manassas area

ASSAULTS

COD HARBOR LOOP, 8500 block, 4 a.m. March 20. During an argument, a woman allegedly threw steak knives at a male acquaintance. A 24-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

RIXLEW LANE, 8500 block, 1:40 a.m. March 26. Investigating a report of bullets being fired during a fight in a restaurant parking lot, police saw a male drive a vehicle from the lot. The driver allegedly attempted to hit a police car with his vehicle. The officers attempted to conduct a traffic stop, but the driver fled. The driver then returned to the lot, where he drove over a stop sign and allegedly attempted to strike a police vehicle. The driver also reportedly attempted to hit a restaurant security guard. The vehicle stopped after it struck two parked vehicles. The driver and a passenger fled on foot. Two Manassas men, 28 and 25, were arrested.

Triangle area

ASSAULTS

OLD TRIANGLE RD., 18400 block, 11 p.m. March 28. During an argument, a man allegedly stabbed another man, who was treated for injuries. A 53-year-old man was arrested.

Woodbridge area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

OLD LANDING WAY, 2100 block, March 12. A male driving instructor allegedly inappropriately touched a woman during a driving lesson. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested, charged with sexual battery and released on bond. A police investigation revealed allegations that the man had touched two other women. The man was arrested again and charged with two counts of assault.

ASSAULTS

KERRYDALE RD., 13300 block, 8:27 a.m. March 26. During an argument, a man allegedly held a female acquaintance against her will and assaulted her. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

MICHIGAN RD., 15200 block, 3:30 a.m. March 19. A man allegedly choked and stabbed a female acquaintance, who was treated for injuries. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for today's Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

-- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1063 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tarvie Cir., 9600 block, 10 a.m. to 1:20 p.m. Nov. 1. Dry-cleaning and upholstery-repair equipment were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a garage window.

DUMFRIES AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Howard St., 3400 block, 5:13 p.m. Nov. 3. Several gunshots were fired inside the home of a woman talking on the phone with an acquaintance. Said to have been making suicidal comments during the phone conversation, a 40-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested and taken to a hospital for examination.

ROBBERIES

Harwood Oaks Ct., 16600 block, 3:23 p.m. Oct. 29. Two men approached a man getting into a vehicle, then struck him in the face and fled with his wallet. 

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lee Hwy., 14800 block, 11 a.m. to noon Oct. 31. An attempt was made to enter a residence through an unlocked rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

MANASSAS AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Charnwood Ct., 8400 block, noon Nov. 3. Glass in a kitchen at a residence was damaged by gunshot.

ROBBERIES

Soldier's Ridge Cir. and Coverstone Dr., 1:17 a.m. Nov. 4. Two males robbed two male pedestrians of their wallets at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charnwood Ct., 8500 block, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Oct. 31. An attempt was made to enter a residence by tampering with the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Gold Cup Trail, 12700 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 31 to 9:30 p.m. Nov. 4. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

NOKESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristow Rd., 13500 block, 4:49 a.m. Oct. 28. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a door. Nothing was reported missing.

TRIANGLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Joplin Rd., 16500 block, 2:27 a.m. Oct. 31. A man who implied that he had a knife attacked a woman that he had driven to this location, then dropped her off at a nearby gas station. A 29-year-old Stafford man was charged with sexual assault.

ASSAULTS

Chestnut Dr., 18300 block, 12:32 a.m. Nov. 2. Three males attacked a man, who sustained a stab wound in the neck. The victim was taken to a hospital for treatment of a serious injury.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Melrose Pl., 3500 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 5. During an argument with an acquaintance, a man threatened her and a man at gunpoint. A 32-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Bacon Race Rd., 11400 block, 10:59 p.m. Oct. 31. During an argument, a woman struck an acquaintance in the back of his head with a glass vase. The man was treated for injuries. A 44-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Capri Lane, 17000 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 3. Responding to a report of a woman making threats at knifepoint, police arrested a woman who approached them with scissors raised in her hand. A 47-year-old Woodbridge woman was charged with assault.

Corbett Pl., 1200 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 29. While being restrained during an incident, a woman bit a police officer in the leg. A 19-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Catalpa Ct., 15100 block, 8:56 p.m. Oct. 31. A man threatened a pizza deliveryman at gunpoint. A 20-year-old Prince George's County man was arrested.

Meadowbrook Dr., 1300 block, 4:36 p.m. Nov. 2. During an argument with an acquaintance, a man locked himself inside a bathroom and fired a weapon several times. A 49-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Cardinal Dr., 15000 block, 10:51 p.m. Oct. 30. A man robbed a convenience store at gunpoint. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Horner Rd., 1100 block, 11:04 p.m. Nov. 5. Two men in a motel room demanded cash from two women at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed.

Opitz Blvd., 2300 block, 1:11 a.m. Oct. 29. A man attacked an acquaintance in a hospital room, then grabbed her cellphone and tried to steal a ring from her finger. A 30-year-old Stafford man was arrested at the scene on charges that included robbery and assault on a police officer.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Binder Ct., 15400 block, 6 to 9 p.m. Nov. 2. A laptop computer, a camera, a video game system and games were among property stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Birchdale Ave., 14300 block, 2 to 7 p.m. Nov. 2. Two laptop computers and jewelry were among property were stolen from a residence.

Birchdale Ave., 14300 block, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 2. A residence was entered by forcing a side door. Nothing was reported missing.

Birchdale Ave.,14700 block, 9:03 p.m. Nov. 4. A business was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

Flotilla Way, 16600 block, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 30 to 7:30 p.m. Oct. 31. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Green Acre Dr., 13400 block, 9:30 a.m. Nov. 2 to 1 a.m. Nov. 3. A TV, a laptop computer and cash were stolen from a residence.

Lynwood Dr., 5000 block, 10:15 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Nov. 1. A video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Minnieville Rd., 12700 block, 6:30 to 8:40 p.m. Oct. 30. A laptop computer was stolen from a business entered through a side window.

Old Bridge Rd., 2200 block, 4:14 a.m. Nov. 5. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by forcing a window at a drive-through station.

Pearson Dr., 4700 block, 7 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Nov. 2. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Touchstone Cir., 12200 block, 1:37 a.m. Nov. 2. Two vehicle keys were stolen from an auto-repair business. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Uppsala Ct., 15900 block, 3 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. Oct. 31. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Byrd Dr. and Grant Ave., 2:30 p.m. Oct. 31. A group of juveniles threatened a juvenile and demanded his cellphone. Two males were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maury Lane, 9800 block, noon Nov. 3 to 10 p.m. Nov. 4. A handgun, a cellphone and DVDs were among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Portner Ave., 8900 block, 5:19 p.m. Nov. 4. A residence was entered by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Forrest St., 100 block, Oct. 31 to 9:54 a.m. Nov. 2. A vehicle window was broken.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1025 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mountain Laurel Loop, 3200 block, 3:28 a.m. Aug. 2. Two unlocked vehicles parked in a driveway were entered. A wallet and keys were stolen. A residence was entered through a front door using a key. Nothing was reported stolen from the residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tall Timber Dr., 8100 block, 3:15 a.m. Aug. 1. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear door.

Yountville Dr., 7300 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. July 28. A video game system was stolen from a residence. 

Yountville Dr., 7300 block, noon July 30 to 10:20 a.m. Aug. 1. A laptop computer, a camera and other items were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ashland Ave. area, 2 a.m. July 20 to 2 a.m. July 21. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A Manassas man, 26, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Williamson Blvd., 7300 block, 1 a.m. Aug. 2. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance in the face. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A Four Oaks, N.C., man, 19, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Granite Lane, 8400 block, 9:05 p.m. July 30. A man implying he had a knife robbed another man of a bike.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Ave., 7900 block, noon July 26 to noon July 28. A residence was entered by damaging a rear door. Several windows, interior walls and fixtures were also damaged. Nothing was reported stolen.

Irongate Way, 10100 block, 9 p.m. July 31 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 1. Items were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Linblake Ct., 8200 block, 5 a.m. to 7 p.m. July 24. Rolls of coins and other items were stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

TRIANGLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Quantico Terr. Dr., 3600 block, 12:56 p.m. July 23. A man asked a female acquaintance for a ride. The woman complied and drove the man to a destination. The man got out of the vehicle, then returned with a handgun. He demanded the woman's cellphone and that she get out of the vehicle. The man drove away in the vehicle.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 8:39 p.m. Aug. 3. A man in front of a convenience store inappropriately touched a woman.

ASSAULTS

Densmore Ct., 12200 block, 11:30 p.m. July 29. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. An Upper Marlboro man, 27, was arrested.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENTS

Worchester Dr., 4400 block, 9:11 p.m. July 31. During an argument, a woman assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance, repeatedly hitting her with an electrical cord. A man also hit the girl with an electrical cord. A man, 26, and a woman, 25, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

WEAPONS

Bel Air and Stevens roads, 3:07 a.m. July 30. Several gunshots were heard, and two cars were seen leaving the area. A man was treated at a hospital for a gunshot wound to his hand.

ROBBERIES

Brook Dr., 14600 block, 11:23 p.m. July 28. A group forced a man into a pickup truck, and they struggled. Several gunshots were fired, and someone took cash from the man. He escaped from the vehicle.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Gideon Dr., 14300 block, noon Aug. 3. A man in a vehicle at a gas station exposed himself to a woman.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clipper Dr., 12500 block, 8 p.m. July 29 to 10:47 a.m. July 30. Cash was stolen from a community pool area.

Frisco Ct., 13600 block, 5 p.m. July 26 to 5 p.m. July 29. A mountain bike was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked porch door.

Ripple Creek Ct., 12700 block, 11:20 a.m. to 8:10 p.m. Aug. 1. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Sophia Ct., 3500 block, 2 p.m. July 24. Two bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Whistling Swan Way, 1600 block, midnight to 9:30 a.m. July 28. A wallet containing cash was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Dumfries Rd., 10100 block, 9:50 p.m. July 23. A female juvenile stole items from a grocery store. When an employee confronted her, the girl hit the employee several times. A Manassas girl, 16, was arrested.

WEAPONS

Greengate Ct., 9000 block, July 27. A man fired a weapon, damaging exterior and interior walls of a residence. No one was reported injured.

ROBBERIES

Stonewall Rd., 4:30 p.m. July 28. Two men demanded money from a female pedestrian, who refused. The men forced her to the ground and robbed her of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 9000 block, July 19 to 25. A video game system, speakers and an air-conditioning unit were stolen from a shed.

Garnet Ct., 9200 block, 12:40 a.m. July 21. Two males searched three vehicles. They fled when a resident confronted them.

Metcalf Blvd., 8400 block, July 22. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Richmond Ave., 9600 block, 10 p.m. July 22 to 9:30 a.m. July 23. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

Stonewall Rd., 8900 block, 10 p.m. July 26 to 9 a.m. July 27. A vehicle was entered and searched. Items were stolen from a wallet.

Weems Rd., 8600 block, July 27 to July 30. A residence was entered through a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

7th Regiment Dr., 10300 block, 2:30 to 6:30 p.m. July 20. A handgun and two watches were stolen from a residence entered by prying open a front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Centreville Rd., 9000 block, 3 p.m. July 26 to 8:30 a.m. July 27. A 2006 Ford F-550 truck was stolen from a dealership.

VANDALISM

Clover Hill Rd., 9500 block, 10 p.m. July 24 to 11 a.m. July 25. Someone fired an airsoft gun, damaging a window of a vehicle and the side of a residence.

Fairview Ave., 9600 block, 5:15 a.m. July 26. Someone fired several shots from an airsoft gun. No one was reported injured.

Georgian Ct., 8300 block, 7:15 a.m. July 29. Tires of a vehicle were punctured and flattened.

Plantation Lane, 8700 block, 1:30 to 3:30 a.m. July 28. A speed-limit sign and a mailbox were damaged.

Manassas Park

No incidents were reported by Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

The Washington Post


October 15, 2006 Sunday  
Final Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: Southern Maryland Extra; T19


LENGTH: 695 words


These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

DUNKIRK, 3:17 p.m. Oct. 7. A skateboard was stolen from Dunkirk District Park.  

MILL CREEK DR., 4:30 p.m. Oct. 9. Items were stolen from a residence.

H.G. TRUEMAN RD., 9 a.m. Oct. 3. The front doors of the Boys and Girls Club building were shattered. Nothing appeared to be missing.

SOLOMONS ISLAND RD., Oct. 6. McDonald's Express was robbed by two armed men. Employees were ordered into the cooler. The men fled the business on foot with cash.

ROUTE 2/4, 10:20 to 11:17 a.m. Oct. 8. A digital camera was stolen from a room at the Holiday Inn.

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ELDER PL., 8:11 a.m. Oct. 6. A burning portable propane torch was placed in a vehicle, igniting the interior and causing damage.

PORT TOBACCO, Oct. 5. Four boys, ages 8-12, were sexually abused in a trailer and on a boat docked at Aqualand Marina in Newburg while the boys were working for a charter fishing service. A man, 63, was charged with sexually abusing a minor, fourth-degree sex offense, second-degree assault and other crimes. 

COPLEY AVE., 1100 block, 6:31 a.m. Oct. 10. A guinea pig, a turtle, a hamster, four acrylic insect molds, candy, a radio and a digital camera were stolen from a classroom at Arthur Middleton Elementary School. Two boys, 12 and 13, were charged with second-degree burglary, destruction of property and theft more than $500. The guinea pig was fatally injured after being attacked by a dog while in the boys' possession. All other animals and items were recovered.

CRAIN HWY., 4700 block, 11:19 p.m. Oct. 11. Two men forced entry into a residence demanding money. Inside, a man, 24, was struck with a shotgun by one of the suspects. A woman, 19, was also at the residence. The couple complied with the demand for money, and the men fled.

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ABELL, Oct. 10. A woman was assaulted at a residence during a domestic dispute. A man, 49, was charged with second-degree assault.

CALIFORNIA, Oct. 10. A pellet gun was used to shoot at vehicles and streets signs. A woman also reported being shot at while in her vehicle. A man, 18, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

POTEAT CT., 11:09 a.m. Oct. 8. A woman and a state trooper were approached by a woman with a knife after the trooper had responded to a residence for a reported assault. A woman, 19, was charged with assault.

BOND CIR., 7:30 a.m. Oct. 7. A Chevrolet Silverado was stolen from a residence.

GREAT MILLS RD., 7:42 a.m. Oct. 8. Candy was stolen from a vending machine. The machine was damaged.

ROUTE 235 AND JONES WHARF RD., 2:30 p.m. Oct. 9. A man, 23, was found jumping in and out of traffic swinging a baseball bat. During his arrest, he spat on a state trooper and on the interior of a police vehicle. He was charged with assault on a police officer, resisting arrest, possession of a concealed deadly weapon and false statement to a police officer.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH


LOAD-DATE: October 15, 2006


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

302 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


March 25, 2010 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW26


LENGTH: 769 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Bristow area

ASSAULTS

SAYBROOKE DR., 9600 block, 6:40 a.m. March 15. A male grabbed a girl's arm as she left her residence and forced her back inside. When she screamed and her dog barked, the male fled. No injuries were reported.

Dale City area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

EMBERDALE DR., 4:30 p.m. March 14. A man allegedly forced his way into a residence and raped a female. An 18-year-old Dale City man was arrested. 

Dumfries area

ROBBERIES

ASHMERE CIR., 4200 block, 8:40 p.m. March 6. Two males demanded money from a pizza deliveryman at gunpoint. One of them hit the deliveryman in the face with a gun.

Lake Ridge area

WEAPONS

ROLLINGBROOK DR. AND OLD BRIDGE RD., 9:39 p.m. March 6. A man fired a handgun during an argument with two other men. No one was reported injured. A 43-year-old Lake Ridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PRESIDIO WAY, 12100 block, 12:39 p.m. March 11. Two males kicked open a rear door of a residence, forced a female resident to an upstairs bedroom and demanded to know where drugs were. One of the intruders stayed with the resident while the other searched the residence. They fled when they realized they had the wrong house. A 29-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

Manassas area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

UNIVERSITY AND FREEDOM CENTER BOULEVARDS, 1:15 p.m. March 10. A man allegedly touched a woman inappropriately during a driving lesson. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

IRONGATE WAY, 8300 block, 11:12 p.m. March 12. Two men began arguing with two males sitting in front of their residence. The argument escalated into a fight, and one of the men stabbed the two males. They were taken to a hospital. A 36-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with public intoxication.

Woodbridge area

ASSAULTS

NORBURY CT., 4300 block, 6:47 p.m. March 13. During an argument at a residence, a woman allegedly forced a male acquaintance into a living room at gunpoint and fired a round from the handgun. The male fled unharmed. A 46-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

BUFFALO CT., 3500 block, 4:30 p.m. March 6. During an argument, a woman allegedly pointed a gun at two acquaintances. No one was reported injured. A Woodbridge woman was arrested.

HAMPSTEAD RIDGE CT., 17600 block, 12:31 p.m. March 11. A man was allegedly loading and unloading a shotgun when a round was fired. A bullet went through a rear wall, through a neighbor's wall and out a rear window, striking a woman. She was flown to a hospital with injuries that weren't considered life-threatening. A 48-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with reckless handling of a firearm.

ROBBERIES

HENRY WATTS LOOP, 2200 block, 1:40 a.m. March 7. A man asked a male for directions, threatened him with a gun and demanded money. The male entered a residence and the man fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DAPPLE GRAY CT., 12200 block, 7 a.m. to 3:37 p.m. March 5. A jar of coins was stolen from a residence.

EASY ST., 1200 block, 10:14 p.m. March 5. A vacant house was entered. A man and a 37-year-old Woodbridge woman were arrested.

WINSTON LANE, 16800 block, 12:45 p.m. March 13. A man allegedly tampered with an electrical box at a residence, shutting off the lights, and then entered by breaking a basement window. A girl heard the noise and locked herself and a younger boy in a bedroom and called police and her father. After a brief chase, officers detained a man. The girl's father allegedly kicked the man in the face. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with assault.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CENTREVILLE RD., 9400 block, 6:10 p.m. March 12 to 8:30 a.m. March 13. Three computers, a digital camera and software were stolen from a business entered by forcing open a front door.

VERBENA CT., 9100 block, 10 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. March 15. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door. The residence was ransacked.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

KENT DR., 200 block, 3 to 8 a.m. March 8. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

ALPINE ST., 100 block, 6:30 p.m. March 8 to 5:41 a.m. March 9. Someone hit the windshield of a vehicle with a blunt object.

COLBURN DR., 100 block, 9:56 to 10:10 p.m. March 7. A driver's side mirror was removed from a vehicle.

-- Compiled by Sarah Lane


LOAD-DATE: March 25, 2010


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DISTRIBUTION: Prince William County


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

September 27, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 2408 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Creek Valley Lane and Grand Champion Dr., 9:15 p.m. Sept. 6. A man attacked a person. 

Frederick Rd., 15100 block, 3:30 p.m. Sept. 8. A man groped a person at a grocery store.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Parklawn Dr., 11700 block, 7:15 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 6. A man exposed himself at a rental car business.

ASSAULTS

Redland Blvd., 200 block, 6:25 p.m. Sept. 9. A woman attacked an acquaintance. A 39-year-old Rockville woman was charged with aggravated assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Randolph Rd., 4400 block, 8:23 p.m. Sept. 8. A woman attacked an acquaintance. A 22-year-old District woman was charged with aggravated assault. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Lemay Rd., 5900 block, Sept. 5. A robbery was reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crimson Leaf Ct., 8400 block, 10:30 p.m. Sept. 5 to 5:30 a.m. Sept. 6. Coins and a set of golf clubs were stolen from a vehicle.

Crimson Leaf Terr., 9400 block, 7:30 p.m. Sept. 5 to 7 a.m. Sept. 6. A vehicle break-in occurred. Nothing was reported missing.

Fishers Lane, 5600 block, Sept. 11. Two vehicle break-ins occurred in a parking garage. Nothing was reported missing.

Jeb Stuart Rd., 8100 block, 1 to 11 a.m. Sept. 8. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Maplecrest Lane, 10800 block, 1:11 a.m. Sept. 3. A cellphone charger and headphones were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Turnberry Dr., 9400 block, 3 to 9 a.m. Sept. 6. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Turnberry Dr., 9400 block, 5:30 p.m. Sept. 5 to 9 a.m. Sept. 6. Two coats and cellphone accessories were among property stolen from two vehicles.

Turnberry Dr., 9400 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 5 to 7:15 a.m. Sept. 6. A vehicle break-in occurred. Nothing was reported missing.

Turnberry Dr., 9400 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 5 to 7:15 a.m. Sept. 6. A credit card and a pair of sunglasses were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Whiterim Terr., 7700 block, 10:45 p.m. Sept. 7 to 5:45 a.m. Sept. 8. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Derbyshire and Surreywood lanes, 11 p.m. Sept. 8. Two males threatened and robbed a person.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Allen Rd., 4900 block, 2:20 p.m. Sept. 5. A purse, a laptop and a cellphone were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Clarendon Rd., 7100 block, Sept. 4 to 7. Property was stolen from a construction site.

Democracy Blvd., 7100 block, 6 to 6:30 a.m. Sept. 3. Property was stolen from two shopping-mall businesses entered by force.

Democracy Blvd., 7100 block, Sept. 5 to 6. Property was stolen from three shopping-mall kiosks entered by force.

Glenbrook Rd., 6600 block, Sept. 4 to 5. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Rockville Pike, 1400 block, Sept. 3 to 4. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

Lockwood Dr., 11600 block, 12:40 a.m. Sept. 10. Two acquaintances fought each other. No injuries were reported.

Manchester Rd., 8600 block, 2:47 a.m. Sept. 8. Two males attacked a person, then fled on foot. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Colgate Way, 13600 block, 9:43 a.m. Sept. 9. Two males threatened a person and demanded property, then fled empty-handed.

Glenville Rd., 8800 block, 8:15 p.m. Sept. 7. A robbery occurred. A 23-year-old Wheaton man was arrested.

Piney Branch Rd., 12:01 a.m. Sept. 9. A group of eight males threatened and robbed a person.

Valley Brook Dr. and New Hampshire Ave., 9:20 p.m. Sept. 7. A person threatened and robbed a person.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aventurine Terr., Chalkstone Ct., Hidden Valley Dr., Hunters Gate Ct., Old Columbia Pikeand Stewart Lane,Sept. 3 to 10. Tires, a TV, a DVD player, a vehicle light and a computer were among property stolen from seven vehicles. Two Silver Spring men, ages 19 and 36, were arrested.

Childress Terr., Hampton Hollow Dr., Marlow Farm Terr.and Wexhall Terr.,Sept. 4 to 10. Global Positioning System units, MP3 players and clothes were among property stolen from seven vehicles.

Fidler Lane, 1200 block, 7:30 to 11 a.m. Sept. 10. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Providence Ave., 9100 block, 6 to 9 p.m. Sept. 5. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

DISTRICT 4WHEATON STATION240-773-5500 ASSAULTS

Georgian Way, 2200 block, 8:59 p.m. Sept. 10. Three men attacked an acquaintance. Three Wheaton men, ages 21, 22, and 23, were charged with aggravated assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Rockville

These were among incidents recorded by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

Longwood Rd., 500 block, 6:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 12. A GPS was stolen from a vehicle.

Redland Rd., 400 block, 5:59 p.m. Sept. 14. A man put merchandise into grocery bags, then walked out of a store, where he was confronted by an employee. After making threats, he fled the area on foot.

Rockville Pike, 1500 block, 12:49 p.m. Sept. 10. Cosmetics items were stolen from a store. A man wearing a baseball cap and a woman wearing sunglasses were seen fleeing with the property.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 1:28 p.m. Sept. 15. Three females entered a store. While one argued with an employee, the other two grabbed several articles of clothing. The three then ran from the store and fled in a gray SUV.

Twinbrook Pkwy., 1900 block, 9:20 p.m. Sept. 13. A 52-year-old man was charged with theft.

First St., 1000 block, 7 p. m. Sept. 11 to 6:3o p.m. Sept. 12. Two GPS units, climbing equipment and a chainsaw were among property stolen from two vehicles

Edmonston Dr., 1200 block, 5:11 a.m. Sept. 13. A vehicle was stolen from an occupied residence using keys taken in a room that was entered by removing a window screen.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 699 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Coyote Ct. , 12400 block, 6:37 p.m. July 15. A license plate was removed from a vehicle. 

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

N. Solomans Island Rd. , 600 block, 7:28 p.m. July 14. Three men entered a department store, took clothing from a sales table near the entrance and fled in a vehicle.

West Dares Beach Rd. , 100 block, 11:19 p.m. July 20. A tire store was burglarized. While driving to the store, a police officer saw a suspect driving away in a vehicle and attempted to stop him. The suspect got out of the vehicle and tried to flee on foot but was stopped. An Elkridge man, 33, was arrested.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ann Harbor Dr. , 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. July 16. An inflatable 70-foot-long obstacle course with a water slide and an inflatable playground about 54 feet long were stolen from a trailer.

WALDORF AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf Market Pl. , 6:36 p.m. July 20. A boy, 10 to 12 years old, allegedly sexually assaulted a 4-year-old boy at a clubhouse. The 4-year-old reported the incident to relatives later in the day.

ASSAULTS

Caroline Dr. and Cedar Ct. , 11 p.m. July 19. A man, 26, was stabbed during an altercation in La Plata. He was taken to a hospital.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dorchester Cir. , 5000 block, 7 a.m. July 19. Cash was stolen from a pool house entered by force at a recreation center in Waldorf.

Leighland Ct ., 9800 block, July 20 to 21. Parts were stolen from an air conditioner.

Ridge Grove Estates , July 20 to 21. Tools were stolen from a shed entered by force at a residence in Hughesville, and a tractor was damaged.

VANDALISM

Smallwood Dr. W., 2300 block, and Lancaster Cir., 4800 block, July 20 to 21. Several rear windows were broken at two elementary schools. Nothing was reported missing.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Worth Ave. , 44900 block, July 23. An employee of a discount store allegedly took cash, gift cards and merchandise from the business between March 5 and July 22. A Lexington Park man, 20, was arrested and charged with theft.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS

Sue Dr. , 46000 block, 5:11 p.m. July 24. A woman, 24, was arrested and charged with second-degree assault after allegedly assaulting another woman during an altercation at a residence.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Morningside Lane , July 23. A man choked an acquaintance during an argument. A Lexington Park man, 31, was arrested and charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Great Mills Rd. , 21600 block, 1:50 a.m. July 17. Electronic equipment was stolen from a pawn shop entered by breaking a front glass door.

Great Mills Rd. , 21600 block, July 23. An air conditioner was stolen from a building.

Midway Dr. , July 23. A resident received a phone call from a man claiming to be from the IRS. The caller said the resident must pay $2,500 to avoid arrest. The resident purchased five $500 Green Dot cards and provided the debit card information to the caller.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith and Terence McArdle

The Washington Post


August 23, 2009 Sunday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. LZ09


LENGTH: 854 words


Loudoun County 

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact the police or sheriff's department.

Ashburn Area

ROBBERIES

ASHBURN AND FARMWELL ROADS, 9:30 p.m. Aug. 15. A female was assaulted and robbed of a purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GULICKS LANDING CT., 42600 block, 12:01 to 10 a.m. Aug. 15. Two bicycles and a cellphone were stolen from a garage. 

NOKES CORNER TERR., 42900 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 18 to 7 a.m. Aug. 19. Property and a furnace were stolen from a house under construction.

RIDGEWAY DR., 42800 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 14 to 9 a.m. Aug. 15. Three vehicles were entered and two GPS devices, a cellphone and a digital media player were stolen.

RUNNYMEADE TERR., 20900 block, 12:01 to 7:30 a.m. Aug. 19. Cash and credit cards were stolen from an office at an apartment complex.

STONESTILE PL., 22000 block, 7:30 p.m. Aug. 15 to 8:40 a.m. Aug. 16. Five vehicles were entered and a laptop, two digital media players, four GPS devices, sunglasses and credit cards were stolen.

VANDALISM

ASHBURN VILLAGE BLVD. AND OLD RYAN RD., 6:05 a.m. Aug. 15. Soap was put into a fountain.

COHASSET TERR., 20900 block, 8:30 p.m. Aug. 14 to 1 a.m. Aug. 15. A vehicle was ransacked. Nothing was reported stolen.

WINKLE DR., 42900 block, 5 to 10:50 a.m. Aug. 19. A vehicle was hit by paintballs.

Leesburg Area

ASSAULTS

ALPINE DR., 200 block, 12:32 p.m. Aug. 18. An assault occurred. Police said it was a domestic incident.

BEAUREGARD DR., 500 block, 9:23 a.m. Aug. 19. A sexual assault occurred.

FIELDSTONE DR., 700 block, 4:24 a.m. Aug. 19. A sexual assault occurred.

LAKE VIEW WAY, 300 block, 2:28 p.m. Aug. 18. Threats were reported.

LOUDOUN ST., 100 block, 11:48 a.m. Aug. 18. Threats were reported.

NANSEMOND ST., 300 block, 12:52 p.m. Aug. 19. An assault occurred. Police said it was a domestic incident.

ROYAL ST., 200 block, 7:01 a.m. Aug. 18. An assault occurred. Police said it was a domestic incident.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

UPPER MEADOW DR., 18700 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 15. A 2006 Infinity was stolen from the driveway of a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BEAUREGARD DR., 500 block, 6:14 p.m. Aug. 18. A theft occurred.

BRECKINRIDGE SQ., 400 block, 10:53 a.m. Aug. 19. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

CHERRYSTONE PL., 20400 block, 9:24 p.m. Aug. 17. Property was stolen from a building.

CLYMER CT., 1000 block, 8:04 a.m. Aug. 18. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

EDWARDS FERRY RD., 900 block, 6:43 p.m. Aug. 18. An incident of fraud was reported.

HANRAHAN CT., 400 block, 2:44 a.m. Aug. 19. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

KING ST. S., 400 block, 4:19 p.m. Aug. 19. An incident of fraud was reported.

NAVAJO DR., 44300 block, 11:59 a.m. Aug. 17. Property was stolen from a building.

RUNNYMEADE TERR., 20900 block, 7:50 a.m. Aug. 19. A theft occurred.

SMARTTS LANE, 800 block, 3:27 p.m. Aug. 18. A theft occurred.

TOLBERT LANE, 1 to 100 block, 7:57 p.m. Aug. 18. A theft occurred.

UPPER MEADOW DR., 18700 block, 8:08 p.m. Aug. 19. A theft occurred.

Potomac Falls Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RIPPLING DR., 47500 block, 8:30 p.m. Aug. 13 to 11 a.m. Aug. 14. A wallet, CDs and sunglasses were stolen from a vehicle.

Purcellville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

IVY HILLS TERR., 100 block, 6:19 p.m. Aug. 10. A bike was stolen.

MAPLE AVE. N., 500 block, 5:36 p.m. Aug. 10. A portable radio was stolen from a public safety agency.

Sterling Area

ASSAULTS

GARFIELD RD. N., 100 block, 12:19 a.m. Aug. 14. A man entered a residence and assaulted a female acquaintance. Oscar A. Lopez, 22, of Sterling was charged with burglary, simple assault, destruction of property and unlawful use or injury to a telephone.

WESTWICK CT., 100 block, 2:20 a.m. Aug. 16. Several people were involved in a fight at a party. When one of them produced a knife, a resident announced plans to call the police. The suspect damaged the telephone and fled in a vehicle. Kenneth Maurice Wilson, 21, of Vienna was charged with assault and battery and a count related to the telephone damage.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ALDER AVE. S., 600 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 17 to 5:49 a.m. Aug. 18. Two vehicles were entered by damaging windows. A GPS device, sunglasses and CDs were stolen.

HIGHWOOD CT., 21300 block, Aug. 10 to Aug. 16. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

MERCURE CIR., 44200 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 17 to 10:30 a.m. Aug. 19. A salt spreader was stolen from a construction site.

TOTTENHAM CT., 1000 block, 6 a.m. Aug. 13 to 10 a.m. Aug. 16. Jewelry, alcohol and cigars were stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

SETTLERS POINT PL., 20600 block, 1 a.m. Aug. 12 to 11 a.m. Aug. 15. Vehicle tires were damaged, the surface of a vehicle was scratched and flowers were pulled out of a planter at a residence.

The Washington Post


November 6, 2008 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ14


LENGTH: 4040 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

TOPPING RD., 4700 block, 9:25 p.m. Oct. 17. A male assaulted a male youth.

ASSAULTS

GREAT FALLS RD.,, 600 block, 6:26 p.m. Oct. 21. A person in a vehicle wearing a badge and carrying a gun tried to pull over a male driver on Route 270. The driver pulled into a school parking lot at the above location, and the assailant fled in the direction of Falls Road in a gray Dodge Intrepid with Maryland tags. 

ROBBERIES

GLEN RD. S., 11400 block, 9:05 p.m. Oct. 20. A male went to meet a man at the bottom of a driveway. The male asked whether the man had change for a $100 bill, grabbed the man and said he had a gun. The assailant took the cash and fled in a white Chevrolet Cavalier driven by a male.

MONROE ST., 700 block, 9:05 p.m. Oct. 16. Two male youths accosted a male who had just made a pizza delivery. One youth threatened the deliveryman with a knife and demanded cash. The deliveryman said he had no cash and hit one of the youths. Both youths fled on foot.

VEIRS MILL RD., 12600 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 16. A male followed a woman from an apartment building hallway to her apartment. When she entered her home and tried to lock the door, the male kicked it open and cut her with a knife. He fled and was later suspected of being involved in a robbery on Hewitt Avenue. A male was arrested in connection with both incidents.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARDENNES AVE., 12500 block, 2:40 to 3:15 p.m. Oct. 19. Property was stolen from a construction site entered by force. Police identified a suspect.

BROADWOOD DR., 300 block, 11:59 p.m. Oct. 15 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 16. An airbag was stolen from a 2006 Honda S2000.

GUDE DR. E., 500 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 16 to 7:15 a.m. Oct. 17. Change was stolen from a vehicle entered by force at a transmissions business.

GUDE DR. E., 500 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 16 to 5 p.m. Oct. 17. A vehicle at a transmissions business was entered by force and searched. Nothing was reported missing.

LONG PINE TRAIL, 11100 block, noon Oct. 18 to noon Oct. 19. Property was stolen from a residence's garage.

MOCCASIN LANE, 7600 block, 8:57 p.m. Oct. 15. A residential burglary occurred, but nothing was reported missing.

PARK LAWN TERR., 5100 block, 6:38 p.m. Oct. 21. Property was stolen from a residence.

PARK POTOMAC AVE., 12500 block, 2 p.m. Oct. 15 to 6 a.m. Oct. 16. Aluminum and copper wiring were stolen from a construction site.

PARKLAWN DR., 12300 block, 11:26 to 11:39 a.m. Oct. 18. Two people entered an auto body shop through a hole in a rear fence and took three wheel rims and a radiator. The assailants fled in a white pickup with a dark cab.

PRETTYMAN DR., 300 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 16 to 8:20 a.m. Oct. 17. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle that someone entered by breaking a window.

RESEARCH BLVD., 2500 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 16 to 11:20 p.m. Oct. 17. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle in a hotel parking lot.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1800 block, 2:30 to 5 p.m. Oct. 14. A female in a furniture store parking lot approached a woman putting her child in a car seat and asked for directions. When the woman turned back to her car, her purse was gone. It was unknown whether the female or a second person took the victim's purse.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 12000 block, 8:05 p.m. Oct. 13. A driver in a grocery store parking lot pulled up to a woman loading groceries into her car and asked for directions. The woman gave directions, and when the vehicle pulled away, the woman noticed her vehicle door was open and her purse was missing. The assailants are described as a woman with long, dark hair; a man with a tattoo on his neck of an unknown symbol; and a man with a gold tooth who was wearing a white baseball cap.

TRAVILLE GATEWAY DR., 9600 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 16 to 8:15 a.m. Oct. 17. Clothing and a laptop were stolen from a vehicle.

TWINBROOK PKWY., 500 block, 11:40 to 11:50 a.m. Oct. 15. A leaf blower was stolen from an open truck bed.

VEIRS MILL RD. AND TWINBROOK PKWY., 10 a.m. Oct. 15. A male driver pulled his vehicle alongside a girl walking to school and offered her a ride. When she refused, the man drove around the block and asked her again. When she refused again, he blew her kisses and drove off in a small, tan four-door vehicle.

VILLAGE SQUARE TERR., 12200 block, 3 to 5 p.m. Oct. 15. Property was stolen from a residence.

WESTMORE RD., 7400 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 13 to 8 a.m. Oct. 14. Several CDs and a stereo were stolen from a vehicle that someone entered by breaking a window.

WESTMORE RD., 7400 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 16 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 17. A person at an auto collision center broke a rear window of a vehicle, took a jacket and hand tools and fled.

WOODBURN RD., 500 block, 11 a.m. to noon Oct. 15. A leaf blower and a weed trimmer were stolen from an open truck bed.

YELLOWSTONE WAY, 7700 block, 8:11 p.m. Oct. 15. A male entered a residence but fled when a resident yelled. Nothing was reported missing.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

AVON DR., 5900 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 15. A male was seen kneeling behind a tree looking in a female's window. The man fled in a red Toyota Tacoma when he was spotted.

MONTROSE RD., 10400 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 22. A female saw a male looking in a window at her. She banged on the window, and he ran away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRADLEY LANE, 3500 block, Oct. 14 to Oct. 15. Two bicycles were stolen from a residence's garage.

BRIERLY RD., 8800 block, Oct. 13 to Oct. 14. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CARROLL AVE., 8700 block, 3:30 a.m. Oct. 20. A man entered a residence by force, took property and fled.

CHESTNUT AVE., 4300 block, 12:30 p.m. Oct. 20. Two males were discovered in a residence when a resident returned home. Police recovered stolen property and arrested two male youths.

DEMOCRACY BLVD., 7100 block, 12:45 p.m. Oct. 13 to Oct. 17. Property including Global Positioning System devices, cellphones and purses was stolen from vehicles entered by force in a shopping mall parking lot. A man was seen in the lot Oct. 15 breaking a vehicle's window, reaching in and taking a Global Positioning System device. When someone called out, the man dropped the stolen property and fled.

GARLAND AVE., 8800 block, 1:57 p.m. Oct. 15. Two men with tattoos on their arms were fleeing a residence when the homeowner came home. One of the men threatened her, tried to take personal property and knocked her to the ground. Both assailants fled on foot.

GEREN RD., 8700 block, 8:45 a.m. Oct. 15 to 1 a.m. Oct. 16. Two related residential burglaries occurred. In the first incident, an attempt was made to enter a residence. In the second, a residence was entered by force, and property was stolen.

GROSVENOR PL., 10100 block, Oct. 14 to Oct. 20. Property including satellite radio systems, Global Positioning System devices and other electronics was stolen from an unidentified number of vehicles entered by force.

HAMPDEN LANE, 4900 block, Oct. 16 to Oct. 17. Property was stolen from a dry-cleaning business entered by force.

LAWRENCE AVE., 3800 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 15. Property was stolen from a residence.

MARINELLI RD., 5400 block, 2 a.m. Oct. 16. A person entered a vehicle but fled when confronted.

RICKOVER RD., 4000 block, 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ROSS RD., 2600 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 15. Property was stolen from a residence by an acquaintance of the homeowner's.

WEST CEDAR AND DUDLEY LANES; WEST LOCUST AVE.; HENNING ST., 6000 block; CUSTER RD., 8200 block; ANNISTON RD., 5900 block; GRANT ST., 8600 block; and MELWOOD RD., 8600 block; Oct. 17 to Oct. 18. Electronics and other property was stolen from an unidentified number of vehicles entered by breaking windows and shimming doors.

WISCONSIN AVE., 6700 block, Oct. 18 to Oct. 19. An attempt was made to enter an office's third-floor suite.

WYNDALE RD., 7500 block, Oct. 15. A person was seen taking a bicycle from a residence.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

ASSAULTS

GEORGIA AVE., 8600 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 19. A man drew a weapon, pointed it at a man after a confrontation and yelled at him. A suspect was identified.

NORTHAMPTON DR., 800 block, 1 a.m. Oct. 18. A man at a party stabbed a person with a knife and fled.

ROBBERIES

DECEMBER WAY, 11400 block, 11:52 p.m. Oct. 17. Two men accosted a male pedestrian at knifepoint and demanded cash. The pedestrian escaped uninjured.

DEXTER AVE., 2100 block, 3:05 p.m. Oct. 14. A man with tattoos on his cheek and arms exited a vehicle, punched a person, took property and fled in a dark four-door Ford Crown Victoria.

LOCKWOOD DR., 11300 block, 3:14 a.m. Oct. 18 A man entered a convenience store, took cash and a cellphone and fled on foot.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9000 block, 2 to 2:34 p.m. Oct. 17. Two men accosted a person, demanded cash, got it and fled.

ROBEY AND GREENCASTLE ROADS, midnight Oct. 15. Three males accosted a female pedestrian and demanded cash. When she said she had none, one of the assailants punched her and took property. The assailants fled on foot.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 100 block, 10:24 p.m. Oct. 17. A man robbed a person using an ATM at gunpoint, took cash and fled.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 700 block, 2:56 p.m. Oct. 16. A male with a bat and a male riding a skateboard accosted a man. One of the males demanded cash, swung the bat toward the man and took property. The assailants fled. The male youth armed with the bat was arrested and charged in the incident.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BALMORAL DR., 900 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 15 to 8:30 a.m. Oct. 16. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

FOXGLOVE LANE, 8 p.m. Oct. 14 to 6 a.m. Oct. 15. A car stereo, tools, a carpenter drill, two saws and an extension cord were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

BEL PRE RD., 3900 block, 11:55 p.m. Oct. 20. An unidentified number of males armed with handguns attacked three males. One of the robbers discharged a round from a gun and struck one of the males. They took property and fled.

ENGLISH ORCHARD CT., 12600 block, 2:30 p.m. Oct. 14. Two males accosted a male, took his jacket and fled toward Randolph Road.

GRANDVIEW AND ARCOLA AVENUES, 5:11 p.m. Oct. 14. A man accosted a female pedestrian, demanded cash and groped her, then fled empty-handed toward Georgia Avenue.

HEWITT AVE., 3200 block, 11:20 p.m. Oct. 16. A man attacked a woman, took her purse and fled. A man, 20, was arrested.

MIDLAND RD. AND NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 8:45 p.m. Oct. 16. A man struck a male and demanded his jacket. The male complied, and the robber fled.

WHISPERING PINES CT., 14100 block, 12:35 a.m. Oct. 21. A masked man pointed a gun at a person and fled in a black Cadillac.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FARTHING DR., 3400 block, noon Oct. 14. Four male youths were seen leaving a residence. Nothing was reported missing. Police said there was evidence of alcohol use.

WISTERIA AND WALDORF DRIVES, 7 a.m. Oct. 17. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

ASSAULTS

BUBBLING SPRING RD., 14600 block, 7:39 a.m. Oct. 18. A man came home and went into his bedroom, where he found a male friend of his wife's sleeping. The resident beat the man in the head with a cylindrical object and then drove him to a hospital, where he told staff members he had found the man on the side of the road. A man, 34, was arrested.

GIRARD ST. AND LARKSPUR WAY, Oct. 19. Three males attacked a security officer near a clubhouse after the officer tried to dispel a group of 10 to 15 disorderly youths. One of the youths threatened the officer with a handgun, and one displayed a butterfly knife. They punched the man in the face and fled. One of the attackers was described as having a hard cast on his right wrist.

RUSSELL AVE., 11:40 p.m. Oct. 18. Three men accosted a male pedestrian, and one of them began slashing at the pedestrian with a razor. The assailants fled.

WEST SIDE DR., 800 block, Oct. 20. A man cut a person with a razor or knife after an argument. A man, 26, was arrested at the scene.

ROBBERIES

BAY LEAF WAY, 18500 block, 9:56 p.m. Oct. 18. Three males wearing Halloween masks followed a driver who had just exited his vehicle. They tripped him, hit him in the face and ribs, took his wallet and fled.

CLOPPER RD., 800 block, 10:15 p.m. Oct. 20. Two males with handguns assaulted two males and demanded cash. One of the assailants struck one of the males with the weapon and took cash. One of the suspects was found on Perry Parkway, and one escaped.

CLOPPER RD., 13500 block, 9:55 p.m. Oct. 18. Two men entered a restaurant and became angry when a waitress brought their bill. One of the men pulled out a knife, and both fled.

LOST KNIFE RD., 11:45 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. Oct. 16. A male reported he had been accosted by five males at a transit center who demanded cash.

MEADOW VISTA WAY, 17700 block, 2:35 p.m. Oct. 21. Two males knocked down a male youth, struck him with their fists and fled.

MONTGOMERY VILLAGE AVE. AND STEDWICK DR., 2:15 a.m. Oct. 15. A male accosted a male pedestrian, implied he had a weapon and demanded cash. The assailant struck the pedestrian, took property and fled.

PEARLBUSH DR., 7900 block, Oct. 16. A man and a woman turned on a friend trying to mediate a domestic dispute. They kicked and beat her, robbed her of property and fled.

SHILOH CHURCH AND CONRAD SPRINGS ROADS, 8:14 a.m. Oct. 18. Two men approached a male driver at the above intersection, stabbed him and fled in his car. Two men, both 20, were arrested.

SNOUFFER SCHOOL RD., 8500 block, 2:40 p.m. Oct. 16. A man placed an order for a food delivery. When the driver arrived with the food, the man met him, pulled out a handgun, took cash and fled.

WATKINS MILL RD. AND CRESTED IRIS DR., 10 p.m. Oct. 13. A male robbed a person at gunpoint of cash and property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CROSSBOW LANE, 100 block, 2 to 5 p.m. Oct. 16. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

FREDERICK AVE. N., 6 p.m. Oct. 15 to 6 p.m. Oct. 16. Property was stolen from a cookie business entered by force.

GRAND CORNER AVE., 1-100 block, Oct. 16 to Oct. 18. An attempt was made to enter a sporting goods store.

HALFPENNY COURT, 11:50 a.m. to 12:40 p.m. Oct. 19. A bicycle was stolen from an open garage at a residence.

KING JAMES WAY, 17000 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 17. Someone told police that he had heard people in an apartment that should not have been occupied. Police arrested three men.

LAYTONIA DR., 7500 block, Oct. 17 to Oct. 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LOST KNIFE CIR., 18400 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 17. Cash and credit cards were stolen from a purse.

SNOUFFER SCHOOL RD., 8500 block, 2 to 5 p.m. Oct. 18. A rental office was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

WASHINGTONIAN BLVD., 9700 block, 7 to 9:30 p.m. Oct. 18. Global Positioning System devices were stolen from three vehicles in a hotel parking lot.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported recently by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

CRABB AVE., 4:41 a.m. Oct. 20. A woman, 30, was arrested and charged with domestic assault in an earlier incident.

FIRST ST., 1200 block, 9:50 p.m. Oct. 24. A woman, 20, was arrested and charged with domestic assault in an earlier incident.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHAPMAN AVE., 1900 block, 3:55 p.m. Oct. 25. A wallet was stolen from a dressing room at a retail store.

COLLEGE PKWY., 400 block, 3 a.m. Oct. 25 to 3:40 a.m. Oct. 26. A laptop, two video game consoles, a high-definition multimedia interface cable, a video game controller and a video game were stolen from a residence.

FALLSGROVE DR., 700 block, 9:30 Oct. 9 to 8 a.m. Oct. 10. A Global Positioning System device and a digital music player were stolen from a vehicle.

FIRST ST., 800 block, 11 p.m. Oct. 22 to 5:45 a.m. Oct. 23. A rear seat, a front bumper, a front grill, a set of headlights, a tire lock and a spare tire were stolen from a vehicle.

SHADY GROVE RD., 15200 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 21 to 4 p.m. Oct. 22. Someone attempted to enter a medical office by prying a front door.

STONESTREET AVE. N., 400 block, 11 p.m. Oct. 21 to 8 a.m. Oct. 22. A front grill, a set of headlights, two radios, a seat cushion, a rear seat, a door panel and a radio cover plate were stolen from an auto repair shop that someone entered by prying a garage door.

TWINBROOK PKWY., 700 block, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Oct. 20. A saw, a drill and a bicycle were stolen from a residence's back yard.

Takoma Park

ROBBERIES

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7600 block, Oct. 25. Two of three males got out of a vehicle and accosted a female who was waiting for a ride. They took property from her and fled in the vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6500 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 12. Property was stolen from a church entered by force.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7600 block, 8 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Oct. 27. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

PHILADELPHIA AVE., 300 block, 1 to 8 a.m. Oct. 24. A vehicle's four wheels were stolen.

SHERMAN AVE., 100 block, 2 a.m. Oct. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 1300 block, 4 to 4:27 p.m. Oct. 24. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

-- Compiled by LISA M. BOLTON

The Washington Post


February 18, 2001 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County The followin ...


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 600 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site can be found at www.charlescountysheriffsoffice.org. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

BRYANS ROAD, 9:40 a.m. Feb. 12. A man, 23, was arrested in connection with the Nov. 19, 1999, rape of a female youth, 17, in a vehicle. He is charged with rape, sexual offense and assault.

BRYANS ROAD, 11:17 a.m. Feb. 8. A man, 38, turned himself in at the Charles County sheriff's office. There was an outstanding warrant for his arrest for the sexual abuse of a female youth in 1998. He was charged with one count of sexual child abuse and three counts of third-degree sex offense.

VEHICLE THEFTS

INDIAN HEAD, 9:15 a.m. Feb. 14. A man, 33, possessed a stolen vehicle. When apprehended, he gave officers a false name. He was charged with motor vehicle theft and giving a false statement to a police officer.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FREEMAN PLACE, 11:30 a.m. Feb. 11. A man, 18, and two male youths, 14 and 12, broke into a vacant house. All three were charged with fourth-degree burglary. The man, who had provided a false name at the scene, was additionally charged with making a false statement to a police officer.

ASSAULTS

WALDORF, 9 a.m. Feb. 12. During a fight Dec. 19, a man, 19, stabbed two male youths, 17 and 19, in the parking lot of a Kmart store. He was charged with first-degree assault and possession of a deadly weapon with intent to injure.

OLD WASHINGTON RD., 4100 block, 3:29 p.m. Feb. 10. A man, 41, was arguing with another man, 20. The two began to fight, and a piece of broken glass was pushed into the 20-year-old's chest. He was flown to Prince George's Hospital Center, where he was treated and released. The other man was charged with first-degree assault.

SMALLWOOD VILLAGE CENTER, 1:55 a.m. Feb. 10. A group of six to 10 suspects assaulted three people, ages 21, 28 and 23, during a fight. The 21-year-old was stabbed numerous times. He was flown to a Washington Hospital Center. The 28-year-old had multiple bruises. The 23-year-old had bruises and a cut. He was treated on the scene, but refused further treatment.

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 3100 block, 4:36 p.m. Dec. 26. A 16-year-old employee at a Shell gas station was robbed of money from the station's cash register, as well as money belonging to him. Police were seeking a male suspect about 5 feet 8 inches tall and wearing a black hat with a Dallas Cowboys logo.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BERRY RD., 5 a.m. Feb. 11. A man, 28, was stopped in a parking lot for driving with his headlights off. A computer check revealed that his car's license plates had been stolen in Washington. He was charged with theft under $ 500.

DEERWOOD COURT, 6300 block, 9 a.m. Feb. 11. Radio equipment and speakers were stolen from a vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

MALL CIRCLE DR., 11100 block, 5 to 9:15 p.m. Feb. 9. A 1997 Dodge Neon was stolen from the parking lot of the St. Charles Towne Center.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MARSHALL'S CORNER RD., 9300 block, 1:30 a.m. Feb. 7. Property was stolen from a residence. A suspect fled the scene in a vehicle.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

September 26, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 835 words


Southern Maryland crime report

Reports from the Maryland State Police and the Calvert, Charles and St. Mary's counties sheriff's offices.

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about the crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the Maryland State police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Eighth St., Sept. 7 to Sept. 9. Someone entered a home. Nothing was reported stolen.

DUNKIRK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd., 1:34 a.m. Sept. 12. Tools were stolen from a storage container at a construction site in a shopping center.

Southern Maryland Blvd., 8:54 p.m. Sept. 15. Glass in a front door was smashed, and cellphones and cash were stolen from a business.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holland Cliff Rd., 9:30 a.m. Sept. 9. A safe was stolen from a closet at a residence.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Calvert Ct., 11:17 a.m. Sept. 9. A homeowner saw a man inside his garage. A screen was cut, and a rear window was opened in the garage. Nothing was reported stolen.

Grover Rd., Sept. 6 to Sept. 13. Farm equipment was stolen from a residential yard.

H.G. Trueman Rd., 11:48 a.m. Sept. 10. A wallet was stolen from an employee's purse at a convenience store.

OWINGS AREA VANDALISM

Owings, 9:34 a.m. Sept. 13. A vehicle's engine and gas tank were tampered with at an auto repair business.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us, featuring daily news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA WEAPONS

Springhill Newtown Rd., Sept. 11. Police are searching for a Pomfret man, 29, who crashed his vehicle while driving it and then fled. A stolen firearm was found in the vehicle.

WALDORF AREA ROBBERIES

St. Ignatius Dr., 1000 block, 4:04 p.m. Sept. 11. Three men robbed a convenience store at gunpoint and assaulted a clerk.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berry Rd., 10100 block, 3 to 4 a.m. Sept. 18. A hundred packs of cigarettes and cash were stolen from a business.

Freemantle Ct., 2100 block, 1 p.m. Sept. 13. Two men were seen tampering with a heating, ventilation, and air conditioning unit at a home. Police later stopped a vehicle in which the two men were riding. Inside the vehicle, police found a heating, ventilation, and air conditioning unit. The two men were charged with theft. The unit inside the vehicle was not the one being tampered with at the home.

Dr. Samuel Mudd Rd., 3700 block, 2:16 a.m. Sept. 14. A lock was missing, and a door was opened at a museum. Burglary tools were found. Nothing was reported stolen.

VANDALISM

Crain Hwy., 3300 block, 3:19 a.m. Sept. 17. A front door was damaged at a business, but the business was not entered.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line at 301-475-2936, which people can use to anonymously report information.

CALIFORNIA AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

California, Sept. 6. A California man, 45, was arrested in connection with sexual conduct involving an 8-year-old in August. The man was charged with fourth-degree sex offense and sexual abuse of a minor.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, Sept. 18. A man hit a woman on the head and scratched her wrist when she attempted to get her cellphone. A California man, 30, was charged with second-degree assault.

Sheriff Miedzinski Way, Sept. 15. During a foot chase, a man assaulted a police officer. A man, 28, was charged with assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

LENGTH: 2678 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 ASSAULTS

Boiling Brook Pkwy., 4900 block, 5:45 a.m. Sept. 16. Two acquaintances fought each other. A 21-year-old Rockville man was charged with aggravated assault.
