310 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


September 27, 2007 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA16


LENGTH: 1059 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents recently reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

KING ST., 3200 block, 5:50 to 6:15 a.m. Sept. 12. A man exposed himself to a 41-year-old Alexandria woman.

ROBBERIES

MARK DR., 3700 block, 7 to 8 p.m. Sept. 8. Two males assaulted an Alexandria man, 41, and robbed him of cash. The man reportedly refused treatment for injuries.

MARTIN LANE, 100 block, 9:13 p.m. Sept. 13. A gunman approached an Alexandria man, 42, in a vehicle and demanded cash. The occupant said he had none, and the robber fled in a car driven by another man. Soon after, police located the car at Duke and Kemper streets, and the driver, an Alexandria man, 18, was arrested and charged with attempted robbery. The gunman escaped.

VAN DORN ST. N., 700 block, 9:30 to 9:50 p.m. Sept. 14. Two gunmen got out of a car, robbed an Alexandria man, 41, of cash and fled in the vehicle. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ALFRED ST. N., 900 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:40 p.m. Sept. 12. Electronic items were stolen from an apartment entered by force.

BRECKINRIDGE PL. N., 200 block, 6:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Sept. 13. Cash and electronic items were stolen from an apartment entered by force.

DUNSTER CT., 5700 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 9 to 11 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from an apartment entered by force.

EISENHOWER AVE., 5000 block, 5:30 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sept. 13. Property was stolen from a residence.

EISENHOWER AVE., 5000 block, 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. Sept. 12. Property was stolen from a residence.

FILLMORE AVE., 5100 block, 10 a.m. Sept. 6 to 1 p.m. Sept. 14. Cash was stolen from a residence.

MILL RD., 2200 block, 11 a.m. Sept. 15 to 9 a.m. Sept. 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WALNUT ST. W., 200 block, 9:30 to 10:52 p.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BAYLISS DR., 1300 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 16 to 11:30 a.m. Sept. 17. A red 2006 Acura TL was stolen.

BRADDOCK RD., 4800 block, 12:15 a.m. Sept. 14. A blue 2000 Ford Explorer was stolen.

CIRCLE HILL RD., 3100 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 11 to 6 a.m. Sept. 12. A beige 2005 Volkswagen Beetle convertible was stolen.

ELLICOTT ST., 4000 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 16 to 8 a.m. Sept. 17. A gray 2006 Lexus ES300 was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3800 block, 11 to 11:20 a.m. Sept. 17. A gray 2002 Isuzu Axiom was stolen.

LYNHAVEN DR., 100 block, 12:30 to 3:30 a.m. Sept. 16. A red 1991 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

SHIRLINGTON RD., 2300 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 6 to 4 p.m. Sept. 17. A tan 1989 Mercury Marquis was stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents recently reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

CLARENDON BLVD., 1 a.m. Sept. 14. Police responded to a report of a sexual assault and found a woman unconscious in a basement storage room. A Reston man, 27, was charged with forcible sodomy.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

GLEBE RD. S., 1-99 block, 2:45 p.m. Sept. 12. A man in a vehicle exposed himself to a female motorist.

ROBBERIES

GREENBRIER ST. S., 800 block, 11:18 p.m. Sept. 16. Four males displayed weapons and assaulted a man, 25, outside an apartment building and then robbed him of a wallet. The man reportedly suffered minor injuries.

HENDERSON RD., 4300 block, 11:43 p.m. Sept. 14. Five males assaulted three men in the lobby of an apartment building, took their beers and fled.

EIGHTH RD. S., 5300 block, 2:50 p.m. Sept. 15. Two males pinned a man, 46, against a door of an apartment building, robbed him of a wallet and fled.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

SECOND RD. N., 4300 block, 9:37 p.m. Sept. 14. A man peered into a bathroom window of a residence and left when a female resident screamed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CARLIN SPRINGS RD. N., 4300 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. Sept. 13. A change purse was stolen from a residence.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 3200 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 16 to 8 a.m. Sept. 17. An office was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 3800 block, 10 a.m. Sept 14 to 2:30 a.m. Sept. 15. Cash was stolen from an apartment entered by forcing a window.

EADS ST. S., 1200 block, noon to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 15. An attempt was made to enter an apartment by force.

RHODES ST. N., 1700 block. A license plate was stolen.

TAYLOR ST. S., 1300 block, 3 a.m. Sept. 15. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a screen door.

WALTER REED DR. S., 2400 block, 8 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. Sept. 13. Electronic equipment, cash, a box of checks and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a screen.

WALTER REED DR. S., 2500 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sept. 13. A laptop computer, electronic equipment and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a window.

WASHINGTON BLVD. N., 3400 block, noon to 2 p.m. Sept. 15. An attempt was made to enter an office in a restaurant.

WASHINGTON BLVD. S., 2100 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 12 to 6:05 a.m. Sept. 13. Cash and four laptop computers were stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

WASHINGTON BLVD. S., 2100 block, 6:30 p.m. Sept. 12 to 5:30 a.m. Sept. 13. A business was entered by forcing a door. Nothing was reported missing.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 3800 block. A license plate was stolen.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4100 block, 3 p.m. Sept. 14 to 7 a.m. Sept. 17. Construction material was stolen from a construction trailer.

January 18, 2007 Thursday  
Final Edition


Montgomery County Crime


BYLINE: REWARDS FOR INFORMATION


SECTION: Montgomery Extra; T23


LENGTH: 1902 words


These were among incidents reported by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

 Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

No report was available from the Rockville Station for today's Montgomery Extra.

NORFOLK AVE., 7900 block, 12:11 a.m. Jan. 8. A man wearing a white hooded sweatshirt and carrying a knife threatened a 24-year-old female pedestrian, then dragged her into an alley off Del Ray Avenue and sexually assaulted her. A 32-year-old man who was walking home from work heard the woman screaming for help and ran to the alley. The assailant fled on Del Ray Avenue toward Old Georgetown Road. The woman was transported to a local hospital for treatment of injuries.  

BURTONSVILLE AREA, 8:40 a.m. Dec. 24. A 35-year-old Burtonsville man was arrested and charged with first-degree assault, reckless endangerment, concealing a dangerous weapon and three counts of possession of drug paraphernalia in connection with a domestic dispute.

MUNCY RD., 7600 block, 12:08 p.m. Dec. 26. A 30-year-old woman reported she had been attacked with a knife by a male acquaintance who had stopped by her apartment Dec. 25 with his brother.

BENTLEY LANE, 10700 block, 7:04 p.m. Dec. 21. A gunman robbed a man of a wallet as the man was walking home with a female relative, and the robber fled across McComas Road.

COLONY RD., 100 block, 1 a.m. Jan. 1. A female asked for a cigarette from a 23-year-old Hyattsville man who had just gotten into his vehicle, and the woman's male acquaintance then put a knife to the man's throat. The assailant asked for cash but took personal property.

FENTON STREET, 4:07 p.m. Dec. 26. A man in front of a sandwich shop pulled out a black handgun and demanded cash from a 12-year-old Washington youth who was walking by. The youth complied, but the robber said it was not enough and took the youth's digital music player, then fled.

GEORGIA AVENUE, 10:35 p.m. Dec. 27. A male at a bus stop grabbed a 28-year-old Olney woman around the neck, causing her cellphone to fall to the ground. He snatched her purse, then fled southbound on Georgia Avenue and turned left onto Bel Pre Road.

GEORGIA AVE., 14200 block, 7:51 p.m. Dec. 19. One man in a group of disruptive men aboard a Ride On bus punched a 20-year-old man in the mouth and took his digital music player. Later, the men fled the bus.

GEORGIA AVENUE AND SHOREFIELD ROAD, 7:45 p.m. Dec. 30. A man with a knife followed a man who had just taken cash from an ATM. They walked across the street where two more men joined the man with the knife. The three forced the man to the ground. A knife was held to the man 's throat and he was robbed of cash.

LITTLETON STREET, 9:15 p.m., Dec. 29. Four male youths accosted a 48-year-old man walking home, forced him to the ground and took a bag from him.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 13400 block, 12:11 a.m. Dec. 30. A man armed with a screwdriver in a convenience store ordered employees to fill a bag with cigarettes. The man was last seen walking westbound across New Hampshire Avenue.

SOUTHAMPTON DR., 300 block, 8 p.m. Dec. 31. Two people demanded cash at gunpoint from a 19-year-old male pedestrian. The man complied and the robbers fled.

UNIVERSITY BOULEVARD AREA, 3 p.m. Dec. 27. Two males approached an 84-year-old man standing on the street and one struck him on the head. The man fell to the ground, and one of the assailants pointed a handgun at the man's chin. The second assailant took the man's wallet, and the robbers fled down Buckingham Drive.

BROWNSTONE DR., 14800 block, 5 p.m. Dec. 29 to noon Dec. 30. Property was stolen from a residence.

COLESVILLE RD., 8600 block, 5:30 p.m. Dec. 24 to 10 a.m. Dec. 26. Cash was stolen from a nail salon entered by force.

FAIRVIEW RD., 8900 block, 4:30 p.m. Dec. 22 to 8:30 a.m. Dec. 26. A business was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GEORGIA AVE., 8400 block, 5 to 8:23 p.m. Dec. 29. Property was stolen from a digital image processing business entered by force.

GREENCASTLE RIDGE DR., 3900 block, 3 to 3:45 p.m. Dec. 28. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 11200 block, 3:43 p.m. Jan. 1. Property was stolen from a wireless communications store entered by force.

SHEPPERTON TERR., 2900 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 22 to 1:15 p.m. Dec. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

STRAWBERRY LANE, 14800 block, 4:30 to 4:34 p.m. Dec. 28. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

SUTHERLAND RD., 10100 block, 11:30 a.m. to 9 p.m. Dec. 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

TEAGARDEN CIR., 3300 block, 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Dec. 28. Property was stolen from a residence.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 1 to 100 block, 7 a.m. Dec. 22 to 3 p.m. Dec. 29. A church was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

16TH ST., 9300 block, 11:57 a.m. to 12:02 p.m. Dec. 30. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

HOYT STREET, 9:10 p.m. Dec. 22. A man demanded cash from a 54-year-old male pedestrian of Wheaton. The pedestrian said he had none. The robber patted him down and, finding no money, told the man to run.

VEIRS MILL RD., 11100 block, 6:20 p.m. Dec. 23. A 27-year-old Takoma Park man reported he was assaulted by five males at the above location. He was unable to provide any further information to police.

AMHERST AVE., 11500 block, 4:30 p.m. Dec. 17 to 6 p.m. Dec. 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

FELDON ST., 12500 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 31 to 7 a.m. Jan. 2. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LIVINGSTON ST., 12300 block, 5:30 a.m. to 9 p.m. Jan. 10. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

PEAR TREE LANE, 3500 block, 3 p.m. Dec. 13 to 2 p.m. Jan. 2. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GERMANTOWN AREA, 5 p.m. Dec. 27. A 25-year-old man was arrested and charged with three counts of reckless endangerment, and with first- and second-degree assault in connection with a domestic dispute.

ASHMEADE RD., 18400 block, 12:30 to 4 p.m. Dec. 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

BARNESVILLE RD., 15100 block, noon Dec. 19 to 6 p.m. Dec. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CLARKSBURG RD., 20900 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 19 to 6 a.m. Dec. 20. Property was stolen from a residence.

FREDERICK RD., 20000 block, 6 p.m. Dec. 15 to 7 a.m. Dec. 18. Property was stolen from an apartment entered by force.

LOCBURY CT., 12800 block, noon Dec. 26 to 4 p.m. Dec. 30. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MAIN ST., 9800 block, 8 p.m. Dec. 21 to 5:50 a.m. Dec. 22. A nail salon was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

RIDGE RD., 26000 block, 11:45 p.m. Dec. 21 to midnight Dec. 22. A gas station was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

SMOKE HOUSE CT., 18200 block, 5 to 9 p.m. Dec. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SPINNING WHEEL DR., 13600 block, 12:04 a.m. Dec. 26. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

WISTERIA DR., 12800 block, 11:30 p.m. Dec. 23 to 11:15 a.m. Dec. 24. Cash was stolen from a grocery store entered by force.

WINNERS DR., 15700 block, 12:17 p.m. Dec. 21. An 18-year-old man was arrested and charged with first- and second-degree assault.

DIAMOND AVE. E., 200 block, 9:41 p.m. Dec. 31. A 20-year-old man of no fixed address and his 27-year-old acquaintance of Montgomery Village were arrested and charged with robbery, theft under $500 and second-degree assault. The arrests were in connection with a strong-arm robbery of a Gaithersburg man, 30.

KING JAMES WAY AREA, 2:55 p.m. Dec. 27. A man in a parking lot forced an 18-year-old woman to the ground and took her purse.

MATENY RD., 8:38 p.m. Dec. 28. One of three men pulled a handgun and demanded cash from a 23-year-old Germantown man walking away from a convenience store. The robbers forcibly took cash from the Germantown man and fled.

DEER PARK RD. E., 1 to 100 block, 7 to 10:50 p.m. Dec. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

NATHAN'S PL., 18700 block, 1 to 5 p.m. Dec. 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WALKERS CHOICE, 18700 block, 8 to 10:07 a.m. Dec. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

MONTGOMERY AVE. E., 100 block, 9:23 p.m. Jan. 5. Two male youths were charged with second-degree arson in connection with an incident at the above location. The two were released into the custody of their mothers.

YALE PLACE, 1600 block, Jan. 2. A 35-year-old man was charged with aggravated assault in connection with an Oct. 16 incident at the above location.

CRABB AVE., 700 block, 11:30 p.m. to 11:51 p.m. Jan. 5. Cash was stolen from a residence.

DAWSON AVE., 200 block, 4:40 p.m. Jan. 4. A 28-year-old man was charged with fourth-degree burglary and three counts of trespassing in connection with an incident at the above location.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 700 block, 7:45 to 8 p.m. Jan. 4. A water pipe was stolen from a retail store.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1400 block, 3:04 p.m. Jan. 6. A blood pressure monitor was stolen from a retail store.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 5:10 p.m. Jan. 3. A 40-year-old Hyattsville man was charged with shoplifting and two counts of possession of drug paraphernalia in connection with an incident at the above location.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1700 block, 4:26 p.m. Jan. 5. A cellphone was stolen from a retail store.

FREDERICK ROAD AND REDLAND BOULEVARD, 8:51 p.m. Jan. 4. During a traffic stop, a man in a vehicle was found to have a knife. A 19-year-old District man was charged with possession of a concealed weapon.

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7400 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 8. Two males wearing dark hooded jackets entered an office, pushed a man and held him down against a desk, while one of the assailants searched his pockets and removed property. The man saw two other males with dark hooded jackets standing by a front door. The robbers fled on foot. No injuries were reported.

MAPLE AVE., 7100 block, 9 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Jan. 5. Property was stolen from a residence entered by using a brick to smash a window in the back of the house.

MAPLE AVE., 7500 block, 8:40 p.m. Jan. 10. A man was arrested and charged with burglary in connection with a Dec. 4 incident at a construction site on Lee Avenue.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6800 block, 11:09 p.m. Jan. 10. Cash was stolen from a register at a retail business. Police found glass in a front door broken.

ROANOKE AVE., 8100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Jan. 8. Property was stolen from an apartment.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7100 block, 5:30 p.m. Jan. 8 to 12:30 a.m. Jan. 9. A 1989 Toyota Camry was stolen.

WILLOW AVE., 7300 block, 7:53 p.m. Jan. 5. A 1996 Dodge Caravan was stolen. It was found at 11:49 p.m. the same night in Washington. The van's ignition was damaged.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ17


LENGTH: 3074 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents received recently by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

RANDOLPH AND VEIRS MILL RDS., 8 p.m. Nov. 22. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance in a residence.

ASSAULTS

GRUENTHER AVE., 1600 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 21. A man got into an argument with a female acquaintance and threatened her and two roommates with a sharp object. A man, 19, was charged with aggravated assault. No injuries were reported. 

ROBBERIES

BEALL AVE. AND N. WASHINGTON ST., 11 to 11:59 p.m. Nov. 21. Two males walked to a park with a male they had just met at a movie theater and took his wallet. The victim reported the incident Nov. 22.

DARNESTOWN RD., 12100 block, 7:26 p.m. Nov. 19. A masked gunman robbed a beer-and-wine store.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRADLEY AVE., 300 block, 7:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GUDE DR. E., 1600 block, 10:25 a.m. Nov. 24. A restaurant was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

MARSHALL AVE., 1600 block, 7:40 a.m. to 6:05 p.m. Nov. 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

MIDWAY AVE., 13200 block, 12:48 p.m. Nov. 23. A man tried to enter a residence by force.

PINEWOOD RD., 500 block, 5:25 p.m. Nov. 20 to 5:25 p.m. Nov. 21. Tools were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

ROCKLAND AVE., 2300 block, 6 to 8 p.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

STANLEY AVE., 2000 block, 5 to 11 p.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a residence.

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, 4:31 a.m. Nov. 20. A man forced his way into a delicatessen and fled with property.

ROBBERIES

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

JANUARY DR., 1700 block, 8:20 a.m. Nov. 17. A man was seen looking into a window of a residence. When confronted, he said he was an employee of a company and fled.

ROBBERIES

EASTERN AVE., 8100 block, 9:58 p.m. Nov. 21. A man wearing a black jacket with a fur collar grabbed a female pedestrian, implied that he had a weapon and robbed her of property.

GREY CASTLE WAY AND ROYAL CREST DR., 10:40 P.M. Nov. 22. A male knocked a woman to the ground, robbed her of property and fled.

ISLINGTON ST., 800 block, 6:15 p.m. Nov. 19. Two males grabbed a pedestrian, knocked her to the ground and fled with property.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9300 block, 8:46 p.m. Nov. 18. Two men grabbed a pedestrian and tried to pull him into a stairwell at knifepoint. When the victim screamed, the assailants fled.

TECH RD., 12200 block, 12:30 a.m. Nov. 25. An armed male demanded cash from a man in a parking lot. When the victim showed the assailant an empty wallet, he fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CANNON RD., 900 block, 9:15 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. Nov. 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CARONA PL., 400 block, 2 to 3 a.m. Nov. 21. A person tried to enter a residence by force. When an occupant was awakened, the intruder fled. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ARLISS ST., 8700 block, Nov. 19. A 1994 Toyota Tercel was stolen.

CASTLE BLVD., 11900 block, Nov. 18. A 2004 Chevy Impala reported stolen Nov. 17 was recovered.

ELTON RD., 1700 block, Nov. 21. A 1995 Honda Accord was stolen.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 8100 block, Nov. 19. A 1997 Honda Accord was stolen.

STEWART LANE, 11400 block, Nov. 19 to Nov. 20. A 2005 Jaguar XJ3 was stolen.

District 4 Wheaton Station Telephone: 240-773-5500

ROBBERIES

ARCOLA AND GALT AVENUES, Nov. 18. Two men accosted a male pedestrian, assaulted him and demanded cash. The pedestrian resisted, and the robbers fled empty-handed.

CONNECTICUT AVE., 13500 block, 3:45 a.m. Nov. 21. A strong-arm robbery occurred in a restaurant. No further information was available.

HEWITT AVE., 3300 block, 10 p.m. Nov. 22. Four men accosted a male pedestrian and followed him onto an elevator. One of the men assaulted the pedestrian. The men took property and fled.

HOMECREST RD. AND LONGMEAD CROSSING, 8:34 p.m. Nov. 22. A group of six males and females accosted a male youth at a bus stop at gunpoint, assaulted him, took property and fled. A few minutes later, one of the female assailants returned, apologized and returned the property.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 2700 block, 9:30 p.m. Nov. 21. Two males accosted a woman, robbed her of property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BEAVERWOOD LANE, 3200 block, 3 a.m. Nov. 19. A male entered a residence by force. Nothing was reported missing.

BEL PRE RD., 3700 block, 8:30 p.m. Nov. 17 to 9 a.m. Nov. 18. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

GEORGIA AVE., 12000 block, 8 p.m. Nov. 19 to 6 a.m. Nov. 20. Property was stolen from a dry-cleaning business entered by force.

LANDGREEN ST., 4200 block, 12:35 p.m. Nov. 18. Three men entered a residence by force and fled empty-handed in a white van. Nothing was reported missing.

OLANDWOOD CT., 3400 block, 7:45 p.m. Nov. 18 to 8:43 a.m. Nov. 19. Property was stolen from a doctor's office entered by force.

OLD BALTIMORE RD., 3600 block, 9 to 9:30 p.m. Nov. 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

VEIRS MILL RD., 11000 block, 7:54 a.m. Nov. 17. An attempt was made to enter a business center by force.

District 5 Germantown Station Telephone: 240-773-6200

INDECENT EXPOSURE

LOWFIELD DR., 10500 block, 12:38 a.m. Nov. 24. A man on a deck outside a residence exposed himself to an occupant inside.

ASSAULTS

ST. JOHNSBURY LANE, 19300 block, 3:15 p.m. Nov. 23. An aggravated assault occurred at residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BENT WILLOW CIR., 18800 block, 4 p.m. Nov. 23 to 7 a.m. Nov. 24. Someone entered a vehicle by prying a window. Nothing was reported missing.

CHISWELL RD., 17100 block, 3:30 p.m. Nov. 19. A male assaulted an acquaintance after entering his residence through an unlocked front door. Nothing was reported missing.

CLOVERLEAF CENTER DR., 12900 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 21 to noon Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

DEMETRIAS WAY, 13300 block, noon Nov. 23 to 8:30 a.m. Nov. 24. A digital music player, a satellite radio, a DVD player, a camera, a briefcase and other property were stolen from three vehicles entered by breaking windows.

KITCHEN HOUSE WAY, 12800 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 20 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 21. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

NUTMEG PL., 18600 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 21 to 7:30 a.m. Nov. 22. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

These were among incidents reported recently by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA17


LENGTH: 878 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

WASHINGTON ST. N., 1200 block, 4 a.m. Nov. 22. A man forced a woman behind a building, then sexually assaulted her.

ASSAULTS

MADISON ST., 1300 block. After a brief altercation, a man assaulted a male acquaintance. An Alexandria man, 39, was charged with felonious assault. 

REYNOLDS ST. S., 300 block, 4:12 a.m. Nov. 22. A group attacked a Fairfax County male, knocking him to the ground and causing a puncture wound.

ROBBERIES

DUKE ST., 2900 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 21. Cash was stolen from a business.

SEMINARY ROAD AND FAIRBANKS AVENUE, 5:20 p.m. Nov. 23. A man took a woman's purse from her shoulder.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARMISTEAD ST. N., 400 block, 12:45 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

COWLING CT., 5800 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 15 to 10:40 p.m. Nov. 16. Property was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

DERBY CT., 5600 block, 9 a.m. Nov. 17 to 6 p.m. Nov. 18. Property was stolen from a residence.

PAYNE ST. S., 500 block, 4 to 7 p.m. Nov. 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

EDSALL RD., 6700 block, 4 a.m. Nov. 19 to noon Nov. 20. A silver 2000 Toyota 4-Runner was stolen.

READING AVENUE AND WINSTON COURT, 1 to 11:45 a.m. Nov. 22. A black 2005 Ford Focus was stolen.

28TH ST. S., 3200 block, 10 p.m. Nov. 19 to 7:50 a.m. Nov. 20. A dark-blue 2005 Honda Accord was stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

ARLINGTON BLVD., 1000 block, 2 a.m. Nov. 22. A motorist tried to crash into a male acquaintance's vehicle, then assaulted a female passenger in that vehicle. A District woman, 41, was charged with attempted malicious wounding.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 20. A man confronted about shoplifting assaulted a store employee and then tried to fight off police. A District man, 18, was charged with assault, resisting arrest and petit larceny.

EIGHTH RD. S., 5100 block, 10 a.m. Nov. 21. A male forced his way into an apartment and stabbed a man in the back. An Arlington man, 27, was charged with malicious wounding.

31ST ST. S., 4500 block, 10:30 p.m. Nov. 20. A woman grabbed a knife during an argument with a man and cut him in several places. An Arlington woman, 23, was charged with malicious wounding.

ROBBERIES

CLARENDON BLVD., 2100 block, 9:30 a.m. Nov. 19. A man pushed a woman to the ground and tried to take her purse. He fled empty-handed.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2000 block, 2:30 p.m. Nov. 19. Four male teenagers attacked a man and robbed him of a wallet. One male was arrested.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5000 block, 5:30 p.m. Nov. 19. A man at a bus stop robbed a juvenile male of a cellphone.

WILSON BLVD,. 5900 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 22. A man robbed a woman of a purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ADAMS ST. N., 2000 block, 10 a.m. Nov. 25. Electronic items were stolen from an apartment.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 1900 block, 9 a.m. Nov. 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 3100 block, 4:30 p.m. Nov. 22. After conducting a traffic stop on a vehicle with stolen license plates, police arrested a 50-year-old Alexandria woman. She was charged with driving with a suspended license, improper registration, and receiving stolen property.

EADS ST. S., 1200 block, 10 a.m. to noon Nov. 21. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

EADS ST. S., 1200 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 8 to 7 p.m. Nov. 19. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

FERN ST. S., 1500 block, 3 to 4 p.m. Nov. 21. Jewelry was stolen from an apartment.

LEE HWY., 4700 block, 6:30 p.m. Nov. 24. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

LEE HWY., 5700 block, 5:30 p.m. Nov. 18 to 6 a.m. Nov. 19. Cash was stolen from a business entered by cutting the window bars.

LINCOLN ST. N., 2500 block, 9:30 p.m. Nov. 22 to 10 a.m. Nov. 23. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

NELSON ST. N., 2600 block, 8:30 a.m. Nov. 15 to 8:30 a.m. Nov. 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

QUINN ST. N., 1800 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 21 to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 23. A man seen trying to enter an apartment through a window fled when confronted.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 2800 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 21 to 10;30 a.m. Nov. 22. Global Positioning System devices were stolen from two vehicles.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 3000 block, 8 to 10:30 a.m. Nov. 25. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle. A nearby vehicle was entered, but nothing was reported missing.

WILSON BLVD. N., 4200 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 22 to noon Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a mall kiosk.

THIRD ST. S., 2500 block, noon Nov. 21. A man trying to enter a residence fled after being confronted by its owner.

18TH ST. S., 4100 block, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 24. A computer was stolen from an apartment.

24TH ST. S., 2300 block, 3 a.m. Nov. 20 to 4 p.m. Nov. 21. Electronic items were stolen from two vehicles.

GEORGE MASON DR. S., 1400 block, Nov. 22. A 2000 Ford Crown Victoria was stolen.

EIGHTH RD. S., 5300 block, Nov. 21. A tan 1989 Chevy Motorhome was stolen.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 693 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brigstock Ct., 12900 block, 2:30 p.m. July 26 to 10:15 p.m. Aug. 31. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement window.

Cunard Ct., 13400 block, 6 a.m. Aug. 23 to 11 a.m. Aug. 30. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through a basement window. 

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Formby St., Aug. 17. A 2004 Hyundai Elantra was stolen. The vehicle was identified during a police traffic stop in Manassas. A 17-year-old Manassas male was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Wallace Drive area, June. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 43-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Livingston Rd., 12100 block, 10:45 a.m. Aug. 28. During an argument, a man assaulted a male acquaintance, who was later treated for injuries.

CHILD CARE INCIDENT

Notes Dr. and Balls Ford Rd., 8:05 p.m. Aug. 31. Police stopped the male driver of a vehicle and determined that he was under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Four children, 13 months old to 13 years old, were in the vehicle. A 32-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with driving under the influence and child neglect.

ROBBERIES

Stream Walk Dr., 7700 block, 8:30 a.m. Aug. 27. A man and a woman in a vehicle offered to hire a man in a parking lot for landscaping work. The man was driven to a wooded lot, where he was robbed of cash at knifepoint.

Sudley Rd.,8300 block, 9:48 a.m. Sept. 1. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Galveston Ct., 12700 block, 6:30 p.m. Aug. 26. A man in a grocery store exposed himself to a woman.

Sudley Rd., 8100 block, 3:40 p.m. Aug. 24. A man sitting in the children's section of a bookstore exposed himself several times.

TRIANGLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Fort Pickens Ct. area, Aug. 28. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance at gunpoint. A 31-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ATTEMPTING KIDNAPPING

Geraldine Ct., 1400 block, 6:41 p.m. Aug. 31. A man picked up a 2-year-old child and attempted to walk away. The child's older brother was able to get the child away from the man. A 26-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULT

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 9:43 a.m. Aug. 30. A man was stabbed during a fight. He was treated at a hospital.

CHILD CARE INCIDENT

Braddock Rd., 3000 block, 2:01 p.m. Aug. 27. A woman left four children, ages 3 to 10, alone in a residence. A 34-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

ROBBERY

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 2:47 a.m. Sept. 3. Three men, including two who wore masks, robbed a male at a residence of a safe. They were armed with a handgun, a machete and a bat.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hill Meade Lane, 11500 block, 5:55 a.m. Aug. 28. A man entered a residence and fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

Still Pl., 4700 block, 8:53 a.m. Aug. 26. A man attempted to enter a residence.

Telegraph Rd.,14500 block, 8:33 p.m. Sept. 1. Cash was stolen from a business entered through an unlocked rear door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Confederate Trail, 6 p.m. Aug. 30. Four males assaulted two male juvenile pedestrians.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bragg Lane,9700 block, 11:25 p.m. Aug. 29. A male attempted to enter a residence through a second-floor window.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Euclid Ave., 8 p.m. Aug. 29 to 10 a.m. Aug. 30. License plates were stolen from vehicles at a business.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 2189 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Rockville Pike, 1900 block, March 21. A man groped a person near a gas station.

ASSAULTS

Shady Grove Rd., 16000 block, 9:50 p.m. March 25. A man attacked an acquaintance at a motel. A 22-year-old Gaithersburg man was charged with aggravated assault. 

ROBBERIES

Frederick Rd., 15800 block, 7:30 p.m. March 23. Two male youths wearing black T-shirts and shorts attempted to take property from a pedestrian. They fled empty-handed.

Veirs Mill Rd., 12200 block, 4:50 p.m. March 23. A man armed with a weapon robbed a retail store.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crawford Dr., 1000 block, 3 p.m. March 24 to 6 p.m. March 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Dowgate Ct., 5600 block, noon to 9:30 p.m March 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Emden St., 4300 block, 4:58 p.m. March 27. A break-in occurred at a residence. There was no sign of forced entry and nothing was reported missing.

Grandin Ave., 700 block, noon March 19 to 4:10 p.m. March 22. A break-in occurred at a residence. There was no sign of forced entry and nothing was reported missing.

Great Arbor Dr., 10400 block, 5 to 8 p.m. March 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 1:10 p.m. March 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force. Nothing was reported missing.

Idlewood Rd., 11500 block, 6:45 to 7 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Manor Lake Dr., 15100 block, 3 to 6 a.m. March 23. A computer bag and an external hard drive were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Parklawn Dr., 11800 block, 6 p.m. March 20 to 6:30 a.m. March 20. A shed was entered at a school. There was no sign of forced entry, and nothing was reported missing.

Timber Hill Lane, 8600 block, 6 to 7 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Trailway Dr., 5100 block, midnight to 7 a.m. March 23. A laptop bag and several checkbooks were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Veirs Mill Rd., 2200 block, 6:41 a.m. March 23. A restaurant was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

Waterview Dr., 5200 block, 10:30 p.m. March 22 to 7:41 a.m. March 23. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Parklawn Dr., 11900 block, 5:30 p.m. March 22 to 7 a.m. March 23. A vehicle was stolen.

Edgemoor Lane, 5300 block, 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Magnolia Pkwy., unit 1:50 p.m. March 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force. Two D.C. men, ages 18 and 19, were arrested.

Morning Gate Dr., 11100 block, March 22 to 25. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATION301-565-7740

ASSAULTS

Cherry Hill Rd., 12000 block, 7:48 p.m. March 22. A man armed with a weapon threatened a person in a parking lot. No injuries were reported.

Ellsworth Dr., 900 block, 5 p.m. March 23. Responding to a report of a fight, police arrested two men. A 25-year-old North Carolina man and a 23-year-old Montgomery Village man were charged with aggravated assault.

Heather Hollow Cir., 1500 block, 10:20 p.m. March 26. A female attacked an acquaintance. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Barron St., 8300 block, 4:15 a.m. March 23. A male armed with a weapon robbed a person of property.

Blair Mill Rd., 7700 block, 9:16 a.m. March 22. A male robbed a person of property in the parking lot of a fast-food restaurant.

Colesville Rd., 8400 block, 1:13 a.m. March 24. A robbery occurred.

Wayne Ave. and Ellsworth Dr., 9:35 p.m. March 23. A group of more than a dozen males threatened and robbed a pedestrian.

Wayne Ave. and Ellsworth Dr., 12:01 a.m. March 24. Two men wearing masks threatened and robbed a person in an alley.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Castle Blvd., 14400 block, 7:30 to 10:20 a.m. March 26. Property was stolen from a storage room at a business entered by force.

Castle Blvd., 14400 block, March 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Fairdale Rd., 2700 block, 7:50 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. March 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Georgia Ave., 9500 block, 3:45 to 5:15 a.m. March 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Old Columbia Pike, 12700 block, 4:14 a.m. March 21. Property was stolen from an animal hospital entered by force.

Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 814 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Christiana Parran Rd., 9:45 a.m. Aug. 9. A girl, 16, called police to report that a man was trying to force his way into her home. She and her younger sister were advised to lock themselves in a bedroom. Police arrived and found find a man hiding in a closet. A man, 33, was arrested on charges that included parole violations in connection with other burglaries in the area.

LUSBY AREA ASSAULTS

H.G. Trueman Rd., 12:42 a.m. Aug. 9. During a dispute at a convenience store, a man attacked an employee. A Lusby man, 24, was charged with assault, illegal possession of prescription drugs and possession of drug paraphernalia.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catalina Dr., 7 a.m. to 9:25 p.m. Aug. 8. Property was stolen from a residence.

Rousby Hall Rd.,7 a.m. to 9:25 p.m. Aug. 8. Property was stolen from a residence.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lor N Kel Lane, 6 a.m. to noon, Aug. 6. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA VANDALISM

Biscoe Gray Heritage Farm, Aug. 9 to Aug. 10. Calvert County government equipment was damaged.

Fairgrounds Rd., Aug. 7. Windows were shattered on a bus shelter and a vehicle at a commuter lot.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayside Rd., Aug. 6 to Aug. 11. Electronic items were stolen from a residence.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities. WALDORF AREA ASSAULTS

Lancaster Cir. and Becard Ct., 9 p.m. Aug. 13. A male was attacked after he refused to give cash to a group of males. No serious injuries were reported.

Old Washington Rd., 2300 block, 1:09 a.m. Aug. 15. While being escorted from a bar because of disorderly behavior, a man threatened two employees at knifepoint. An Oxon Hill man, 20, was charged with assault.

Wilson Rd., 1300 block, 11:54 pm. Aug. 10. During an argument, a man threatened an acquaintance at knifepoint. A Waldorf man, 28, was charged with first-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

Huntington Cir., 3200 block, 1 a.m. Aug. 15. Four males threatened and robbed of cash a man walking a dog.

St. Charles Pkwy., 11:14 p.m. Aug. 12. A group of males demanded cash from three pedestrians, threatened them and fled with a pair of sneakers.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 2200 block, Aug. 8 to Aug. 9. Property was stolen from several vans parked at a business.

Heathcote Rd., 3000 block, 8:45 a.m. Aug. 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by kicking in the front door.

WHITE PLAINS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Diamond Ridge Lane, 4700 block, Aug. 13 to Aug. 14. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

GREAT MILLS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Great Mills, Aug. 12. After several reports of a man inappropriately touching children he was baby-sitting, a Great Mills man, 53, was charged with child sexual abuse and third-degree sex offenses.

HOLLYWOOD AREA ROBBERIES

Three Notch Rd., 10:30 to 11 p.m. July 27. A man robbed a pizza delivery business at gunpoint.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, July 29. A man was found with a gunshot wound. He was flown to Prince George's shock trauma center, where he was treated for injuries that were not life-threatening.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Fairfax City

These were among incidents reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For information, call 703-385-7809.

ROBBERIES

Pickett Rd., 3900 block, 10:30 p.m. July 18. A man with a box cutter threatened a male at a bus stop and robbed him of his cellphone. A 49-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fairfax Blvd., 10400 block, 12:15 a.m. July 14. Two males did not have the money to pay for their meals at a restaurant. One promised to return with the cash but did not. The man was identified and a warrant charging him with defrauding an innkeeper was issued.

Lee Hwy., 11000 block, May 1 to July 8. An employee generated store gift cards and used them to make purchases on the company's Web site and at another store. A 19-year-old Chantilly man was charged with felony embezzlement.

Main St., 10300 block, June 22, June 23 and June 25. A man and a woman paid for merchandise using checks written on a closed account. Attempts to contact them were unsuccessful. A 35-year-old Reston woman was charged with felony bad check and a 39-year-old Reston man was charged with misdemeanor bad check.

Main St., 10500 block, 1:13 a.m. July 17. An untended purse containing cash, checks, credit cards and jewelry, was stolen from a restaurant. A 20-year-old Fairfax City man was charged with grand larceny.

Main St., 10900 block, 11:37 p.m. July 17. Police saw a man in a convenience store parking lot asking people for money. Investigation revealed that he had taken merchandise from the store. A 46-year-old Herndon man was charged with petty larceny, unlawful begging and public drunkenness.

Mosby Woods Dr. and Plantation Pkwy., 9 a.m. July 19 to 7:57 p.m. July 20. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

Oxford Lane, 4100 block, 11 p.m. July 19 to 6 a.m. July 20. Two watches, sunglasses and clothing were stolen from a vehicle.

Rebel Run, 3500 block, 8:45 to 11 a.m. July 22. An iPhone and cash were stolen from a locker in a high school.

Whitehead St., 10400 block, 7 a.m. July 14. Two metal signs were taken from a post in a parking lot.

VANDALISM

Fairfax Blvd., 9500 block, noon July 13 to 2:59 p.m. July 15. Tires on two vehicles were slashed and license plates were damaged.

Fairfax Blvd., 9600 block, 7 to 7:14 a.m. July 18. A tire on a vehicle in a parking lot was punctured.

Falls Church

These were among incidents reported by the Falls Church Police Department. For information, call 703-248-5056.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Washington St. S., 800 block, July 17. A man exposed himself in the parking lot of a convenience store.

ASSAULTS

Broad St. W., 300 block, July 17. A 26-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested in connection with an assault and battery incident. He also was charged with public drunkenness.

Broad St. W., 1200 block, July 18. A 57-year-old District man was arrested in connection with an assault. He was charged with assault and battery and shoplifting.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broad St. E., 1000 block, July 15. A wallet and a computer were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a side window.

Grove Ave., 300 block, July 17. Two unsecured bicycles were stolen from a residence.

Little Falls St., 200 block, July 16. An unsecured bicycle was stolen from a community center.

Wilson Blvd., 6700 block, July 20. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Cameron Rd. W., 100 block, July 20. A decorative fence was damaged.

Ellison St., 1200 block, July 20. Household items were damaged.

Poplar Dr., 700 block, July 21. A utility line at a residence was cut.

Rosemary Lane, 400 block, July 21. A vehicle was scratched.

Herndon

These were among incidents reported by the Herndon Police Department. For information, call 703-435-6846.

ASSAULTS

Alabama Dr., 900 block, 618 p.m. July 21. A person struck an male acquaintance with a beer bottle. The injured man was treated at a hospital.

Elden St., 1200 block, July 20. A simple assault was reported.

Locust St., 800 block, July 17. A simple assault was reported. A 31-year-old woman was charged with simple domestic assault.

Snowflake Ct., 1500 block, July 20. A simple assault was reported.

ROBBERIES

Elden St., 1000 block, July 24. Three men displayed a gun and attempted to rob a clerk at the drive-through at a fast-food restaurant. They were unsuccessful and left. A short time later, the same men entered a fast-food restaurant in the 300 block of Elden St., brandished firearms and demanded cash from a clerk. They also took a cellphone from a customer. A 19-year-old Chantilly man, and two Aldie men, 18 and 19, were charged with armed robbery, attempted armed robbery, abduction and wearing a mask and using a firearm in the commission of a felony.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dulles Park Ct., 600 block, July 21. A residential burglary was reported.

Elden St., 1000 block, July 19. A theft from a building was reported.

Elden St., 1200 block, July 21. A shoplifting incident was reported.

Elden St., 400 block, July 16. A shoplifting incident was reported. A 29-year-old woman was charged with larceny.

Elden St., 400 block, July 20. Two shoplifting incidents were reported

Elden St., 400 block, July 21. A shoplifting incident was reported.

Elden St., 600 block, July 18. A shoplifting incident was reported. A 49-year-old man was charged with larceny.

Gentle Breeze Ct., 700 block, July 16. A theft was reported.

Trevino Lane, 1000 block, July 20. A theft from a building was reported.

Worldgate Dr., 13000 block, July 16. A theft was reported.

Vienna

These were among incidents reported by the Vienna Police Department. For information, call 703-255-6396.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cedar Lane SE, 200 block, 12:30 to 8:30 p.m. July 23. Property was stolen from a residence.

Cottage St. SW, 900 block, 10:30 a.m. July 14 to 10:30 a.m. July 21. Several light fixtures were stolen from an unoccupied residence, causing damage in the basement.

Country Club Dr. NE, 900 block, 9 a.m. July 23 to 10:25 a.m. July 24. Charges were made on a woman's credit card without her knowledge or permission.

Maple Ave. W., 300 block, 9 a.m. July 11 to 9 a.m. July 29. A woman lent her vehicle to a co-worker, and the co-worker has ignored her requests to return the vehicle. The woman also reported that petty cash was missing from the business.

Meadow Lane SW, 400 block, midnight July 7 to 3:21 p.m. July 22. Front wheel covers were stolen from a vehicle in the driveway of a residence.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. 11


LENGTH: 696 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or Crime Solvers, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Chesapeake Beach Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HIGHVIEW RD., July 7-8. Six windows at a residence were broken. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHESAPEAKE BEACH RD., July 7-10. A flat-screen TV in its original box was stolen from a residence.

North Beach Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SIXTH ST., 7:30 p.m. July 8 to 4:15 p.m. July 9. A bicycle was stolen from a yard at a residence.

Prince Frederick Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HALLOWING LANE, 5:30 p.m. July 9 to 9:30 a.m. July 10. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

La Plata Area

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 6600 block, 10:17 p.m. July 8. Two armed men wearing masks robbed a clerk at a gas station of cash and fled on foot.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CRAIN HWY., 5000 block, 6:14 a.m. July 8. Symbols were spray-painted on the side of a garage at Golfarama.

Waldorf Area

ROBBERIES

COUNCIL OAK DR., 12500 block, 10 a.m. to noon July 8. Three males assaulted a boy, 16, and attempted to steal his cellphone. The boy fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 3200 block, July 14. A man was arrested on suspicion of stealing a catalytic converter from a vehicle at a shopping center. After his arrest, four catalytic converters and tools to remove them were found in his vehicle. A man, 31, was charged with multiple counts of theft of more than $500, malicious destruction of property, possession of burglary tools and possession of marijuana.

ST. CHARLES PKWY., 3:49 p.m. July 4. A man was driving a vehicle with stolen license plates. Police discovered that the vehicle was also stolen. Two men, 18 and 19, and four youths were charged with motor vehicle theft, theft of license plates and possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or Crime Solvers, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

California Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA AND LEXINGTON PARK, July 11-13. Global Positioning System devices and other items were stolen from 12 vehicles parked at various businesses.

Hollywood Area

ARSONS

LOCUST GROVE FARM LANE, 5:05 a.m. July 14. An abandoned two-story residence and barn were set on fire. Both structures were destroyed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, July 16. Three men were arrested in connection with thefts of catalytic converters from vehicles throughout the county from June 1 to July 9. The men, ages 20, 21 and 27, were each charged with theft scheme and multiple counts of theft.

Lexington Park Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LEXINGTON PARK, 10 p.m. July 12. A man sexually assaulted a woman, 23, at her residence. A man, 24, was charged with second-degree rape and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MACARTHUR BLVD., 3:44 p.m. July 11. A metal shelf and table were stolen.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

ESSEX DR. N., 6:38 p.m. July 13. A vehicle was spray-painted.

Mechanicsville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LOVEVILLE RD., 8:47 p.m. July 7. Coins and copper tubing were stolen from a residence.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 780 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Coyote Ct., 12400 block, 6:37 p.m. July 15. A license plate was removed from a vehicle.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

N. Solomans Island Rd., 600 block, 7:28 p.m. July 14. Three men entered a department store, took clothing from a sales table near the entrance and fled in a vehicle.

West Dares Beach Rd., 100 block, 11:19 p.m. July 20. A tire store was burglarized. While driving to the store, a police officer saw a suspect driving away in a vehicle and attempted to stop him. The suspect got out of the vehicle and tried to flee on foot but was stopped. An Elkridge man, 33, was arrested.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

INDIAN HEAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ann Harbor Dr., 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. July 16. An inflatable 70-foot-long obstacle course with a water slide and an inflatable playground about 54 feet long were stolen from a trailer.

WALDORF AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf Market Pl., 6:36 p.m. July 20. A boy, 10 to 12 years old, allegedly sexually assaulted a 4-year-old boy at a clubhouse. The 4-year-old reported the incident to relatives later in the day.

ASSAULTS

Caroline Dr. and Cedar Ct., 11 p.m. July 19. A man, 26, was stabbed during an altercation in La Plata. He was taken to a hospital.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dorchester Cir., 5000 block, 7 a.m. July 19. Cash was stolen from a pool house entered by force at a recreation center in Waldorf.

Leighland Ct., 9800 block, July 20 to 21. Parts were stolen from an air conditioner.

Ridge Grove Estates, July 20 to 21. Tools were stolen from a shed entered by force at a residence in Hughesville, and a tractor was damaged.

VANDALISM

Smallwood Dr. W., 2300 block, and Lancaster Cir.,4800 block, July 20 to 21. Several rear windows were broken at two elementary schools. Nothing was reported missing.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Worth Ave., 44900 block, July 23. An employee of a discount store allegedly took cash, gift cards and merchandise from the business between March 5 and July 22. A Lexington Park man, 20, was arrested and charged with theft.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS

Sue Dr., 46000 block, 5:11 p.m. July 24. A woman, 24, was arrested and charged with second-degree assault after allegedly assaulting another woman during an altercation at a residence.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Morningside Lane, July 23. A man choked an acquaintance during an argument. A Lexington Park man, 31, was arrested and charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Great Mills Rd., 21600 block, 1:50 a.m. July 17. Electronic equipment was stolen from a pawn shop entered by breaking a front glass door.

Great Mills Rd., 21600 block, July 23. An air conditioner was stolen from a building.

Midway Dr., July 23. A resident received a phone call from a man claiming to be from the IRS. The caller said the resident must pay $2,500 to avoid arrest. The resident purchased five $500 Green Dot cards and provided the debit card information to the caller.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith and Terence McArdle

St. Mary's crime


SECTION: Southern Maryland Extra; T06


LENGTH: 277 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police.  

For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULT

LAUREL GLEN RD., 9:26 a.m. Oct. 25. A man, 27, assaulted a woman, 26, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JONES WHARF RD., 1 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 20. A 10-month-old German shepherd was stolen from the back yard of a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRETON VIEW DR., 7:45 p.m. Oct. 27. A woman, 23, assaulted another woman, 47, at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

MEDLEY'S NECK RD., 2 p.m. Oct. 25 to 3 p.m. Oct. 26. A mailbox at a residence was damaged.

MERCHANTS LANE, 7:04 p.m. Oct. 22. A man, 26, stole several CDs from an unlocked vehicle parked at a business.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SALAMAUA PL., 7 p.m. Oct. 25 to 8:45 a.m. Oct. 26. The tailgate of a 1990 Chevrolet Silverado pickup parked at a residence was removed and stolen.

SEX OFFENSE

MECHANICSVILLE, 10 a.m. Oct. 23. A man, 37, sexually assaulted a male youth, 9. He was charged with child abuse and third-degree sex offense.

ASSAULT

BEACHVILLE RD., 6:56 p.m. Oct. 28. A male youth, 13, assaulted a woman, 34, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HAPPYLAND RD., 10:30 p.m. Oct. 24 to 1:30 a.m. Oct. 25. The hood and trunk of a 1998 Honda Accord parked at Club New York were dented.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 1783 words


Montgomery County crime report Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Alexandria and Arlington crime report Alexandria and Arlington crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Alexandria and Arlington.

Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 722 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Christiana Parran Rd., 9:45 a.m. Aug. 9. A girl, 16, called police to report that a man was trying to force his way into her home. She and her younger sister were advised to lock themselves in a bedroom. Police arrived and found find a man hiding in a closet. A man, 33, was arrested on charges that included parole violations in connection with other burglaries in the area. 

LUSBY AREA

ASSAULTS

H.G. Trueman Rd., 12:42 a.m. Aug. 9. During a dispute at a convenience store, a man attacked an employee. A Lusby man, 24, was charged with assault, illegal possession of prescription drugs and possession of drug paraphernalia.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catalina Dr., 7 a.m. to 9:25 p.m. Aug. 8. Property was stolen from a residence.

Rousby Hall Rd., 7 a.m. to 9:25 p.m. Aug. 8. Property was stolen from a residence.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lor N Kel Lane, 6 a.m. to noon, Aug. 6. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

VANDALISM

Biscoe Gray Heritage Farm, Aug. 9 to Aug. 10. Calvert County government equipment was damaged.

Fairgrounds Rd., Aug. 7. Windows were shattered on a bus shelter and a vehicle at a commuter lot.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayside Rd., Aug. 6 to Aug. 11. Electronic items were stolen from a residence.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

WALDORF AREA

ASSAULTS

Lancaster Cir. and Becard Ct., 9 p.m. Aug. 13. A male was attacked after he refused to give cash to a group of males. No serious injuries were reported.

Old Washington Rd., 2300 block, 1:09 a.m. Aug. 15. While being escorted from a bar because of disorderly behavior, a man threatened two employees at knifepoint. An Oxon Hill man, 20, was charged with assault.

Wilson Rd., 1300 block, 11:54 pm. Aug. 10. During an argument, a man threatened an acquaintance at knifepoint. A Waldorf man, 28, was charged with first-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

Huntington Cir., 3200 block, 1 a.m. Aug. 15. Four males threatened and robbed of cash a man walking a dog.

St. Charles Pkwy., 11:14 p.m. Aug. 12. A group of males demanded cash from three pedestrians, threatened them and fled with a pair of sneakers.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 2200 block, Aug. 8 to Aug. 9. Property was stolen from several vans parked at a business.

Heathcote Rd., 3000 block, 8:45 a.m. Aug. 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by kicking in the front door.

WHITE PLAINS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Diamond Ridge Lane, 4700 block, Aug. 13 to Aug. 14. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

GREAT MILLS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Great Mills, Aug. 12. After several reports of a man inappropriately touching children he was baby-sitting, a Great Mills man, 53, was charged with child sexual abuse and third-degree sex offenses.

HOLLYWOOD AREA

ROBBERIES

Three Notch Rd., 10:30 to 11 p.m. July 27. A man robbed a pizza delivery business at gunpoint.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, July 29. A man was found with a gunshot wound. He was flown to Prince George's shock trauma center, where he was treated for injuries that were not life-threatening.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

May 12, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 893 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREASEXUAL ASSAULTS

Bristow and Nokesville roads, 11:30 p.m. April 30. A male motorist offered a ride to a woman, then sexually assaulted her before driving her home. A 47-year-old West Virginia man was arrested.

DUMFRIES AREAASSAULTS 

Banks Ct., 2800 block, 9:58 p.m. May 3. Four men assaulted a male pedestrian, who was treated for injuries.

Denali Pl. and Acadia Dr., 5:54 p.m. April 28. A group of males assaulted a male pedestrian, then fled in three vehicles. The man was treated for injuries.

Reservoir Loop and Hourglass Dr., 11:45 p.m. April 30. A group of males assaulted two male juvenile pedestrians, who were treated for injuries.

GAINESVILLE AREATHEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashby Grove Loop, 6400 block, 11:01 p.m. April 27. A man attempted to enter a residence by crawling under a partially opened garage door. The man fled empty-handed when a resident confronted him.

Thoroughfare Rd., 15400 block, 10:30 a.m. April 28 to 10:15 a.m. April 30. Four guns were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door. A fire was also started in the house, causing damage.

HAYMARKET AREAASSAULTS

Kanawha Way, 10:30 a.m. April 25. A male juvenile assaulted a female relative, prevented her from leaving a residence and broke a door. A 14-year-old boy was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bencrest Way, 5700 block, 7 p.m. April 28 to 1 a.m. April 29. Golf clubs were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

LAKE RIDGE AREATHEFTS/BREAK-INS

Inglebrook Dr., 1900 block, 3 to 4:30 a.m. April 27. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MANASSAS AREASEXUAL ASSAULTS

Portsmouth Rd., 10000 block, 8:17 p.m. May 1. A man abducted a female acquaintance from a parking lot, took her to a residence and raped her. A 34-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Margate Ct., 7500 block, 6:11 p.m. April 28. Two men assaulted two male pedestrians. One of the men held a knife to the throat of one of the pedestrians, then both men fled. Two Manassas men, 20 and 21, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Battleview Pkwy., 10500 block, 7 a.m. April 26 to 1:30 p.m. April 27. Someone attempted to enter a building by prying a fire door.

Chaddsford Terr., 13000 block, 10:47 a.m. April 27. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear basement door.

Prince Charles Ct., 7400 block, 1:18 a.m. April 28. A man attempted to enter a residence. When a resident confronted him, the man fled empty-handed.

Williamson Blvd., 7300 block, noon April 23 to 10 a.m. April 24. A TV was stolen from a hotel room.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Belle Grae Dr., 7500 block, 11:18 p.m. April 24 to 7:20 p.m. April 25. A residence was entered through an unlocked front door, and a vehicle key was taken. The key was then used to take a 2004 Infiniti G35.

TRIANGLE AREATHEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fuller Heights Rd., 19000 block, 4 a.m. to 4 p.m. April 26. Cash and electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a bedroom window.

WOODBRIDGE AREASEXUAL ASSAULTS

Beaumont Rd., 5:33 p.m. April 27. A man raped a female juvenile acquaintance. A 29-year-old man was arrested.

Wadsworth Way, 5:35 p.m. May 2. A man raped a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. A 22-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Brookville Lane, 3500 block, 8:50 p.m. May 3. Five male juveniles assaulted a man, who was treated for injuries.

James St., 1500 block, 3:47 a.m. May 1. A man entered a residence by breaking a window to unlock a door, then assaulted a female acquaintance. He fled with her phone.

Marina Way, 13100 block, 1:56 a.m. April 30. A group of men assaulted a man, who was treated for injuries. Less than two hours later, gunshots were heard.

WEAPONS

Fairhope Rd., 3800 block, April 4 to April 27. Someone fired BBs at a residence, hitting a front window.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Acorn Ct., 3000 block, 6:34 p.m. April 26. Someone attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door.

Anchorstone Dr., 5000 block, 2 p.m. April 20 to 1 p.m. April 28. Electronics were stolen from a residence.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14500 block, 9 p.m. April 26 to 6:45 a.m. April 27. Tires were stolen from three vehicles at a business, and three other vehicles were entered by breaking windows.

Langer Lane, 4800 block, 7:15 a.m. to 2:15 p.m. April 27. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Lynwood Dr., 5000 block, 5:44 a.m. April 28. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door. He fled empty-handed when a female resident on a couch woke up.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enterprise Ct., 9200 block, 1:30 a.m. April 14 to 9 a.m. April 28. License plate tags were stolen from a vehicle.

Holmes Pl., 9700 block, April 13. An MP3 player was stolen from a vehicle that had been towed.

Market St., 100 block, April 28. A camera and a wallet were stolen from an unlocked residence.

Polk Dr., 100 block, 11:30 p.m. April 23. Two teenagers stole a mountain bike.

April 10, 2014 Thursday 11:44 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 1553 words


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel and Howard counties and Annapolis.

Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

ANNAPOLIS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Annapolis area, March 27. An Annapolis man, 22, was arrested in connection with the alleged sexual abuse of a child he had been hired to babysit at the parents' home on numerous occasions between April and October 2013. He was charged with sex abuse of a minor, third- and fourth-degree sex offenses and second-degree assault. He was released on bail. 

BROOKLYN AREA ROBBERIES

Franklin Ave. and Alley 7, 1:47 a.m. April 1. A gunman told a male teenager to empty his pockets. The gunman fled on foot with a wallet and cellphone.

Ritchie Hwy., 4000 block, 5:08 a.m. March 30. A male shot a convenience store clerk with a BB gun during an attempted robbery. He fled on foot empty-handed. The clerk was taken to a hospital with injuries that were not considered life-threatening. On April 2, a Baltimore man, 29, was arrested and charged with attempted armed robbery, reckless endangerment and first-degree assault. He was also identified as a suspect wanted for the unprovoked slashing of a pedestrian's face March 13 at Meadow and Belle Grove roads. He was charged with first- and second-degree assault, reckless endangerment and possession of a deadly weapon with intent to injure in connection with that attack.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 1700 block, 8:37 p.m. March 30. A man robbed a pedestrian of prescription drugs and a cellphone at gunpoint. The robber fled on foot.

Ritchie Hwy., 6700 block, 2:55 p.m. March 30. A man robbed a card shop of cash and fled on foot. On April 1, a Glen Burnie man, 21, was arrested and charged with robbery and theft.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Holly Creek Dr., 3400 block, March 23. A gunman robbed a female of her purse, car keys and cellphone. A man and a woman used the credit cards at a store immediately after the robbery, leading to the capture of a suspect. A warrant for a District Heights man, 32, has been issued for armed robbery and additional charges. He has been linked to two other armed robberies, one in Howard County, on March 26.

JESSUP AREA INMATE ESCAPE

Toulson Rd., 2000 block, 4:50 a.m. March 31. A minimum security inmate scaled a perimeter fence by covering the razor wire with blankets. The blankets were noticed by staff at 6:15 a.m. The inmate, who was sentenced in Prince George's County in 2002 for attempted murder, was recaptured that day.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

TRAFFIC INCIDENTS

Forest Dr. at Tyler Ave., 11:19 a.m. March 31. A Ford Explorer hit an electrical pole, destroying it. The driver fled in the vehicle. It was found unoccupied on Rosecrest Drive near Roselawn Drive. An Edgewater man, 24, was arrested and charged with leaving the scene of an accident and driving with a revoked license. Utility crews worked until 4:35 a.m. the next morning to repair the pole and damaged lines.

ROBBERIES

Madison St., 1100 block, 2 a.m. March 27. Two men knocked on an apartment door and forced their way inside. They threatened to shoot the residents if they didn't give them money. They took a cellphone, hit one resident and fled through a back door. An Annapolis man, 19, and a Halethorpe man, 20, were arrested and charged with robbery, burglary, assault and theft. The younger man was also charged with drug possession.

West St., 200 block, 3 a.m. March 29. A man took a bag of chips from a gas station. An attendant inside a locked booth asked him to pay, and the man banged on the booth, telling him to come out. The man then attempted to steal the attendant's bike. The attendant came out, and the man punched him several times. An Annapolis man, 30, was arrested and charged with robbery, second-degree assault, theft and reckless endangerment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burnside St., 300 block, 11:30 p.m. March 31 to 8:20 a.m. April 1. An unlocked vehicle was ransacked. Nothing was reported stolen.

College Ave., 1-99 block, 10 a.m. to 5:20 p.m. March 29. Cash, a laptop computer, a travel bag, sunglasses, a camera, a watch, a necklace and a ring were stolen from a residence.

Garden Gate Lane, 200 block, 10:20 a.m. March 30. A male teenager was seen entering a home by forcing open a back door. An Annapolis male, 16, was arrested and charged with burglary and assault.

Market Space, 1-99 block, March 15. Cash was stolen from a restaurant. On March 27, a suspect was arrested. An Annapolis man, 29, was charged with theft and burglary. He was released on bond.

Murray Ave., 1-99 block, noon March 29 to 7 p.m. March 30. Cash and sunglasses were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Prince George St., 200 block, 9:30 p.m. March 31 to 10:15 a.m. April 1. A tote bag containing a computer speaker, a power cord and clothing was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Shipwright St., 1-99 block, noon Feb. 10 to 4 p.m. March 21. Three kayaks were stolen from a marina.

Westbridge Dr., 1900 block, 6 p.m. March 29 to 1 p.m. March 30. A laptop computer and a GPS device were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Westcott Pl., 7000 block, 12:43 p.m. April 2. A residence was entered by force. Extensive damage was caused.

COLUMBIA AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE

Nightmist Ct., 10300 block, 8:33 a.m. March 27. A woman left a residence, stood on the porch, yelled obscenities and exposed herself. A Columbia woman, 71, was arrested and charged with indecent exposure and harassment.

ROBBERIES

Macomber Lane, 9400 block, 11 p.m. March 27. Two boys pushed another boy on a footpath and took his shoes, cellphone and other property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bird Song Pass, 10800 block, 4:27 p.m. March 28. A bike was stolen from a garage.

Fruitgift Pl., 6500 block, noon to 12:45 p.m. March 31. A video game system and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10100 block, 3:19 a.m. March 31. Cigarettes, cigars and lottery tickets were stolen from a store entered by smashing a front glass door. An attempt was made to pry open an ATM.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Broken Land Pkwy. near Route 32, 5:36 p.m. March 30. A burgundy 2009 Range Rover SUV was stolen.

Cobblefield Dr., 8600 block, 11:20 p.m. March 31. A green 2005 Lincoln Aviator was stolen.

Cradlerock Way, 6700 block, 4:46 p.m. March 30. A green Kawasaki KX60 motorcycle was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA ROBBERIES

Pirch Way, 6600 block, 11:32 p.m. March 31. Three people with guns attempted to enter a residence by kicking a front door. Entry was not gained.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Argent Path, 3100 block, 5 p.m. March 26 to 8:30 a.m. March 27. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a kitchen window.

Plumtree Dr., 3400 block, 6:15 p.m. March 27. Two boys tried to enter a home through a window and were caught by a resident. Two Ellicott City males, 13 and 14, were arrested and charged with breaking and entering.

HANOVER AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hanover Rd., 6400 block, March 27 to March 29. A residence was ransacked. The home was entered by forcing a front door.

HIGHLAND AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clarksville Pike, 13900 block, noon to 3:55 p.m. April 1. Electronics and guns were stolen from a home entered through an unlocked door.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Stebbing Way, 9100 block, 1:40 a.m. April 2. A gunman searched someone's pockets and fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Covered Wagon, 9700 block, 7 a.m. to 2 p.m. April 2. Electronics were stolen from a home entered through an unlocked window.

Lynn Buff Ct., 9500 block, 2:10 a.m. March 27. Two men entered a storage container. Two Laurel men, 51 and 33, were arrested and charged with second- and fourth-degree burglary.

Mary Lee Lane, 8300 block, 7:40 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. March 31. Jewelry and electronics were stolen from a home entered by forcing open a back door.

SEVERN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barnet Ct., 2200 block, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. March 27. A residence was entered by breaking a window. Nothing was reported taken.
